department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: American Express has been wonderful to work with. I received my first AmEx card in 1978. Recently AmEx has helped me build both business and personal credit.
Always accepted in all types of purchases.. It's recognized as a prestigious card. So I'm thankful having the opportunity to have one.
Great card with a ton perks. It allows a flexible spending limit which really allows you to feel comfortable that you will have the funds needed always available

Absolutely terrible. Wouldn’t follow through with introductory offer after I spent the amount specified. After months and months of playing phone tag, they told me they still wouldn’t give me my introductory offer points. Terrible customer service and terrible company.

Not woth it. Have had the card for many years never late, great credit scores, credit history of 27 years, haven't even applied for a credit card in 5 years, never late on anything, have spent thousands on the card and pay it right back, and excellent income but yet I can't get a credit limit increase. Just going to put the card away and not use it. All my other cards consistently give me credit limit increases even when I don't ask. Discover is by far better.
Amex is by far the best CCard company. Great customer service. Quick to resolve any problems or concerns. Have been with them for many years.

Excellent card for groceries up to $6000 annual spending limit. Also offers discounts on a variety of stores from time to time. Annual fee is somewhat high ($95) but still comes out ahead in groceries' cashback compered to my other cards.
Solid Card but Balance transfer opportunities are slim. Also a high APR % and foreign transaction fees. Overall its a decent card for points and rewards but not for balance transfers

Only advantage of amex had compared to their competitors use to be customer service . Lately is a hit and miss depending the operators had gold and platinum for years , just not worth it even if you travel alot.
I feel as if American Express is always on my side, and has my back. I enjoy their customer rewards program and late checkouts with the platinum card. Their customer service is par none!!

Opened the card in September with 746TU 745EQ 735EXP. Was approved for the card with a $1000 limit which was weird after being approved for CSP with an $13,400 limit. Also, the threshold for the bonus was $2000. But I went with it. Used it for gas food and some hotels, paid it off as soon as I used it or paid balance in full before statement closing. In December, I requested a CL increase and was bumped to $5000. Kept paying and using similar. In June was bumped to $10,000. So yes......slow start on the card but with proper use and payments you will get the better limits.


Earning 12x at hotels is great especially when combined with Gold (which you get automatically with the card) or Diamond status. You basically end up earning 32x/$1. Plus Hilton has great bonuses like double points or triple points if you use their card (which adds up to around 54x. They add up quick!


Use it for gas, food shopping and dining and earn 6x per dollar. If you drive and buy groceries, again, adds up quickly.


When you hit $15k, the free night certificate has no point limit so you can use it for a night in any market for even the fanciest hotels (Conrad, Waldorf, etc.)


The $95/year isn't bad for the perks at all. Including 10 priority pass uses per year. And alot of the AMEX Offers are pretty useful.


Perks are pretty great. I would definitely give the card at least a 4.5/5.
department: Hilton Honors American Express Surpass® Card

content: Was given a CL of $7,600 with an instant decision. Credit Score was 720 at time of application. Card came fast. Had 12 months of 0% apr.

I wish i could give them ZERO stars. They don't have poor customer service, they have NO customer service. I have called them and used their chat system and they either don't answer or ghost me. When i do speak to a customer service "supervisor", they say they don't have the authority to help me.
They DROPPED my credit limit, and I have been FAITHFULLY making the payments! I could see this happening if I was late 90 days, I WAS NEVER! Have this card if you have money and do NOT "need" credit.
This is a great card! Being able to get 6% cash back on grocery store purchases is simply outstanding. This is now the only card we use for grocery store purchases.
Very few issues with Amex. All have been resolved promptly. I would recommend the American Express family of cards to anyone. The Gold card is especially good for restaurants.

Upgraded my SkyMiles platinum to Reserve and glad I did. Yes, the annual fee is high, but after getting companion certificates, TSA precheck, CLEAR access, no-fee baggage, lounge guest passes and lounge access, the $550 is TOTALLY worth it.


I travel about once every 2 months (so not frequent, but enough) and hate waiting by the gates. Lounges are totally worth it. You get great complimentary food and drink, comfortable seating, wifi and even showers. It really makes travelling enjoyable. LAX has re-opened the Centurion Lounge and I cannot wait to check it out this month.


AMEX customer service has always been superb for me. They are not perfect, but I would rate them much better than most.


I did get to use my companion certificates this year (in late August) and that has been worth the annual fee alone. Airfares are through the roof right now. I got 2-round trip tickets from LAX to MIA for under $160 (air tax?) I also used the card's miles for a later trip to Miami and paid a total of $448 for two round-trip tickets coast-to-coast.


My only complaint is that Delta's 787 Dreamliner order was cancelled. Flying those jetliners across the country are such a joy but I guess I have to fly American if I want to fly on those.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Reserve American Express Card

content: Great card. I absolutely love it. 4x points on groceries and dining out, no interest, and no preset limit. Next up will be the Platinum.

I received a voucher from Delta in the mail during the first week of May 2022 with an offer to earn 65,000 bonus miles instead of the 40,000 miles after spending $2,000 in eligible purchases during the first three months. The offer also mentioned my full name as well as my Skymiles and said to apply today using my SkyMiles numbers (please see attached pictures).


I followed what the offer said and got approved for a Delta American Express Gold card. I spent the $2,000 as needed and got my credit card in the mail before the offer ended which was 06.08.2022. However, I logged onto my delta account and only saw 40,000 miles credited into my SkyMiles. I contacted the customer service line for Delta and they instructed me to call the customer service line for American Express. I proceeded to call American Express and customer service said they'll open an investigation and asked for my POID number which I gave to them. Nothing happened and I called again after 15 days to follow up. They asked me for POID number again which I gave and they said they will investigate again. I called for a third time and asked to speak to a supervisor, he said his name is Diego (employee number ###4164) and he gave me the most incomprehensible, unreasonable, unexplainable answer. He said the offer was not found and he was not able to tell me what the voucher I received means or where is it coming from. I offered to take photos and email him the voucher I got in the mail, and he declined. The worst part about all of this is he said "you could be saying anything" regarding the voucher even though I had it in hand. I asked if I could escalate it and he said "there is nothing we can do", and then I asked to speak to his supervisor and he refused. It sounded like his answers were inconsistent.


In brief, I received a letter with a promotion from Delta and I applied by following the exact instruction, but Amex was not able to honor the promotion they promised their customer, and refused to investigate the matter whilst being rude and unprofessional. I guess I don't understand why Delta and Amex could lie to their customer and could not fulfill 25,000 mile difference which is around $250. I believe this is an absolute fraud. I want to express my disappointment and frustration with a big company like this for lying to me and refusing to offer to help. And I hope people reading this don't ever do business with them.

AMERICAN EXPRESS IS THE BEST IN THE BUSINESS ! THEY WILL HELP THERE CUSTOMERS FOR SURE !


YOUR INTEREST RATE WILL DEPEND

ON YOUR EXPERIAN CREDIT SCORE
No common sense in how the credit card program or app login works. I don't know who is over user service at this company but they have no regard for convenience or even one's credit score.

Today there is an email: "You will now have one login for your American Express® Savings and Card accounts." Really? This is a huge issue. First, safety and security. A credit card compromised now could affect all life savings!! Really, AMEX? I'm taking my business elsewhere.

I have had a Centurion Card (Black Card) for years. The service levels have declined to the point it is a waste of money. They cannot accurately book a plane reservation or even a dinner reservation. Do not waste your money. Their customer service doesnt even answer the phone anymore.
One of the best cards to have. Supports my son in college. Useful for emergencies and misc school requirements. First choice in student help.

I love this card that comes with great promotions. 100 % recommended for everyone

Very soon I will apply for a credit limit increase
Card is very flexible, e8nabling me to purchase my daily necessities easily and makes my life much easier. Debt is generally paid off each month.
I’ve never used this card but got charged $99 for fee. Not fair and paid it in full but here it sits on my credit report as if I owe it still frustrating
Reliable for any needs I have, consistent service and review of credit line for increases. One of the favorite cards I use and one I plan to continue to do business with!
Excellent card to use don’t leave home without it. A miles add up fast with purchases and there have many options to choose from. Enjoy the card!

My credit balance went up because they did not receive my sent check. I contacted them twice about this matter but never heard from them. I included the check number. This should not have impacted my credit score. I sent a much larger check to cover outstanding balance.

worst card ever got a copy to my mailing address saying I am eligible for 0% Apr for 15 months along with welcome offer of 200$. when I went on and applied for this credit card they said congratulations I am approved but they say I am not eligible for 0% Apr and welcome offer, worst experience ever never gonna apply for any Amex card again, trash service.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: Never applied for card n don't have it..fraud.american express never contacted me.other 3 agencies r frozen to prevent this crap..and still they don't check

American Express is my go to credit card. If I could only choose to keep one card in my wallet this would be it. Some may ask if that’s a viable first choice as you have to pay the balance in full each month, but AMEX has come a long way and you do have many choices now. Although I do always pay in full each month so that doesn’t matter much to me. What does matter is their level of customer service. You can tell that they love to keep their customers happy and I for one have only had over the top, wow me, amazing experiences. Everytime I need a dispute…hands down BEST! They make it painless. They make everything SIMPLE. I have four Amex cards. Gold is my favorite because of all the perks and did I mention ease of use?! The Uber Eats and Grubhub dining credits alone pay for the annual fee. So yes. I will continue to be an AMEX fan girl for life. ??

They have become unhelpful and made changes to their policies that make the use of this card worthless. The card I had was the business gold with no preset spending limit. However if you don’t continuously charge a lot every month and then pay it off, do not expect to make any larger purchases all at once. They penalize you for not charging up high balances and paying them off on a monthly basis. They are no longer beneficial to me, many other cards out there that have more to offer.

Lot of hidden charges and customer care never respond to the queries in positive manner and will take weeks of time to close the request requested by the customers. I have raised the request 10 days prior to the billing date however the request is still in process and they are not bothered about the concerns of the customers, they will say their back end team is working
AMEX has evolved over the years with supreme customer service and easy to use tools on their website that offer great solutions to any problem you may be experiencing.

Smaller businesses don't take this card. I was wanting the $225 welcome bonus to use when I wanted to. When I really needed it. They took the $225 off my statement automatically. I was not happy with that. No other card that I have does that. I'm sure it said that somewhere in the paper work that they send you with the new card but I do not read all that. I know how a credit card works. I know it's my fault but, I think you should be able to use it when you want to, or in my case, need it.
I love the amex vredit card, I take care of it dearly. When I lived alta street in Lincoln heights I took very good care of it. It's been very good to me and my family for sure.
American express is very hard to get and increase with I've been with them for 5 years or more credit score went highly makes more money i keep getting turned down
Very disappointed in the decline in customer service. They removed benefits from the gold card and aren't as attentive as they once were.
Excellent customer service and benefits. The annual fee is high but the perks that it comes are far more valuable than the fee! Great card
I was so excited on being a customer of American Express and it has help me increase my score in a short time. I also have recommended some friends and they have been very happy to.
Amazing AMEX cash back card, the best cash back card from AMEX???I love this card , I highly recommend this card for high earn cash back on gas and groceries

I've been satisfied using this savings account for more than 7 years. But recently, their customer service has been abysmal. I was trying to remove a joint owner due to death. Simple enough at every other bank I worked with, but here, every time I called to check on the status I was given a different story about what was required. Multiple calls and a month later, the issue is still not resolved and all withdrawals are on hold until it is. (I would cancel the account if it weren't for their good interest rates.)

I have been an American Express Blue card member for 22 years. I just called customer service today July 2,2022 at approximately 3pm est. and spoke to a manager who told me his name was Diego. I explained to him that I had mistakenly not paid my entire balance of $50 off on June 28,2022 and asked if they could please look at my history and see that I do pay my balances in full and to please extend a courtesy and remove my late fee of $29 dollars. He replied with unfortunately we cannot remove the late fee.........WOW. So after 22 years thats how American Express treats their customers. Just figured I'd share that with everyone. Sad the direction things are going.

I have been an American Express customer since 1986. I have always paid my entire balance the same month. I hadn't used 2 accounts in years. I assumed they had closed. When I was sent a new card for my Amex every day card, I called and found out that my platinum card was still open.

My son and his 3 young children recently moved in with me, because his wife has post pardon psychosis. He is working full time while the kids are in daycare, which that in itself was an obstacle he just overcame. His kids have seen thier mom deteriorate the past 18 months and seeing her less and less. I added my son to my account and I was impressed with how easy that was. Ever since the 3 cards, 2 for my account and 1 for his and mine arrived it has been by far the worst bank/ credit/ even financial situation I have ever experienced. I have tried to buy my grandson a Nintendo switch 3 times all getting declined, after speaking each time to a representative for over an hour verifying who I am. Each time being promised after that it wouldn't happen again. They shut off all 3 cards yesterday. My son got declined at Wendy's for $14 charge and couldn't buy his kids a four for four. I am going to send them back the notarized signature and close all my accounts. I never imagined this company I have used for so long has treated me and my family with such disrespect, and disregard for my concerns. I don't even want explanation. . I'll be just fine, my C.S. is a 793. Just thought you might like to know.

I LOVE THIS CARD: I treat it like my debt card, charge and the next day make payment(s) on it you can do 5 different payments daily and that is what I do each charge had a payment. It's easier keeping up with it that way. Plus, the points at this time my husband and I are using the points on our GAS since gas is so high per gallon. We use this card more than any other credit card or debt card.
Easy to apply, fast direct deposit on approval. A seamless, easy process with a company I trust, have been an AMEX card customer for years.

Travel service by phone always disconnects - I give them my call back number but they do not call back. Seems all fine when can book online, but if one ever has to cancel a flight and get a credit, expect to spend 3+ hours to utilize your own money. T
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: Well worth the $95 annual fee. Six percent on groceries alone pays for the fee many times over. Paying $95 and getting back $300 to $400 annually is a no brainer.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content:
Amex refused to honor signup bonus after $15,000+ spend in 3 months. Apparently the annual fee does not count, which I missed. Normally this isn't an issue, as a $99 annual you likely cross the spend requirement anyways.. but with it being $695 it's easy to think you qualified after hitting $15,000, when in reality you had a little ways to go.


Amex also stats even when I close the card at the end of the 12 months I will not be able to receive the challenge bonus in the future. (I thought the terms were only if you did receive the bonus you can never get it again, but support stated that you only have one shot and it doesn't matter if you did not receive it when you've had the card before).


At $695 a year, when most of the benefits never add any value due to overlapping with other Amex cards, it's not worth it if you do not receive the signup bonus.
department: The Business Platinum Card® from American Express

content: Love my AMEX and will be using it frequently in the future.I put in a credit limit increase request and they responded immediately.

My second and third credit card I used 3 month now and I though this is an excellent credit card it is good to have one of them but make sure you’ve to pay at the due date of times for you good credit report.
I love the cash back an the payment process an how quickly it reports to your credit. We will see how long it takes before they increase my limit an then I will give a 5 star.
Good card. 6% cash back on groceries and 3% cash bank on gas in exchange for a $95 annual fee. I got an intro cash bonus and the annual fee waived the first year.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: Very useful information i can always depend on this kind of information to keep me posted at all time I will definitely recommend doing this information to give you a very accurate

Multiple card holder for last 20 years. Excellent credit. Cards paid in whole monthly. $10 paid in interest, ever. Was $200 low on a due date, the “overdraft” attempt cost $39/day and went on 10 days with no contact from AMEX. Only got a letter in the snail-mail 10 days later saying they tried to charge X amount on the 1st due date, and I had insufficient funds. I don’t babysit these things, they’re automatic and I’m used to humans and banks that put a bit of effort in. Anyway, I immediately logged in and paid it off in whole, as I would have 5 min after any potential text notification. Come to find out I was charged 39/day x 10 days overdraft fees and nearly $500 in penalty interest over the next 3 statements. No call, no text, no notifications? What in the h*ll kind of interest rate costs me $500 in 10 days anyway? Sure isn’t the APR I signed up for. That’s more like the APR changed into a MPR. Hours on the phone with them multiple times asking for an explanation of business practices, simple decency and charges resulted in 2/3 of the charges removed and no sensical answers to the rest. If I have to call this company one more time, it’s over for me. Benefits be da**ed. That was a bunch of nonsense, on a level I’ve never experienced.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: Lost my prepaid card and called to get a new one. It only had a few dollars left on it but I figured I'd try. It took me 3 phone calls and transfers to get to the correct department and then over 1/'2 an hour to give her my information. Her language was hard to understand but we muddles through it and then at the end she races through a URL that I had to send something to and I lost it. Couldn't understand one letter she was telling me. For the few dollars I was getting the process was too much and I told her she could keep her money.
Love....love ...love ...this card always been easy to use security is great always worked with me if I needed a few extra days to make a payment...

I have been an Amex card member for 30 years and a platinum member for at least 10. I have loved every minute until today when flying international on Lufthansa business class on flights booked through my platinum card. Don’t ever do this bc Amex somehow canceled my husbands ticket and no one has been able to help us rebook. This has been unbearable as we are celebrating a big milestone and now we may end up missing our entire prepaid tour. Thanks Amex platinum!
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: Pathetic! I have very good credit and 14 credit cards and was denied an American Express card! I have a Zero balance on my cards except one! ? I don’t make late payments and I’ve paid everything on time. Because I recently bought a new house I was denied credit because of “too many “ inquiries into my credit report. If you know anything about buying a new home and getting insurance for the home, switching automobile insurance, then you know that your credit is hit a lot. Which you have no control over. It’s pathetic that this company thanks that they’re so good when I have 14 other credit cards and an open line of $20,000 in credit and they treated me like trash when I applied for their cheap card! Don’t waste your time ! Go to credit a card company that deserves you. I called customer service and they just hung up on me so obviously when I told him I didn’t need his credit card that I just wanted to let them know that I was disappointed that I they didn’t really do a accurate check on me before the denial letter and I was offended at their accuracy and customer service. So my husband has been hospitalized for about a month. I was dealing with insurance stuff, paying HIS credit card bills etc, and lo and behold, I forgot to pay MY AMEX rose card. I found out with a text from them saying my card was past due. I almost had a heart attack.


I called them immediately and explained to them that I must have been distracted and forgot to pay them. (I figured out later that I double-paid my platinum AMEX) NO PROBLEM. They credited me the $29 late charge and wiped away the note that I was late. They were sympathetic and compassionate. I think this service is hard to come by--- the CSR actually asked me how my husband was doing! Being part of the AMEX family is an awesome thing. Yes, the yearly fee is high. But if you take advantage of the perks, this card pays for itself.


It's a great feeling when you know that AMEX has your back in case of an emergency.
Best card out there. Customer service experience is amazing with people you can understand, willing to help you unlike capital one, citi, chase, and so on. Never will I switch to another company.

AmEx Blue Cash preferred is a great card for me. I spend a lot at grocery stores at 6% cash back and gas stations 3% cash back. It is well worth the $95 I will definitely keep this card. AmEx is a delight to talk to when needed on the phone. They are eager to help, any way they can.

I don't understand the negative reviews. I assume maybe for the "Serve prepaid card"? AmEx is hands down one of the best CC's to carry. The Hilton Honors rewards are awesome (as is the name lol) but the cash back is beat, in my experience, only by the Citibank CitiCash card (I am sure Barclay's is the exception, but I'm not there yet(. I am curious though... those carrying the real "metal" card, is it REALLY worth 10k a year just to say "yeah, I have this card"?
Easy, fast, low-interest rate, what more can you ask for? I love my AMEX and all the fabulous, creative, and useful lending products that come with it.

Cash back can be applied to statement balance. You currently get $300 bonus if you charge $3000 in first six months. $95 fee waived in first year.

Absolutely The Best! That pretty much sums it up, I’ve been a member since 1992 and have other accounts with reputable banks and the only one that I can say that compares to American Express would be my Navy Federal. Thanks American Express.

I have had an "Everyday Card:" for approximately 5-6 years. It started out at 14.9%, but after a couple years it went up to 18.9%. Then approx. 2 years ago they jacked it to 22.24% for no logical reason. All this time my credit rating was over 700. When this happened, I transferred what balance I had to two other cards with either 0% - 3.9% promo rates. Early this year, 2022, I had no choice but to put aprox. $3,300 in medical expenses on the card. For the first 2 months the rate was 22.24%, but this month with no explanation the rate went to 22.74% with no explanation and my minimum payment is actually higher this month, for 6/22 than it had been even though I had reduced the balance due by about $200. If I can get out from under I will again at the soonest opportunity and would never recommend American Express to anyone.
Thank you, American Express! Great card and friendly customer service ! The Plan It feature and no interest for 15 months were greatly appreciated for an unexpected major expense!

Not a place to deposit your money, they are untrustworthy and maybe even criminal. I started a ACH withdrawal on funds that had been sitting in this bank for almost a year and because of the large dollar amount American Express bank refused to honor my request for the withdrawal. They gave no reason because there was no reason other than it was a withdrawal they did not want to happen. I was treated unprofessionally and even hung up on by three different employees,

spent four hours on the phone, finally a supervisor agreed that what was going on was wrong and completed the ACH. The funds were completely available and clear for any withdrawal but someone at this less than honest bank did not like the idea of the very large exit of money. I recommend any depositor look elsewhere and in fact, lots of higher paying interest accounts are out there now, much higher that American Express bank rates.

This is an OK card overall but in 2022 there are lot of similar, better cards I'd take over this one. The real reason I believe most people (including myself) get this card is because it is effectively the starter card for building a relationship with Amex. Two good reasons to do that. One being Amex will only ever do a hard credit pull on you once (on your first approved card with them), so getting another card with Amex is a lot less risky to your credit than with other issuers. This is kinda nice for if you're going for something like a Gold/Platinum setup in the future. The other is that being in Amex earns you a LOT of exclusive offers, most of which you will probably never use even if you're a turbo-shopaholic. But these include many of the bigger shopping retailers like Adidas and Uniqlo.


If the above is important to you, then the BCE is a decent choice. But the perks themselves like the 3% back on groceries also exist on similar cards like the Chase Freedom Flex and Capital One SavorOne, with more competitive benefits and no minimum rewards redemption (compared with the BCE where annoyingly, you need to have at least $25 in cashback rewards to redeem it). I've since upgraded to the BC Preferred since it has a 6% groceries cashback, but it does carry the caveat of a $95 annual fee.

Little over rated for what you get. So I'm gonna hang on this card for another year. Maybe my review will change later. Many places do not accept America express . I guess because of the high fees.

Thank you for everything American Express especially on the high annual percentage rate..keep up the good customer service employees, you guys are awesome!

American Express card is great to be used when you would like to travel and keep all of your expenses in one place it’s also great for day-to-day needs and purchase
This car is great I just really like having it to use as needed for travel and day today expenses shelters gas groceries it is truly a wonderful card
Sure fast approval process and since I already had an account with American Express no hard credit inquiry done. Only thing I did not like was the loan is not accessible via the AMEX App.

This company does not care about the customer. I have tried to resolve an ongoing issue, only to conclude that this company is lacking the ability to resolve any issues at all. I put an amount in dispute and it was not supposed to earn interest while in dispute. Not only did it earn interest,but the balance went from 900 to not 4200. I stopped using the card a long time ago and they do not have a way to prove that I owe any of it. They cannot go back more than 9 months of your history. That is absurd. You can never speak to the same representative. What a sham of a company. Get a card with any other company, but American Express to trust your charges and disputes with. I hope it catches up to them. No wonder costco dropped them a long time ago! Visa stands by their customers!!!

I haven't had this one very long, it was upgraded so my gold amex account which I had used for years was closed (ouch). AMERICAN DISAPPOINTMENT or RIDICULOUS EXPRESS. Will give you up, and then will let you down.

A whole week of disrespectful calls setting deadlines every time, and threatening me with closing my account in case if no answer, they spend way too much of my time asking for additional info, and corrections at their complicated forms. How much of disrespect am i have to take to use it? I am done

Amex only cares about their revenue, not their customers

they refuse to back us up and refund us a fee from a rental car company that ran an extortion scheme on us. department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I’ve been a member since 1988 - this shows why I rate this card 5 stars. They have great reports too. Their online chat is super, if the agent doesn’t know the answer they don’t hesitate to reach their higher management. Fast n helpful.

I was a happy Blue Cash Preferred credit card customer until I used the card to buy a luxury good outside the US and got charged $200 (2.75%) in transaction fee. I assumed Amex was the best of my credit card options for the purchase since they run their own payments network. Wrong, this product has insane international transaction fees and customer service refused to do anything about it. I have other, better, more transparent credit cards in my wallet. My Amex account is now closed.
Excellent card. Great rewards. My best card yet. Great customer service. I never leave home without this card just like the commercial
The card came in the mail quickly, highest credit limit on a card of got. Credit was 714 FICO. Three credit bureaus were in the mid 700's

American express platinum payment options are confusing and inconvenient. One month must pay 90 % percent of balance. Next month they want only 10% of balance. I love the perks and rewards. I recommend this cad for that alone
Love this card! Because of the extra points for restaurants, including Uber eats, and groceries. I have not paid for a flight to see my family in Florida in the last 5 years.
This is the best card I have and it has genuinely been an asset in helping me increase my good standing with all three credit bureaus.
I love how this card lets you pay charges and gives you automatic credit on your balance without it taking days pending. Great customer service.

Three months ago I requested American Express to dispute a charge from Hertz car rental. After supplying American Express the documents I received at the Hertz rental desk and those I received when I made that charge through a third party discounter AND written details of the happenstance of how I was overcharged, American Express opened a Dispute for me.

A few weeks later American Express informed me Hertz answered their inquiry by sending them copies of my rental documents and Hertz's decision that the charge was valid. American Express then closed the dispute and sent me that decision and those copies of the rental documents Hertz supplied.

The items American Express supplied to me that they said Hertz provided to them did not include all those I supplied that displayed Hertz's overcharge. American Express basically ignored my claim and supported Hertz's overcharge that was very clearly evident on my rental documents. I requested American Express to reopen the Dispute and they did.

The same response from Hertz was given to American Express again and I requested the dispute be reopened - twice more! Roughly 3 weeks went by for each of these disputes. Each additional time American Express ruled for Hertz - IGNORING my paperwork and documentation that was more complete. American Express totally ignored the documentation I supplied them from the rental car discounter who in fact made the rental with Hertz for me.

Rather than go on and on about my experience of Hertz's "bait and switch" at the rental desk and how American Express failed to "act as my (their client) representative repeatedly - let me say that I DID GET THE REFUND OF THE AMOUNT HERTZ OVERCHARGED ME! A travel organization (not involved in this rental transaction at all) assisted me in getting Hertz to make the refund to my American Express Account.

The morale of my experience -

DON'T TRUST OR EXPECT AMERICAN EXPRESS TO ACT ON YOUR BEHALF OR AS YOUR ADVOCATE AND BEWARE AT THE HERTZ RENTAL COUNTER OF UP-CHARGES!!!!!

We (Gava Commercial Group LLC) have a business credit card from American express. There was a double charge by a merchant. The info follows:

The dispute Ref. No.D-27433536 has lots of supporting documentation to show the double charge by the merchant. American express did not even look into the uploaded documents to come to a conclusion. American Express is so much biased toward the merchant, I reopened the dispute. It is asking me to upload any supporting documentation, I uploaded a couple of documents. American express's behavior is such non-sensical, it kept all the newly uploaded documents into the previously uploaded documents section. The dispute again says it is awaiting my response.


American Express is not committed to protecting small consumers like my company.


A 5th grader can understand the documentation and the charge in question, I am thinking American express intentionally does not align with the truth. American Express is afraid that it loses the commission if they undo the charges.


How low can you go?


I pledge not to use American express cards anymore from now on.


Thank you for being an unethical company.
Excellent card with seamless fraud protection. Accepted 95% of the places we eat, shop and travel. With Delta Air miles attached, we upgrade to first class routinely.
Positive experience. No negative issues. It is a good card to have access to in an emergency. Great customer service and reliable.
The annual fee is very high and there isn’t many cash back categories that you could potentially earn points with, more for travel.
AmericanExpress is one of the best company to do business with. They believed in me when started out building credit. Thank you AMEX

They WERE fine intil after 3 years decided to close my zero balance credit card without informing me first. They are ruining my credit rating for YEARS. It had a ZERO balance, never missed a payment. Bad business practice, don't plan on benefiting with a credit card here.
I have not used my card since last year and feel like someone else is using it. I have reached out to them and not received any response on this matter
One of THE BEST cards ive ever had ! I recieved an automatic credit increase and when i asked for more it was also granted, great rewards and best customer service i love american express
This really help me to get my score up to when I was younger I had a great score but now it’s just getting better and I definitely know what I’m doing with it now

This card has saved my but a few times for buy last minute plane tickets and helping with moving but otherwise sucks the interest rate increases are like clockwork and half of my payments are interest

I love the 6% Cash Back on Groceries and 3% on Gas. I like the overall experience of American Express and its very helpful customer service, as well as the classic and unpretentious look of the new Blue Cash Preferred Card.

I have never had one problem with my American Express Cards. Any time i have had a situation with a merchant, I notify AmXp, and they were there to take care of any situation and have always had my back. Thanks AmEx, you beat them all!

Once i provided all this information to their customer service team, their answer was “sorry sir there is nothing we can do” they said i should have read the terms and agreements and they did not provide any solution, just basically saying tough luck, and continue with my day. Im extremely disappointed since i have not even reached a full month with the card and now i gotta find a way to cover a annual fee of that high amount. Really bad first impression for a new customer, i truly expected a more helpful solution, like what chase or other banks have provided for me.

<p>Great welcome bonus ,really good rewards earnings on groceries and restaurants this card is for those who like to pay off card monthly (You can carry balance but at a ridiculous high apr) also $250 annual fee is high but reward opportunities almost covers that .In reality that's $21/ Month to have this card.


Lastly visually this card looks good and always gets a reaction when used.</p>

Just received the card. I switched over from my other cash rewards American Express card because it had an annual fee and I didn’t want to do that anymore. I didn’t get enough benefits to justify the $95/mo.

Love the 6% cash back at grocery stores and super markets because I have plenty to feed in my family. 3% back at gas stations is an A+ for me and for subscriptions I also get 6% cash back!! Wished I could earn more than 1% when I go shopping at department stores for clothes/shoes for my kids though. That would be awesome!! Amex does have offers that card holders can add to their card to earn additional rewards/cash back but some of the stores are not the ones I shop at or close by. Hopefully they'll add more department stores in the near future.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: My inbox has been bombarded with notices of pre-approval for this and other rewards cards. The Covid pandemic has deeply impacted the travel industry, the hotel industry, food and beverage industry. The repercussions of the intermittent lockdowns, border closings, vaccination passports, and related economic stress has prompted these rewards card companies to really push their product. Sickness and death have slowed the public's spending in these industries. Slam dunk approval on all these low limit travel cards. I believe I'll pass.

American express offers some of the best benefits of any card, I love the Amex perks, its great for travel, dinning, lodging, I use it for almost everything, An i never carry a balance, always pay it in full.
I have had an account with American Express since 1973 and they have often been my go-to card. They are very good with resolution of disputes with sellers.

It's my favorite number one credit card in all customer service, security protection, I love it's the best for everything on travel reservations and excellent travel tickets. I've been with them for 21 years I don't change to my American Express.
Excellent travel card co-branded with Delta Airlines. Great discounts thru Deltas travel Sky Miles program. You can bundle hotel, car and airline tickets at a discount.
American Express is a great card to have. They give you reward points when you purchase from gas to groceries to flights to anything you want to buy.
Love this card. Issue it all the time for the points and hotel stays. Any traveling that is done I use this card. The perks are great. I have been Amex customer since 2015.

Great cashback credit card for everyday use for groceries and gas. They offer a $200 reward for spending $2000 in the first 6 months of use. They offer monthly credit scores from Experian Fico 8 and Transunion Vantage 3.0

Unbelievable business practices - They offered a zero percent offer "in recognition of your membership" (20 years) but exempted fees which seemed reasonable until you consider that one has no control over the annual fee, so with great care to ensure everything posted properly and payments were made on time and no interest was earned several months in a row, the annual fee popped in and started racking up interest. Thank you American Express for showing me what I should expect "in recognition of your membership"

It's okay I guess. Average CC. Absolutely nothing special really comes to mind when thinking about this card in general. Which, is insane, because here I am trying to come up with a 130 character review for absolutely no reason at all.

So far I love my Amex BCP!! Since I've had my Amex card I've been using it a lot on my grocery shopping, subscription services which I do earn 6% cash back, gas prices have been up the roof but 3% cash back does help a bit because with all these high prices lately why not use a card that is helping you earn something back. My Amex is mostly my go to card even though I do have some other cards they don't earn as much as my Amex BCP. But then again with my Amex I'm only able to redeem for statement credits and my other cards I'm able to redeem it for statement credit, cash back, use it to pay purchases, redeem for gift cards, and so on. Also my Amex has no annual fee for the 1st year and then after the 1st year the annual fee will be $95.00, which isn't too bad if you're spending a good amount monthly/yearly.
Amex is secure, reliable. Smart to use. Their services are very good for an individual. I enjoy the way the attend to regular customer.
I Love my Am Ex Card, use it for everything. Bought Adjustable beds with it. Great Company & great staff. Always helpful & cover all my vet bills to keep my beloved rescue four Kitty’s healthy!
Provides a lot of opportunities to earn points. This card also rewards its users on a normal basis. I would recommended this card for everyone.
American Express is my and my wife’s favorite card to pay for purchases. We always pay the balance on the card every month. The card is recognized in most places and countries.

This is an easy card to know how to calculate your cash back rewards and a great AMEX starter card. This was the first AMEX I was approved for and I loved their services. I especially love that I can send payments through Venmo with my AMEX send account with 0% fees. I started with a $1,000 limit and after only 6 months they automatically increased my credit limit to $3,500. I still have 8 months of 0% APR which is great in the event I need to carry a balance. I rarely do, but it's nice to know just in case.

They're really trying to pan these travel and hotel cards off here in the Covid era. With all the travel bans, chancy airline service, vax mandates, sickness, jobs loss, and general uncertainty. It says my chances are excellent if I were to apply but the biggest thing is once they check they're not going to give me any credit. If you get approved the next step, done at activation, is an IRS 4506 release of tax records. This is done by Equifax. I guess if you don't release your tax records to Equifax on behalf of Amex you can lose your other cards.

I love the duo brand credit card because of the benefits that this card have when shopping or stay-cationing. Im very delighted to have this credit card.

Great card, good rewards, definitely worth the annual fee. A credit card for high spenders like my self for business and personal.

They also informed me they waived a interest charge for me that i never requested within that year and since i got that courtesy i couldn't get it again (i never asked for an interest fee waived and didn't know that existed, but could be a good perk). Double wammy hit. Wth happened to your customer service amx? Had no problems for one 5 years, not until the worst time possible! I would cancel you only if it didn't have adverse effects on my credit reporting atm in my life. Further, i made payment for amount due in full immediately after noticing the error because i don't want to deal with you anymore. That was over $6k in a single payment. Grrr!!!

If there is ever and issue with my card i receive amazing customer service! It’s great to travel with and I use it for all our family’s food in order to receive cash back.

I was offered 90,000 bonus miles for the Delta SkyMiles AMEX Platinum Card at the Sunport airport in September 2021, although I have the Delta SkyMiles blue card.

I got approved and received the card. I spent the required $3,000 in three months, paid the associated membership fee of $250, but I have not received the 90,000 bonus points.

It was December 13th 2021 I was checking my account to see if my child tax credit head came through yet. I had planned to use this to finish the rest of my shopping for Christmas for I have six children. Much to my surprise when I called it said my account had been canceled so I called to speak to somebody I spoke to two different ladies who told me that they check would be returned to the government and then mailed back to me. So basically I was screwed for Christmas and if I wanted to challenge this situation I would have to write a letter in ink and mail it to them. I can truly say I have never been so devastated or disgusted in my entire existence. I will never ever use Jackson Hewitt again for taxes as long as they are with American Express.

Today I received my new AMEX Business Card, and already I am disappointed. I find their marketing to be at least disingenuous, and at most, outright deceptive. I am a highly qualified applicant with a FICO score of 830 and decades of credit history without a single missed payment or ever having even approached my credit limits. I applied for the card because of the 120,000pt introductory offer given that I have a large purchase I have to make in January that would immediately meet the minimum purchase requirement. AMEX claims to have "No Preset Spending Limit", however, when I called the company to confirm receipt of my new card, I was told that my spending limit was only $10,000!! They said that this was because I am new. Therefore, only a portion of my intended purchase can go on this card, and I would need to wait to spend the additional $5,000 in subsequent months to meet the spending requirement. So they are intentionally limiting my purchasing power & making it more difficult for me to meet the spending requirement. When I pointed out to them that I have a Chase Sapphire Reserve card with a $65,000 credit line they didn't care, despite easily being able to confirm this through the credit check they themselves performed. They assured me my spending limit would increase (despite there officially being a "no preset spending limit") as I used and paid off the card. So an AMEX Bait and Switch. I will wire the funds to my card to fund the purchase, collect the points, then cancel the card after the first year. I strongly recommend anyone looking for a business card to get the Chase Ink Business Preferred Card, as well as a Chase Sapphire Reserve card in their own name. Points can be transferred from the business card to the personal card, and the Chase Sapphire Reserve has amazing perks. They instantly credit $300 in travel expenses - ANY TRAVEL EXPENSES - once they are incurred. Not $200 in "incidental" airline charges like AMEX offers. They also have deals where they offer 50% bonus points on Apple purchases. I used my points for (2) new MacBook Air laptops, an I-phone 12, and a mix of accessories. AMEX's perks are for Indeed? Adobe? Seriously??? Go with Chase, I promise you it's a far more REWARDING experience.

content: There’s a reason I’ve been with AMX for 25 years, They have your back. Anytime I have had disputes with a seller, AMX takes care of it.

Just signed up for the American Express Delta Blue card a few months ago. At first it was great, and I used it for everything.


I Spent the last 3-5 years fixing my credit after medical and other hardships forced me into a tough spot. But I did it! Got my score up to a 780! I had plans to purchase a house and finally get my life back on track.

So I received my card around the beginning of October and planned a trip and booked my flight. I spent over a $1000 but made a $1000 payment right away. I ended up purchasing other items and whatnot for the trip along with daily necessities. I had over $1000 on the card again. So around November 6th (three weeks before my first bill was even due, and days before I received it in the mail) I made another $950 payment leaving about $100 left unpaid on the card. I wanted my card balance low in case I wanted to use it while on Vacation.


Come to find out a day or two later that my credit score took a 100 point hit because American Express felt the need to report my high Balance on November 1st to the credit bureau 4 weeks before my bill was even due. I didn't miss a payment and actually made a $1000 payment before they felt the need to report my balance.

Now my credit score is ruined, at least for the purpose of purchasing a house at a low mortgage rate.


I called and asked them if this was common practice for them. Reporting a customer to the bureaus for high credit limit before you give the customers a chance to even get their first bill in the mail, yet alone giving them a chance to pay before the due date, and after they already made payments in good faith weeks before the bill was even due. They basically said yes. They acknowledged my current low balance and said they would report it immediately to the bureaus. But that was all they could do.

So now I will never use this card again. It will sit on my credit and just be an open account. Good job AMEX, ruining a brand-new customers life after he spent years trying to fix it.

I’ve been an Amex user for many years and I have to say customer service have always been great BUT what I don’t like are the annual fees in this pandemic and hardship many have lost or limited income. Do not, REPEAT, DO NOT sign up with American Express!!! PROMOTIONS ARE SCAM!!!!!! They offer enticing promotions to get people to sign up. What caught my attention was an offer for $300 to sign up. All I would have to do to get it would be the usual “spend this amount of money within this amount of time”. Well I did everything required and guess what!? No $300 ever came my way. I spoke with 4 supervisors at this point and they will not budge. All claim that a screen supposedly popped up when I signed up telling me that I wouldn’t be eligible for the promotion. I swear on my mother’s life, there was no such screen. Trust me, I always keep an eye out for things like that when signing up too. NO WAY!!!!!! THERE WAS NO SUCH SCREEN!!!! They are weaseling their way out! And what would it mean even if they had put up a screen!? Why would someone be eligible for a card but not the promotion!??? What kind of scam is that!????? Save yourself the trouble and trust me on this one. Do not sign up with them. You will regret it! The customer service is not good. The promotions are a SCAM!!!!! The two supervisors I most recently spoke with were LEE Employee #GI6685A and Serling #1260134

content: American Express canceled my card due to some vague reason such as I spoke rudely to one of their associates on the phone. Just like most credit card or any corporation, they tend to be remote and impersonal and I despise being routed to different agents 5 times in a row and never accomplish the task at hand such as to question a unauthorized or duplicate charges which can occur with vendors (as I have a business account with them). Not to mention how many times the damn phone calls dropped because they routed me somewhere across the globe in Asia or Europe. But without any warning, I received a letter that the account is cut off and they no longer wanted me as a customer. However, the cancellation letter did not contain the person who wrote and issued the letter and therefore no personal accountability at all. I can't even know if that was based on a personal vendetta of one of the agents. Not only that I was brushed off like dirt after 10 years with this company, my over 280,000 award points were also cancelled by their company's executive office. This act is extremely unprofessional and unethical. To me, that is corporation thievery at its finest to a small guy like me! I have been a champion for American Express for so long as my business have been accepting American Express cards all these years, unlike many other businesses that don't. This experience got me rethink my strategy and my blind devotion to them while they couldn't care one bit simply because I am a no body after all to these faceless, nameless overlords.

I am a small business that accepts American Express at great cost for the convenience of my customers. I recently completed an HVAC installation for a customer and accepted an American Express as both deposit and final payment for completion of the work. The customer did not like the appearance of one small portion of the installation. There was nothing wrong with the job or work. All permits were approved. The customer even had the Manufacturer come to their home for inspection and it was approved by them as an above standard installation. The customer claimed breach of contract and denied the charge. I supplied all documentation to American Express that the job was installed as written on the contract, inspected and approved by Fire Department and they denied my request and charged me back for the job over $5,000. with no recourse. Just DENIED! They did not tell me what was the breach or how to correct no information, just DENIED! All because the customer said so! I will no longer accept American Express at my business and I will be sure to spread the word to colleagues the practices of American Express!

Going through a very bad experience currently with Amex. My business was approved for a business gold card with no preset spending limit. We've been utilizing it for our purchasing and then paying it off each statement period. My partner normally does the purchasing and since he's not the primary signer, Amex put a hold on the account until they can verify my personal taxes? I understand that this is a small business account and it requires a guarantor, but the business income should be taken into consideration. The business will have a lot more spending power than an individual due to its cash flow, and Amex only wants to take into consideration personal tax returns. Which should be a factor to understand that the guarantor has some sort of income, but not the only determining one when there's a business with 100x the personal income. It seems the whole customer service team is overseas and it was honestly a bit challenging to understand these employees. Why not ask for this in the beginning? Now, while they verify the income we have to move all of our purchases over to the previous card. Unnecessary inconvenience. I'm really not happy with this.

After leaving an abusive marriage, and trying to turn my life around, then Covid hits. Without notice, AmEx took my BUSINESS account and reported it to my PERSONAL account as a collection. The last payment was in May, and they did this in July. We have had an excellent relationship with AmEx and always paid on time. Covid severely affected our business income, losing 75% of our business. My personal credit was great. They now have caused a more than 100 point drop on my report.

After contacting the AmEx credit bureau department, as well as the 3rd party collection agency (all day being sent back and forth with no help or answers, except that, "you need to pay the balance off") the 3rd party rep actually had to audacity to say to me, "once you pay this debt you can re-establish a relationship with AmEx as you are a valued customer". Is he insane? After they've done this to me, AND ruined my credit score?

DO NOT even think about signing up with this company. I wish I never had.
Yes I will use American Express card for everything and thank you American Express never have any problems do you think you keep an eye on our credit

Just spoke to Peggy J. from AMEX. She was very rude and did not understand the situation whatsoever. I was told by 5 reps (yes, 5 individual reps) that my account is cleared for a charge I was about to make. The charge was declined although I'd wired money to AMEX specifically for this charge. I called to check why it was declined, they advised me to split the payment into 2. I did that and it was declined again. I called them again and explained that if the charge doesn't go through I will incur fees since it's a long weekend. They said to try it again. Tried, declined. Called again and spoke with Peggy. After having this card in my wallet for five and a half years not once have they done a credit line increase. With the fees they charge my advice is to stay away. If you use the card for a purchase it actually hurts your score. If you get near the 13% usage you drop 7 points on your credit report. I have Never missed a pmt, always either over pay or pay it off. Also, they WILL sell your personal information and you will get hounded by email to buy this and buy that with the card. My truly honest advice is visa, Mastercard, discover. They have treated me extremely well. I hope this helps anyone considering this card.

Service has deteriorated in the last few years, it appears I am now paying just to be lied to and put on hold... I called AMEX today to confirm my flights in August to Europe and ask about covid precautions. I was told that the airport, date and duration of my return flight had changed but no one had informed me. My return flight went from a duration of 13hrs to 38hrs and I was then told I would have to pay if I wanted a better flight or fly from my original selection. I was also told I would have to pay for a bus to the new departure location. I refused to agree to this as none of this was my fault nor was I informed and I was then transferred to the Platinum insurance dept as my card covers travel interruptions like this. An automated service said there would be a 5min wait and I was on hold for 35mins and then the phone was hung up on. When I called AMEX Travel back I was told this department closed at 6:30pmEST, while I was on hold, I asked to speak with a supervisor who then told me the dept isn't even open on the weekends. At the same time I was on the Online Chat service and I was told the Ins Dept was open until 8pm and was given a direct number to call that didn't work. I asked the supervisor I was speaking to on the phone to send me information to make a formal complaint as I was receiving 3 different stories form 3 different AMEX staff members and I was told there was no further person to contact and there was nothing more I could do. This is terrible service but its worse when this all in response to AMEX changing my flights without notifying me and asking me to pay for any extra cost they caused, I spent 3 hours on the phone today to be told there is no one working that could help me and I have to call the insurance dept on Monday. I just want Amex to honor their service agreement and instead I pay hundreds of dollars to have my flights changed and then treated like this by the service team.

insurance benefit is a rip off. Had a 180 dollar electronic purchase get busted on the way home and I turned in a claim. They approved the claim and gave me a $6.66 credit, what a joke. I have been with them for eight years and this is my first claim which will be making me look for a new card.

I have been an AE Platinum member for over two years. I had heard great things about their premium card and decided to give it a try. Up until last month I have been pleased with the service provided. Now I have an issue. My wife and I planned a cruise last year before COVID hit. Our cruise was canceled so we rebooked for this year and booked our airline tickets to Europe also. Our cruise was canceled again this year so we decided to ask for a refund for both the cruise and the airline fare until COVID sorts itself out. We received the cruise credit within two weeks...no issues. Our airline was non-US carrier and a bit of a challenge to even ask for the refund. Finally, I was able to piece together the refund and explain to AE how to proceed. Several weeks ago I received a credit for the airfare ($6,500) and then was immediately rebilled the same amount. I have had numerous discussions with the Conflict Resolution department, but seem to receive a different story every time I call. I even had a supervisor hang up on me even though I was calm through out the call. I have had to dispute charges in the past and never had this issue. It seems as if the Conflict Resolution team is not on the same sheet of music.
I just received this card but looking forward trying it out and love the possibilities it has and insurance on renting a car. Nice credit line
