They are ok if you have no issues but even with that it will cost you. American Express is not excepted everywhere. I have been turned away quite a few times. You can only add money to your account by finding a store that still money on the card at a cost of 4.95 or using direct deposit. The direct deposit money has always come on time but that's really not them is it? I have had a number of issues with money being taken from my account but never returned. There is always a reason why but not a valid reason. I cannot contact them to stop recurring charges that are not even mine which is customme a lot of money but i can't talk to anyone. I can'temail anyone. I have to send a letter to their office and hope its in the time frame they give. If not they deny the claim which they have doneto me and that's after they sent me the letter late saying i had a limited amiunt of time. They just don't like to return money. Use another company. Use Chime Banking much better customer service.

I booked international travel utilizing points for a very special trip and American Express Travel completely botched the booking and accepted no responsibility for the horrible experience. They offered me a $50 gift card and would not even consider reimbursing at least some of the 600,000 points it took to book the flights that resulted in economy standby. We couldn't even sit next to each other and the seats were not what I had originally booked. The travel dept was a joke during the entire experience. I did not accept the $50 gift card...completely insulted and disappointed.

First time opening an American Express. This company does not support small businesses at all. Most small businesses profit by word of mouth and through family and friends. Tell me how this is acceptable.


I charged my card at my relative's business. Card gets declined. I call in to find out my account is currently getting cancelled due to "conflict of interest" without any notice or warning. It's been literally 2 days since I opened the card from the mail. This is how you treat your customers?


Yeah sure, it's my relative's business (my little sister if that really matters). But I'm here to support her and pay for her services. How is an invoice and physical goods not enough proof? She runs a t-shirt printing company! She would have to order the tees and print it for me. Nowhere on the card agreement form mentions you can't spend your money on family! I didn't even know this was a thing. This is probably the most absurd and ridiculous experience I have ever gone through.


Most of my family members are small business owners. You are stating I cannot support any one of them because they are affiliated to me? You guys need to reconsider what you're doing with your life if you don't believe in helping out your own family.

You simply cannot beat Blue Cash Preferred's 6% cash back on groceries. And now, it offers 6% cash back on streaming services. For me personally, those two rewards alone will easily cover the $95 annual fee!
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: The Blue Cash Preferred from American Express is the best card for grocery shopping. Between my husband and I, we don't hit the $6,000 limit for 6% back in a year, so it's perfect for us. This has been our "grocery card" since we got it, but we're considering using it for gas expenses to get that 3% back. Haven't regretted upgrading to the Preferred card from the original Blue Cash all year! Great card.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: My application on the credit card with 60000 miles was successfully approved. The spending ammount in the specified term was met. However, no bonus was given. Before my activation of the card and during the first 3 months, I had several communication and got the confirmation of getting the bonus. The final conclusion was "No"/ My requested on the the communication record for justifyng the bonus was totally ignored.

60 days starts on moment of approval. one service rep said it could go past 60 days one said I expired. very disappointed as I was not ready to use card yet. two different service reps. one from america (jennifer)during u.s. business hours and one from the phillipines (scott) call center - you could hear so much background noise of other service reps. they definitely know the amex program. very dissappointed in the ability to to service new customers at 70 days out. 830 credit score, i cancelled the card cause i can take the hit.
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content: My credit scores have been jumping between high 600's to just over 700 and I was approved instantly. I just started rebuilding my credit a little over a year ago with a Capital One starter card with a $200 limit with a high interest rate. I charged something, paid it off etc.. I worked my way up to a Citi card 0% interest for 15 months and now this American Express 0% interest for 15 months as well. They are the only 2 cards I will be using now paying my monthly bills for the most part, groceries etc. and paying them back off while earning cash back!

The travel services alone are worth the fee. My wife has an assigned agent who helps with everything involved in a trip, overseas and local. Greeters, luggage assistance, even the tiny details. I.e. flowers in the rooms. Someone is always available to help.

Misleading info for Balance Transfers. 0% Balance Transfer has a maximum of 5,000 regardless of your credit limit. Other cards do not have this limitation such as the offering from Bank of America (BANKAMERICARD). Customer service claims it was in the disclosure but I assure you it was not listed anywhere obvious or I would have never applied.
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content: Don't bother with this card if you need to transfer balances! The max you can transfer is $5000 ( I called Amex Express and was told this is their policy) It's too bad the reviewer for this site doesn't disclose this information in the review!! Would have saved me a hard inquiry on my credit score. Bummer!
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content: I trusted serve because of the American Express brand and reputation for customer service. But, this one time I stayed at a hotel for two nights and they charged me for three. The hotel would not reverse the charges, so I called the Serve rep to dispute the charge for the night I didn't stay. They investigated and told me I wasn't getting a refund because the hotel manager said I was lying. This doesn't seem like proper customer service to me.

I got so mad at wells Fargo about a year ago because they had allowed charges from my x-wife "on my Account" and caused an avalanche of $35 Overdrafts, So I opened the Bluebird Card by American Express. For the Most Part, I like the Bluebird Card, I have Two Teenagers and I opened Family Accounts with their NAmes on their Own Cards. Teaches Teens Money Management! Also, I can instantly Transfer Funds to My Teenagers and I like that a lot. Now, if We can just Get Amex Bluebird to Instantly Transfer the Funds Back to Us, the Cardholders when a Merchant and/or hotel Releases a Hold on our Card or Refunds Monies back via Returned Item or CRedit. I understand that AMEX has to Make Money Someway with this FEE FREE Card, so I really Don't Complain about this one Little Greed FActor, However, as Many others have Stated on this Forum, I really Really Really Needed the Funds Credited Back ASAP on a Target Store Purchase-Refund, and Amex has Not Even Posted Pending on the Refund and it been two Business Days. I understand they Exercise their Entire 5-7 Days Right to Earn Interest across Thousands of Account Holders, But it Absolutely Hurts when I'm a Disabled Single Father that Uses Bluebird as my Main Debit Card for Essentials Such as Gas, Groceries and Bill payments. Well, this Month My Kids are Suffering because of Amex Debit Card Refund Policy. Seems They are Treating this Debit Card as a Credit Card? And Making us Suffer Long- Extremely Long Delays to Get back our Money when a Store Credit and or Refund is processed by a merchant.

Hope the FTC and or Financial Bureau of Consumer Affairs Steps in to Help American Express Correct this 5-7 Day Wait Time they have Chosen to make us Endure and Declare it Unconstitutional!

If FDIC is going to Allow Amex Bluebird to Act like and Be Insured Like a Banking institution, then they Must Be required to Uphold the Same Standards as Banks, i.e. Release the Funds Back immediately such as Banks are Required to Do, when the Card is Used as Debit for the Transaction. Come on Bluebird, you guys should be ashamed of yourselves.

Love your Card, Just Hate this one Little Policy that Most Likely Makes Amex a Fortune and Causes the Least of us Card Holders Heartache and in my Case, this Week, Took Food of My Kids Table.

I used this card at a gas pump. Big mistake! It put $100 on hold on my account. The actual cost of the gas, $33 went through but the $100 hasn't and its been over 8 days. I tried calling customer service to get an actual person but got nothing. Maybe it was a mistake getting this card.

I love AMEX, this is my 2nd time with them, great to be back at home! Credit limit was generous at $2,000, then after 61 days, used the little known 3x credit limit increase, sure enough, went to $6,000. After 6 more months, asked for $7,500 & got it.


As added perks, AMEX BCE cardholders gets an Experian FICO score, refreshed monthly, in addition to a no cost ShopRunner membership, where one can order from many participating stores & get 2 day business shipping. Think of the money saved in shipping fees, there's something for everyone. Of course, this doesn't include Amazon.


In the less than a year of having the card, still in the 0% promo, have racked enough points to redeem for two payments (or statement credits). Some may call it a con, the minimum payment is $35, or less if the balance is below that.


The AMEX site is also very user friendly & easy to navigate. I highly recommend the BCE card for everyday needs, and families can double the rewards with the upgraded card which comes with a $95 annual fee. The only places where rewards are the lowest are warehouse clubs (Costco) & supercenters (Walmart), yet one still gets 1% back at these places.


I don't leave home w/out my AMEX BCE card.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content:
Worst service, I was in abroad, they asked for financial review, I was busy to submit, they cancelled the card. All reward points gone.


Best ignore, i never in any other cards like this.

Sorest service, don’t trust their service , all are for publicity.

Amex would only let you do a balance transfer up to $5000 Which is not much. So it sucks! It would be nice if they were to disclosed that information under this section. A fee that might be charged when you transfer a credit card balance from 'Credit Card A' to 'Credit Card B'.


This fee is charged by the credit card that receives your transferred balance (i.e. 'Credit Card B,' in this example). There is never a fee charged by 'Credit Card A.'
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content:
I have used Bluebird for my two boys for years. Today, I stopped using it after a bad experience. I would not recommend it. I got a new debit card from my bank, which happens when they expire. Since it has a new 3 digit code on the back, I had to remove the old linked debit card and link the new one. The system would not let me do this. I called and spoke to 3 people. The first two kept telling me that was just "how it was. The system chose to not let me link any more debit cards." They could not explain why. They kept saying "nobody did it, the system did it. Nobody knows why, it can't be undone." I finally got through to a supervisors supervisor and was told that it was a fraud prevention measure. "I have been using the account for years, and now I can't link a debit card to it anymore? " I was told, "yes, that is for your own convenience and protection." So, how do I get money on the account? "You go to Walmart and add it."

Standing in line at Walmart to add money to the card? I don't think so. Can it be reversed off my account? "No, it will be forever. You can never link a debit card to this account again." Why? Because the system said so."


Well, I told them what their system can do. I would transfer the money out of this account and close my Blue bird for good. But, guess what? I won't let me get my money, because I do not have a linked bank account! AND, what's more, I can't link a bank account, because the system said I can't.


I only have about $70 dollars in there, but I have a feeling it is going to be a fight to get that money back.


I REALLY DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS CARD. Go to your local bank and get cards that can be transferred between account instead.

cker you in with 0apr 0 fees but afterwards gets jacked up to 15%, also 3% transfer fee is very expensive... I originally applied because I thought was a good deal but they goAmex is expensive. They sucker you in with 0apr 0 fees but afterwards gets jacked up to 15%, also 3% transfer fee is very expensive... I originally applied because I thought was a good deal but they got me

content: HORRIBLE DEFINITION OR HORRIBLE !!! Why is it legal for this company to put a REFUND on hold for 7days and blame the other party making the refund. Anyone who uses papal knows that it doesn't take PayPal 7DAYS to return money into an account. ESPECIALLY when it is already showing back in my actual account PayPal took the funds from to begin with. American Express Serve needs to be sued! I am seeking legal advise on my end to see what I can do besides close my account which I am closing my account 2day. I have been patient for several years. Not wks YEARS and its been a bad ride more then anything else.

I applied and was approved for the American Express Blue Cash Card. But the opening available credit limit is only 5 hundred dollars! Discover and Capital One opened my accounts with available credit limits of 10 thousand dollars! I'm very Disappointed in this card, and will probably Cancel the card before I receive it!
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I work in a company and we use American express card to pay for our travels. The client service in France is really bad. I tried contacting them with a request many times by phone and by email. They kept putting me on hold and referring me to someone else! All I wanted was an invoice for the hotel that I booked through the agency portal and that theyyyy paid for! The hotel is not able to provide this because I used them as an intermediate party ! Big mistake ! Amex france invoice department gave futile promesses about editing the invoice and sending it by email. I never received anything! I had to beg the hotel to send me the invoice. If they are unable to provide proper service for hotel bookings and not only travel bookings, they should not suggest this to clients. I have never seen such disregard of clients needs ! Even if my company is the client !

content: If I could give a half of a star I would. I Have been trying to reload my card for the longest by linking my bank account. They are supposed to debit 2 small amounts that you need to verify. For a month I have been trying to do this, it only drafts one amount, I then call customer service to reach the customer service who you can barely understand. Their customer service is a joke and does not attempt to assist you. Need to just have automated system, this company sucks and needs to stop outsourcing their calls. NEVER WILL USE AMERICAN EXPRESS AGAIN!

I had my American Express for over 6 years. Recently some unknown charges where put on my card. They refused to back me up on it. I closed the account today. They lie when they say they will back you up.

I have the Delta Reserve SkyMiles card. Though benefits are decent depending on what kind of spender and traveler you are, when i signed up for the card i distinctly remember the representative telling me the $450 annual fee would be charged at the end of the first 12 months of having the card. I've had the card for a bit over a month and a half and I'm just now finding out after seeing the charge on my card, that the policy is actually after the first 45 days you will be charged. I know I heard correctly because that was the one question I made sure to ask at least a few times just for clarification when applying for this new card. As to not be surprised again, I will surely be discontinuing my account with them.

Been a valid customer since 2010. The Platinum and rose gold were always paid and others were never late. But 5/16/19 they up and decided to cancel all my cards bc they I have other payments such a vehicle, and other bills...ect. Honestly it’s Disrespectful to cancel them when they get paid back.

Wanted me to send them all of my information concerning my deed! Did not happen. They are rude and think they can rule . Did not happen. Rates are not good. I would not consider American Express . They are oversees. Cheaper rates to work them. And, we wonder why our accounts are being hacked. Keep it in, America.

I regret having applied for this card because I believe that American Express pulled a fast one on me. I was approved with a $7200 starting limit, which I thought was fine, and I really liked that because I'm already an American Express cardholder, I was approved with only a soft pull. A couple days later, I received a letter in the mail informing me that the $7200 credit limit for the Cash Magnet was being deducted from the credit limit of my Blue Cash Preferred card which had a $14,000 limit. It's now been reduced to $6800. This is bait and switch. Had I known American Express would do such a thing, I never would have applied. I've always loved Amex, and I've had a great relationship with them for the past 19 years, but this just leaves a bad taste in my mouth. According to the letter, I can call to reallocate the credit limits. Because I don't want to tank my credit scores by closing the new account, I think my best bet is to reallocate all but $500 back to my Blue Cash Preferred and then sock drawer the Cash Magnet. If you're already an American Express credit card holder, you might want to think twice about applying for the Cash Magnet or any other additional American Express credit card.

Charged gas at Shell, $25.25. AE-Bluebird allows merchants to charge additional amounts for 7 days. I was charged, for no services, an additional $125.00. AE-BB WOULD NOT reverse this cash charge. AE-BB stole $125.00 CASH from me for 7 days. This is a cash card not a credit card! STAY WAY from this card. If you have one cut it up! Walmart has a better cash-debt-card. AE's policy violates FTC policies. This is why so many places don't accept AE!

I got this card especially to transfer money to my son who lives out of state and is sick, so I've been helping him out. Last night i transferred 200.00 onto my card and was going to transfer 200.00 more today. First i think the limit of 200.00 is pretty low and should be higher. What if there was an emergency and someone needed money now. Well today I went to transfer 200.00 more and kept getting an error. So i got on my computer to do and then it said I had already transferred money today. UMMM, NO I DIDNT. So I called to find out what the problem was. Then i find out that it is 200.00 a day in their time zone now my own which is complete bull. I transferred at 9pm my time but of course it was midnight there. The only message you get when you go to transfer is the limit is 200.00 a day. Maybe they should put in there that they go by eastern time. So mad because my son really needed this money by today.

It is the only card that I pay my income , I just set an auto pay for my income and that is it, I do not have to worry about. the U$95 annual fee is only U$7.91 monthly. I am not sorry since I got it.

I am all-in with American Express!

I went years paying for everything with cash & debit cards, and had no credit cards. l work an average job, have no debt and pay every bill on time, because I was raised that way. Last year I was at my bank for unrelated business, and was asked if I was interested in applying for a credit card, I said "sure, why not?". Shortly after, the "declined" letter came in the mail, Annoyed, I checked my credit online and discovered that I have no credit history and NO FICO score at all, zero!

On a whim and in total disregard to online advice, I applied for an American Express Blue Cash Everyday card. Amex quickly responded and wanted to check my income taxes, so I printed & signed the form. When I mailed it, I also included a short personalized letter to them explaining why my credit history was basically empty, that I owned my vehicles out-right & had no debt, and that I wanted to become a trusted Amex customer and start getting credit for my responsibility.

Three weeks later to the day, I got a welcome email! They had accepted me, and with a nice big-boy credit limit! I was so elated that I even bragged about it at work, and they couldn't believe that I got approved for an Amex card with no FICO score! Perhaps I got lucky, but they put their trust in me, and I am loyal to them for that. So far, I have nothing but good things to say about American Express. I called them and they were super-friendly, too.

My tip for people in situations like mine is to write American Express a (short) personal letter and sign your name to it, in addition to only clicking buttons on a computer screen and filling out forms.

I learned my lesson about credit, too! Maintaining excellent credit is my new passion. My wife is already sick of watching the credit videos with me on YouTube!
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: There is no other company with the amazing reputation or customer service like AMEX. If you are a responsible borrower and pay in full every month, the benefits are stellar. AMEX Green Charge Card was my first and only card right out of college, and they continue to be prominent in my wallet 30 years later. I now have the Platinum, Gold, Delta Platinum, Everyday and Blue Cash Everyday cards.

The balance transfer limit is much lower than the actual credit limit they give you. If you are approved for a $10,000 credit limit, they won't allow you to transfer over that amount. The balance transfer amount will probably be less than half of that. This is nowhere in their cardmember agreement. And, even if you pay down that transferred balance, they won't allow you to transfer over additional balances.
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content:
I lost my husband in January of 2019. Our daughter was getting married in February, and our AMX charges were a bit higher due to wedding expenses. I contacted American Express because my husband paid his bill automatically from one of HIS bank accounts. I called the company to ask that a paper statement be sent to me, so I could pay what he owed. Let me be clear, I had a card on this very account and was listed on the account. He was the primary account holder, but i was an intregal part of the information.

After being transferred from one person to another, and LONG waiting periods, I was connected to a person from (You guessed it!). INDIA>. I could not understand a word she said. Finally, after some rude questions, I just said SEND ME A BILL and hung up. I was in tears.

American Express advertises about their great customer service. RIGHT! No company that wants to serve you uses a call center in INDIA! The story is not over! Did I get a paper statement? On no, they have turned me over to a bill collector.

Let me clarify. My credit rating is excellent. I have contacted the other companies (Discover, Visa, etc). They have simply changed the address and sent me the bill to rectify. On most of those, I wasn't even listed on the account info.

My final word to the wise. Don't believe those claims of CUSTOMER SERVICE made by this horrible company. If you want to check it out, I am sure that someone in India can really give you a sales talk! Or, perhaps the debt collector?

They are scum and trying to get your money. They charged you fees $5.95 monthly either you use it or not. So basically you are giving your money to them to pay their customer service. So, Pls. Don't buy this card.
Great Card. Would love to have it. Cash back every purchase. Generous credit line. Great rates and points incentives. Great for solving Debt issues. Great for transferring balances from other cards.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I have had a Amex Gold for 19 years and the service has always been outstanding. When I need to speak to customer service, it was fast and very polite. They have always been very helpful. I lost a card one time while getting gas. Called Amex and they immediately cancelled the card and got me a new one the very next day.

I already have bluecash with 30k limit . Applied for this got approved for 15 k however credit limit for blue cash was reduced to 15k immediately when checked online. Any idea why my limit on blue cash was reduced?
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content: My direct deposits are never consistent! I was told to call my employer. They said the notify the same time every two weeks and still have never received a deposit two days early! Their company always manages to take their fee on time! About to cancel after my check is deposited for the last time and just be done with it!!!!

Like most other people I have been a victim of fraud and American Express Serve is doing nothing about it. My question is why do the charges need to post before they are disputed? Once i realized my card had been cloned and used fraudulently on Feb 7 I called right away and all the charges were still pending. They told me they could not begin the dispute process until they posted! Why is there no option to void pending transactions? Especially from a company like Amex. So the next day Feb 8th i checked my account again and most of the charges had posted with the exception of 2 (merchant never collected the money for 2 fraud transactions so i guess it released on its own) I have all my confirmation emails stating the dispute has been filed but i dont have time to wait 21-45 days for these dumb asses to investigate. Stay far away from this card people! I got this card out of desperation because I was in the chex systems and couldn't get my own bank account due to my PNC account being compromised years before. The only thing i really liked was that i get paid two days earlier but that shit doesn't even matter anymore. Hardly anyone takes Amex and overall it's a hassle. I couldn't even withdraw my own money in Dominican Republic back in September because it's not a real bank and you can't use it internationally. Some BS! Why wouldn't you be able to use an Amex worldwide?! Stay far far away!

Card has some good qualities but you can't pay for had at the pump other wise it takes almost all your money off if you use it more than once in a month and takes almost a whole day to return to you. Customer service sucks overall have a had a few nice people to deal with. If someone returns money back to you they will post it and then place on hold so you are thinking your money had returned and it hasn't. Most places you go to you will have to run as credit for some reason. I like Chime better I only still have this card is because I don't want to try and change all of my bills that I pay with it

Signed up and agreed to pay the ludicrous annual fee because they offered 100k points. They ended up denying me the points for some total BS reason, but I still had to pay the fee. Plus, the benefits are not very good. "Free" stuff you don't need isn't such a great deal when you're paying through the nose for it. Stay far away!

I have had a Bluebird account since 2012 (it is now 2019).

I have never been charged a fee aside from out-of-network ATM fees.

My checks were all free until 2016ish, but I use them so rarely that I still have all of the free ones.

However...

Everything is done online or at Walmart, and if you hate Walmart as much as I do you'll feel me here.

If you want to deposit cash you have to go Walmart. If you want to schedule a cash pickup, you have to go to Walmart.

I am not a fan of limitations. There are many times I am frustrated because I can't simply walk into my bank, fill out a withdrawal slip, and walk out with $2,000 cash.

You just cant. You have to do it through Walmart, or find an ATM and still be limited to $750 a day.

There still are no chips on these cards.

If you have any refunds/returns expected, also expect to have your patience tested for 7-10 business days. Holds are ridiculous, and transfers are just as bad.

There are useful, quick bits of information we are used to (or expect to have access to) about our accounts and I don't think the Bluebird app delivers. You're very limited in what you can do on it, and what information you can see.

I really hate having to call customer service. It's not an awful experience, but it is always foreign based, and helpful MOST of the time. You'll get real customer service at a real bank.

You will run into many situations where a vendor doesn't even accept American Express cards and you're just SOL unless you have PayPal or the time to wait 7 business days for a bill to be paid from your bank account.

My income has changed since 2012, and I deal with bigger transactions now, larger deposits, and larger amounts that need to be moved from account to account or be pulled in cash and this card just doesn't work for any of that anymore.

I'm looking into a local, physical bank but as you can expect that is never easily done when everything has been with another for the past 8 years.

This is a good card if you have a small income, because you will probably never have fees.

If you have a larger income it is just not worth it.

I don't even think they're FDIC, but don't quote me on that.… read more

Please be aware that if you are applying this card for Balance transfers, there is an internal limit. 25% of your credit limit is your balance transfer limit. Example: If your credit limit is $20000, your balance transfer limit is $5000.
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

Watch out for these guys, the lie. Advertised a balance transfer limit of $7,000, then after applying, they only give $5,000. Shame on American Express for falsely advertising balance transfer limits.

They have no human customer service and then when you finally figure out how to get a person they don't speak English! Are they based in India?! I've been trying to get my money from a fraudulent transaction since January 16 First off I was on hold over an hour every time I call but was lied too and the non-english speaking customer service have no idea what the hell there doing and are extremely rude! Still haven't received my money back! Run people American Express Serve you should be ashamed of your business ethics!!! I'm reporting you to every to the BBB and any and all that will listen!

I have excellent credit. Where is your card for ppl with over 800 on their credit score? All I see is piddling bs for 'good' credit-- wheres your balls??? You can't get it together to offer different cards to different credit score worthyness you can bite me.

content: I wish I had read the other reviews regarding the "No Fee" balance transfer before I applied. I was given a $2000 credit limit which makes the card useless for balance transfers, and I have good credit! I applied for an increase and was told that you have to have been a member for 60 days before you can get an increase. What???? Closing the account but now that application will show up on my credit report. Other reviewers have described the same experience so the bank knows about the problem, yet they still pitch the card for it's no fee balance transfer option. I think this is very dishonest.

content: I would avoid ever having an American Express card altogether. 8 years ago I was briefly unemployed and unable to pay any of my credit cards. I had a Discover, Visa, Mastercard, store cards, and Amex. I missed payments for 4 months. Not good I realize, but what are you going to do? Pay your rent and utilities or your credit cards? So, when I got a job after 4 months I was able to negotiate with each card to stop all late fees and remove interest and set up a payment plan with all cards EXCEPT AMEX. All the other cards let me pay 0% once I got on an automatic payment plan and they did not mark me as late because I didn't pay the full amount I owed at that point. Not AMEX. They continued to mark me late for over a year after I was making regular on time payments. So, my credit score is still screwed today 8 years later because of them. I tried to call customer service to have this removed seeing as I was paying them an agreed amount that THEY agreed to. NO, just got the run around and of course my credit reports remained stained. I hate AMEX and I actually used to work for them. No special treatment for employees that's for sure. If you have this card, you better plan on never paying late or being unemployed or any other bad thing happening because they don't care. Your credit will be screwed for 7+ years.

The Serve card is a POS.

Forewarning if you use this card you can't get cash back anywhere!!!

You can use the money transfer feature and you can transfer money to yourself but its $16.99, per every $2500, To Get Your Own Money!!!

People out there lying about this card.

They hold your refunds for 7days.

They charge 2.50 for each atm transaction.

There’s no chip on the card so bank atm don’t accept it. And the so called free atm locations are, If accurate, Inconveniently located.

I’ve been with AMEX for over 6 years and nothing has gotten better.

The only plus, is getting your direct deposit early.

Not worth the charge backs by my credit card company etc. I’m moving on !

Stay away that is all i have to say. The reason been why I dont tell my story is beause there too many mistakes they made that iof I write them I will never end. So a wise advice stay away if you dont have to have one of this account. You will be glad you did

I honestly think that the people who give this card a good rating are somehow affiliated with the company or just haven't been burned yet. I noticed some people said that in most cases it was user error or something the person did wrong. To those people, I just ask you to believe me and think of this scenario. I went to the ATM, the ATM was not out of money or malfunctioning because the second transaction went through. However, the first transaction for 200$ did not dispense money. I am told to wait 45 days to get this money back. I just want to warn people that even with Wal-Mart money cards if the ATM doesn't dispense money its ten days. I thought ten days was a lot but what if it had been 400$. Does American express really think everyday people who for whatever reason have to put their money on prepaid cards can wait 45 days for hundreds of dollars to be returned? Its sad. And I think about people out of work who this is happening to and it sickens me. I don't even feel confident the money will be returned in 45 days. It just feels like a scam. So to all of the raters including wallet hub who recommend this card, What did I do wrong in this case? How did I bring this on myself?

Don't do business with them. When you get a refund you have to wait up to 15 days. Let's say for example you do a Walmart return for 20 bucks it will go back to your account in 3 days and the minute it gets returned serve puts a hold on it for additional 7 days. So what ever money you get back from who ever serve puts it on review for 7 days. And when you call they don't have an answer for why they do it. They say oh it's normal bank practice bull shit shit!!! Trust me stay away from them!!!

Lounge access is supposedly one of the major benefits, right? Check out the reviews of Priority Pass lounges with an average of 1-2 stars. Priority Pass is a sneaky setup where they can post charges to your card without permission. Several times they "overcounted" my number of guests and charges appeared on my card a week later. No notification, no signature, not even a bill! Such a scam!
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: This is a cash back card 1.5% on EVERYTHING. With recent news of credit card companies cutting back on rewards on their high percentage points card, this simple 1.5% still stays....on everything. Actually not bad at all and I dont have to figure out which categories to use this on since I just use it on everything.... and I still get 1.5% cash back. I know it does not sound much to other people but so far my rewards have stacked up quite well. They have an internal catalog shop for reward items from clothing to gift cards to elctronics even car accesories. Heck I got a Sony 55" TV using my rewards from this. Love this card!

dont get this card. its not worth the hassle, there is a fee for this a fee for that, they put bogus transactions on your card and expect you not to know...good thing i watched my transactions...4 fraud transactions that just appeared, from WISH.com, shutterfly ,and two from fingerhut freshstart..they said I HAD TO fill out paperwork that would take 45 days to review AND anything that was not already paid would have to wait. the next day 2 of the frauds disappeared into thin air and one was refunded???? they cant tell you how much money YOU had BEFORE the fraud, but sure can take your money for the fee.

This company is TERRIBLE. They put holds on basically everything in order to collect additional interest off your money. Returned merchandise They have a "7 day merchandise review" hold before they give you your money. Companies that release holds (like hotel's); 8 day hold. Also, used this card in Vegas. The resort puts a $50 per day hold on the card for incidents, which gets returned. Apparently Amex Serve also increases all hotel and resort charges by 25%, to cover incidentals. You will not receive any of this back for 8 days. The second I receive my refunds after their mysterious 7 day hold, I'm withdrawing all my funds and closing the account. Already transferred my direct deposit to my bank. I'll happily get my check one day later to not deal with this scam company.

i was approved for an adjusted cash magnet card with a fair credit rating. is this not true ? the reply above says you need a 700 plus rating. it asked me if i would like my card number sent now and i said yes, to see if it was real. none of the verification numbers worked, but i also cannot find that spot in this web site again. i had to pick a rating so i just picked three for the moment. so i could post this

this is a horrible company. the customer service people lie. I have told at least 30 people who are gonna close their account with them. shady companies like this one. Should not be allowed to be in business.

This card is pretty cool. Just the standard go to card for everything if you like the simplicity which I enjoy. I do understand other people out there are churners trying to churn cards, but this AMEX Cash Magnet is not one of those and its just daily use. I like the design logo. Yes the BCE can offer higher perks but some purchases may not be eligible but with Cash Magnet AMEX, everything is eligible. Slow and steady.

wallethub said i had a good apv odds good i give a 0* to wallethub if you're looking to boost your score in lower utilisation look into Synchrony .Synchrony Bank has their own credit cards and does most of the Big Chain store

American Express doesn't provide customer protection. They are more interested in the vendor than the card holder. DO NOT RELY ON AMERICAN EXPRESS FOR TRAVEL - this is a false assumption.

American Express allowed a hotel to steal $700 from me, when reservation was cancelled and we didn't stay at the hotel

They use "No Fee" BT as a sales pitch. Here's the catch, no matter how high is your credit line, the maximum transfer amount is only $7,500. Very misleading. Also, the funds take a long time to be transferred to this card.
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content: I'm sickened by American Express Serve. I filed a claim on October 23,2018 for almost $1300. I was just informed that my claim was denied and my account had been permanently suspended. I gave them a copy of the police report that my card was stolen and used. And proof that I was not the one that made the transactions. It's Christmas time and now my family will be doing without Christmas thanks to AmExpress Serve. I will be contacting legal assistance for this matter. I'm disabled and that is alot of money for me to just write off.

If I could give no stars, I would. The worst customer service ever. I have been an AmEx card holder for over 20 years and purchased the Serve card for a family member so I could get them money in emergency situations. AmEx blocked my debit card on a weekly basis and their help desk were clueless as to why and how to fix it. The last straw was that they rejected my debit card and will no longer allow me to use a debit card to transfer money. I've never been in the red and my debit card always had funds available. Instead of alerting me that they were doing this, they just did it and when my parents furnace blew out I had no way to get them money.

Save yourself a lot of stress, don't use this card. I got hacked for $1500.00 while the representative watched it happening and all she did was say " oh my, I'm so sorry this is happening to you". I have been GUARANTEED by one of their supervisors in the dispute department on Dec. 7 2018 that I would have my money back in 24-48 hours. While following up on Dec. 10 I was guaranteed by the same supervisor that it would be back in my account by the end of day. Needless to say on the 11th I still didn't have my money. I called back and got a different supervisor which informed me that I will not get my money before the 21st. Apparently this company trains their people on how to do nothing but lies. STAY AWAY FROM THEM!!!!!!!!!!

Original agreement included balance transfer. But I was refused.

When I tried to dispute an unsatisfactory purchase, I spent hours trying to find out the process and when I learned the latter I had a huge number of confusing forms to complete.

waste of time and money!!!

When charges are declined, the hold on the funds are ridiculous long which 7-10 days. I called and complained about this. Initially they said it is the company put the hold while thinking you won't call and follow up with the company. I did both times and they said the charges were declined and have no control of bank holds, Bluebird do. Bluebird is no help but to say sorry repeatedly and cannot release the funds until waiting time is over! I removed both direct deposits from this card and doing traditional banking from now on. It is NOT that great and stress-free as it seem.

The card was supposed to be for cash back; however, I was switched to their "reward points" program. Even though I have very good credit, they started me off with a low credit limit and they won't consider any higher limit. Since they are not widely accepted, I will probably not use this one much. I pretty much wasted an inquiry "ding" to my credit profile.
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content: June 24, 2018: I went online to request my reward dollars for an amazon gift card and received an order confirmation number via email. Today is December 6, 2018. I've called twice between June and today, spent a total of 2 hours on the phone, and they still haven't sent the card. The first time I called was October 25, 2018 because I hadn't received the card and still hadn't received a response from them. At this time, they said that they would reissue me another one, confirmed my address, and said I should expect it in about a month. I waited 6 weeks keeping an eye out for it in the mail. Still hadn't received it so opened a chat in the American Express Chat window to see if they could check on it. After chatting for about 10 minutes they said something about how they saw the request from 10/25 and that someone would contact me in 3-5 business days or I could call the rewards number. I call this number and talk to a lady that tells me that they never reissued a card and that she will try to do it on her end. After another 45 minutes on the phone and being put on hold multiple times, she tells me that she is having an error on her end on entering the address for it to be sent (you should already have my address and why is this a problem?). I talked to a supervisor who claimed that he can see the reward dollars I have and that I requested an Amazon gift card but that they have an error on their end and they will call me back in 7-10 business days. Also, they claim that they cannot send emails or text messages whatsoever, including any confirmations or letting me know if and when the card has been sent. What a load of crap...they are just avoiding giving me the reward dollars that I earned. Poor customer service....go with a different credit card that is actually going to do what they say.

Step outside the US and this card is worthless. No one accepts it, even in Canada.


Very easy to get slapped with their late fee of $39....no "payment due" alerts.


Their argument is that for most charges, there's this additional grace period until the end of billing cycle. However, the late fees get charged on typically the charges that are occurring just before the end of billing cycle - so the grace period doesn't apply to all charges. I have been a long time owner of this corp card (20+ yrs) but getting increasingly disgusted with their business practices. Looks like AmEx has opted to make the late fees a revenue stream. Looks like they want the customers to default on payments. They know that it takes 20+ days to get expense reports to get processed through a company's accounts dept. They know that today's professional does not have time to keep tab of each expense and the number of days from their payment statements. AmEx has removed the alerts options so they don't warn you that payment will be due in say 10 days or 5 days. As soon as the late fee is slapped, they will be sure to send you an alert :) so they surely do have the technology to do it.
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content:
Customer service is a joke (which seems crazy to me because I always felt like Amex was thought to have better service). Agents are poorly trained and not empowered to actually do anything. Responses vary for the same factual information between agents (5- days, then 10-14 days... same question asked 24 hours apart!). Sanctioned company responses include blaming it on partners (like ticketmaster). Technology is apparently sadly inferior... can't cobrowse or accept attachments in chat... phone system literally lies about estimated wait time (the pleasant recording lady told me someone would be with me in less than a minute for about 15 minutes before I hung up).


Rewards points getting steadily less valuable. Used to be many options in the 1c per point range... now it takes over 8K points to pay for a $49 charge. Crazy.

Terrible experience! I signed up for the American Express Delta Gold Card online promo which promised 60,000 miles after spending $3,000 in the first 3 months. During the first month after receiving the card I noticed that they had granted me 30,000 miles. I called customer surface and was told they would open an inquiry which would take up to 2 or 3 billing cycles. I called back a month later and was told that I would be granted the additional miles after I spent the $3,000 threshold required in the offer. After spending the $3,000 I called and was told that I would receive the additional miles after the billing cycle ended. when the billing cycle ended I called and was told that they were not going to grant me the miles promised. BAIT and SWITCH- DON'T sing up for this card!
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: Please don't use this card. If you have any issue beyond 60 days they will do nothing to assist you, regardless of the situation. Almost any other card will offer better results and won't hold your money for prolonged periods of time.

Big issues exist at Amex. I have been a cardmember for 18 yrs. They are losing data. They lost my account manager credentials for our family cards. They lost my bank routing info for auto pay which is, ironically, Amex Personal Saving FSB. The FSB is solid. They card member services is broken. They have no explanation for losing data and expect me to go though a new set up process each time they lose data. Read 30 min phone call. They have always been good. Now they are bad.

They have been holding $233 for 5 days now. I wldnt be so upset if I didn’t have this money set aside to pay for my sons medical procedure which is TOMORROW. Right now I’m contacting PrePaid Legal and I won’t have to deal with this BS!!! #VeryPissed

It takes entirely too long for your own money to be given back to you. I've had a few situations occur where where my money was just held because they wanted to hold it, even after they were able see that the merchant never charged my card they still held my money, $400 to be exact, I had just got paid and had bills due that I couldn't pay because they wouldn't RELEASE MY MONEY. I did a simple refund at the register, still had to wait for my money. I guess the people at American Express serve don't think people have important things to do with their money because they definitely take their time giving you WHAT'S ALREADY YOURS. THIS CARD IS HORRIBLE AND THE CUSTOMER SERVICE IS HORRIBLE, DON'T GET THIS CARD!!!

Rating -20! Don't use it! I had a merchant refund my money to paypal they instantly sent it back to Bluebird. Bluebird says it may take 10 days to get my money back. WTF! If you can instantly pay there is no legitimate reason why you can't be instantly given your money back! No need to hold it!!!!

This card may allow you to get your paycheck early. How ever they approve decline transactions even if the merchant calls and verify th hey are not collecting funds do to being decline. They will hold your funds for 7 days.

If you make a return they will put holds on your funds for 10 days, customer service cant override or help you at all. Getting store credit is your best option if you cnt wait.https://wallethub.com/d/bluebird-prepaid-card-732c/

They sent my money to some property abandament place since I didn't use my card and they can't even tell me how to contact them to get my money back I will never use this crooked company again due to the manager even saying I don't have that information on how to contact them

I have been using an Amex serve card for my payroll direct deposit. It's a big enough pain that so many places don't take Amex because of the high fees they're charged by the company. Then finding an atm that won't charge a fee comes into play. Yesterday my direct deposit was sent and not released to my card by Amex. When I called I was told it is "technical difficulties" and there was not estimated time of it being fixed, but if I called my employer to get a trace number they could tell me when it would be deposited. I was dumbfounded by this response and called back to speak to someone else. They would not give me a supervisor but the second woman told me it should be by the end of the day. This morning it's still not there so I call them and get a message "we're sorry we're experiencing technical difficulties please try your call again later" I get this message 3 times. Then I decided to block my number and call again and sure enough I'm on hold now being told "all of our agents are currently busy, please hold for the next available agent." This isn't some new deposit they need to insure will clear, this is my paycheck that they have always cleared before, clearly an unreasonable hold. Not to mention that they didn't notify any of their customers that there was an issue. I could have requested a check be cut, or changed my direct deposit to somewhere else, and I damn sure would not have taken my car to the mechanic if I had known I wouldn't be able to get it back due to this issue. I'm 2 hours away from contacting a lawyer at this point.

I have had a card with them for a number of years... No longer do I receive my money early... Therefore there is no reason for me to keep using them... Likewise on my Facebook prepaid card page I am recommending my followers get rid of Amex Serve and Bluebird. I see where my money was released and is marked as paid into my account last Thursday and Friday and here it is Monday and I still do not have my money and that would be just like a regular Bank... Banks today also have no fee accounts.

AMEX account opened in Nov ‘17 with an initial $11k limit on a 749 credit score. Used the card for EVERYTHING and in turn, paid it off 4-5x over the next few months. Then got an email stating that my limit was increased to $18k. Not too bad for a first time user. Customer service has been fine for me. Guess my experience has been different from others??

If you think that American Express will help you when a business cheats, think again. I had an Amex card for decades but when I had a problem with a car rental overcharge earlier this year it was the merchant that Amex supported. The company was Hertz in Mexico. I had a confirmed reservation with a price of $181.80. That price included, itemized $65.85 in fees and taxes. When I returned the car the Hertz agent claimed there was accident damage. That was not true and what he referred to was a loose panel under the front bumper. It was noted on the inspection slip when picking the car up. When the statement arrived Hertz had charged $379.21. I filed a dispute with Amex. Then contacted Hertz and Hertz claimed the additional was for fees and taxes. When I pointed out that of the original $181.80 $65.85 was already added for fees and taxes and that it would be absurd for a rental charge of $115.95 to have fees and taxes totaling $263.26. This went back and forth over several months and Amex just supported Hertz. I decided it was simply not worth more of my time and gave up, but not before closing out my American Express account. All the details are posted at: http://www.larryluckham.com/2018-Hertz/On%20January%2012.pdf for anyone interested.

My advice; 1) Don't ever rent a car from Hertz; and 2) Don't ever use an American Express card.

They have great customer service. I have been a member for a year always made payments on time. pay down my card finally got majority of cards paid off. asked for $1000 increase I have a Discover card Think I will start recommending that card to family and friends. Anxious to see the reason for denial.
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content:
I've had the PRG since 2012 and have an annual spend of $50-100k depending on the year but decided to cancel my card today due to horrendous customer service.


When I first got the card, the customer service was excellent and I was always greeted by someone friendly and willing to help but in the last few years the service has really gone downhill to the point where I didn't even want to call. Besides the horrible wait times and rude representatives, every-time I call I'm greeted by someone from India who barely speaks english and is ill equipped in providing the minimum level of customer service necessitated for a charge card. To give one example, a few weeks ago Amex totally dropped the ball and had some IT issues and wiped my 3X Amazon point offer from my account after it had expired. Worse, they removed the useful offer tab that said "expired" so the only proof I had was a screenshot of the offer as this has happened to me before. Now, a loyal member with a significant point balance that calls about something like this should be greeted with an immediate apology and a reinstatement of the points but instead I was told I had to wait 3-5 business days for the "back-office" to sort the issue. I guess even when you exploit underpaid and destitute workers in Mumbai to enhance your bottom line it stills takes significant time for a simple issue but I'm a reasonable guy so I wait.. and wait... and wait. Nearly 10 business days later I call back and they say sorry we're still working on it, you need to wait at least another 15 BUSINESS DAYS. When I escalated the situation they totally lied and mentioned the hurricane even though the original time period they had given me lapsed well before the hurricanes onset.... When I asked to cancel the card the representative offered me 20,000 points but I would rather keep my dignity than dance with the devil that is American Express.


In summation, if you like speaking to exploited Indian CSR's who can't help you, being lied to, and being cheated after being a customer for six years, do business with Amex.
department: Premier Rewards Gold Card from American Express

content: Giving 1 Star is a fucking joke ! I am ever so happy and grateful I closed my account with this garbage SERVE CARD. Money being on hold .... servers being down and transactions being declined .... the pay your bill options is a fucking joke and your billing companies weren’t receiving payments .... this card service is a joke .... going back to chase was the best decision I ever made. Do not !!!! Have your taxes come to this card ... you will be awfully sorry. Screw the get your direct deposit one day quicker, you will be happy to wait that one day with another card service. ATM withdrawals are fucking ridiculous when you will be paying an extra $2.50 for each transaction you make (good luck if the ATM have a limit). Customer service is horrible .... wanted to dispute two transactions when instead they denied it saying I made the purchases of two items FROM OUT OF STATE! DO NOT I REPEAT DO NOT USE THIS CARD FOR PERSONAL, vacation or tax money. IN ALL HONESTY DONT USE THIS CARD AT ALL .

Just don't ever need customer service for anything. Everyone is in India and there is no help. System issues every other month and no answers as to why. I want to love my card I really do, but the terrible customer service, lack of caring, and constant system issues make it so hard.

terrible iraq customer service. if they close your account, sell your debt to collectors and report your negative balance because your credit score changed don't say i didn't warn you.


if you make a payment make sure you don't touch your account for three or four days because three or four days after you get the payment recieved email they will take the money and if its not there they will keep trying to pull it giving you isf fee after fee
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content:
Good bank. They want around 6 months of credit history for newbies. I do have a gripe with their stinginess on rewards. They also want big spenders and swipers. If you don't spend a lot, they want you to swipe a lot. And sadly, they still aren't accepted at random places so you can "not leave home without it" and not be able to use it!


I also feel like they're "missing" a credit card I want. You can tell by their credit cards that they only want fringe people. They really don't want to go Chase or Citi deep in Credit Cards. Many still don't know they offer anything other than Charge Cards. And it's clear they like where they are.

Long time Amex customer, I use the Platinum card for many of the routine company expenses. Thanks to Amex my accounting process is simplified greatly, all neat on statement. Instead of multiple payments to expenses, all condensed down to one. Service is unbeatable, reputation is well known. Been using Amex since 1978, never had a problem. Real simple company to deal with, they back you. You pay them when due. get along just fine.

content: On July 12th someone hacked my account and transferred a total of $629!! ?? They were supposed to investigate but emailed me the NEXT DAY saying i authorized the 2 transfers within 3 mins of each other!!!! Ive had to file a police report and let some responsible adults do their JOB RIGHT!!!! I wouldn't NEVER go back to them!! I have NEVER transferred money to ANYONE, ESPECIALLY NOT $629!!!!

giving you guys one star is being fucking generous. I called to dispute fraudulent charges from my card last week. They told me in 7-8 business days the money will be returned back onto the card. I called on the 8th day and another representative told me "no one put in the request" the last time I spoke to them. Now i'm being transferred 10 different times to 10 different people trying to figure out when I will get my money back. American Express and AMEX Serve you all should just eat shit and die. You have no idea how hard it is for Americans to make their money and you just sit there and avoid fraud on your customers accounts. Shame on you and I pray your business fails. Fuck all of you and go to hell.

I actually love the card. Lot of comments are over 2, 3 years old , and issues experienced in the past , has not been my issue today. I never had a hold put on my funds, as I transfer my money from one card to this one. Money is there asap, or I either load for free at Walmart. NO fees are involved with this card that is a win win all together. True enough everyone doesn't accept Amex/Express, but more than enough merchants do to make using the card still pleasant. I use it for my trips. I have reserved hotels, made purchases with no problems. I got the card to not have to worry about theft, and unauthorized charges to my bank debit card which is of course attached to my bank account. Now that was a headache! If used properly this is a excellent card the free send money feature to another card holder which my son is also a cardholder, has been wonderful. I have had the card now 2 years and none of the issues stated here, have I had. I tried other prepaid debit cards that come with a bunch a hidden fees and fees to load. This card is great Lyft even accepts them now....The card has truly served it's purpose for me. Another thing consumers need to start doing is reading the pkg and fine print. Don't be so quick to load money on a card that may not be suited for you. read more

When I say the customer service is awful words can’t explain. First it takes 3 times for me to call in order to get a representative.. I had to say Lost & stoke card the last time & it connected me quickly. So the wait time wasn’t long less than 45 seconds. Well I got a rep & he answered. His name was “Darnell” so he say, but I know that wasn’t his name. Well anyway I was going to tell him about my card situation & he cuts me off so I said excuse me sir I’m speaking. He apologized. I continue to tell him my problem he cuts me off again.. by now I’m like how can you help me with my problem if you keep talking over me!? He kept talking so I listened. I then went to speak again & then he cuts me off again by then I got really frustrated and I told him off without cursing. I requested to speak with a manager & he immediately transfered me.. I then sat on the phone for 30+ minutes waiting to speak with someone.. I just decided to hang up this is he worst customer services.

If you are thinking of getting this card, I suggest you don't. I had this card for over a year because I was not able to get a checking account because of my credit history. Luckily I got that resolved. I had money taken out so many times from other account and different transactions from weird places. Not too long ago I had a transaction made from someone named "Loraine Sasser". This lady hacked into my online account and made a direct deposit of all my money into her account and left me with nothing but $0.98. So I called the bank and was on the phone for 2hrs trying to get my issue resolved and I got no where. I suggested they give me a credit or speed up the process and got nothing. This is the worst prepaid card out there. You are probably better off getting green dot. Honestly do not get it. The costumer service representatives are not helpful at all.

Where to Start?


Tax Refund- We received our deposit for our tax refund (late) and went to use our card. Denied. Went to the ATM. Denied. Called Customer Service. No calls were getting through. We were not able to access any funds on our card including the funds that were on the card prior to the Tax Refund.

AmEx says they received to many funds at once and it crashed their system.


Direct Deposits- Like clockwork in the beginning we received our direct deposit on schedule almost down to the minute. After the tax refund issue they began to hold direct deposits. Some times they would not come until the day of. I called and they stated that as soon as the money hits their account they distribute the funds. Well, my company gave me documentation of when the money was sent to my account and I got it the following week. They had not answer for what happened. This has happened on more than a dozen occasions. I have even had problems with my son SSI and my husbands job. So they can't say it was "my companies fault".


Refunds- Whether its a refund for a product you return or gas purchased I was told that they could take up to 30 days to refund the money. Really? 30 days.


Customer Service: Pointless. As a matter of fact, I noticed that if you have an issue their system suddenly shuts down. This is like every other call.


I am starting to think that they are taking advantage of us by holding our money to gain interest on it. Now I have a bank account where I don't have these problems. I guess this is a common thing which is why most stores don't want to accept American Express.

I put all my spare money into one of these cards. Went to pay my phone bill. It stated it was"ON HOLD". I thought it was the phone. Tried again. The second charge was "ON HOLD".


I borroed money and used a different card. IT WORKED. I call Bluebird to get the HOLD charges released. They say I have to wait up to a week. I call the phone company and they don't reflect any holds. It's all on Bluebird.


I can't wait a week, I need the funds now. Nothing they can do about it. They rejected it. They are holding my money. I ask to speak to a manager. I am put on hold for 10 minutes then they hang up on me. I wait a day and call them back. Exact same thing. I hate this company.

The Amex PRG card offers so many benefits. I love getting 3x points on travel, 2x points on gas, and so much more! The benefits of carrying Amex and utilizing Amex offers are unbeatable! Free room upgrades, flight upgrades, you name it. I love the airline credit! Use my referral code and get started with some extra membership rewards points: http://refer.amex.us/JACOBBEPGh?xl=cp15
department: Premier Rewards Gold Card from American Express

content: Bluebird card is great, until someone gets ahold of your card information and takes money from you. Unlike a bank that immediately returns your funds, they make you wait 48 hours to see if the funds post, then if they do post you have to wait another 7-10 business days while they do a dispute investigation to get your funds back!!! Horrible! Talk about a slap in the face when your hard earned money has been stolen, then you have to wait over 2 weeks to get your money back!!! Beware!!!

was told through my email that it would take up to 7 days to get my money seven days have came and gone I called and waited on the phone for 45 minutes at a time to be told that there was a glitch with their computers which I don't understand why I should have to wait for my money I am now on hold again because I was transferred to a supervisor the last representative that I spoke with lad and told me it was not Wednesday when it has been Wednesday 12 hours longer at her location in Manila then it has been at my location in America then she said she didn't lie lucky for me I have a witness I would say do not put any money on this card at all they find a way to gain interest off your money and they bullshit you while they're doing it Bluebird is a scam get a regular bank or keep your money under your mattress at least you'll have it and be able to track it that way I do not believe that something call damn erican should be based in another country who doesn't understand our values in the concept of truth and how seriously we take it here in America they are thieves and scammers at Amex

Beware if you return merchandise or have a refund coming to you, it takes 7 to 10 days before you’ll get your money back. These people don’t care if that is your last dime. I have almost $100 pending forever. They blamed it on the store I got a refund from, but turns out all along it was Bluebird. Their customer service leaves much to be desired. Don’t use this card unless you can afford to b without your refund.

I had unauthorized charges for uber and lyft total 204they woul not credit it back to my card the raud dept told me i had to call uber and lyft this was clear fraud charges i never made what happened to zero liability will not recommend or use this card with jackson hewitt next tax season

I've never had a problem with this card and I've had it for over a year. Does the basics, nothing fancy but not a bad choice if you can't get a regular account. They have the option to set up sub accounts with their own cards plus a savings account. Customer service is pretty good and the app/website is easy to use especially to move money between the sub accounts. Only major down side is the checks are expensive and they have a pre-approval process which isn't a big deal but giving someone a check from them kind of gives away the fact that your using a prepaid card but it does assure them that it's good.

BE CAREFUL !! I used mine to pay for gas at the pump. I pumped $19.00 and they put $70.00 ON HOLD. I called and they said that is the practice and it could take a week for the hold to be released and for actual amount to show up. I also used it to purchase a pizza on-line to be delivered. AMEX put the total on hold plus another 20% - they said this is for incidentals until it is settled. It still has not been adjusted. Not a bad card but don't use it for gas at the pump and be careful using it on-line

I had an accounting error...I wasn't aware of the "Penalty Apr" , a.k.a. ripoff, my interest rate went from 20% to 29.99%! When I called cs they told me, even though I've never missed a payment, that because I paid 1 day over my due date.....not 30 days late, that I was being charged $38 for the late and my interest rate accelerated. Very deceptive. Now there's a minimum of $270 for a $6k dollar balance. I'm transferring to another card and closing. 29% is ungodly.
department: Marriott Bonvoy Business® American Express® Card

content: This card is the worst prepaid cc I have ever had. Anything happens where you have to deal with customer service your in a jam believe that. I think the whole service is trash including but not limited to the customer service it's really just the whole account they hold your money for stupid stuff everything is a 7 day hold terrible company...please avoid them at all cost or don't say I didn't tell you so.

I was just approved for the Blue Cash Everyday card with an initial limit of 6k. I was hoping for 2k so they have exceeded my expectation right off the bat. My credit score is slightly just over 750. I've received pre-approved offers before from the Blue Cash & Preferred cards but disregarded them but I decided to give them a try this time and I'm glad I did. I will submit an updated review in approximately 6 month but for now I give them 5 stars. I've already transferred a balance upon signing up and received a $60 credit just for waiting for my card to come in the mail which will cover my transfer fee. I'm looking forward to making this card my everyday card and reap the cash back rewards for what I use most, groceries and gas. I've also talked to customer service a couple of times and used their online chat and all times they were very helpful.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: Worst card ever! Cant ever get cash back and fees are horrible. Hard to find atms that dont charge. Alot of places dont accept american express. Never again will i use this for direct deposits im getting a walmart debit card much better i hear.

0 stars!!!!!

PLEASE PLEASE, JUST DON'T GET THIS CARD!

Believe me, someone (NOT ME) made some transactions from my account, they drained my money, almost $2 000 and this people told me there is no fraud so I don't get my money back! How in the hell could somebody just made 4 money transfers???? Now I have no money!

I liked serve but it’s hard to rely on it as a bank account. I spent 12.00 in atm fees last week because I needed to pay my rent and I didn’t realize WALMART doesn’t have money pass ATMs anymore. Many places don’t accept American Express which causes chaos when you have a buggy full of groceries. The bill pay option is amazing. Honestly some big banks I’ve had didn’t have those type of features. It basically is a bandaid for one of Serve’s bigger flaws, Many of the bills I paid online didn’t accept American Express so I had to set them up as a biller which got the bill paid but I’ll be honest it took a lot longer. I like the sub accounts. They made giving my wife money hassle free. I went at the review in a Serve vs Bank account mindset. Serve however beats every other prepaid card out there. But still I rate it 3/5, if serve was more broadly accepted in my area and had more free ATMs. I would keep the service.

Received an invitation to apply. Was pre approved through Amex website approved with 24 hour notice low CL 1000 Score 658. Hoping my CL will increase with my score improving although received no HP this is my 4th Amex card. Suppose to be one of the easiest to get I joined Skymiles a few months ago, I think that helps get you a preapproval. If Amex likes your credit you can get about any card I have low score but clean report 80,000 yr income. Hope that helps
department: Delta SkyMiles® Credit Card from American Express

content: This card is an absolute SCAM. the companion certificate has a ton of restrictions. AMEX plays dumb when you call and ask about it. If it sounds too good to be true, it probably isn't...not worth the extra $$ for this card
department: Delta SkyMiles® Platinum American Express Card

content: I only have this card because I had to file chapter 7 Bankruptcy in 2017, since I can't even get a credit union to let me open an account. Anyways, this card is great and it's nice to get direct deposit 2 days early, but it never deposits at the same time or even close to it. My company submits payroll on Sunday and normally employees get paid Thursday, but I get my check on Tuesday usually anywhere from 12pm-1230pm or anywhere from 4-5pm or anywhere from 11pm-12am. I called them and asked why the time is always different and they said that if I don't receive a deposit by 7pm I wont get it, which is a lie because I got my check a few times after 11pm. Somehow every so often my account goes negative a few dollars which I don't understand because I thought these things were supposed to stop you from going over. I don't get charged for this but it's kind of annoying and I know I can budget myself but still lol . A lot of places don't even accept American Express, I was at taco bell and had to leave the drive-thru and find an ATM because they don't accept this card. Walmart said they are not allowed to unload these cards only load, so it's kind of dumb if i need to get money off of it without using an ATM. I had to call customer service a few times and they were helpful. I had almost $800 on it and used my card at a gas pump and received a $50 hold which I'm guessing is the gas stations thing, but I thought these cards were supposed to withdraw the funds right away towards a purchase so the hold is kind of stupid. I've never truly had a pending purchase, it always shows up right away and shows the funds that I spent. Overall if you have trouble getting a bank account, this card is the way to go. There are a lot of free ATMS to use these at but make sure you check prior if the place you're at accepts American Express. A lot of stores told me that AE is expensive to use, so that's why they don't accept them. I would recommend getting the card through the Bluebird website so you don't have to buy the kit in store. Mine shipped fast. Another issue I have had is when I received my taxes, I had well over $2000 and went to purchase a Walmart money order to pay rent and I was denied, sometimes it will ask you for the security code which can be either the 4 digit one on the front OR the 3 digit one on the back. I don't care what anyone says, but I have had to use both codes at different times.

This is also one of my many use cards,I love the ability to use my points for different things and use them to pay for purchases,,Amex has been super easy to work with and quick using the chat feature,,they are usually pretty good with credit limit increases and APR reductions as your file improves...I was at low 700's on initial approval and had a 18.% range Apr with a baddie on file, when baddie left jumped to 760+ and was able to lower APR to 8% before these raises started...I'm still not complaining it comes in handy at the times when I did carry a balance a few mths....Also has long term 0% period..

I've done business w/AMEX nearly 5 yrs now and to me the most appealing things have been quick friendly customer service methods. I like they way they do their CLI's and how they usually are pretty good about APR reductions.

One star off for raising APR @ yearly review for reasons that to "too low to bring in line w/other similar products" even though I was raised to lowest APR for card it was still an increase non the less, and being that I had a low rate on the card I would carry a balance from time to time and payoff high rates every month.

But, other than that I have enjoyed the workable CLs the ease of chat and twitter for questions and the added benefits that come with the cards I have....I plan to keep my AMEX cards and recommend to friends and family..
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: It’s difficult to understand how to activate the card. Every time I tried to activate mine the server is down. I tried calling Customer Service but all I got was a machine that didn’t have any of the options I wanted. Plus, when I checked my balance (I have never used this card and I know the person who gifted the card to me) it only had $7.50 when it should have had $25! Definitely would not recommend this to anyone - go somewhere else for a card.

Approved with mid 600 score already a card holder preapproval for this one and the PRG card approved for both. Received a low limit 1300 on this one and no preset limit on either charge card. No annual fee nice but limit to low for a balance transfer. Amex has good CS and my CL will increase as my score improves with perfect payment . Already set up auto pay.
