department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content: biggest piece of crap card and company!!! Can't use the temporary card unless you go out and reload it at a f%$# store....or wait for a new one!! idiots....hope they lose a major customer base!!! Their customer service is very unprofessional as well!

Worst card even I don't know why tax places went to this card for tax refunds I would stay far away I had a refund for a Internet order that was never shipped to to back order place I bought it from refunded right away when I cancelled order but now American express has had a hold for review on my $400.00 for over a week this is bull it is not there money

WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE ever!!! I would recommend any other prepaid debit card other than this company. I have not only been put on hold for 10 minutes or longer but also they will hang up in your face. This happens each time I call and at first I really wanted to give them the benefit of the doubt, because things happen, calls drop, systems go down but EVERY time I call, someone with a thick accent will put me on hold and never return and thats just horrible customer service. I had a company take amost $170 out of my account for services never rendered and so I went ahead and disputed this with AmerExpress Serve and not only jas this taken over 2 months but NO RESOLUTION, I actually have to get my own money back because this company has not and does not have any intention on getting mw refunded. This company does not have ANY reps in the United States and I wish someone would have told me, I WOULD HAVE NEVER signed up for a card company that has no connection to the US. This company does not get 1 star or half a star from me. Choose your prepaid card merchant more wisely than I did.

Had an issue with American Express Serve. I used Billpay to pay my final Verizon bill. Fast forwarding 14 months later, I get a call from a collection agency saying Verizion never received payment. I contacted Verizon Corporate department. They believe my payment went through American Express via an ACH transaction. Verizon requested me to get an ACH Transmittal report from American Express. I made several phone calls, wrote several letters.. Even sent a certified letter with signature required.. They can't help me because its been over a year. The amount of time to dispute the charge ran out.. I'm not disputing the charge, I just want information where the money went.. Apparently they can't keep track of where my money went. I'll probably have to pay this bill again to clear it.. Otherwise the service is alright, Sometimes I get frustrated if I go to a restaurant, buy gas at pay at the pump, stay at the hotel a grossly high amount of money is put on hold until things process. At least now if I gas up at Shell, the automatic hold seemed to drop from $75.00 to $50.00.. I haven't been able to figure out a flat percentage on what Amex figures for a tip.. Sometimes its 30%.. Sometimes 20%.. Sometimes 40%... I recently loaded my tax refund on there when i did my taxes with Turbo Tax, and the money was on the card in a few days. I like the serve account for some of the features, putting money on reserve is an excellent security feature.. Sub Accounts are good. I don't like the fact that customer service representatives are outsourced with strong accents.. They need to hire more Americans..

I set my card up for direct deposit 2 weeks before being issued a check. My direct deposit should have hit on Friday but I still have not seem my check. I'm about to cancel direct deposit. I had no issues with my tax refund but I still need my weekly pay checks

This card is great! I love the bill pay feature and th convenient ways to add money. The lowest to no fee of the majority and excellent customer service. Mobile check feature is horrible. That the reason for a 4 star rating.

if I could give 0 stars I would terrible cust service their systems crashed and my card would not work I was at Walmart with 200 dollars in groceries my card would not go through but every time I swiped it sure took the 200 out of my account now my money from my pay check is on hold for up to 8 days for them to verify the transaction was declined and every time you call the automated service just hangs up on you its bs I will be closing this card

Im having the exact same issue as other people...the system updating and I cannot use the ATM...thats bullshit!!!! Never again! Nothing but problems with this card...no customer service, no English speaking reps...absolutely hate it

I wish I could give less then one star, I've been a loyal customer for four years and this year has showed me they don't care about their customers one bit. With the tax issue for 2018 going haywire today 2/17/18 I didn't know it was down when I had called my it insurance people to pay my bill. It was declined 2 times, there was plenty of money on my card. I then googled and found out they had shut down because of being over loaded. Finally 13 hours later 1am I was able to use my app again and saw they had charged my account anyways even though it was declined. I sat on the phone for 1 hour till Julie answered and her spew of it's not our fault that your card was declined. And I have to wait for them to decide if it was my auto insurance company who declined the card or I didn't have any money in my account. I told her to look my account and I have plenty of money I'm my account. She called me a lier and oh well if I don't get my money back. Horrible customer service ever. Don't use this company everyone. After I get my money off the card I'm cutting it up.

I will never use this card again. Got my refund and they say they are updating the system so i cant get my money. This is a bullshit card. They say the system is down i think its bullshit. I have spoke with the fraud team, customer service,and corporate office. Its my money they cant hold it. Funny they waited to update the system the day we get our refund. They new what day the refunds would be loaded!

I will never ever trust amex serve with my tax return ....this is the 1 st and last time I use their service amex has let.me down I revieved my tax return on the serve card and now I can't use it system is down for 4 hrs so far can't speak to no customer service rep this is so beyond wrong terrible customer service NEVER AGAIN

Expedia has taken over the booking for American Express Platnium travel customers. There is no longer a way to get customer service or leave a review. Dead links everywhere. When you book a fine hotel and resort and you show up they list you as Expedia and you don’t get the contracted upgrades. I recently spent $10k on a few days in a hotel and had to ask 3 times for what was suppose to be contracted from the AmEx travel website. I finally asked what they had me listed as and they told me, indignantly, Expedia. When I told them AmEx fine hotels and resorts they spent the next two days apologizing but the problem was my stay was already mostly over. Happened again with the rental car, I’m put into a line with a bunch of chain smoking, price shopping, red necks and listed like Expedia again and the guy behind the counter treats me like it. You prepay the fee so when my contract is up I won’t renew AmEx platnium. I spend and pay off $50k-$100k a month on the card. This card I have had for 5 years and it’s no longer worth it. The 5x and 30% points back is a joke. You won’t be able to figure it out and it’s a “gotcha” mantality. Good luck. They are trying to be more like every other card, but they still keep transaction cost high and take profits. Call center turned into garbage as well. They don’t know what they use to and the Customer XP is raspberries. No friend to small business.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: STAY AWAY will put holds on your money and not release it even if it is an issue with their system. Their customer service is horrible. Even their supposed "Supervisors" are of not help. Transfer never happened and they refuse to make my money accessible again. Excuse "technical issue" for 10 days. Only get involved with this company if you want one headache after another.

Horrible customer service AND they’ve had my money “processing” In the account since the 13th, it was suppose to take 3-5 business days to transfer into my bank account and it’s still not there. I’ve been on the phone with customer service with whom can barely speak English and they have BS answers for me. Some sort of tech errors. After 5 different representatives and 10 days I’m forced to call the BBB and my attorney!! They are literally holding my money from me!! They wouldn’t let me give them no stars to submitt so I had to give them 1!!

My American Express card has served me well for over 6 years now. I initially signed up for it because of the great rates and the points incentives. I have stayed with them because of their customer service and their willingness to help out when I am in a jam. Their points system is pretty straightforward and has many versatile uses.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: Horrible. Use cash or get a real bank account. It's fine if you load cash on and only use in small amounts. If you need large amounts transferred or need a large amount of cash they make it so inconvenient that you just give up. Can't use this for a lot of things (including uber). If you need to call be prepared to be on hold for a half hour, explain your situation repeatedly, and then have them tell you there's nothing they can do.

The best card I ever owned. The annual fee is high but well worth it for the perks. This is the only card I use for travel, I've placed my other cards in the sock drawer. I highly recommend this card for those who travel often.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: You've ever had any other card with American Express don't think for a second that the policies or customer service is even remotely similar on this card. Transaction cannot be disputed until it's been fully completed. After they finally allow you to file dispute you must wait 6 business days before they will credit the funds back to your card. If you cancel a transaction either just a minute or two after the initial transaction American Express has already taking the money from your account. Despite having the supporting documentation showing the cancellation MedExpress will hold will keep your money 8 more business days until the pending transaction and their system lapses as a result of merchant inaction. There's no excuse for this except laziness and greed on the part a company take advantage of the customers that can least afford it. Shame on you

I've had my account for over a year just started as something small to put money up and save. Well now I use it a lot more and I had one time that I added over 300.00 to it, went to 2 stores and spend 100 at one and 60 at the other. It told me I had 28.00 left over. Well that didn't add up. So I started to add everything up to see where the confusion took place from that day. And I got more confused. So I started all the way to the day I opened my account. And realized the more I used my card the more money disappeared. First it was 7.00 one month that was miscalculated. And by the time I finished i'm missing over 300.00 because apparently there computer can't count when adding up your transactions. I called customer service and some lady that you can understand to much went back to my last deposit which was like 5 days and I didn't use my card a lot so of course those three transactions she went over added up. I'm talking about over a few months money's coming up missing.

Beware the complimentary Priority Pass lounge "membership." While they advertise it as access to these lounges, you will be charged $27 per person per visit when you use the priority pass membership card. While it states this in the initial paperwork they send you, when you go to use the membership card, they ask you to sign for the number of people visiting but do not have you sign for a charge to your credit card. The charge just shows up a few days later. I'm very disappointed that AmEx would offer this as a benefit. They should either provide truly free lounge membership (like the Citi Prestige card) or no membership at all. Overall, if you enjoy staying at Hilton's get this card for the bonus and then cancel it.
department: Hilton Honors™ Surpass® Card from American Express

content:
The bluebird prepaid cards sucks. I got an overdraft. When I purchased something there was a transaction. It should've been canceled automatically!

Bluebird doesn't do a good job protecting their customers. Debit cards are better.

I was offered this card as an upgrade to my existing HHonors card. Didn't realize it had forex fees attached where the "lesser" card didn't, which is bad news for those of us who like to travel abroad. Plus it comes with an annual fee, whereas the "lesser" card didn't. Total junk - stick with the standard HHonors card, or just redeem the sign-up bonus and then cancel it. A sad offering from Amex.
department: Hilton Honors™ Surpass® Card from American Express

content: This card (specifically the green serve card) has many benefits that other prepaid debit cards don't have. At CVS, there is no activation fee. There are no cash reload fees at CVS, Family Dollar, 7 Eleven, Walmart and Rite Aid. There is a monthly fee of $4.95 except for customers in NY, VT and TX. The blue and silver serve cards have a cash reload fee because the silver has a 1% cash payback program and the blue card is $1 per month. The green serve card doesn't charge an ATM withdrawal fee at Money Pass locations. Additionally, getting cash at US Bank and TFC bank ATM'a, it is completely free from both banks. There is a reserve savings account attached with no interest and subaccounts for o additional charge. The foreign transaction fee is 2.7% which is less thsn the average card. Most establishments and retailers now accept American Express but it is wise to have a Visa or Mastercard as a backup.

This is a great credit card, I just love it. This card has solved my debt issue. I really think this was a great recommendation by wallet hub. Keep the good work!.Thanks American express for introducing such wonderful opportunity.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I am giving 5 stars for the simple fact that my credit is not that great and was approved. My credit is bad 608 transunion 620 equifax 5 collections from 3 years ago and more than 40 credit inqiiries within the last 2 years. I was approved for the green card and no pre set spending limit, which i still don't understand how that works.

I Give American Express Blue Cash Everyday Five Stars★★★★★. It Is The Most Top Of The Credit Card From American Express. If You Do Not Believe Me, Then Check Out, The Other Cards That American Express Offers! There Is One That Has A $550 Annual Fee! OUCH!
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I have been American Express card holder for such a long time but due to financial problem I couldn't pay my debt on time which is $800. I called the customer care and talked about my situation but they didn't care about my problem. Later, I paid everything. Just after that, without informing. They deactivated my account. I really feel bad that moment because they didn't care about situation without the proper information they took an improper action. I talked to customer care about my situation but they just ignore it. I even didn't get a chance to use my point which I have collected for a ages. So, think twice before you apply for account. They don't care about customer. It's just a business to them.

Bluebird is okay, but the issue I have is not many establishments accept American Express. I went to a gas station and swiped at the pump and received an error. So I went inside and they told me that they do not accept the card and I was on "E". It's a good thing that I was able to use the "ATM" machine and pay the Fees to get cash.


Secondly, I went to an establishment and when they saw my card with the American Express Logo they told me they do not accept. I stood in line 10 minutes to get rejected.


Also, I do not like the fact that I have a PIN but I cannot get cash back at a grocery store when I buy groceries.


Lastly, finding an ATM that offers withdrawals is a hassle. Walmart is the SLOGAN behind Bluebird and where I live the machine is ALWAYS out of order. It has NEVER worked for me. Therefore, I have to drive 20-25 minutes to use an "ATM" that accepts Bluebird - without the fee.


Moving forward, I have received good customer service despite the many times I have called and the representatives could not find my account using my email address, SSN, or other pertinent information. However, when I ask for a supervisor they are able to find my account. With this being said, I did get one representative that was VERY reluctant to allow me to speak with a representative.


I like Bluebird because I get my payroll check Wednesday night vs Friday. Is it work the issue(s) I am having? Yes it is until I get control of my finances and DOCUMENT when I use ANY card. When you make a purchase, write it down.

Excellent report american express approve excellent or good credit.


My experience if very satisface.


Last 2 week's I'm solicited DISCOVER card and have receive denial


Jc penny macys denial my cards


Comenity bank I have 3 cards with then denial my PayPal account.


But american express give me opportunity .

Approached at airport to sign up for this card. Already had a few. Signed up anyway as some pressure applied. Did a status check to see where I sat with the promotion 80% at the spending goal and was told there was no promotion. So I closed all AMEX cards but this one and plan to close this one. Beware!

This card services is horrible, I had to dispute several charges on my card that were no of my doing. They held the funds for over a month after telling me that if no decision was made in ten days I would get my refund returned to my card. It's been over a month and they keep feeding me excuses on why it keeps getting pushed back. The customer service is awful and they are clueless and can't give you an answer on what's going on. I hate this service and to me hate is a strong word but it's appropriate for the amount if crap they put me through.


Do do not uses this card there far better card to use besides this one.

Be warned. They offer you a hefty credit limit initially, which I used to transfer balances from 3 cards onto, which saved me a ton of money. Then within the next 15 months they gradually kept reducing my credit limit, which caused my credit score to keep reducing. Given I was never late on a single payment, this was uncalled for. They send you am email telling you that you can ask them to review their decision, which amounts to them giving you 30-60 days to pay most if not all of your balance off in full. Ridiculous. I can't wait to have it all paid off so I can let them wonder where I went.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I really love mine. I have had no problems. The only problems I know of, is that AMEX isn't accepted everywhere like a visa or mastercard is. It helps me to protect my real money in my bank when making gas purchases, I use at most any place that accepts American Express and love them.

I have been using the American Express Blue Cash Everyday card for over 4 years now and highly recommend it. In addition to its generous cash back rewards program, features such as automatic extended warranty on consumer products and travel benefits make this great an excellent credit card option with no annual fees and the best customer service in the business.

OMG this Card between them & 711 took my $788 Thieves. Canceled my card & told me to wait 7-10 days & still no money. Customer service puts you on hold 1 hour and 30 minutes and never picks up. From the reviews I see they been doing the same thing over and over. How are u gonna rob your customers.

Major scam I can't believe they haven't been shut down or heavily fined in good faith I used their service for federal tax refund went to confirm activation email did not work then locked me out explained situation new card issued in 7-10 days well 3 new cards & 4 months later still no refund I have called emailed twittered only response sorry for the inconvenience new card on its way that response only took 2hrs on the phone being passed around dept. to dept. Besides the other times disconnected left on hold never to be responded back to lied to total fraud I know family & friends who also used their services all with negative experiences some card holders all ready who were suddenly locked out supposedly for clause violations never exp!aimed or proven

I have been using the card for 3 years now, never had any problems. I used to use for direct deposit for my old job when got a new job they didn't use direct deposit. Still use paper checks. Not a problem I deposit my check via camera load on the card.

Don't link your checking account or any account to bluebird. Someone got into my bluebird account, changed my profile and transferred 400 dollars to bluebird and then transferred 478 out of bluebird to some lady named Rebecca fransway. Your only allowed 200 per day to load money on your bluebird but unlimited money going out. This happened at 11:58 pm and another at 12:01 am.

Called the fraud department and they had to send me a voice mail to my phone with a fraud case number. They would not talk to me until I got that case number and called back. I then got the number and called back. They are idiots, the guy gave me the wrong case number. I rechecked the number again and called back, they kept saying it's the wrong number. She called the guy and got the right number. Meanwhile someone is in my account and stealing money and I'm arguing of a number. Go figure they are in Asia. They took the info right and said don't worry you will get your money back. After 8 days The people in Salt Lake City sent me a email saying they declined my 1278 dollar claim because it was authorized. Case closed !! The lady can't add, I never said 1278 so she submitted it wrong. She even read back to me the amount, it was right. But submitted it wrong to salt lake. I called tha same number (fraud dept) and they said there is nothing they can do that I have to right a letter. I wrote a letter, sent certified mail with all my bank account statements proving my case and I have heard nothing from them. That was on 5-7-17 and now it is 5-23-17. I got screwed. For someone to now my personal info and to change my profile had to be an inside job. There is no number to call Salt Lake City Utah. I expected a lot more out of American Express. They went on what the lady put in 1278 and it didn't add up. No wonder they declined the claim. Almost done intentionally so they won't investigate it. Even though they say " this conversation is being recorded ".

Listen to the recording!!!! They suck!!!

I had fraudulent ATM withdrawals from my account and do not know how this could happen when I still had the card in my possession! It was about 1200.00 in ATM withdrawals from multiple atms in another state. I called customer service and they cancelled card and transferred me to fraud and I put in a claim and they stated I will be refunded 5 to 7 business days. Here it is 2 weeks later and still I have not been refunded. This caused me to be late on rent for the first time and had to wait for another direct deposit to pay rent whereas I'm out of 1200.00 to go toward other bills so I'm SOL for the month. I withdrew all the money from this card and changed my direct deposit to another card and will keep this card open until they refund my money from these fraudulent atm withdrawals! I will never do business with this trash company again. No phone call or nothing while all these atm withdrawals were being done. I signed up with Brinks prepaid Mastercard and will get a text everytime any kind of transaction occurs on my account. Screw AMEX Serve Card!!!!

AWFUL, AWFUL, AWFUL customer service. I had no issues with this card until I used it at a local money pass atm to withdraw $300 from my account. The money was deducted from my account but was not dispensed from the atm. I went inside the bank immediately to let them know and contacted Bluebird from their parking lot to file a dispute claim (at the suggestion of the bank's atm manager). The bank counted their atm that night and acknowledged that it was, in fact, over in the amount of $300. They immediately sent the credit back to AMEX to be put back on my card. Bluebird denied my first dispute claim stating the merchant had provided documentation that shows the money was dispensed. They don't seem to understand that it was dispensed to THEM to be put back in my account and they HAVE NOT DONE THAT, so they are sitting on my money. I opened a second dispute claim and now it has been almost a month since this all started and Bluebird claims there has never been any credit issued back to them for my account and that they are still investigating my claim. On the last set of documents I faxed over yesterday (because they claim they never received the documents I faxed over last week) I let them know that I am fully prepared to file a complaint with the BBB and contact media sources to investigate this issue that appears to be a common one with AMEX, and *gasp* I woke up to a $300 provisional credit to my account, which they stated can be withdrawn if they deem my dispute invalid again. HOW DOES ANY OF THIS MAKE ANY KIND OF SENSE?!? I am beyond frustrated and will never touch a Bluebird card again, nor will I EVER recommend it to ANYONE. The day this all happened I went and opened a TD Bank account. Lesson learned. DO NOT USE BLUEBIRD!!!!!!!!!

Worse customer service ever..I was trying too relate a concern to customer service an she kept asking me if I understood..What she was trying to tell me..Her asking me once is a question ..Her asking me 3 to 4 times is an insult..I quess because I have a Hispanic name she figured I didn't know English..

NO CUSTOMER SKILLS

I don't like like it's optional to register a temporary card but if you don't and you lose the card whoops the money is gone for good. They should put that damn warning on the freaking packets so now I'm out of my hard earned money so therefore I'm just gonna Walmart prepaid cards then at least I know with them I know my money won't just "vanish"

I unfortunately opened a Bluebird account for travel expenses for work. I get my reimbursement checks paid to this account. On my last business trip, I lost my ATM card and was told it would take another 7 - 10 business days to receive a new one. Well.......how do you get money out of your account when you don't have an ATM card? The website proposes a service called RIA, or something, to have money waiting for you at WalMart. However, you need to have your pin number and security code from the back of your card. Since the card has been cancelled, this doesn't work.


I called Bluebird customer service and they said I should write a check to myself for cash and take it to WalMart (who underwrites this nonsense). The only way you can write a Bluebird check is to have it 'pre-authorized' for the total amount - meaning it automatically deducts that amount from your account and gives you a verification number to put on the check to ensure that it is going to go through. I did all that. I took it to Walmart and they looked at me like I had two heads. They said, 'we don't cash personal checks here, you need to take this to your bank.' I assured them I JUST spoke with Bluebird customer service and they said Walmart could do it since they're the ones who issue this account. No one there had ever seen a Bluebird check before and they wouldn't take it.


Next step, I took it to MY real bank. They said they'd cashi it but it would have to be on hold for a few business days. I didn't like that solution either as it's my money and I need it right now. I called Bluebird Customer service again and they said try a Wells Fargo bank since that's who underwrites our checks. Tried that too and they wouldn't touch it.


Bottom line is that Customer Service has no idea what they're talking about and you're totally screwed if you lose your ATM card, as there's no way to get at your own money. The Customer Service Rep kept repeating, 'well sir, if you know someone else who has a BlueBird Account, just transfer money to them.' Hell no! I don't know anyone else with this crappy bank and I certainly wouldn't wish it on my worst enemy.

To hell with this banking nonsense and stick with the big players.

Careful! May damage your credit history and credit rating when using auto pay!!


Have had the Blue Cash Everyday Card from American Express set up using auto pay each month to make the minimum payment for years. Worked hard to improve my credit to qualify for this card (and like most AMEX customers I care about my credit rating, and credit record).


Continued improving financial situation and was ready to improve monthly auto pay to pay off the complete balance each month.


Logged in and changed the auto pay settings to pay complete balance and replaced minimum payment (correctly during the same login in about a 3 minute transition) and completed this about 10 days before next payment date.


Discovered the new auto payment didn't auto pay and called to ask why. They explained that the AMEX system doesn't pay your upcoming payment, it begins auto pay for 2nd payment.


What?!!


How is this a service to the type of customer AMEX is looking for? Why is AMEX not doing everything they can to protect the customers who are trying to protect their credit by using auto pay?


AMEX told me there’s a notice when setting auto pay that, “ you’re next payment will not be automatically payed so you have to manually pay your upcoming payment even though you just authorized auto pay.


I’m focused on the type and amount of auto pay I’m setting up, not making a manual payment.


How does this serve the customer?! It’s hard to imagine how. It’s easy to understand how it serves AMEX because they have my $30ish late fee in their pocket which they wouldn’t return to my account because I didn’t make a manual payment while adjusting auto pay.


This is a conscious systemic decision that jeopardizes every customer’s credit.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: Closed my account because I opened a claim about a purchase I didn't make for $117. Closed my account and sent my remaining balance of my tax refund in a check, which my credit union had problems verifying. I'm still working on solving my dispute!

I would give them zero stars if it would let me. I've had this card for about three months and found it very difficult to use. First, there tons of businesses that just don't accept Amex. Second, I had a travel website double charge my card for a hotel reservation. It was their mistake. I contact Serve and they said there was nothing I could do but wait 7 days for the transaction to fall off of my account. I was stuck traveling with no money in my account and Serve would do nothing about the unauthorized transaction. I contacted the travel website who then got a Serve representative on the phone to clear it up and they still refused to do anything. Using this as the account for my travel funds, I was stuck on a trip with no money. This card is worthless, this company is worthless and the customer service agents have zero power, knowledge or incentive to assist customers. STAY AWAY FROM AMEX SERVE!!!!!!!

American express is a shit company. It takes them way too long to take care of fraudulent charges, their customer service is some of the worst I've ever experienced, and in order to get even a slight increase in your credit limit you have to have excellent credit, good is not enough. I have had this card for 2 years, have maintained good credit, doubled my yearly income, and never come close to the limit they have set. I have asked for an increase twice in these 2 years just benefit my credit and every time I have been denied. My other 4 credit cards with other companies (who started me off at a higher limit than this shit company did) have all increased my limit 3 times in these past 2 years without even being asked by me. Once this card is fully paid off, I will no longer be doing any business with American Express.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: its ok.....i read online that there's no monthly fee and thats what attracted me to it, but there IS a fee, $3 or so...and u pay to put money in and take it out...they basically lied

This card is better than Netspend and Green Dot from my experience. The reserve account feature is very convenient (it acts as a savings and it comes with the card account), the mobile website is easy to navigate. I started getting my dd's two weeks after giving my employer the info. There are minimal fees compared to other cards like Netspend. The best feature is the cash back, which is unheard of for a prepaid debit card. I've only had a couple issues. When trying mobile check deposit it said my account wasn't authorized for it, don't know what that's all about. When trying to get cash back at a gas station, the terminal immediately ran the transaction as credit when it usually it asks first if it's credit or debit, this probably happened because some stores recognize amex as only credit, it was only at one location this has happened so far. Some locations do not honor amex, but they are very few.
Amex Serve Account will not return stolen funds. They may be good at first, but just wait until Fraudulent charges on your card. You will never get your money back.

My daughter's card was stolen and it took them 8 (eight!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!) weeks to credit our account. The customer service team 1). hung up on me, 2.) would not let me speak to supervisor, 3.) lied about receiving our fraud claim documents we uploaded, and 4.) could not speak English. It was the worst experience ever. Made me HATE AmEX.

I was really happy with american serve until I lost my card in Chicago...The fraud claim department put the wrong information into the system leading to my account being shut down. Now my account is closed because the mistake of a customer service representative.... Can you say worst service of all time? Anyways I ordered a new Kaiku Card from Visa looks alot better then American Express Serve.

This is a gimmick card. The telephone salesperson kept telling me that 3x the points on our large online media buys was the same as 3% back. It is not.


I will stay with my Fidelity Visa that is 2% cash back into a money market account with no limit.


American Express has more gimmicks than real useful deals.

Worst prepaid card available and by far the worst customer service you will ever experience. They are untrained, clueless, rude and extremely hard to understand as none of them speak fluent English. Beyond frustrating. Stay away from this card unless you want your money stolen.

I have had my card over a year and only ever used it for Walmart bucks. However my husband's new job requires direct deposit so I called blue bird about doing this. I was told I would have to add him as a family account holder first. I did so and we took the information to his employer. Pay day comes and no deposit. We call blue bird. After me explaining four times how I am primary on the account, they tell me a family holder can't receive direct deposit. So now no way to get paid. All because they gave me false information from the beginning!

The "card" is great. C.S., not so much. ALL money was stolen off card and Amex doesn't want to credit me so I have to jump thru hoops until they realize I won't give up. AND they only out source so you can't speak to anyone in the US.

Don't let the 1 star, negative reviewers fool you...


If you want a prepaid account that does exactly what it says, Serve is for you. I have Serve for 2 years, never once had a problem. I even lost my card, and they sent me a replacement, even overnighted it to me for free.


Direct deposits are fast and hassle free... I, personally, get my money 1 day early most of the time, lately it's been 2 days early. It states "up to 2 days sooner", but never makes the promise. When you money becomes available has more to do when it is processed by the bank your company draws payroll from, not Serve.


At the register, it works just like a prepaid credit card, which is basically what it is, it is AMEX after all, and they DO NOT do DEBIT, which means you have to have the money available or the transaction will be decline.


You cannot get cash back at the register, but you can use an ATM, and there are plenty of FREE ATM's around. I live in a small rural town, and I have 2 of them.


Customer Service has always been easy to work with, thankfully, I only ever had to call 3 times... mind you, all 3 issues where my own fault. And just to make a note, I see the way people talk on here, I can only imagine who ignorant they can be to a person on the phone... no wonder they aren't willing to help you better.

If you have ever heard of "No customer service" then you've heard correctly. This card was doing well until I needed to reach out to them. Twice, I was not told the truth and on the 2nd time they refused to look into why my automatic reload did not load onto my card. They do not have State-side agents in which to speak with. I had to close my account due to the nature of the way my inquiry was handled and do to "no customer service." I would not get this card again..ever!

Great card.

Payday comes two days early, which is nice.


Also, I had an issue not too long ago where I lost my card, and desperatelt needed cash because my car was in the shop. I knew they had an option online to send cash to Walmart, which I planned to do. Unfortunately, you have to have an activated card to do so - and since I'd already reported the card lost I was inable to do so.


Called in and spoke with a wonderful ahent, who wasn't able to help me but she said her supervisor may be able to do so. And boy did he! He made an exception and had the money sent to me via western union - free of charge!


I now have a subaccount in my fiance's name just so I can transfer funds to it if my card is ever lost again. Which is convenient.


If you need a prepaid card for direct deposit... you can certainly do worse.

Worst company to deal with a direct deposit. My husband's direct deposit should have shown up today but it has still not posted and we have rent to pay. I think I will contact the office of thrift supervision and make a complaint.

I love this card. The cash back builds up fast if you shop at the grocery store often. I also use it at gas stations and department stores. American Express gives you great service, fraud alerts and the app experience is perfect.

I use the bundled discounts a lot as well. Already saved 100$ this year using this card on purchases I was going to make anyway.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content:
By far worst company i have ever used. Called because i had lost my card. They have issued me a new one but i have yet to recieve it. I needed to make 2 seperate bill payments. I called to verify if I used my account number and rounting number if i could make thise payments. The sales rep informed me that would be fine.


After making the payment i see it had not came out of my account. I call back only to be told i was given false information and now i am going to be charged $30 per transcation for the bounce check the car payment will recieve. Even though all calls are recorded and they can hear the sales rep give me false information all they could do was apologize as if that helps ME THE CONSUMER!!! They pretty much told me now im responsible even though their rep told me i could.


As soon as i get my replacement card i am with drawing all my funds and cancelling their service because clearly they do not care for their customers. At least Visa would have handled the situation. My advice is to NEVER EVER go with this company.

I used my prepaid card to reserve room at a hotel. The hotel charged a $50.00 fee for incidential. I checked out of the hotel and the hotel assured me the $50.00 would be return to card. After 2 weeks I notice the $50.00 was still on hold. I contacted American Express customer service and was informed they had 30 days to release hold. I contacted the hotel and was informed they cancelled the hold the day i checked out. Really a 30 day hold for a prepaid card. Once I receive money back. I will be cutting up this card

I've been having BofA for a while now, was always being charged monthly maintenance fees because we couldn't meet the minimum deposit each month, and whey we had a low balance to begin with we would be charged overdraft fees and at some point ended up with 89$ in fees because I didn't realize paypal didn't go through yet my bad. Finally found this prepaid card. It works wonders. I've had a balance of 0.01 cents for a few months now because sometimes I don't add cash to it. But with the bank issues this card is a great life and money saver. Would highly recommend this to anyone who has balance issues. Thank you American Express/Walmart! And might I add free savings set aside account omg :)

I have been with this card fa 3mnths no problems until today 122216 I didn't receive my direct deposit at the usual time ever morning they release my funds which is 5:30-5:45am. So I called and the first agent while verifying my acct hung up on me. I know this because I used the house phone that everyone has hook to their cable accts but never really use haha lol. So I calld back again and the 2nd agent didn't even verify my acct so I know she was talkn off the top of here head that there was no direct deposit on hold are even showing up in the system to come out on my regular pay date which is 122316 to check with my employer to get the transaction ID. My company payroll is always correct and on time. I work for a major company so they have their payroll account very much together. After getn off the phone waiting on my employer to get in at 7:00am to call, miraculously my deposit hits my card not even 15 mins after getting off the phone. I don't know what happen to day but regardless I dont like being lied to with a company I'm conducting business with especially when it's a company that literally holds your financial lifeline in their hands. I will be getting out while I still can. I tried to give this card a chance regardless of its reviews and personal knowledge of fraud on my sisters account through the Jackson Hewitt card but I'm afraid if I keep this card I will have a real horrific encounter like most.
They charge me, interest charge on shopping and interest charge on balance. I am charged $10 every month. It will be $120 annual interest. This is ridiculous. I will cancel my card!!
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content:
Would not give any stars but you have to.

We bought the start up kit and this is the first time and we have not even tried to use it because the website gives you some processing error. And customer service is a joke I work in customer service and if a card says no credit check to have then why do they do one? It's a flipping prepaid card. You are not getting a credit card. After over an hour and a half talking to customer service. I would not recommend this card to my worse enemy. Now to get the money we put on the card before this crap so we can find an alternative that does not lie about what you can and cannot do with the card. So if you don't agree fine but my experience was terrible I would NEVER recommend to anyone. And any customer service explanations after this incident will not fix my opinion of this false advertising and poor service

I choose my Bluebird prepaid card over a bank card Bluebird doesn't give me a lot of problems they have amazing customer service that is available 24 hours I love the features that they have like the set-aside account will have you feeling like you have a savings account because you get to put all of the money that you're going to use at a later date inside of it i love that they offer direct deposit i always get my money on time I like that they give you free checks to use and the only time your card ever gets charges if you withdraw money for ATM machine the only thing I don't like is that American Express is not accepted everywhere so that could be a little frustrating to me when I'm trying to eat at my favorite mall or buy something but other than that they are a really great card company I have been with them i believe it has been 2 years now I feel like I have always had my back

I personally love my Bluebird card! The only thing I do not like is how Amex isn't accepted in every store like Visa is, but I know that's because Amex charges ZERO fees unlike other card companies. Highly recommend!
Buyers be aware their loyalty is to the merchant, consider other alternatives... they will make you wait for your money...

Horrible customer service

Does not with a lot of merchants/ not acceptable

Is not affiliated with American Express corporate office / no phone # provided for a corporate office

Supervisor s and managers have no authorization to makefchanges in their system or offer a satisfactory resolution.

Horrible customer service

Does not with a lot of merchants/ not acceptable

Is not affiliated with American Express corporate office / no phone # provided for a corporate office

Supervisor s and managers have no authorization to make fuanges in their system or offer a satisfactory resolution.

If I could this business zero stars i would. Every representive I speak with tells me something different and then if your asks to speak with a supervisor they place you on hold and never come back to the phone. I was told I had to fill out a form because of some fraudulent activity and would receive it within two business days. A week later I'm told it will take another 7 to 10 days. The rep I spoke with (Shawn) was very unprofessional and did nothing to help me and at the end of the day I wil do everything in my power to spread the word as to why this is the worst company to do business with.
Can't get a replacement within the 10 days...I need my money

If you have no other option for saving money then okay this maybe a way to go, but it seems most places do not like accepting prepaid debit cards, Not Netflix not Boost Mobile, not to many places take AMEX saving your money in a sock would be a better option, half the time you to Walmart and the ATM is out of order or they don't have one to begin with, I don't have the gas to drive all over town looking for ATMs that I don't have to pay a fee on, it's very inconvenient to find ATM's that have no surcharges ie Cash points.
It's a great card costumer service is 24/7 and professional I like it very much

This reward program is a scam.

1 To 1 Rewards is only limited

I went to claim reward points and they charged me 167 points per dollar because I didn't use there travel program through them which they obviously get a kick back from.

I asked the agent when signing up and was assured the program was 1 for 1.

Very disappointed with this company and will start to use my "NO Hassle Rewards" card from here on out!!

Shame on you American express!!!

Tried to redeem miles for airline travel I already purchased.

Seems there is some fine print that if you don't book through them, You will only receive 1 dollar for every "167" points earned.

I specifically asked about this before I signed up and was told its 1 for 1.

Now on redeem day they pull this crap.

Very unhappy customer and see myself switching over to one of my other card vendor for daily transactions.

You pay an annual membership fee also to be part of this sham!!!

I looked on this page to find that lingo and had no luck!!!


Super unhappy!!
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content: They are very closed mouth on where you can get credits. I put over 12000 dollars on my card the first 4 months i have had it and only received about $75 in credits less the additional $150 i received for using the card. They are unable or unwilling to tell you where you receive the credits that you have received. Its a screwed up mess.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I have had my card replaced 3 times because I have been hacked 5 times

I've been using this card for at least 6 months (probably more like a year.) I have had ZERO issues. Everyone who has complained about this card has complained about customer service, so the 2-star rating really isn't accurate. I have direct deposit set up and get my paycheck 2 days before they hand them out at work (super-convenient.) Because of that, the already measly $1 monthly fee is waived. I can get cash out at any US Bank ATM (super convenient.) Most places that accept credit/debit cards accept AMEX. My only complaint is actually about the Android app - I have yet to be able to deposit a check by taking a picture. That function pretty much just doesn't work. I did A LOT of research before getting this card, and it really IS the best prepaid card available. It is unfortunate that a few people have had negative experiences with customer service, but don't let that dissuade you from getting this if you're in need of a prepaid credit card...
Did work good- now sucks big time

This is the best prepaid card in existence. Free to reload. No extra charges to use the card. Not perpurchase or monthly fee. And i see comments. The merchant may refund it but it doesn't happen over night. I was charged and the merchant returned it. I called cause it was on my card n when i asked the merchant i was told it takes 5-7 for them to send it back. Even tho it took 5 seconds for them to charge me. Its not the card ots the store. 2Years with this card so far so good

I've had Blue Cash Back card for years. I use it a LOT -- never had an issue. Until two wee­ks ago when I noticed I hadn't been getting the correct (higher) percent of cash back, despite clearly reaching the required spend. I called. After many holds, the rep said, "Yes, we made an error." Really? You're American Express? Isn't this what you're building your business on -- CASH BACK? Isn't it kind of essential you know how to do that? So the guy apologizes and basically says "We'll be fixing it at some point in the future." No other correspondence from them. Scheez. So incredibly disappointing.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: Customer service is totally the worst. I tried on line and on the phone. I cannot get a person and have spent over an hour trying, That is Ridiculous !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I have been waiting for a portion of my payroll deposit to hit my card. My payday WAS 4/15/2016. Today is Wednesday, 4/20/2016. STILL WAITING!!! Where the hell is my money??? This whole SERVE card operation is hoax!! They are stealing all of our hard earned money. NEVER AGAIN. Just stick to the actual bank cards that are tied to an ACTUAL BANK. So frustrating! Everytime I call, they just say they are having phone difficulties and to call back. Who is bank affiliation? I'm calling them M'Fers next. This is ridiculous
Customer support sucks I cannot reach anyone ever I am cancelling this card rip off completely

I was happy with the Platinum Delta American Express rewards program, but American Express account customer service support for this card was very poor. I had a credit on my account due to a refund. AmEx said a credit check was issued, but it never made it to my home. I cancelled my card and a cancellation letter did come to my home, so they had the right address.


The representative said they would reissue the check. After two months, the check never arrived. The online status of the issue that was opened said a letter was sent to customer on resolution. I never got a letter on resolution. I called AmEx customer service again today. They said because it was a reissue of the refund, it needs to go through a different process, and they will now submit through that process.


The first time I called was on a weekend and I got a person from the Philippines that could barely speak English and I had a very hard time understanding. This time I called in the middle of the day in the middle of the week, hoping to get someone from the US. The representative spoke much better English today, but we still had some communication problems.


I am giving a low rating to Delta American Express Customer service due to:

1) Not able to resolve my issue on first try

2) Long time on phone to resolve

3) Communication difficulty with representative due to language issues
department: Delta SkyMiles® Platinum American Express Card

content:
Absolute WORST customer service department. I've been using Serve since day one. Literally! Over the last year my average spending per month via serve is $3360 yet when I call I'm treated like garbage.


In the 30+ times I've called it's been the same result...a rude, defensive, arrogant representative. Never once have they fixed anow issue, they're simply there to inform you that what ever your problem may be will have to wait as they have no authority to make any changes to pending or completed transactions.


Most recently I was told that "it's a privilege to be able to use this card, you should feel privileged sir" right


Absolute embarrassment of "customer service" staff

Worst! company ever....it's been over one month that I have been waiting for my refund after they suspended my account. It was only because I called today to inquire about the status of my refund, that my acct was sent off for "review" which will take another 3 to 5 business days and then ANOTHER 7 to 10 business days before they'll process my refund. Do NOT get this card!! They're thiefs!

am out of town because my son has leukemia. He scheduled for a bone marrow transplant. I'm not working so understandably I have to watch every penny. I tried to book a hotel room on a third party website. They took almost $200 from my Serve account but did not give me a room. I called Serve customer service and was informed that the funds would appear on my account immediately as soon as the vendor release them but they have up to 7 days to release them and then without medical experiments but 100% of those on the vendor. I called customer service for the online company and they were very Cooperative they apologized and informed me that they never took the funds they just pre-authorized for the amount of the hotel room. However if the money was still appearing as taken from my account they offered to call serve with me on the line and inform them of the error and inform Serve that they will not be taking the money. When we reached the supervisor at the surf customer service she was rude and refused to help in any way just simply saying a phone call was not sufficient that another form of communication was necessary no matter what form of communication the third party online company offered the woman that serve refused. Eventually I had to get off the phone because I needed to get back to my son. I tried calling again over and over speaking to supervisors and always that continue to blame the vendor and in some cases blame me. Serve customer service hung up on me yelled at me and accused me of using profanity when I mentioned that I'd worked in banking for 9 years. The whole experience has just been appalling. Instead of being of the focus on my sick son I'm on the phone with heartless soulless robots. I am cancelling the card as soon as all the money is released. They are holding more funds but I dont really need to go into those because the process was the same. Eventually after numerous calls to Serve customer service in speaking to supervisors one simply told me they didn't care what I needed and what the manager said that with American Express was going to hold my money.

I love this card. I had some issues getting a bank account, and this card has been a lifesaver. All ATMs are free. My paycheck is direct deposited into my account. I can set up bill pay - just like online banking. The customer service is above and beyond ANY bank you will EVER deal with. There are never any hidden fees or overdraft nonsense. Just the customer service alone is worth it. And any charge you make on this card is protected by American Express, which means you can dispute unfair charges. I've been using this card since July, and I could not be happier.

This company is a joke good at first than after your established they turn on u they give u mis leading information and do nothing to correct anything when they lose a 4000 dollar check through direct deposit all they say is we will give that rep a coaching and counseling close the account and shred the card that's what I'm doing as I speak worthless prepaid card

I got my card because i wanted to have credit and also people family member's were recommending it. I think everything is good as it is and doesn't need any improvement. I would definitely recommend this card to others. American Express customer service is great. Everyone is friendly and very informative.
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content: I travel a bit and prefer to stay in Hilton wherever I go. I got this card due to the signup bonus at the time. It was actually better than that shown on your website. If you are like me and like those two things, then this is not a bad card to get. The silver status, and then gold, gets you perks when staying at Hilton hotels. I haven't needed to use their customer service; I imagine it would be just ok. As well, I pay off my bill monthly so the APR does not bother me.

I got the Serve card because I was having problems with my debit card being declined unexpectedly. I wanted to have a second card for to protect myself in those situations. The only thing I would improve would be to not have the monthly $1 fee. I would definitely recommend the card to others. It has a lot of valuable features, such as an app that lets you deposit checks. I haven't used the customer service yet, so I can't comment on that, but I did receive the card within the time frame I was told I would.

I got this card through my father's card as a secondary account cardholder. The card itself has been amazing to use. There are various perks to using it such as percentage cash back, various amounts of credit to online or in store purchases, airline and hotel perks and more. The thing I liked the most about the Amex card is when someone somehow used my card information on two online purchases, and I contacted them about it, they investigated immediately. The first charge of around $30 was reversed within the day. The second charge of over $400 was reversed after an investigation but it took a while longer. They did not contact me after the resolution about who did it, but they did contact me about how the charges were reversed. I think that I would have liked to know how and who stole my card info so I could prevent this in the future. Regardless, I would recommend the card wholeheartedly. The customer service was great and they stand behind their cardholders when something goes wrong.
department: Premier Rewards Gold Card from American Express

content: This was one of the first credit cards I started using regularly and I must say I didn't much care for it. The rewards system is based on points, instead of cash back, and you have to make a ton of purchases per billing period to be eligible for any of the special bonuses, otherwise you accrue points at a snail's pace. Points themselves can only be redeemed for specific things too like flights or hotels. The interest rate on this card is pretty high compared to many other cards available and the customer service at American Express is lacking to say the least. When I called with some questions about my statement once, it took me over 30 minutes to get the information I was looking for because I waited on hold and had to talk to three different people. I would not recommend this card.
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content: I got this card for the Delta Skymiles rewards. The only thing I would improve is the annual fee, with so much competition out their it would be nice to waive or lower the annual fee. I also would like to see more promotions in earning additional miles. I really like the layout of the website to view my account the alerts straight to my phone in case of suspicious activity. Customer service is fast, courteous and very detailed in any questions or requests that I ever had. I have recommended this card to my family in friends for the same reason I got it in the first place.

The main reason that I signed up for the amex plenti card is because of the bonus. I was really excited to get the special bonus. I still use the card from time to time. I wish more points were given per dollar spent. I enjoy the live chat feature that is on the amex website. They are always quick to respond whenever I have questions. Its much easier and faster than calling customer service. I can pay my bill online every month very easily. I would definitely recommend the amex plenti card to everyone. I am very happy with it.
department: The Plenti® Credit Card from Amex

content: I got the Blue Cash card about 3 years ago because I wanted a rewards card that was easy to use for everyday purchases. I decided on the blue card because of the 3% cash back on supermarkets and 2% on gas because those two categories are the ones I tend to spend the most on. I have found that the card is very easy to use, especially because there are no rotating categories and you know you are getting cash as a reward and not redeemable points. I really like that there is no annual fee and I think the APR is pretty standard for rewards cards. I have had no issues with customer service so far. I would definitely recommend this card to anybody looking for an easy to use cash back card.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: This card has been pretty great for me. I got it so that I could help build my credit by having a revolving credit source that I would use regularly. The reason I went for this card in particular was because I wanted something that gave good rewards. So far the only complaint I have is the interface on the website; I've heard from others that it's very intuitive and easy to follow, but I personally found it difficult to navigate and unintuitive. However, that may just be my opinion. I have had no interactions with customer service so I cannot comment on them, but I would recommend this card regardless.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: The American Express Green Card was actually the first credit card I was granted. My AMEX Green Card was issued to me in July of 1976, right after I signed my second enlistment in the Air Force. Back then American Express approved all career military personnel, with no negative credit, for a Green Card. I used it exclusively for travel and expenses that were being reimbursed to me by the government, and family emergency travel. In the 39 years I've had my Green Card, I also have a AMEX Gold Card, I can honestly say that I have never had any issues with American Express. Anytime that I called with a question or problem it was promptly addressed. When I was TDY and needed additional spending limit approved it was approved on the spot. When I needed travel assistance it was available, and remember this was before Smartphones and the Internet! I recommend the American Express Green card for anyone who needs a flexible spending limit and wants the ability to get real assistance for any card related issue (travel, purchases, product insurance, etc.), anytime you need it!

I got this because I am a big grocery shopper, and this card gives me 6% cashback reward. Gas cashback is also good at 3%, which is still amazing. Definitely a great card if you buy a lot at supermarkets and pump a lot of gas.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I signed up for this card to receive more miles for my airline tickets, because the point system was extremely rewarding. So far this card has netted me many extra miles and allowed me to upgrade numerous flights to a better business class. I would say this card has been more handy than many of the other credit cards I have received, and would certainly recommend it to others in my similar situation. The only down side to this card is the 160$ annual fee, which may be off putting for some, however with the extra points earned through its reward program it practically pays for itself.

This has been my go-to card for the vast majority of my purchases. This card makes you feel a certain level of prestige, owning a 'mid' tier American Express charge card. There's an annual fee, but it's not too bad for what you get as a result of membership. This card gives you access to AMEX Membership Rewards, points that can be cashed in for flights, hotels, gift cards, Amazon purchases, among countless other things. You also gain access to additional protection from AMEX, such as an extended return policy, purchase protection, extended warranty, among other perks. Overall, I love the card, I just wish the fee was a little lower than $195. Fantastic perks and rewards, fee could be lower.
department: Premier Rewards Gold Card from American Express

content: I got this card about a year ago around Christmas to keep track of my purchases and earn rewards. The rewards added up quick and I was able to quickly find things in my statement. I am now using this card for gas and groceries and the rewards do add up. I am pleased with this card and the rewards that offered. The only thing that would be made this card better would for it to be accepted everywhere. There are some places that do not accept it.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I got this card because my other American Express card was with Costco and there was a question about whether or not Costco would cut its ties with AMEX. I really liked having an AMEX card, so I went ahead and got this one. It has a nice low rate, and a pretty good cash-back rewards system. I get savings on things like groceries, gas, and travel. The one thing I would change is that it looks kind of cheap - the clear plastic just doesn't look 'classy' to me. But this isn't a big deal at all. I would highly recommend this card to anyone. American Express customer service is second to none. Whenever I have called, my issue was addressed very quickly by well-trained staff who were native English speakers.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: This was my first credit card after many years of not having one. I was very surprised I was approved because I thought Amex was one of the harder cards to get. I applied randomly when I got a pop up ad on the Delta site while booking a trip. I love that the interest rate was not too high for someone with average credit like myself. The best part of this card is the free checked bag and the priority boarding on Delta! Amex is a little stingy when it comes to credit line increases so I am disappointed with that as I was given a rather low credit line while other cards I have applied for since have given me much higher limits. I do think the $95 annual fee is on the high side but I have saved enough money with free checked bags to make it worthwhile. The initial 30,000 bonus points were awesome and I was able to book a hotel for a weekend in Miami and still have 10,000 leftover. All in all I am very happy with this card.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: This card always delivers. I got this card several years ago jointly with my boyfriend. This card is virtually accepted everywhere! I went out of the country to Domenican Republic with this card, and experienced no issues whatsoever! My account has no predetermined limit, but has tight security and alerts me if anything seems out of the ordinary for my spending. Customer service is amazing and very helpful with my questions or inquiries. I would definitely recommend this card to friends and family!

I love this credit card. I looked into this cards because of its excellent benefits and have been very, very happy with it. This card boasts the best cashback rate for groceries available - a whopping 6% back ON TOP of 3% for gas and 1% back for everything else. I would definitely recommend this card to anyone who steadily buys a lot of groceries...so basically anyone who shops and doesn't exclusively eat out. This card does have an annual fee of $75, and I would normally never go for a cc with an annual fee, but the grocery savings more than make up for it during the course of a year. The customer service is pretty good with Amex. They've been kind and courteous and even waived some fees for me in the past. Overall this card is an excellent choice is you've got good credit.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I've had this card for about 2 years now and have never had an issue. Love the fact that there are no hidden fees and no way to overdraft. My direct deposit has come in 2 days before all of my coworkers. My taxes came in 2 days before the IRS said it would. Maybe I've just been lucky, after reading some of these reviews. I use their ATM locator to find an ATM that doesn't charge fees & I've never paid a penny to withdraw money. (up to $750 a day) The only down sides would be that there is no cashback option and that some merchants don't accept Amex. I also am not familiar with their customer service, because I've never had to call with any issues.

One star for services I have waited two months and ongoing for my permanent card, only for customer service to continuously replace my card and force me to wait ten days. I have bills and other important priorities to handle. To top it off they charge a card fee from my taxes for a card i have yet to receive.

i took me forever to figure out how to talk to a human. the automated system is deaf to the the word representative even though it says its an option. when the system prompts for ur account number if u put the wrong number in 3 times it automatically bumps u to a rep. i have never spoken to a rep without a heavy foreign accent and have asked politely for that rep that doesnt exist. as for the card its self.... after using it for almost a yr only about half the stores i shop at actually take it due to higher cost for the shops. u would think if their rates r that high they could afford to higher better reps. in general....find a different card unless u like spending money on atm fee and want crappy customer service.

For all those giving low stars system is too hard for the brain inside the head that'd using it. Never had any issues with this card and it's way better then green dot no fees monthly. If you follow directions correctly first time setting up card you will never have issues and a second card can be given to child in collage and you can control how much is on card by transferring money and also keep track of it. So for all the negative responses on this page stick with cash and money orders seems to be best move if following card set up and directions is beyond your conception of understanding. Also have greendot and they are greedy little pigs been using them for years as well and the little fees add up were AMX don't charge for loading at Walmart or do they charge monthly Great card to keep money on.

Their card activation system is a joke.

First I tried calling. They said they'd send me an e-mail to verify that I was registered. They didn't.

Then I tried registering online. I gave them my social security number and all the information they needed. I tried again and again, but I couldn't get through. They kept saying my information didn't match. I couldn't logon, because they said my username and password didn't match, so I requested a new password. They gave me one. I still couldn't logon, so I requested a new username. To get that, I had to enter my information all over again. They kept saying there was something wrong with my information, but they wouldn't say what.

I went to "contact us." Their page showed only one phone number -- the same one you use to activate. The "contact us" page said they had people to talk to us 24 hours a day -- but there's no option on the phone menu to talk to someone. The only other option is to send them an old-fashioned letter, in the mail. You can't even E-MAIL them.

This is my OWN card -- and I can't activate it, I can't register with them, and I can't contact them. It's going right in the shredder.

Bluebird is by far the best prepaid card on the market. I will qualify that statement by saying I have had issues with them, mainly with the "transaction hold" which feels like a hostage negotiation, but otherwise I challenge folks to find a prepaid card with such low fees. My payroll deposits are always available in a timely fashion, or early, there are free ATMs available and not just at Wal-Mart, you can write checks, and I have started to use the bill paying feature which has been terrific so far. For people like me who can't open a standard checking account at the moment this card has been pretty good. If they could shorten the "hold" time on cancelled transactions I would probably never look to use a bank again.

this is b***s**t if you want someone that has your best interest in mind you are with the wrong institution the customer does not come first i only use prepaid so that i do not have to give out my card information to my bank account but they are obviously a mistake use chase prepaid or someone along those lines at least they take care of you

Everything was fine until I tried to withdraw from a ATM. The ATM charged me the fee and gave no money. Its been 2 weeks and serve had not refunded the money I am owed. I filed a dispute so far no action from them yet.

Amex serve declined my wire transfer from t Rowe price my retirement company however when you Google cards that accept wire transfers amex serve is the first card to pop up This has put me in a bad spot....

I (tried) to use the the mobile ap to deposit a check, which they say takes up to 6 days to apply the funds. I assumed it was to ensure the check cleared. What they don't tell you is that they use a vendor to evaluate whether or not to accept the check. They check I deposited was rejected and even after speaking to a vendor rep I have no idea why. The information is proprietary and they won't tell you why a check was not accepted. They do not provide guidelines of any sort, which means any check can be rejected for any reason. Their excuse is that it is an ap and we shouldn't expect every check to be accepted. The problem is that the Bluebird website and the ap do not give any indication that the check will be put through this arbitrary process. It is time for me to look for another card.

Let's start from the beginning. I have had the Amex Blue card for 2yrs with no issues. I saw the cash back card came out. I closed my Amex serve and got Cash back serve. I currently live in PA, on a trip to Disney for 6days midway through I receive an email saying my card is suspended. I didn't think this was a big deal because I was using my card in Florida. I get on with a Rep and they tell me my card is shut down. It is impossible for me to get any money. So I'm in Disney World with no money. I thought this was a joke. After hours and hours of fighting with them I have up. Also my direct deposit got rejected bc of the closed account. There was no warning, no phone call, no anything. They said my account was high risk. Mind you I make decent money and I'm about to get a real bank account. This card left me stranded in Fl and didn't help at all. They also hung up on me several times. I'll answer any questions. Please use a different card. Oh they will be sending my funds in the mail 5-7 business days.

I love this card. I just got my first statement and I was surprised to see I already got almost 30 dollars back in cash rewards mostly from the 6 percent back on grocery store purchases. I also already got my $150 dollar credit for spending $1,000 in the first three months. . Zero percent interest for the first 15 months is a great help too. That is allowing me to pay off my other credit cards faster that do have interest charges. Three percent back on gas and one percent on everything else plus all the other perks make this a great card all around. As others have warned, the grocery rebate does not include big box stores like Costco. For Costco I use another Amex card that has rewards specific to that store.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content:
**DON"T DO DIRECT DEPOSIT FOR FEDERAL TAX RETURN ON THIS!!!**


They tell you, you can get your federal tax return, but FAIL to state. The return needs to list you as primary, if you are the card holder. Meaning its doesnt matter if you file married filing jointly, with your spouse's SS# on the return first. They will still reject it..hold your money. The IRS than will not receive "official" notice of the rejection until 3 weeks later..and a paper check will be mailed to you from there..given a total, quoting the IRS..a total of 8 weeks from your givin refund date to receive a check. I am soo upset with bluebird this doesn't make sense. We called bb and offered to get it sent to my husband's bb acct...they said they only allow 1 attempt for tax returns to be deposited!!! SHAME!! Where is this on their fine print..or anywhere???

At first I had no problems with this card it did what I needed it to do! Then I had to go and enroll in direct deposit BIG MISTAKE! Direct deposit went trough and I'm still waiting for my money! Now I gotta call my job and get a tracing number so they can find it! WHAT THE F@$ K YOU MEAN! I'm so livid with customer service and her damn attitude and lack of understanding if I could jump through the phone and punch her in the throat it would've happened! Closing this damn account as soon as I get my money!

They only think I like is that they process their fraud claims quickly. What I dont like is that their customer service is NULE. They will let you down, wont help you in any ways. They took Western Union feature off and there is no other option unless you want to transfer your funds to an estrange person and trust he/she will give them to you. They gave me a really bad time. They had me on the phone for over 2 hours just to tell me there was no option. I got transfer more than ever....I compare them to any other prepaid service like NetSpend or one of those you buy at the gas station. DO NO USE

Filed in person with Jackson Hewitt on 2/6 irs accepted on 2/8.
