As someone who constantly watches. for the estimated DDD to post and even then will check bank account every day just in case the funds were sent early and i wasn't informed.So on 2/10 I received a DDD of 2/16 and you can only imagine my level of surprise when I refreshed my email today 2/11 around 5:30pm and I had an email from JH notifying me that my funds were deposited on to my AMEX Serve card. Very surprised but very thankful, bc I truly did not expect to receive it until the 16th. Also I am very pleased with Jackson Hewitt (minus the pricey fees paid to have someone prepare and file) and as long as my refund is not impossible to withdrawal from my Amex serve, then it has been a dream to use this tax season.

If I could give it NO Stars, I'd give it that! :(

I though I'd found a decent card; however, I found out today that they hijack your money for 7 DAYS so they can earn interest on it, I guess.

My story:

I had 4 orders from evine live that I cancelled.

When I placed the orders, my Bluebird funds (almost $300) were put "ON HOLD" on 02/08/11;

Evine contacted Bluebird on 02/09/16 the orders were cancelled & to release the funds to me;

On 02/11/16, my funds were still "ON HOLD";

I contacted Bluebird & was told their policy is to keep the funds "ON HOLD" for 7 days then on the 8th day to either send to merchant or release to member,

I told CS Supervisor my funds were for non-existent orders, so did NOT fall under their policy, she said they still will keep my funds ON HOLD for the 7 days DESPITE merchant telling them to release them to me!?!? :(

Need I say I'm no longer going to use this card once my funds are released?!?!
This is ridiculous I've been on the phone with costumer service for over an hour and still not satisfied. How long did it take everyone else to receive their card?
ridiculous card can not access my tax return due to transfers to my sub accounts not ever once withdrawing money

Screw green dot. Pay $5 for the card and have no fees at any Walmart. Reload is free, no paying stupid amounts at the end of the month for not using your card. NO FEES. Except a non Walmart ATM for withdrawls. Have had it for about a year and a half and had no problems. The people complaining did it to themselves. Either buying something on a shady website or blaming amex for taking money when your son or someone else close to you is in fault. I have always received a refund for a mistake purchase within a reasonable amount of time. If you wait a week to report it then you shouldn't own any type of card. Know what you have and know what you spend. A++ for Bluebird.

Do NOT use this card. For the second time in as many months I am sitting on the phone for hours with foreign based customer support most of whom barely speak English and constantly repeat themselves as if they are reading from a script. I have asked for a supervisor and get hung up multiple times after waiting 10 to 20 additional minutes. Once this latest issue is resolved I WILL NEVER put another dime on this card, you can't trust them. This most recent time I attempted to take $400.00 out of an ATM the bank denied it saying "$400.00 EXCEEDS CARD CASH WITHDRAWAL LIMIT" I thought this was strange (the daily cash withdrawal limit is $750 on the card, but apparently the ATM had a $400 limit). I immediately tried again for $300.00, this time it went through with no problem. Although the ATM never dispersed the money, the $400.00 was deducted from my balance. I immediately called AE and was told that it would take up to 10 days to even start the dispute process and it could take up to 45 days for it to be completely resolved. I've NEVER had any kind of issue like this with any other bank or card. I'm moving this weekend for a new job in a new city and that money is needed, NOW! The last time was an issue with Macy's pre-authorizing the card twice right at Christmas time for $150.00, Macy's bent over backwards trying to resolve the issue with Amex Serve yet to no avail it took a full 10 days for the money to be released from the erroneous hold, even though Macy's released it immediately. This card is trash and holding onto individuals money impacts their lives. I'll be contacting the BBB and banking authorities regarding them.

Used this card to get our taxes deposited. Went to one of the atms to get money out and didn't spit the money out but it still charged us the amount that we typed in. So now they are making us go through this long process to get our money back. And saying there's a chance we won't even get it back. I will never in a million years use this card again I am shredding it the very minute I withdraw the rest.
How can you take a big sum of money off the card

This card is awful, Stay away from American Express, There customer service is all outsourced to India. They have attitudes when you speak with them. basically I did a balance transfer online, they duplicated it and wouldn't fix. So they stole money form me. I called 4 times in one week and got different answers from everyone I spoke with. They are terrible stay away
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: 2 days early refunds for direct deposit is a lie. Bull Shit

I have to give one star... They didn't even earn that. I signed up for this card in July 2015 and made $1,000 purchase. However, they didn't give me the 30,0000 points. They had to open one investigation after another investigation because they said I was supposed to spend $2,000 instead of $1,000. They did give me the $50 credit on the first statement though. Their customer service was terrible.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content:
Beware!!! Absolutely atrocious customer service. I applied for and received my card in October of 2015. I specifically chose this card for the travel benefits and sign up bonus miles. Upon my first flight, on January 6th, I did not receive the priority boarding benefit. Upon further investigation, I also discovered that not a single mile had been added to my sky miles account. The obvious answer was to call customer service and have them rectify the oversight. After more than a month, hours and hours of my time, dozens of customer service reps, and nearly a dozen supervisors, I have yet to receive a single mile! In fact, when I finally spoke to someone who expressed a genuine concern, my relief was short lived. Charlotte, at extension 57169, assured me that she would have it all resolved in a matter of two or three days at the latest and that if I had any additional questions or concerns, I should feel free to call her directly. When I inquired as to which number I should use, she stated to use the number on the back of the card. Unfortunately, upon calling the number, I would continue to be disappointed after I was told by the operator that they had no way of transferring to extension numbers. This begs the question of why give it to me in the first place if this is the case??? This conversation took place nearly three weeks ago and still, not a single mile credited to my Skymiles account, nor reflected in my American Express account. The latest update in this case, is being told by another "supervisor" that it may take up to 6-8 weeks before they rectify the account. Keep in mind that Charlotte stated it would be 2-3 days. When I asked to speak to his supervisor, he stated that he did not have one and that there was no one I could speak to above him.


So, where does this leave me? Firstly, I seriously doubt that the account will ever be corrected, even if given 6-8 months! In addition, nobody has given me an explanation as to why they have the account in error in the first place. I'm sorry, but I just can not fathom how a major corporation even begins to stay in business by treating their customers in such a manner. In addition, I have been promised returned phone calls on three occasions. it should be no surprise that, for more than a month, I have received not a single email, nor a single promised returned call. At this point, I will be canceling my useless card, AND shorting American Express stock, as such incompetent management will surely lead to the demise of what was once a reputable company. Do not waste your time!!!
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I do not get my money 2 days early like i was told its some false advertisement

I see a lot of people complainging about fees and gas holds. May I just say, you are going to get this with EVERY debit card. Unlike other prepaid debit cards however, you don't pay monthly fees. Another thing, if you don't know by now not to use a debit card at the pump you need to cut up every card you own and just stick with cash. You ALWAYS pay inside with a debit card/prepaid card. As far as your tax refund, that is not Amex fault the government didn't push yours through fast enough. As soon as the funds are posted, they recieve them. I get my pay checks a full day earlier thanks to this card because as soon as payroll posts it, the funds are put into my account. This is an amazing card as far as prepaid cards are concerned.

I wanted to use a prepaid card to keep myself on a budget. My largest expense is food, so I was going to load it with a preset amount of cash so I'd stick to the budget. Well, American Express would not let me add from my bank account to the card without "verifying an alert" they had on my bank account. The first customer service rep hung up on me after I had waded through their automated system for 15 minutes. I wrote it off to a mistake, then called again. I finally told them I would just add cash, that I wouldn't tie it to my bank account and they said I couldn't do that either. I was so frustrated. I was getting a customer service rep with " witty " canned scripted answers and it was very unsatisfactory. To top it all off, I get an email that night saying that I had "broken the terms of my agreement" with them so my card was suspended. Not the customer service experience I had hoped for. I will never go with American Express, and I will tell this story to anyone who will listen to me. I just wanted to to have a conversation to figure out what to do, but I guess they are more interested in monologues than dialogues with their customers.
bluebird is the worst card you can get they will lie about fees and direct deposts they claim you will get your taxes faster but you will not

BE WARNED WITH THIS CARD if you like or need to use cash, ever, this is not the card for you. You CANNOT get cash back with this card. Period. Not $20 back at the grocery store, nothing. And if you like the added security of needing a pin for your debit card that's another feature this card doesn't have, it only asks for your pin if you're using it at an ATM($2.50 per transaction+whatever the ATM charges, usually another $3-4). Everything else goes through as instant approval like credit, only without credit's extra security of a signature. If you like paying $6 to get at your own money and the security that comes with knowing any Joe shmoe can swipe your card no questions asked than this might just be the card for you! Also about half the times I try using online features you can't log in due to "technical difficulties", some transactions take a LONG time to show up unlike most debit cards where it shows up instantaneously, and there are NO automatic text alerts (which I think is by far the most useful tool to track spending). I would highly recommend the prepaid vision card, that's definitely the best one out there, or the netspend card over this one. Vision comes with easy bill pay, text alerts, roadside assistance, 3% cash back at gas stations, and savings account with 5.65% apy. Close runner up is the netspend card. Also has a savings account and text alerts. If you're a saver this one is great, it pays 5% apy up to your first $5,000. I'd recommend just about any card over the one debit card that won't give you cash back, but those two are the best on the market in my experience. Also, I've noticed no matter how many awful reviews this card has so many websites are still saying it's "great!" Yeah, right. Amex sure has their marketing budget on point! If the card was half as good as they say they wouldn't need to pay websites to get the word out, people would just recommend it. Which I would not. To anyone.
Barely any fees! Way better then any other debit card company. Ex. Green Dot. I Love My card. It works for online use. Never had any problems.

This card isn't what it is touted to be!! Beware!! I spent $1700 last month and only got a few points. I spent $182 at Fred Meyer (grocery store) and it even says grocery store on my statement and only got credit for $60.00. I spent $94 on gas and only got credit for $56. I will be cancelling this card next month!!! No wonder American Express stock is in the toilet!!! Liars!!! Check your statements people!!!
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I love it! I will tell others how great it is!

I have had the serve card for a year. I get my direct deposit every month sometimes they give it to me 4 days early. I love this card and have never had a severe problem. When I had a minor problem they always fixed and even gave me a satisfaction credit of 10.00. This card rocks.
This card sucks! I mean really

I signed up for my card in January but didn't receive my card until April. I began using the card right away, but AmEx refused to give my 30,000 bonus points because they said they had mailed it in February (which I didn't receive).
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I wanted to; do something different and purchase a Bluebird for now... I have seen not, so good outlook's from customer's but; I'll stay Low using my Bluebird (Only) travel purpose's... P.S. AE was an all time Favorite for TRAVEL when; I was growing up in the 80's early 90's...

This card is a joke. I made a cash deposit 7 days ago and they lost my money. I've called 7 days in a row and customer service keeps telling me that a copy of my receipt has been sent over to their dispute team. I wonder if there's really even a dispute "team" or just some guys sitting on the beach in the Philippines spending my hard earned money. This has been one of the worse experiences I've ever had with a prepaid card service. I guess I should've trusted my gut and stuck with Google wallet. If you're living paycheck to paycheck like most of the free world please BEWARE!!! American slow serve will leave you feeling helpless in the corner without electricity. Do yourself a favor and signup for Google Wallet or Simple banking.. at least you get real results when you call customer service not just talk and emails that don't get read.

This card always delivers. I got this card several years ago jointly with my boyfriend. This card is virtually accepted everywhere! I went out of the country to Domenican Republic with this card, and experienced no issues whatsoever! My account has no predetermined limit, but has tight security and alerts me if anything seems out of the ordinary for my spending. Customer service is amazing and very helpful with my questions or inquiries. I would definitely recommend this card to friends and family!

I have had my Bluebird American Express card for almost a year now and had no issues until last Wednesday 1/20/2016 when I had unauthorized transactions on my card, I had called and filed fraudulent on the charges, they finally got back to me today on 1/26/2016 by email saying that they investigated it and they see that the transactions were authorized and they cant get the money back. NOT OK!! no one knows my pin but me, and i never made those transactions. it was a total of 168 dollars that i lost. Now i after receiving that email I had received a balance email saying that my balance in my account is 0.00 dollars which is really odd considering i had almost 1000 on my card the night before. I called the customer support number and the 1st agent was nice and then he hung up on me. I called in a second time and the agent was very nice, she stated that 2 check withdrawals equaling out to my total was removed from my account, not sure how that was possible when they had disabled my card and I couldn't use it. The second agent had transferred me to another specialist agent and that agent had told me that they had sent me 2 checks with my money on it. I don't understand why they just couldn't send me a new card. After experiencing the worst customer service today I will no longer be using bluebird american express for anything. I originally got it to use my Walmart savings catcher money but now i think i will do something else. WORST WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE!!


**NOTE** BE CAREFUL WITH YOUR CARD. THE MOMENT YOU SUBMIT FRAUDULENT CLAIMS ON YOUR CARD, AMEX BLUEBIRD WILL DISABLE YOUR CARD AND WONT SEND YOU A NEW ONE THEY WILL ONLY SEND YOUR MONEY BY CHECKS. SO I HOPE YOU DON'T WANT TO BE THEIR CUSTOMER AFTER THAT.


BLUEBIRD AMERICAN EXPRESS DOES NOT CARE ABOUT THEIR CUSTOMERS. AFTER TODAY I WILL FILE A LAWSUIT AGAINST THEM. THIS IS B.S.

Horrible. Had the card about 3 or 4 months. Out of the blue I received a letter saying that all privileges to load funds had been suspended due to "unusual activity".... WTF? Phone calls to customer support was worse that worthless. All they did was tell me I had to send a snail mail letter to the address in the letter, so I did so, specifically asking if they had detected a suspected breach/fraud regarding my card. In about 3 weeks I received what was clearly a standard form letter that addressed absolutely nothing. The only thing of substance was a statement which cited the section of the cardholder agreement which provided them the right to suspend the card..... duh.


The tone of the letter was condescending at best, if not outright arrogant. The last paragraph stated "... although this may not be the response which you were hoping for we trust this letter has answered your questions and addressed your concerns." Seriously? Any "trust" I ever had in this company has permanently disappeared forever.

I received an American Express Serve prepaid debit card. Not too long after, a fraudulent charge of 400.00 was withdrawn from my account from a ATM in New Jersey. However I reside in California. After speaking to various customer service representatives, supervisors, managers and so forth my claim was denied. They will not give a feasible reason as to why. I asked them how could this happen and they are well aware that I have no access to an ATM in New Jersey. Moreover, all of my transactions were made in Los Angeles, Ca. This transaction does not add up and they refused to credit the funds to may account. Furthermore, they have blocked my account in which I have my direct deposit linked to this card. The representatives are poorly trained and whenever I speak to them they are either fully unaware of what is happening with my account or some information is missing. Not only is this an inconvenience but it has also caused financial hardship. I am unable to pay any of my bills and the situation occurred a week before Christmas. I wouldn't recommend this card to anyone.

Sitting here reading these comments on the dislike of their af makes me question if many card holders actually understand the purpose of this card. The price of their af equates to perks that are offer for this particular card. If you think the fee is too high, then it's not for you. Amex has a great product line that reflects individuals' finances. This platinum card is not the only or last card ever made. Part of being accepted by this company means that you have made good or demonstrate good spending habits or good financial decisions. Don't get caught up in the perks or status of a card. Continue to make smart financial decisions and teach others how to make good decisions. Especially if you have kids. Choose cards that enhance your financial portfolio and allow you to elevate your financial situation.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: My Blue Cash card is so easy to use. I am very comfortable with how the card works and the simplicity of it's features. I have received great customer service for the past 5 years and I have experienced minimal problems when using this card. I really like how I am able to save money and actually get money from the card. Hands up!!! this is one of the best cards that I have owned!
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I canceled a transaction of $350 from a merchant .. The merchant released my money back to my serve card The same day and now american express serve is telling me That I have to wait 8 to 15 days when I was told initially 24 to 48 hours that It would be returned... They lied to me withheld my money .. Very rude experience I would not suggest or recommend this card to anyone ...

I got it because they had a limited promotion where they would DOUBLE your Walmart SavingsCatcher money. But, I have continued to use it. There are no fees except ATM charges. But, fees are waived with a compatible ATM. It's simple and easy to use the card, from adding funds to making purchases - online or in-store. It's an American Express and not all businesses will accept AE. But, that's not an issue for me, I give it 5 stars in the world of Prepaid!

A friend had recommended this prepaid card to me. I was very happy with it. There were no monthly fees which is a big plus to me. I had to call customer service twice, just to find out some information, and the reps. are very knowledgeable and friendly. I also like that it is simple to check out your account information online. I think it is one of the best prepaid cards out there.

One of my favorite cards in my wallet, credit application process went really smooth had my card in my wallet in a little less than two weeks. I really love american express and the 0 percent apr for 15 months is what turned me onto this card. This card has really made a difference on my credit score being that I'm using it alot due to the 0 apr. On my end this card has been a perfect card for me.
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content: Horrible experience. I was so embarrassed, when a retailer voided a purchase, and due to American Express serves policy it froze the funds for 8 days. I spend to much money with this service just to be left hanging. I'm really disappointed.

I really like using this card. I originally got it due to the Savingscatcher program at Walmart, but I find that the ease of reloading and the good customer service make it the best prepaid card to use. I also like that it is very easy to check the balance and transactions online, and that you can load it easily with more money at Walmart.

I love this card. Igot it because I needed a card to purchase items off of Amazon. The application process was easy. I just applied on the internet and i received my card in a week. Soon after i put money on the card and it's free to do. No monthly fees or nothing. One bad thing is it isn't accepted everywhere. i wanted to pay my gas bill but American express wasn't an option. Other than that, i love this card.

Nice and simple information, I have one of American Express prepaid been 4 years, Now my credit improves. I still hold this card for emergency case. just fee 1.00 dollars every month. My wife got disapprove major credit card. she gets American Express prepaid need order shop online protect from her private. American Express online very simple app. The app is more security and safe.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I have been an American Express customer since year 2000. Last year while taking an extended trip overseas, I decided to get a prepaid card to use during my travels. Being a dedicated AmEx customer, I inquired about prepaid services and ended up getting the American Express Serve card. I only use this card while traveling which gives me a better protection compared to regular credit cards. Payments are posted rather quickly and I would recommend this card to anyone looking for a prepaid solution.

The good thing I found is free activation and fast process of documents. I like cashback cards which is effective to me. The process got completed than the time of my estimation. The approvals is also very fast. I booked it through online and got the call within hours for confirmation.

When I was looking for a prepaid card, this one jumped out at me. I had spoken with others who used it and were pleased. The application was simple and the card is easy to use. I have never had any trouble using it to pay for items online or in stores. I highly recommend this card for those looking for a prepaid card. Customer service is wonderful if you experience any trouble as well.

American express serve is one of my favorite cards because it offers a flat fee and no other fees. I love the flexibility I get with the card. I love the fact I used in Portugal without any issues and American express alerted me to fraud charges with the use of my card. I felt so secured with my card. I can even have my direct deposit go in to make my life better. I loved the customer service I got when I had lost my card. They replaced it and rush a new card and I got in 3 days.

This is a great card because unlike most prepaid cards, the monthly fee is nominal ($1). That is very tough to beat! The card offers everything from ATM withdraws to being able to be used just about everywhere. If you are starting out and trying to build up some credit history, this card needs to be one of the first you own. It is a cheap way to get immersed in the "Credit card game."

BEWARE!!!! The American Express Serve Card is a RIPOFF! There have been several occasions where I have used my Serve Card, only to have American Express refuse to release a hold on my funds that were due back to me, for FIFTEEN DAYS, long after the merchant had released the hold.

1) I was travelling out of state and I used my Serve Card at the gas pump to purchase $25 of gas. The next day I contacted AMEX to inform them that a $100 hold had been placed on my card for the $25 gas purchased. AMEX instructed me to contact the merchant and request they release the $100 hold. The merchant informed me that the $100 hold had been released. When I shared with AMEX that the merchant had released the hold, AMEX then told me, they have a FIFTEEN DAY HOLD POLICY and while the merchant had released MY funds back to my card, AMEX refused to return my funds to me for FIFTEEN DAYS!

2) I had a similar experience while using my Serve Card at a major hotel chain. Used my Serve Card to pay for hotel stay, after checking out I notice a deposit hold on my SERVE Card. Once again I contacted the hotel about the hold and I was informed that the hold had been released by the hotel, and AGAIN, AMEX refused to release the hold for FIFTEEN DAYS!

3) I used my SERVE CARD while renting a car from a major national brand. Upon walking to my rental vehicle I noticed the rental car company had made a mistake and charged me a higher rate for my rental. The rental car company promptly voided that transaction and corrected the error. However, AMEX refused to release the incorrect amount for FIFTEEN DAYS. I ended up paying for two rentals and not having my $250 returned to me for FIFTEEN DAYS! I'm done, I cut my SERVE CARD in half. No other debit cards or credit cards place FIFTEEN DAY HOLDS on your funds. BEWARE!!!!

This card has been one of the most reliable and consistent cards that I have ever owned. I am excellent at paying my bills on time, but the safety net of having a low APR is really nice in case something comes up. The rewards program is great too. It's simple; points = products. If you are attracted to low interest rates (especially during an introductory period) and do not mind sacrificing some rewards perks, than this is the card for you!
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content:
When I first went to my bank looking for a prepaid card, I was just a student. I wanted something that I could feel secure with when I traveled abroad, in case of emergencies. The associate at my bank recommended I get this car, because of the different types of benefits associated with it when buying from certain places. She also told me that it had a good chance of being universally accepted in the countries that I planned on visiting.


In the end, I am really satisfied with my decision. I especially love the online banking interface, and how easy it is to check how my finances are doing. The only thing I wish that they would improve, is that it takes a bit too long for my purchases to log themselves on my online account. It makes planning for finances more of a hassle for me.

I initially got the Bluebird Prepaid card for a promotion with Walmart's Savings Catcher. If I redeemed my Walmart Bucks to Bluebird, I got double the money. But after the promotion was over, I found myself loving this card. There is no fee to reload the card and I can reload the card with a machine at Walmart. That was very easy. The card is pretty convenient, when I have money loaded on it, I can use it a lot of places, but I did run into at least one store that didn't take American Express so that was inconvenient. It was very easy to apply online for the card and I got it within two weeks or so. I love that it has the option for you to set up sub accounts. You can set up a savings account and move money from the main account to it and you have to transfer it back to the main account to spend it so that can potentially help you save money better. You can set up subaccounts for other family members as well. Customer service was pretty friendly and helpful but it was a little frustrating when I called because I had made a purchase online and something happened so that it didn't go through (computer error or something) and the money was transferred but it didn't go through on the retailer's side and it took several days for it to get transferred back over to Bluebird. Finally, I use Bluebird to get paid for online crowdsourcing work and I get the money pretty quickly, at least by the next day.

Years ago, I got myself into debt and hurt my credit score. I had to get back on my feet with a prepaid credit card. If you go this route, I recommend American Express because they’re reputable. I had to make a deposit which was the amount of money I had to spend on the card, i.e if you put down $500, you have $500 to spend (unless there’s an additional security fee). I was sure that I did not overspend on the card so that I could build my credit again and not be stuck with unsecured cards.

I did not have any problem with this card, or with the customer service, and I'm kind of surprised to see this many poor reviews. I think this card does what it says it is going to do. Fees are waived if you do direct deposit and so it's basically free to use, what more can you ask? Customer service has been on point with me, when I had to call, which was very rare. Usually I pop online to check the balance and it's pretty easy breezy cool. This is a much better option than some checking accounts out there, for sure. A good card with a great company. I recommend.

I've been using the AmEx Bluebird Prepaid Card for about a year. I got it primarily to use for transferring some money I make from working online, but since getting it, I find that I use it for so much more! Transferring money via my Bluebird is so fast and easy. Transfers go through within minutes. My deposits are handled smoothly and quickly. I use their app to find compatible ATMs, so there's no fee for withdrawals, but on the few occasions that I've not been able to locate one, the fee is comparable to my regular bank account.

The Blue Cash card from American Express is my good to card when I want to get rewards. You can not beat the cash back rewards and also the extended terms for no interest. This has been a life saver in helping me get certain other things paid off while avoiding any extra interest having to be paid.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: This card totally sucks. Rushcard was able to get me my direct deposit by 2pm est every other Wednesday for over 8 years...I have to wait till after midnight with this card. And the customer service is horrible!!!!!!!. I work for the biggest Corporate Giant in this World and we rock chat and calls...American express is the absolute worst...changing my direct deposit today! Yuck!!!

I use the Bluebird Prepaid Card to transfer some of my money that I make online. I love this card, and it's ease of use. This is not a debit card, so I don't use it for my purchases. Whenever I want to make an ATM withdrawal, Bluebird makes my transactions go smoothly each and every time. The ATM fee is relatively low compared to other prepaid cards that I've used in the past. Overall, I feel that Bluebird is a perfect card for those with or without a bank account. This card would also be ideal for college students! Parents can easily load the card with money every month for their kids away at college, and it gives them an opportunity to learn about budgeting their money.

I've had no issues whatsoever with AmEx Bluebird. It's actually a rather nifty little card to keep in your wallet even if you have a traditional bank account. My work direct deposit hits my account two days sooner than a traditional bank, and if you use US Bank for your withdrawals, it's free!


These negative reviews are from inbred, Walmart-shopping hicks that have hot knifed too much dope. They can't even spell, ferchrissake. Bluebird isn't a debit card and shouldn't be used like one. Don't use it at the gas station, don't use it at hotels and don't assume all merchants accept AmEx. Instead, hit the ATM on your way out and avoid the embarrassment. They keep whining and moaning about how crappy it is. AmEx ain't stupid. They'll catch onto your scheming ways quick so don't try it. Use the card as you're instructed in the welcome packet and it'll but nothing but a breeze.

I have used this credit card for a few years and I love it. I love being able to use the points to get cash back. The points accrue rather quickly. I am often able to use the points for a statement credit towards my next bill. You can also use the points towards products. They also provide great customer service. The only thing I don't like it that not all merchants accept American Express.

Of course, this isn't American Express fault. Great card though!
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I have had this Serve card now about 1 year. They have waived all monthly fees and now only require 1 inbound electronic transfer to avoid any fees monthly. Can withdraw with no ATM fee at most Sheetz and Walmarts. Still are some stores that do not take - like Aldi - even though it is a debit card. Inbound transfers always post within 1 day. I am a big Fan

This card is pretty good. They gave me points when I first signed up which you can use on their reward site. It roughly transfers as 100 pts / $1. There is an annual fee, but I have made it back in rewards. There are other benefits as well like automatic rental car insurance, which are very useful.
department: Premier Rewards Gold Card from American Express

content: I absolutely love this card I do not leave home without it. This is my go to card for getting, I travel alot so spending on this card really gives me alot of points toward traveling and getting free things via that way. I love how low this apr is as well for my credit. This is by far one of my top 3 cards in my wallet that I use on a day to day basis.
department: Premier Rewards Gold Card from American Express

content: What I really like about this card is the reward program that comes along with it. Upon applying (which was very easy by the way) I was given 50,000 reward points. This is the equivalent of about $50. Now keep in mind I was required to spend some to get that much, but if you are applying for a card to get a large purchase, you cannot find a much bigger reward in another card. I was able to purchase a video game for my son with the reward points.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I would give a 0 or negative star rating if I could. The Companion Fares are very restricted, almost impossible to use. AVOID
department: Delta SkyMiles® Platinum American Express Card

content: I would give this a zero if possible. Bought an American Express Serve card at OfficeMax where it was marketed with all of the other Reloadable General Use Cards and Gift Cards. Getting back home, I notice that the that card cannot be effectively used without registering it at their website. Ok, fine. PITA, but get it done. Go to the website but our firewall and spyware checker blocks the site. That seemed odd, AmEx is supposed to be a reputable company. Do some checking. Yes, the Serve.com does put spyware on your computer from marinsm.com. Not good, call the 800 number on the card to register via phone hoping to avoid the spyware. They say the only way to register the card is through the website ( yes, the one with the spyware). Grumble. Ok, visit a library to use a public computer (the library wipes away all of the bad stuff after every use). Go to register the card only to find out you MUST give them ALL of your personal information including uploading a scan of your personal ID with PHOTO. Umm, NO! All I wanted was a reloadable card for Christmas so the SO doesn't see how much and where I spent on her. Thought I would try the AmEx card just to try their service. One really bad experience. Not sure how I get my money back now. I don't want to use the card afraid that even using it to get the money off the card will obligate me to some term or condition that I don't know about.

I love this credit card the benefits have come in handy more than once. First time I dropped my brand new camera in the water while on vacation. Once I got home I took it to a repair shop which said it was too much to fix so Amex refunded the entire amount of the camera and I was able to buy a new one. Second time my apple laptop stopped working and it was after warranty but Amex extends your warranty so they paid for the repairs. I always make sure to put any big purchases on my Amex.

This is a great everyday credit card. I always use this card to buy groceries because of the 3% cashback. I also always use this card to buy gas as it offers 2% cashback at the pump. American Express is always offering great offers as well. Considering this card also has no annual fee, it is a great card! I highly recommend it.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: Poor customer service and rude team

i have enjoyed this card for the last 8 year. this card offers a lot of flexibility. Earn 1% on everything you purchase. You can use it for cash back on statements, airline miles, or use it to get merchandise. Best feature of card is occasional discounts, like 10$ back if you use it to pay cell phone bill.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content:
Unlike a lot of reviewers here, I have had no trouble at all with my Bluebird Card.

I have moved money to and from other cards with no problems, and the transfers are done in seconds.

There is even a review button to make sure how much you are doing and what the total will be when you are done.

That comes in handy when you are no good with numbers.

It is limited to where you can use it.

But if you withdraw money from an in house ATM, there are no fees.

And most Walmarts have one.

First of all I found this card very interesting because I travel a lot more than the average person, so it really helps me out. The people in charge of the other line are always helpful, kind and so nice to me. Besides the bonus I recieved thanks to being a responsible card user. I love it
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I have to say this is the best pre paid card I have had. I just wish more places would accept Amex, like for bill paying. That's the only down side to having this card. The upside is, there are little too no fees, and my direct deposit is always in on Wednesday nights, 2 days earlier than most banks. My coworkers hate me. Lol. I would definitely recommend.

This credit card is great because of the sign up bonus ($100 back for spending $1000 in the first three months) and because of the rewards. I use my credit card often. I love the security that I get with this card as well. I traveled to Seattle this past summer and was notified that my card had been used in the airport. Some people find it a creepy or a pain that someone is keeping tabs on you, but I love the security. The more the better! Check out this card!
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: THe best thing about this card, like every AMEX card, is that the user has access to all the AMEX sync deals through twitter. This alone makes the card superior to other credit card companies. Beyond this, customer service is great. It is always a pleasure to deal with AMEX. Any issues are quickly and professionally resolved.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content:
I think it handles challenges made to purchases in an honest manner and do not have ann innate favoritism for the retailer. I use my card for everything because

I am tired of having to empty a pocketful of change each day
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I have had this card for over a year and have had no issues whatsoever. Whenever I have had to call AMEX, they have been very helpful, and they gave me an automatic $2,000 CLI due to me being a responsible card user. I'd definitely recommend it.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I am in the process of rebuilding my credit and was excited to receive a pre-approval to apply for the American Express Green Card. The Green Card frankly isn't a great card, but it does get you in the door with Amex. You get 1 bonus point for each dollar of spend which roughly translates to 1% back but it depends on how you redeem it. The annual fee of $39 is expensive for a card without great benefits but hopefully after responsible use you will be able to get one of the better cards offered by Amex.

Really love this card I Love American Express I have a few different cards but I love the perks of this card being that you get certain points back and what not, you can't beat getting things back for spending. Another thing I love is this credit card offers really low apr financing which is good for the consumer. Never had a problem with this card and I never leave home without it.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: the customer service is awful. card had fraud and went over limit, they closed my account with no calls, emails or letters. now won't let me pay off the negative balance and won't let me get a new card all because there was fraud that they didn't fix. terrible.

Be careful with this card. I had a Serve account for about 3 years. On Thursday, 11/12 I received 2 emails from Amex Serve telling me that my account had been locked due to possible fraud. I called as soon as I saw the emails, about 7:00pm. Since then I have called 10 times…a combination of customer service and fraud protection. I cannot speak to a supervisor. A supervisor was supposed to call within 48 hours. To date (Sunday night, 11/15) no one has called. No one can tell me why it was closed. I have no idea if someone used my card fraudulently. I can’t access my account. I have no idea if or when I am getting my money back (there was about $900 on the card). I have tweeted. I have called the executive offices. No one is willing to help.

I like that there is a $100 bonus for $1000 charged to the Blue Cash Everyday Card from American Express in the first three months. I'm not excited about the 3% rewards for spending at grocery stores since I prefer to use cash at the grocery, and the gas station I use does not accept American Express cards of any type. I also do not like the idea that the rewards are only available as statement credits. I definitely prefer rewards that can be used for gift cards for merchants.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: The idea of having a card with such great benefits is what drove me to apply. I have a FICO score of 770 , annual income close to 170k . I was approved for only $3,000. I was not happy with that considering that I spend about 5k a month in expenses then pay my balance off. I simply asked for an increase to $5,000. To my shock I was denied. I explained to the rep why I wanted the increase and I had no need for the card unless my request was met and he simply said OK we can cancel your card. I have been with DISCOVER for 2 years now and have been so pleased with Discover. They are top notch. I am sorry Discover for trying to cheat on you . I will stay with them. I recommend that you apply with Discover the interest rate is lower and the customer service is OUTSTANDING! To bad AMEX you lost what was going to be a great customer. By the way I have a 14,000 credit limit with Discover and an interest rate of 11.99% which AMEX couldn't even come close . Plus Cash rewards are applied every month you don't have to wait for them.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: This card is the worst card ever!!!! They closed my account on the 20th of October because I had a dispute I had $1200 in my secondary account. They said they will mail me a check in 10 days from the 20th. It's now been 15 days and I have yet to hear that they mailed my check out!!! Don't ever get this card. Customer service is the worst. Will be filing a lawsuit soon

If i could give zero stars i would. I had a bluebird card associated with my SSN and such. I called today to request a new card because i lost mine. They told me they had NO RECORD of me. I remember purchasing my card at Walmart and loading money on it. They entered my SSN, birth date, and such and they said im not associated with them. The worst part about it is i had money on it. I NEVER AUTHORIZED THEM TO DELETE MY ACCOUNT. Do not get this card. I will be talking to attorney since they violated their rules.

This card appears to be very convenient and easy to use, particularly in the context of every day American life where one maybe too busy to stress over the fees that come with it. The only fee that one would have to consider before using this card is the $3 ATM transaction fee, which stays at a consistent price.

I've been using this card for years. I like it. I get my paycheck at 9 pm wed night which helps me out a lot. Also when I call customer service they always answer my questions and are able to solve my problem. I have a regular bank account which everyone should have because you cant use a prepaid debit card for everything. but bank of america only offers to get my check on Thursdays and then its so easy to over draw using it so I just don't use it much. I like serve and I recommend it to others.

Love every aspect of this card and the quality of service thats come behind it. I use this card like another checking account. If im in a drag and there are no in-network atm in my area i would head over to my nearest grocery store make a small purchase and get the money i need as cash back. This card does everything i'd expect it to.

The only positive is that you can deposit cash at walmart and there are no fees unlike regular banks. If you want to deposit checks though, look elsewhere. I tried to deposit check #2, after the first check was deposited no problem but it took forever for them to clear it. Check #2, which was deposited after the first one cleared, was instantly rejected with no reasons given. I also have Ally bank and all of my checks were cleared the second day. Checks were deposited via respective mobile apps.


The only reason why I'm keeping my bluebird account open is for cash deposits. I don't have a regular brick and mortar bank account anymore so until I find an online bank that has easy cash deposits, which i don't do very often, I guess I'll keep the it open until then. But if you can, avoid Bluebird garbage like the plague.

O% cards like this are a big help. I know it doesn't last forever but 15 months is a pretty big window for not paying interest. I have this exact AMEX card and I'm still in the middle of the 15-month 0% window. It gives me plenty of time to pay off the entire balance without worrying about annoying interest payments. Also, the additional features of this card definitely make it an even better choice for card users out there.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: There is a lot to like about the American Express Blue Card. The first thing that caught my eye was the use of smart chip technology. The embedded smart chip will give consumers enhanced security. In this age of increased identity theft threats, the smart chip gives users an extra layer of protection. I also like the no annual fee feature and reasonable rates.
Put my phone bill payment on hold, money was there to cover amount, this is bs, crap card sorry I ever tried it

Personally, this card is not very attractive to me at all. I understand it's not a credit card but I'd rather have something like a Chase Freedom card or any of the other credit cards that don't charge interest for a year instead of a charge card. I think the annual fee is excessive. No fee is always better. I don't travel or have little opportunity to use rewards points so it's pointless. Considering it's a charge card that you must pay at the end of every month, it may be easy to get into trouble and have to pay a late fee. That would be very worrying in my situation, I'd rather have the safety net of a credit card and have to only pay the minimum.

Would be 5 stars if not for the poor customer support. They try but when explaining to them that gas stations charge an initial fee before fueling to make sure you can cover the cost they don't get it and assume that you have had your card comprised. Had to call a few times to explain that my card was not stolen.

This card was great until I actually wanted to add funds from my bank account. I followed their rules. The account was in my name, it was under the monthly limit, and it was even the first account I tried to link.


I was then locked out of adding any funds at all. I got an email that asked me to upload photo is and a bank statement. I did so and received a new email that said I needed to call them because my documents were not adequate.


I called them up and had to speak to someone with a very thick accent. It was difficult to understand and very quiet. Every other sentence was along the lines of "I know it must be frustrating". Keep in mind that though I sounded exasperated I was not yelling or abusing him.


It also felt so scripted because he stuck to the script regardless of what I said. If I expressed my annoyance he kept saying one line. He looked at my documents and claimed the bank logo wasn't visible. I just looked at it again and its fine. Itsan restatement in a PDF from my banka website. He told me to print i, take a picture and upload that. That will be way worse quality.


I have yet to do that becauase I do not have a printer available but if I have to call then again it will not go well. I would just cancel (if they'll let me without verifying my identity) but I want to transfer my funds back to my bank account rather than to wait a year for a check they'll probably never send.

Blue Cash Preferred® from American Express has a great offer to get those to sign up for the card. The 0% APR is usually offered for 12 months for purchases and cash transfers but Blue Cash Preferred is offering the promotion for 15 months. Also, another great feature is the automatic enrollment in earning cash back. I had that feature with one of my credit cards and it only allowed you to use the cash back with services and/or products that the credit card company offered. With this card, the cash back is offered as Reward Dollars that can be applied directly to statement. One negative is the variable rate of the regular APR. It can fluctuate between 12.99% to 21.99% that depends on a variety of factors. Also, I prefer cards with no annual fees as the $75 is a moderate fee. Overall, a great card and a chip will be a huge benefit for when traveling abroad.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: American Express Serve is one of our favorite prepaid cards. It offers everything you need to say goodbye to your checking account or to check-cashing stores at a price point that’s hard to beat. Serve’s free online bill pay feature allows you to pay billers that don’t accept plastic, and its free mobile app enables you to fund your account simply by taking a picture of a check. There are only two fees to even worry about and both are avoidable. If you direct deposit at least $500 each month and withdraw money exclusively from MoneyPass ATMs, of which there are more than 24,000 nationwide, then Amex Serve will be completely free to use. As such, Serve makes for a great replacement checking account, check-cashing service or financial literacy teaching tool. And that’s all you really need to know. But if you want more information, make sure to check out our full American Express Serve review.

I started using this card about 2 months ago and I currently have started loving it. The rewards for this card are just great. Even when you sign up you get 25,000 bonus points which give you a sort of head start towards earning rewards. I use this card for everyday use and absolutely love it.
department: Premier Rewards Gold Card from American Express

content: So far I love my bluebird since it doesn't cost anything to put any money on it or to withdraw. But the only problem is my walmart is a 20 min drive from where I live and I don't have a car so I was wondering, can you reload it any where or just at walmart? Is there any way I can reload it at Sheetz or Rite aid or at a local bank even if I don't have a bank account with them? I really need to order something offline for my Jewelry in candles business but I can't find a ride to Walmart to reload my card. Is there any other place that I can reload it?

Do not sign up for Am Ex Serve. They hold monies returned to you by vendors for up to 10 business days, even IF the vendor returned it as an immediate credit (With 'electronic money' any credits should show up IMMEDIATELY!!), this should be illegal. This isn't THEIR credit, this is MY MONEY!!!! Their customer service is horrible.

I like that my fee is waived due to direct depisit, but that is where it ends. Until about a week ago there were no "in network" atm's in my area, so I either had to withdraw large amounts of cash at one time to try to cover any needs and avoid losing money to multiple fees or just pay up to five dollars for each withdrawal. Now there are supposed to be network atm's, but I was just charged three dollars at one a few days ago. Besides every merchant not accepting AMEX, my card is repeatedly declined at different places even when there is more than enough to cover my purchase on the card. Making purchases online is a nightmare due to the two different codes on the card and you have to decide by process of elimination which one is valid for the transaction. Yes, you can receive your paycheck early, but every pay cycle will be a crap shoot as to when your funds are loaded. I have received my dd as late as on the payday, early afternoon to as early as five days prior to payday. Basically, the card is only good to minimize check cashing fees for people like myself who are done with the crooked banking system. If you want to be embarrassed and frustrated, get this card.

The Hilton HHonors card seems to have some good selling points, and some that are not so great. The initial bonus of 40,000 bonus points is a great feature when you consider how many nights you may be able to book for free with just those points alone. The regular point values seem to be reasonable as well, which means that this card would probably pay for itself on hotel rooms alone. However, I find that for a card such as this, the interest rate appears to be rather high. Also, be charged both a cash advance rate and a cash advance fee is a little over the top. I would be afraid of ever needing that service with those kinds of fees attached. Overall, if you are someone who travels a lot and uses their credit card quite frequently, this would be a good one for you based on rewards alone.

American Express is highly recognized named in the credit card industry, but the terms of this card are a little steep in comparison with some other offerings. Amex Blue Cash offers a lower interest rate at 12.99-21.99%, Blue Sky offers an interest rate of 17.24-22.24% That's a big spread on the low end and that will add up quickly over time. The $38 late fee is above Cap One's Silver, which offers $35. On the plus side, there's no annual fee, but that's available with many cards. Additionally, there's the prestige of Amex, which is highly regarded. This would not be my first choice, but it seems like a decent card.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: I thinks the fees of this are very reasonable, but I live in a state where they can not charge a monthly fee. The perks do seem better then the account now visa. Have some consumer protection beyond fraud is nice on a prepaid card. AMEX normally has good customer service it appears that someone else might actual do this card customer service from the level of complaints.

This card has made my life better... I get paid as soon as my job sends it not wait time so I get paid two days earlier than anybody else at my job... Different jobs might not put out checks as early as mine..

I filed a dispute on August 30, which they told me i would receive provisional credit in 10 business days. they closed it on September 2nd saying that it was resolved. now here I am September 21st no resolution and no money back no provisional credit! and now they're acting like they don't know what to do!

This is my most used card. Amex in general has awesome customer service and have been very secure by notifying me when they notice odd charges. The rewards system is great and can be redeemed at any Starwood hotel as well as for flights or even car rental vouchers. My only gripe is the annual fee.
department: Starwood Preferred Guest® Credit Card from American Express

content: I thought this card would be accepted everywhere but it actually is not accepted at quite a few places. Also, it can not be used as debit, only credit which means no cash back and unless you go to a wal mart atm you get charged an ATM fee and a fee from bluebird for every ATM withdraw. However, it is not terrible. There is no monthly fee and once I learned the places I can't use it, it has been okay.
So far I like everything about it I didn't know they charges a $2.50 fee for atm withdraws but that's OK there is no other charges

Overall, I think this is a solid charge card that gives you the benefits you pay for. The first year, they waive the annual fee but it rises to $160 after the first year, which is probably the only negative aspect of this card as this fee rests in the upper spectrum of annual fees with any credit card out there. Personally, I would still prefer regular credit cards that allows me the flexibility to pay in full each month or just the minimum if my funds for the month run low. Other cards like Chase Freedom and BankAmericard offer this flexibility while maintaining many of the cash-back options seen in this card. But then again, if you are a frequent traveler, the Gold Card is an appropriate card for you.

The fact that you can get such a high amount of bonus points with this Platinum card from American Express card after spending $3,000, which you could easily do if you travel quite a bit is a great feature of this card. However $450 for an annual fee seems a bit high. I believe using this card you would really have to decide if you could write it off for tax purposes or if you were paying for it personally. The Capital one Quicksilver credit card I have no has no annual fee at all.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: This is the worst Prepaid card company in history....how can u hold my money against me for 7 days....this is a scaming ass company that needs to burn in hell
I've had several charge cards like this before, and the American Express Serve card is easily the best out of all of them.

I travel a lot, almost 11 months a year. I am currently in the US and I have a burner phone (because of my extensive traveling) and they will not verify my account to it, to clear a hold on it. Their customer service seems to be the worst that I have had among any of the cards I held and I am a gold member in Hilton and soon will be platinum, but I think I will probably cancel this card, due to there crappy service.
I love the offer and plan to use it.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: Features are great love the card

I've had this card for a few years now because a friend recommended the card. Bluebird has never failed me!!!!!

Why'd I give it 5 stars? The pros outweigh the con's! I have minor issues, but overall, I LOVE my card!!!


Pros:

- You are not charged to replace a card.

- No bounced checks: It will allow you to write checks for only the amount you have in your account.

- Set aside accounts (I use these accounts for saving). You can transfer money between accounts without a fee!

- Sub accounts: Allows you to add additional cards to your account for your children.

- Bill pay

- Direct deposit. You will not be charged an ATM fee for withdrawals at their ATM's.

- You are able to transfer, unlimited times, money to and from your sub accounts and set aside accounts without a few.

- You're able to pay anyone, anywhere.

- Walmart is open 24 hours. I am able to upload money, anytime via a cash register.

- Lost or stolen card, your money is protected, FDIC insured.

- There is no fee associated with this card!


Con's:

- You can only withdraw a certain amount daily. A couple of times, I needed more money! Its not like a bank where you'd be able to withdraw money for unexpected incidents!

- The MoneyPass ATM in Walmart is ALWAYS out of order. Luckily, there is a WAWA that doesn't charge a service fee. Bluebird doesn't have control if the money machine!

- Without direct deposit, you are charged an ATM fee.

- A lot of merchants do not accept American Express.

- I've had issues using their check cashing service. I was unable to load checks to be processed, I discontinued using this service.

- Customer Service is outside the US!!!!


Bluebird is an alternative to banking, it is NOT a bank!

We have had this case for 3 years or so, but just recently started have paychecks deposited on it. Everything was fine until we tried to have my pell grant refund deposited on it. They rejected it!! They can't even tell me why except it's not a gov't refund. Really?! We were really counting on the money!! Then you have to wait days to have it rejected sent back to the school etc. I've read similar reviews where people have had similar problems with their payroll checks. Can you imagine not getting paid?! Then if you go read all of the small print they say they have the right to reject any deposit. Ok fine but federal pell grant money and pay roll checks really?! We used to like this card until we actually starting using the direct deposit feature which is a joke. This card is no longer in use and never will be again. As for the customer service, Ha these people are rude and you can barely understand them. They repeat the same thing over and over while you are just desperately trying to figure out where your money is. This place lost my respect as well as my business

Here's what I think is great about this card- there is no annual fee and you are ALWAYS earning in some way. It doesn't get much better than that. I guess the biggest difference between this and other cards I have are how the cash is put back to your statement. I do like how my Southwest Card I can put it towards other things besides air travel. It is handy to have that flexibility. But overall the Blue Cash Everyday Card has a very competitive interest rate and no annual fee which is huge! And who couldn't use the $100 bonus?
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I HATE this card with a passion! I gladly would have given negative stars for the bullshit I've had to endure.I have had Nothing but problems trying to get money off of it, even at Walmart where I'm supposed to get free cash withdrawals,no such luck! I had to use a regular atm where I paid the atm fee and another $2.50 from American express,because it wasn't a money pass atm. I paid $5 to get MY money out and twice I've had a merchant screw up and cancel my transaction only to not be able to use the card because the money gets put on hold for 3 to 5 days.and when your on vacation fill your car up and they do it YOUR screwed because that money is not available then,but you have gas and you can't pay for it.so thank you blue bird for ruining what should have been a great weekend(my baby brothers wedding)I almost forgot these problems only happen AFTER you've gone from store to store to store to find someone who will even take this peice of s@$! Card. Don't do it it's worth $5 dollars a month to get a visa preload able card everyone takes visa and if a transaction is voided it's like it never happened you can still spend your money because you should be able to only crappie ass bluebird wants to make you homicidal.

No complaints other than all of the now 8 paper checks from 7 difference sources I've tried to deposit have been declined. Why? who knows, there is NO WAY to find out. As long as you don't need to deposit paper checks the card is very good for a prepaid card.

Simply the best deal out there, along.with the.Bluebird card. They didn't even touch on the perks, like features that help you save money, that help you get premium concert tickets, insure your electronics purchases or car rentals, or roadside assistance.


J have been completely delighted with my AmEx cards.
why does bluebird need your SS number? I don't use ATM I just want a card that I can put money on and save up

My recommendation is to skip this service from Amex. It is a security nightmare and is extraordinarily unsafe. If they send you an email requesting a picture of your drivers license or any other form of identification, don't do it. It is a fraudulent practice. Their support services are also very poor. I closed this account immediately!

First and foremost, very poor customer service. There is no consistency among their staffs. It is sad to be called AMERICAN EXPRESS SERVE.

Please do not use this card and this company. Your identity and money are on risk.

I have used my Blue Cash American Express card everywhere! I use it to shop for groceries, clothes, school supplies, etc. I get points for shopping 3% cash back for groceries and 2% cash back for gas purchases so I have been using it to fill up my tank ever since I got it in 2009. I am very pleased with the company, it is a pleasure working with them.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I absolutely love this target prepaid card.. you can reload it as much times as you want they're no interest fees or monthly fees which is also great. this card has 24/7 customer service which is very helpful in case you have any issues . overall this card is better than any other pre paid card i ever had and i would suggest it to everyone.
Nothing. It is a fraud. 82 days after filing a dispute and still no answer.

I can't complain about this card. It has done what it says. Im somewhat irrate that Amex would go so far for cs rep when we have great cs people who speak English and need work.. I never had a problem with them so far..
They have five of my social security checks and have yet to send me a working card. They are also passed the dead line to return the money to my banking account.

I have a couple of credit cards but by far my Blue Cash American Express card takes the cake. Not only do I get points by shopping, I get to also either purchase items from their retailer with my points or use the points towards my account balance as a payment. Pretty cool idea!
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I don't like blue bird , cause I got a blue bird card and before I could UAE it they cancelled my card for not fault of mind . This is the worst card I have ever had ! And I had money on my card and was told they would be sending me a check for what I had on the card it's been over two weeks and haven't gotten my money back yet !
dont use this bank their customer service is a joke

Was just about to leave the nastiest review ever as I have been getting the run around from some Indian customer service reps about my funds being on hold for 4 days until I just called and got a nice, English speaking man who clarified everything for me and told me the money should be back on my card within 8 days. I guess they must've recently updated their reps, of I got lucky with a knowledgeable one! I see lots of bad reviews about the horrible customer service I agree with. Here's a tip. Call over and over until they give you someone that is American, as the 5 (yes, 5) different foreign guys I have been getting have all been rude, didn't know what they were talking about, and were barely understandable.

Wow! Just ridiculous and unacceptable customer service. I'm having issues with them and holds on my funds like many of the people here. On phone for hours, in asked for a supervisor I was placed on hold and the Rep came back and started asking me questions about if I knew how finance works!? Lol and a weird loop di loop runaround. When I asked for a supervisor again he kept trying to Dodge it. So maybe they get docked or something when transferring to supervisors?


All I know is that I am convinced all these holds etc. For 4-8 days and such. Thats them using your money FOR FREE! WITHOUT PAYING YOU INTEREST OR LETTING YOU HAVE ACCESS TO IT. it's also gotta be how they are funding this Serve Card! This is how they are able to offer no fees and all that. Because they are using all of our money for free with holds etc.

I got this card for an extra credit card to have for our "whatever/wedding money fund" At first I was very concerned because my fiance has NOTHING NICE to say about American Express and claimed I would not be able to use it as flexible as a visa/MC ( no issues yet). I got my card in the time they estimated, and decided to try and load money online to see if it went smooth. Boom.... instant cash on my acct from my other bank. CVS now offers 0 fee for loading your card which is another bonus. I have had this card for about 4 months now and I have not had any major issues. I had a mini issue on Davids Bridal, tried to get something I didn't have enough $ so they charged me 3x for a dollar each time, called customer service the woman spoke clear english was polite no problems. I would have given this 5 stars except I am a little hesitant depositing my payroll check to this card, and I am a little bummed that paper checks take so long to process (6-10 business days) if you try to deposit them on your phone app. Other than those two things, I have not had any issues, I love the fact that there is 0 fees each month for me, and 0 fee for loading your card, where my other card charged you 4.95 to load, and 5.00 a month fee.

Although the $450 fee is high the benefits outweigh it, even if you are not a big spender. Figure $100 of the $200 airline benefits, 3 trips to the Centurion club in NY SF Dallas or LV is worth $150, $20 for TSA Precheck means it costs $180 a year still a lot. BUT you also get Hertz and Avis and SPG gold membership and no expiration date on miles with a 20% mile refund when you use the miles directly instead of transferring them to an airline program. That has a hard-to-measure value. And if you eve take an upscale cruise on one of several cruise lines Amextravel counselors may only be average but you will definitely save money by getting cabin upgrades and free perks.When there is an error on the bill they really check it for you, and the one time I had a $500 Dollar rentacar damage charge they picked it up. Great customer service in general. No international exchange fees is nice but not unique. I have another card for groceries and gas, but I use Amex Platinum for everything else (except when I go to a local merchant who I do not want to let know I have such a prestigious expensive card) Now if you use the bigshot rewards like the special deals at top tier hotels, or the 2 for 1 first class plane tix it is even more valuable, but I don't and it is still great.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I have had Bluebird for 3 years and have occasional issues, but the issue I am having now is AWFUL! I made a purchase at a retailer, the transaction was wrong so they voided and rerang it correctly. The first problem is that the transaction was voided and not returned. Don't EVER let anyone void transactions - it becomes a huge nightmare. The voided transaction was for $111.67, the new transaction for $95.24. The merchant told me the $111.67 would go back to my card within 24 hours. Well, it's day 5, and I still don't have my money. I have called Bluebird 4 times, and the answer I got today was that they eliminated their pre-authorization department and no longer allow merchants to submit info to have a pre-authorization (or hold) removed. I MIGHT get my money back after 8 days. I am so angry I could spit. I will be finding another account to do my banking with. This has been a horrible experience.

They are so bad I hate to merit any stars, but they make me. They are a bunch of lying crooks. Four holds were put on my card totaling over 200.00. I was told that there would be an 8 day hold unless they spoke to the merchant. Well I did a conference call and the merchant clearly stated to release the hold. I was told 24 to 48 hours and it would be credited back to my card. Two days went by and nothing. I then called back and was told that it wasn't true, that the tech should have never told me that, and that it would be 8 days no matter what. At this point I had talked to 8 different people, 4 of which told me 24-48 hours. They are a headache, they repeat the same thing over and over, you wait for a supervisor forever. In fact, one of the techs told me they were getting one and there was no hold music. Come to find out I heard him BREATHING on the other end! He wasn't getting anyone at all! I do not recommend these people AT ALL! Terrible terrible institution!

Based on reviewing this cards terms, there are some positives and negatives. The first negative in my case is the required credit score. In these times, who really has an excellent credit scores. Makes it harder for your average person to be able to obtain this card. However, with that said, I do like the no annual fee. I have received several offers which require $75 to $125 annual fees. Ridiculous to pay money to have a plastic card. Rewards to earn seems pretty standard and a nice perk. The new over limit fee is another nice option as well as the smart chip for extra protection and in this age of fraud this is a very nice feature. Overall, seems like a really nice card, just maybe not as obtainable for everyone.

For an average credit score of 687. I was surprised to receive an offer to apply for the American Express Green Card, and got approved in less then 60 seconds. Yes, it is not a credit card, but a charge prestige card. Connected to one of my checking accounts? The money awaits there automatically to be taken out at due date, with me not to worry. The benefits is not compared to any other bank cards. This is a great charge card, for travel and booking my hotels, rental cars and flights, through AMEXTRAVEL and enjoy double points, with no blackout dates Guaranteed. Just what I wanted for many years, finally came through. Thank you AMEX! Also Fraud protected to the penny! No Bank Debit card needed for the use of your checking account. Call it a payday loan, with no interest, some times a lap of up to 4 to 6 weeks before pay is due! Love it!

What I truly love about this card is that you receive 2x the points on every eligible dollar that you spend. I have found that most of the cash rewards cards out there are not what they claim to be, but that is not the case with the green card. And even better yet I have already used my points to book a flight for my families vacation this year. I would definitely recommend this card to friends and family.
No Complaints Here, I Have Some Of My Money DD & I Have It Connected To My BA So I Can Easily Move My Money Around When I Feel A Need To. Love The Low Fees Too, Plus Received Just About Anywhere.

When I tried to pump gas at Kroger using my card, a malfunction occurred. Everyone was yelling that no gas was being pumped, and neither was my pump. I cancelled the transaction and left. When I tried to use my Serve card at another gas station, it was declined. Why? Because Serve had wiped out the funds on my card and put them ON HOLD. $100 gone and still on hold. I have a Honda Accord - I can drive three months on $100 of gas and not one single drop of gas was pumped into my car. Contacting customer service is IMPOSSIBLE since customer service does not exist with Serve unless you are checking your balance or doing anything that DOES NOT requires human interaction. And from what I have heard, even trying to to communicate with a non English speaking human is a waste of time with Serve. The $1 monthly service fee with Serve is too much. You don't even get ONE DOLLAR WORTH OF SERVICE FROM THEM.

This is the worst purchase I ever made, O stars for American Express Serve Card,

I sent my daughter to Spain with this card. She would have been better off with $1000 in McDonald's Gift Certificates. They have a maximum deposit of $200 dollars a day but they allow, daily transfers. I set up dailies so that my daughter would have $1000 dollars available on the day she arrived in Spain. I had her use the card at the airport in the USA before boarding the plane. It worked. Off you go!

She used the card in Spain at an ATM and the bank machine took the card. Fortunately the bank was open and she went in to the bank and retrieved the card. Afraid to use the card, she contacted me. I contacted American Express Serve. I was told that I needed to download documents and send to Serve electronically. Nothing was wrong with the account that i was transferring the funds from. Why had the first $400.00 been successfully transferred? No one from the India call center could answer that question. Documents uploaded, downloaded and sent with the help of an professional IT guy here helping me (the Amex Serve Web Site sucks) according to the IT guy. Three hours and 5 or 6 customer service representatives later I am told we are all set. I asked, "will the previously scheduled 3 transfers of $200 be retroactive"? I was told "yes".
