Well NO they were not. Back on line setting up transfers first $200 go into serve account and I get an email saying there is a problem with my account. I call the customer service help line, two more hours and 3 customer service reps later, I decided to just fly over to Spain and deliver the money to my daughter myself. Even if I get strip searched at TSA it won't be as painful as my call center experience.

People that don't know that is card (Green Amex) is a charge card and not a credit card should probably not be reviewing it. People are complaining about the annual fee, but it is the only thing you ever pay to them. They don't charge interest because the balance is due every month.


If you have a credit card and you carry a balance of a 1000 dollars and your interest rate is 15.99% you are spending more in interest in 6 months than Amex charges with their annual fee.

I have had to call 12 times to get a check payment cancelled and they still have ot refunded my money!! I have spent at least ten hours on the phone, talking to supervisors & managers and none of them can read the previous notes or get my dispute resolved. The customer service is horrible! DO NOT GET THIS CARD! I am contacting an attorney.

This is simply the best card out there, I have had my Blue American Express card since early 2000s, and I absolutely love it. One of the best features of this card is the smart chip, AE had this technology for so long and others are slowly catching up. I use this card for gasoline purchases quite a bit and loving the convenience. It offers 2% cash back for gas purchases, which adds up after a while. Overall this is a great card from a great company
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: This card was the worse mistake I have made in my life. They will let a merchant access your card and remove money twice. The associates are rude very disrespectful. They'll hold your money until they want to release it. DON'T GET THIS CARD

I use my Blue Cash Preferred American Express Card all the time. It offers great perks like cash bonuses, excellent customer service, and additional insurance coverage on purchases.If I have any dispute they resolve it in an orderly and efficient manner. If you are someone who prefers to pay off their balance every month and enjoys all the benefits mentioned above, then this card is for you. The only drawback is that some retailers do not accept Amex, apparently because of their high fees for usage. Otherwise, very happy with the card.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I really do enjoy using this card one groceries and gas. I like to use it because you get cash back on them, 3% for groceries and 2% for gas. It's what your going to spend anyways on necessities so why not get a little bonus back? And on ALL purchases you get 1%, which of course promotes use of this card.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: The American Express Blue Cash Everyday card is a nice rewards card for gas and groceries. It earns 3% cash back on groceries and 2% on gas. All other purchases earn the default 1% so there are definitely better rewards cards for those purchases. However gas and groceries account for a lot of my spending (and I'm sure most other people as well) so the card is worthwhile to have for just those two categories. For all other purchases I use other cards which a higher rewards percentage.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I was looking for a prepaid card that could be used like an additional debit card. My friend recommended me this card and I have no complaints so far. I mostly use this card for special purchases. The biggest benefit this has over a traditional debit card is its very low fees. I pay $12 a year which is usually what you'd have to pay a month with debit cards.

Great overall card for those who travel a lot. The membership rewards are very good and there is a wide variety of selections. Some examples off the top of my head include lounge access at many airports. $200 credit for travel expenses, concierge service at airports and hotels, hotel accommodations, sporting event rewards, entertainment/concerts, etc. No international currency fees are also great and really useful. There is a pretty steep annual fee but if you travel a lot then it is very much worth it. A very solid card but I had to take off one star for the big annual fee.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content:
The card is good for direct deposit, online purchases and brick and mortar retail stores, as well as extremely low on fees. However it is TERRIBLE for depositing paper checks. In the three months I've had the card I've attempted to deposit 5 paper checks from five different people and businesses using the mobile app, the checks ranged from $100 even to $500 and change, all five checks have been DECLINED.


Check Amount: $100.00


Our decision was based in whole or in part on information obtained from Certegy Check Services


Check Amount: $221.11


Our decision was based in whole or in part on information obtained from Certegy Check Services,


Check Amount: $540.00


Our decision was based in whole or in part on information obtained from Certegy Check Services


Check Amount: $176.49


Our decision was based in whole or in part on information obtained from Certegy Check Services,


Check Amount: $129.99


Our decision was based in whole or in part on information obtained from Certegy Check Services,


It's really a shame you cannot deposit paper checks ad that is one of the main drawing points. However, as far as these type debit cards go, the good outweighs the bad. I give 3 stars, if I was able to deposit checks, I'd give it 5 stars.

I like this card overall. Most prepaid cards cost about $5-$10 a month whether you use the card or not. With this card before I started a direct deposit on it my monthly fee was still waived. I don't trust any prepaid with my total paycheck, so I don't have those problems.

I was thinking about using this card to book my hotel, but after reading some of these horror stories, i'll stick to using my bank account.

I do like that I can transfer money within minutes to this card. I wish I could load money to my PayPal account that fast from my bank account. Not enough people accept AE for my taste. And DONT try to use this card to pay important bills. Other than that, this card is nice..

I dislike automated customer service with a passion, I never am able to resolve my issues in a prompt time period because I am stuck getting a computer over and over again. The $1 monthly fee isn't too bad, although not preferred. I appreciate that there is also no cancellation fee incase something were to cause me cancel.

Just the fact that this card carries the American Express name on it tells you something...Amex has always been trustworthy and committed to customer service, in my experience. While the APRs on this card seem pretty high, there's no annual fee, and the rewards points are easy to rack up, although the minimums to redeem seem pretty high. If you spend a lot on the card and pay the balance off every month, though, I'm sure you can redeem faster. All in all, not the best card out there, but better than most.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: The Hilton HHonors Credit Card is one of the best decisions I have made. If you just spend $750 within the first three months after getting the card, you get a bonus of 40,000 points! For those not familiar with the HHonors program, you can use these points (along with other points you earn using the card) for free hotel stays. The APR is a little high, but this card is a great idea for people who travel often and want to earn rewards that help them save on travel expenses.

I was sent an offer for $100 cash back after spending $500, so I called to apply for the card. After being bounced around between 3 representatives and wasting 30 minutes of my evening, a representative got on the phone and told me that because I already had the card and cancelled it, I wasn't eligible. If you don't want me to apply, DON'T SEND ME OFFERS!!!!
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I bought a bluebird card a couple months ago and have had nothing but problems! I paid my phone bill online and the payment never went threw, the phone company said it was a card error, long story short bluebird took the money off my card and is now making me wait 8 days to get my money back when it was their fault. And they have HORRIBLE customer service.

When you are able to slap one of these badboys in your wallet, that's when you know ..... You've made it. I was looking through certain credit cards trying to find a good one to apply for and my eyes laid upon this one. I'm pretty sure my credit or bank account is not big enough to be able to get one of these but it's good to have dreams and goals. I want to be able one day to go into a BMW dealership and just take a test drive get back to the dealership and slap one of these golden pieces of plastic down. On a serious note, I love love love the travel benefits, purchase protection, and the return protection....I guarantee each one of these services are top notch. I took a look at the annual fee and did a double take but you gotta figure, if your able to get one of these 125 after the first year is more than likely chump change. I feel the annual fee is worth it to just have the piece of mind that in your wallet you've got a gold american express. Compared to my credit card, it blows it away in every category. That's just the way life is, and that's why I love america.....it makes you wanna do better for yourself, strive for something better. You better believe, I will be making strides so that one day, I'll possess this beautiful gold american express !!

What I like about this Platinum card with American Express is that most businesses are familiar with the brand American Express. I also like that you can earn points for each purchase, and even double points, and that there is no limit on the amount of points you can earn. However, I don’t like that the balance must be paid in full each month, or that there is an annual fee of $450. With my current Capital One card, there is no annual fee, and I can earn rewards also.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: Pretty Bad experience with the AE Serve card ! Stay away from attaching your bank a/c to load this card. Looks like it's easy to steal the money and get away with it. After umpteen calls with the Serve customer support all they can tell is to wait for 44 days. That how long its take them to investigate !!!

I absolutely love my Hilton Honors Credit Card from American Express! It is so convenient, and the online services are extremely easy to use and comprehensive. I frequently stay in Hilton branded hotels, and love accumulating Hilton Honors points for just purchasing items that I would normally purchase with my credit card. I also love that the majority of physical and online vendors accept American Express, so I never run into any issues with using the card. I would absolutely recommend this card to my friends and family members.

I love my bluebird card. We get our savings from the Walmart Savings Catcher added easily and they double it! We save up for a couple months until we have between $15 and $25 then transfer to Bluebird and it is doubled. Only downside is we have still not received our permanent card yet. Got to call customer service to get one sent.
I love my American Express Serve card. They offer different chances for me to get extra money. Nice and EASY!!!

I love the 3% cash back feature in supermarkets and the 2% cash back at gas stations on the Blue Cash Everyday Card. Compared to other cards, this card offers much more rewards for its customers. With no annual fee, this card is a step above the rest. The balance transfer fee can be costly, especially if you are transferring a large balance. In addition, the varying interest rate can make the difference between a great experience or just another high interest card, so make sure you understand how the variable rate works.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: My experience with American Express Serve has been mixed. Last year my tax return went through, no problem. This year my tax return was rejected, American Express sent it back with a message that I had already received a return this year and that it was possibly a fraudulent return. I HAVE NOT received a Federal Tax Deposit this year. When I called the customer service department, which is not in the US, I was told that no I had not received a Fed Tax Deposit, but no they would not write a letter for me, since it was not their policy. When I asked to speak to the Manager I was told that he was aware of the situation and that no I could not speak to him as he was too busy. So to sum it up - They are not willing to help their customers and they defame them to the IRS.

I like how there is no transaction fee or monthly fee. However, I do not like that there is a $3.00 ATM transaction fee. I feel that $3.00 to reload a card is a bit pricey, but I do see how without having monthly or transaction fees, it isn't as big of a deal. It is also nice to see that there is no cancelation or inactivity fee for this card. Overall, I would probably purchase this card. It is similar to the Visa Prepaid Cards my parent's have given me as a gift, however I find that this being reloadable makes it more marketable.

I really like The American Express Blue Card for a few reasons. First, there is no annual fee. Second, There is no over limit fee. Third, the reward points are great. The interest rate is a bit high, but it is with most cards. I often pay off my balance before the closing date so this doesn't really affect me much. I also really like the smart chip, as that adds extra security benefits. Great card for me!

The Blue Cash Everyday Card from American Express is a great card for those with a strong credit history looking for generous cash back rewards. I have this card and recommend it to anyone who qualifies. I do not carry cash or a debit card. Instead, I use this card to earn rewards wherever it’s accepted. You can get a $100 bonus if you spend $1000 in the first 3 months. You earn 3% on groceries, 2% on gas and a few select department stores, 1% on the rest. It goes without saying that American Express offers friendly customer support that’s available 24/7.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I would recommend this card to anyone who has a strong credit history (although you need an excellent one to get it) and doesn't mind having to pay the full balance on the card each and every month. This is convenient because of how it keeps your credit great but if something goes awry and you can't pay it there is a big fee to pay. Assuming you have excellent credit to start with this shouldn't be much of a problem though and it keeps the interest from building up. With no preset limits it really opens a lot of doors for its owner. Wouldn't recommend the American Express Green Card to those who love to travel though, get those airplane miles!

I think this definitely provides a lot of good benefits...for the last 2 years I had been using the Citi Hilton Honors Reserve card. I like all the hotel benefits with that one because I work in the hospitality industry, and the automatic Gold HHonors status and free night starts were a great perk, however with the Blue Cash card I feel like the cash back benefits are more flexible and practical...I can get cash back on most of the things I'm already buying and put that towards my statement. Plus the annual fee is only $75 ($95 for my old Citi card), the interest rate is lower and generally I'm just more satisfied with it.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I have had the pleasure of using the American Express Blue card for several years now and, it is by far my most beneficial credit card. I love the reward points, the cash advance, the smart chip and the ability to pay over time, if necessary, allows flexibility in month to month finances. AMEX has won me over and I will be a user for a long time.

Watch out using your card at the gas pump. Pump stated, : you have x dollars to spend on gas 5X what I needed for a little Hyndaii! I cancelled the sale out of fear my whole balance was being quoted! Going on to DAY 6 with my funds from a CANCELLED sale on HOLD. AE says they cannot help!! Urgghhh

I use this card on a regular basis. The Rewards received go towards Christmas gift cards. I have an incredibly good interest rate, after using the card for several years I contacted them and requested that the interest rate be lowered. Their customer service is always impeccable and they readily lowered it as I had a great payment history. I can use their system to set up a monthly payment system and I find it incredibly easy to use. This card is used for all of my vacations, monthly bills and seems to be accepted by most retailers. I'm very happy with their services.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: The Hilton HHonors credit card looks like a great card to have for traveling. The amount of points you can earn is fabulous compared to other cards that I have. Also the interest rate is good and no annual fee makes this a great card to have. The only thing I wish this card included was no foreign transaction fee and a smart chip. Having both of those would bump this up to a 5 star card. Also, with only needing a "good" credit score, makes it a card I qualify for.

The American Express Gold Card has good qualities but they are diminished by the high annual fee of $125 after the first year. On its own merit, the rewards system is a positive. Although you can earn rewards at a high rate compared to some other cards, I would rather get cash rewards than these point reward systems. The negative aspect is you basically have to use this card all the time to earn enough rewards to cancel out the high fee. Which leaving you breaking even. I much prefer a card with no annual fee so I can keep the rewards and spend them on something I want or need.

My experience with this card has been somewhat mixed. The American Express Serve card has some good stuff going for it. No activation fee, a very low monthly fee (1 dollar a month is pretty good), and you can add cash to it for free at a lot of places. When it works, it works well. However, their customer service department leaves some to be desired.


Long wait times and even when you get someone you get the runaround from them. This card is great if you don't have much credit but there's also a lot of other prepaid options out there (Discover has a great customer service team and a very nice prepaid card as well.) It would do well for you to consider your options when looking at this card.

The Blue Sky credit card from American Express seems to be a good card from a reputable company. The points system is nice and simple. You spend a dollar, you get a point. No confusion in that case! The rates seem typical from what I know about credit cards. Of course they like to keep those percentages high but I would probably a lot feel more comfortable with this card than I would with most of the other credit cards.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content:
The Platinum Card from American Express is a fun card to have. Firstly, you have the prestige of having the classic high tier card from American Express but it has a lot of great things about it as well. Great initial point bonus and a lot of points that can stack up after that, no foreign transaction fees (Which if you're a big international traveler can really be a pain after awhile if you're not careful) and being an American Express it's accepted everywhere.


It's a fantastic card by itself but it really shines for travel. Accepted everywhere, no foreign fees, and if you're in a pinch the concierge service can be really helpful.


The Platinum Card really distinguishes itself from the other big cards with it's convenience, great features, and ease of use. It's even better than the Discover Rewards Card which isn't as ubiquitous abroad and has foreign transaction fees.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: This credit card is great. Women are always impressed by men who have the word "Platinum" on their cards and I like that. the point system is fantastic and of all of the credit cards I have, American Express provides the coolest points rewards. This car is accepted like everywhere, and the fact that there is a $38 dollar late fee doesn't concern me, neither does the $450 annual fee, because if you're rich you don't need to worry about that stuff.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I enjoy the flexibility this card offers. Rates are decent, but the bonuses are absolutely fantastic. The most attractive part of this card, however, is the service. There are no other companies offering credit cards that have better customer service than American Express. Nobody else comes close!
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: This card is wonderful! I have the American Express Platinum card, which has great rewards as well. As a reward for using the card, they give you 100 dollars back after spending 1000. This makes using the card worthwhile! You also get 3% cash back whenever you use a supermarket! And 1% for a gas station. Instead of for only 12 months, this card gives you 0% for 15 MONTHS! The interest rate after the 15 months of 12.99%-21.99% is a little high, but worth it with all of the rewards offered by the use of this card.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I am not a very big fan of the $100 back after spending $1000. I have the Disney Visa card and received $100 back after my first purchase. I am in fact a fan of the $0 annual fee. I also like the 0% interest on the first 15 months. The 3% cash back is always nice! It might be hard for most to get this card considering you need to have excellent credit. This card isn't too different compared to others, it kind of just blends in with the rest.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I got this card as a back up to my BofA account. I got some extra money via check so I figured I'd just deposit it to the card. IT TAKES 8 DAYS FOR THE CHECK TO PROCESS. IF YOU TRY CANCELING IT TAKES 10 DAYS TO PROCESS A DISPUTE Once I get my money off of here I will be canceling. It's not worth the headache!

This card is AMAZING!! I love how there are no interest rates on purchases or transfers for the first 15 months which is great because it gives you time to start paying things before the interest rates go sky high. Getting $100 back every time you spend $1000 or more in the first 3 months of having the card. When it came in the mail it was just so shiny and now I use this card everyday for small and big purchases. I actually bought a brand new sectional couch and brand new dining room table for my house not to long ago and I got $200 back because my purchase price was $2000+. I was super happy.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I warn anyone is thinking about purchasing this card it's called served for a reason! And max Jett your statement is wrong this is a prepaid card not a secure credit card therefore it does not build your credit I I don't know who told you that if it was a credit card you would have to make a monthly payment and pay some sort of annual fee but anyways this company is so greedy they hold on to any type of money they can possibly earn interest on even returns now that is crazy they take 45 days to do a dispute and will deny your dispute if you don't provide info about the transaction how in the world are you suppose to provide something that you didn't even do?! I can't stand them and ace elite is worst I'm switching back to regular checking asap and if you must get a prepaid card get krogers or Walmart they both were awesome but I lost Both cards and never replace them but please listen to me don't get this card if you are a big spender like me and love return things to the store and expecting your money to go back on your card within one to two days or want cash back at the check out lane this ain't the card for you because you can't get cash back even if you use your pin and you can't take out more then 2,000 a month and you can't pay your car note at lest I can't if you really wanna get more then 2,000 out at a time what you could do is have your husband or wife buy a card in their own name and transfer the money two them so that why you can take out 4,000 or what ever you want instead being on a stupid 2,000 limit that ain't nothing they need to be shut down for all the little tricks that they be pulling on keeping people money in their account

I actually used this card as a gift card before. It had no transaction fee to activate which is better than many prepaid cards. The added benefit was the person using it was able to use it as a prepaid card themselves, add money and even use it at ATM machines if they needed. To me, this is a better option than just buying someone the standard gift card. It's a gift card with benefits!

Customer service is clearly outsourced to bumf*** somewhere. Most incompetent group of individuals I have ever encountered. Disputes take up to 45 days if there is fraud. My VISA get's it handles in 4 days. The Indian workers English is poor at best and tell you the obvious things over and over. AMEX use to be premier but they are clearly going down hill, no wonder only 35% of merchants will take them. Thanks, but I'm going back to my VISA.

We have had this business card for a few years now. Things we really liked about this card are: the bonus points we got upon sign up, first year membership free and the exceptional customer service and online account management tools from American Express. They also have plenty of great ways to redeem your points. In general, the value for each point equates to about a dollar - however, there are some things that seemed more expensive to redeem. For e.g. if you plan to exchange these points for Starwood SPG points it works about to about 3:1 - which I think is a bit too much. Also, we are not really happy that they have increased the annual fee this year to $175 - this is a good chunk if you are really small business owner and takes a good chunk out of the points you can potentially earn in an year.

The American Express Amex EveryDay Credit Card is just what it bills itself to be: a great credit card for everyday usage. While the fees are a little on the pricey side, what I really love about this card is the intro zero percent APR periods. If you pay your entire balance off by the end of that promotional period, you could effectively turn this card into one that is entirely interest free. One additional great thing about American Express is that their customer service team is first rate, so should their be any issue, it is very easy to resolve by simple contacting their support team.
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content: If you use this card at a Shell gas station, it puts a 72 hr hold on $100 of funds available on the card, even if the transaction is cancelled. As soon as my funds are released, I will be cancelling this card.

I love my American Express Premier Rewards Gold Card. It provides excellent perks and of course American Express's great customer service. I especially love the American Express extended warranty, it really helped when our washing machine died just out of manufacturer's warranty. In addition to the extended warranty, you get the excellent american express fraud protection. While I have not had to use it myself, I have had friends who received very prompt warnings from american express when their cards were stolen. This can save you a great deal of hassle. You also get American Express points on travel and groceries! I cannot recommend it enough!
department: Premier Rewards Gold Card from American Express

content: This card won't win any awards, but it is a fairly responsible card to have in your wallet. You have to pay it off each month, so you're not going to get into as much trouble as you could with other cards that let you carry a balance. I love how quickly you can accumulate points, though. I don't love the annual fee, because I tend to not see a benefit to cards that have an annual fee. However if you use a credit card for any and everything, and pay it off at the end of the month, you could be a candidate for this card. I will say that AmEx's customer service is great. When I have had to contact them for a dispute, they've taken care of everything without having to hassle them. Truly exceptional for this industry!

Well, I see some good and not so good points for this card. I like that they offer points with no limits and no annual fee. The annual fees on some cards can be quite high. Also, they don't charge a fee for being over the limit but I don't like that they charge a 2.7% foreign transaction fee since there are so many fees on overseas transactions anyway. I would prefer my card to not add to the list of overseas transaction fees. Also, the cash advance fee is a probably standard but high for my preference. This card seems like it's good for acquiring traveling points and if you pay on time then you should be okay, otherwise this card has some hefty fees that you may need to review beforehand.

So after reviewing this card I must say i like what I see. The interest rates are fair, the reward points seem very nice for anyone who does traveling. However I am currently using the chase freedom card , I noticed that the chase freedom card has a much lower max apr. I have been with chase for a couple years now and I am very satisfied . Also I noticed the chase card offers a lower cash advance rate compared to the blue American Express. Overall a good card in my opinion.

The Hilton HHonors Credit Card is great. The added bonus you get when you sign up and spend one thousand dollars within three months was a great selling point for me. Not only do you get the initial bonus points, but you continue to get more points as you spend with this card. When I make my reservation with Hilton I get five hundred points that is a great deal! The only down side is the late fee is a little higher than some other cards I own.

I have never had a bad experience with American Express. For me, their customer service and other services has always been impeccable. I got this card when I started out and it let me build up credit so I could make other purchases down the line. The American Express Serve card is a prepaid card though. You have to put up your own money to use on it instead of using a credit line. The upside to this is there's no possibility for overcharging, fees, or any interest accruing.


It's an excellent way to start building your credit or to have tucked away just in case. However, it doesn't have much in extra features or any rewards points. Like the Capital One Rewards Card which you can use points on to redeem towards your balance or other things. Still, it's a good card to start out with.

Based upon the APR range, this card should not be used to carry balances. I can see where this is a good card for someone who travels a lot, but there are a lot of other cards out there which offer more than one point per $1 spent. I have a Barclay card with similar APR, so I pay it off at the end of every month, which offers one point per dollar spent on normal purchases and two points per dollar spent on Groceries, Gas, and Utilities. These points can be redeemed back at a similar rate as the Amex Blue Sky card, but for credits on my credit card bill.


So in short if you travel a lot this might be a card for you, but if you do not there are better reward cards out there.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: It's OK to get direct deposit, but can't find free ATM's to withdrawal money...it's not the best yet, but thankful for it

Overall this card rocks! The Platinum Card from American Express is great if you are travelling overseas, as there are never any foreign transaction fees. (which is also a plus for some online purchases where you can get hit with fees here and there from other cards!) The only downside is the annual fee, but if you are travelling it more than makes up for that. The points that it offers too, coupled with the offers that Amex allows you to add to The Platinum Card from American Express instantly from your online account allow you an amazing amount of savings. (These offers can be loaded with just a few clicks, and don’t require any physical coupons.)
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: The American Express Gold Card has a great rewards system if you use it properly and to its fully potential, but the negative for this card is the extremely high annual fee of $125. Granted, you get your 1st yr free, but after that it will cost you. It's a way to make the customer use this card over any other in order to get the rewards and balance out that annual fee. I still prefer my Chase Freedom Card with the 5% cash back categories and NO annual fee. It really does provide a sense of freedom with not having to worry about using it all the time in order to balance out the annual fee.

American Express is by far one of the best credit card companies out there! They have awesome customer service that has helped me numerous times. When I first got my American Express card my name was wrong on the card so I contacted them and they were so helpful and fixed the problem literally as fast as they could. My new card was overnighted to me so I was able to get it the next day instead of waiting forever to get it in the mail. They also have a great rewards program which is an incentive for me to continue to charge things instead of paying with cash.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content:
This is a fantastic card. The Blue Cash Credit Card is an excellent option for many people. You have a variable, but overall great, interest rate, great intro rates, and rewards that can appeal to a lot of consumers. You get money back from grocery stores, gas stations, and department stores. Who couldn't benefit from that?


Even compared to something like the Capital One Rewards Card, this card trumps them in it's sheer convenience in how the rewards can be applied. This card is a definite win for just about anyone.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: Virtually impossible to use. No one accepts it.

Never ever get an american express serve card. I had an issue with an atm for $500 and I still have not received my credit. All I get is the run around with customer service and the supervisor. Once I get my credit I will be inactivating my account. Take my advise do NOT use them!!!!!! They should be out of business by the way they handle these issues!!!

Pretty excellent card. Decent APR rates, easily use discounts offered when traveling, it covers (like many others) my rental car insurance for up to 10k, no fees, and I get to use their points on Amazon. No hassle card. One complaint I do have is that after their introductory offer, I still have a decently high APR even though I have pretty excellent credit. But I pay it off every month, so it's not that big of a deal.

Target & American Express are two very reputable companies so I know I can trust this card! I like that you can reload this card at any Target because it is very convenient to be able to reload my card while I shop for groceries. My Netspend prepaid card does not have very many locations where I can reload so the American Express Prepaid Card for Target has an advantage. I don't like that the ATM and reload fees are a bit high.

lucky for them there is no option for zero stars cause that is what this card deserve and the people running it as well. If i wanted to go through the hassle of opening a bank account and then getting rejected because you guys cant see the documents clearly then i would went to one of them, It a prepaid card intended to make life easier not harder as u advertise. On the phone over an hour right now trying to get them to issue my refund stupidity on there part. Now there trying to tell me that they cant give a refund cause i have already used some of that money that i put on there.

This card is not exceptional. You can find other cards that will give you 1 point for every dollar you spend and that don't charge an annual fee. This card charges an annual fee after the first year. As a company, I like American Express and the fact that you are expected to pay the card off each month. As far as being a company that does not overly add to the credit crisis we are in as a country, American Express is great. As far as this card's rewards, there are more beneficial cards out there.

The Blue from American Express is perfect for anyone who does a lot of traveling. When booking online travel, it is easy to use your points to get discounts on many typical traveling expenses, including things like rental cars and insurance. While the interest rate is kind of steep for someone with excellent credit, it is still much better than the interest rates on some of my other cards like Capital One. I would highly recommend this credit card if you are someone who has excellent credit and does a lot of traveling.

Bluebird American express is not good at all. They over hold your money blaming the merchants. I experienced that . I will not advice anybody not to take this card. For 15 days to hold somebody money is very unfair and insane

If you can get accepted, the Blue Cash Preferred Card from American Express is an excellent all-around credit card. Excellent rewards which accrue over time, 150 back in the first three months if you spend 1000 or more (easy if you use this for a large purchase), and all the normal benefits that come with being an American Express customer. This card is also great for groceries as you earn 6% back from US Supermarket purchases.


Overall, this is a really solid card. There's nothing I don't like about it. Compare to say the Capital One Journey Card and you have more benefits, a lower interest rate, and an all-around solider package than the Capital One. Apply for this one, you won't regret it!
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: the are terrible; took me 8 hours to link a bank account without success; one "supervisor" did not know which was larger 12KB or 4 MB

The American Express Premier Rewards Gold Card has been the best credit card I have ever had in my life by far! There are oodles and oodles of little perks rolled into this little card...and many of them seem to continue to build on each other. Additionally, the interest rates and fees on this card are very low. Another feature I like is that if they see charges that don't seem to be right, they'll contact you right away to make sure that they are not, in fact, fraudulent charges. Overall, if you qualify for this card, I definitely suggest you get it!
department: Premier Rewards Gold Card from American Express

content: I really like that Hilton Honors provides you with bonus points when signing up for the card as well as when you spend a certain amount within in specific amount of time, this really helped with my trip that I took to Colorado this last Christmas . I also like that the cash advance fee is only 3% and there is no fee for going over the your limit. This is my go to card; I choose it above all others since I am able to earn points at a variety of locations!

The Blue Sky from American Express card is actually a pretty good card. The interest rate is variable but usually pretty good but where this card shines is the reward points and the ability to use those towards travel expenses. If you use your card a lot this can really save you money over time and adds value to the card.


Compare to other reward cards where the points are nice but can't be as readily applied to travel expenses. If you're a big traveler this card is perfect for you, otherwise it's still pretty good. Definitely a good credit card.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: Do not get me wrong, I really like the Platinum card, but it definitely has its flaws. If I am being completely honest, I have to bring up all of the places that do not accept this card. Living in a place like New York City, the last thing you want is to be in a line at checkout and then end up holding everyone back while looking for your card to only realize that the establishment does not accept it. For example ,some places that accept Visa but not this card include my local McDonalds, Northface, and H&M. IN addition to these, there are also a lot of local mom and pop stores which would not be fair to include in this review. When I do use it, though, the points I receive back are very reasonable, and banking with it is hassle free, which American Express does a good job at maintaining.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: American Express Gold Card Rewards is an interesting system. It rewards the card owner for use with the card. I like programs like this they encourage the card owner to make purchases also the rewards sometimes one acquires is great like travels for free. The gold card offers you the choice to transfer points acquired from purchases to use in 20 different frequent traveler programs that the gold card offers. On top of the 500 leading brands in travel, gift cards, merchandise and entertainment stuff.

This card is definitely not for the average credit card user. I think an annual fee of $ 499 is outrageous. I also notice that in the terms it says "Up to" $200 Airline Fee Credit Annually. I wonder what the typical user of this credit card receives. I also notice that in order to get the statement credit you need to chose one particular airline that you plan to use every time. When I fly I chose the airline that has the best deal I'm not loyal to any one particular airline. I think that the Chase freedom card has a much better reward program. No annual fee, points on all purchase and I can redeem them on any airline I choose.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: Love, Love, Love this card. When I first got the card it took longer than I thought to get a job after I had moved state so I had no Direct Deposit going on, they still waived the monthly fee. Now that I have Direct Deposit through Pay Roll the fee is again waived. I have no problems with Direct Deposit or our Major Payroll company not using Serve.. my first paycheck went on there seamlessly. The web site tells you where your free ATM's are located so why people are paying ATM fees I don't know. They also say cash back is free, don't see the issue myself. I have paid online, over phone, in person with no problems and I have had no debit or credit problems, this card works perfectly for me. Thank you American Express!!!!!!!

American Express Skymiles screwed me. I signed up. Received the card after a couple months. Activated it. Spent the required dollar amount within the first 90 days of activation and never received the sign up bonus. I was told that the 90 days started when I applied but as I stated, I didn't receive the card in the mail for 2 months after I applied and then immediately activated it. I placed the account rewards in review with a supervisor and after a month the points were declined. These guys are useless in my mind. Don't waste your time. Go with anyone else, like Chase.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content:
This card is wonderful!!!! Went to the bank Ive been with for over 6 years to help my older "adopted son", who came to live with my family, open a simple checking account and was told no because he didnt have a new TX DL with proof he lives here....I dont have him on any bills for proof of address and he doesnt drive yet and it was so frustrating to be told NO to taking his money....so got the Bluebird card same day...he set it up on phone in car driving him to work (6 min) and when he deposited the cash on the card at WalMart it was loaded within seconds!!! The receipt even puts deposit amount and card balance for convenience. He uses it everyday and just got new official card in mail within 6 days

(not 10) and set up was fast and no comments from Bluebird came at him and no issues!! The best part is my younger son can have one too and load all his chore...birthday...and good grades money on it and its in his name and he gets to keep the card in his wallet and I do not have to be present at the counter signing anything! Its not a bank controlled card and the control has been tossed aside and now both my kiddos can learn how to be responsible with money! The only downfall is Im running to Walmart all week and I think I need gas $ direct deposited into my own Blueburd Acct!!! Lol...j/k I love how easy this card is and Im glad there is a limit on usage because it helps save save save!!!!! Thanks Bluebird. And to those of you griping about it....try and look at it in a positive way cause you could always go back to your bank and get charged for everything and only have certain times you can deposit and with Bluebird the money is never on hold! And if you are trying to deposit a personal check on your Bluebird card its a safety net I love them having to prevent fraud and theft. Checks are cash and if you cant show the green then you shoukdnt be writing a personal check...same as if you received one from a client or something else....if they took checks like that and got scammed outta money then the card wouldnt be free fees anymore now would it??? As far as the savings rewards go....check into that a little more. Yall didnt read the fine print.....I think I covered abt 25 msgs and my responses to them so have a great Bluebird Day!!! Chirp...Chirp!

This is my preferred go to card for everyday purchases. I've found that the reward tier works well with the cash back ranging from 3% on groceries, 2% on gas and 1% on everything else.


I had an experience where my card number was compromised and several charges were posted to my account that were fraudulent. Customer Service was very responsive and quickly canceled my card, expedited a replacement and gave me peace of mind by assuring me I wasn't responsible for the charges.


The online card management tools are intuitive and easy to use. I love the various sorting options that allow me to see expenses by category or by time frame.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content:
Blue Cash Everyday Amex is my backup card. I have had it for a couple of years.


Pro:

- Reward amount (3% cash back on purchases at supermarkets, 2% on select department stores/gas stations, and 1% everywhere else)

- No annual fee.

- Wide range of redemption options including cash back, merchandise, and gift cards.

- Amex offers that you can save to your card and use to receive additional cash back


Con:

- Depends on where you travel to, American Express may not be as widely accepted as Visa

- Foreign transaction cost!

- Website does not list reward earned per purchase.

- Redemption generally require a minimum of $25 in reward balance.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content:
Regarding the terms for the American Express Blue Cash Everyday Card, the length of time for the introductory rate of 0% is better than offered by my CitiBank gold card when I first enrolled; Citi rate was only for 12 months.

I would hesitate to use this American Express card because of the foreign transaction fee. I travel a lot to foreign countries, and such an additional charge would be burdensome. My Citibank did not have such a charge; but now I'm going to double check current terms to make sure that was not a new condition added.

The Amex late fee also seems excessive, and would cause me to not want the card. Due to traveling so much, there are times when I come close to missing the due date (even the grace period).

Seems odd that the cash back percentage varies depending upon the type of purchase made. I prefer cards that have a set percentage, regardless of where I shop and what I purchase. The Capital One card that I had was a set percentage on everything.

Also, the require to purchase $1000 in the first 3 months, just to get the first $100 back is a negative motivator; trying to get the customer to spend more than they might ordinarily spend is not good.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: The American Express prepaid card is a good way to teach older kids and especially college students how to use a credit card without ruining their credit if they mess up and spend too much. This will control their spending by giving them a limit and not allowing them to go over. However, the cost of reloading the card is $3 each time and if you use an ATM there is also an additional $3 charge. Fees can get quite expensive and are a waste of money in some instances. There are other cards available such as at Walmart or through a bank that will be cheaper and still allow parents to teach their children about the value of money and using credit cards. American Express cards are getting harder to use at some places but the businesses are having to pay a fee to American Express each time the business swipes a card so it would be more convenient to have a Visa or MasterCard instead of an American Express.

I applied for the Blue Cash Preferred Card from American Express a few months ago. I am very pleased with it. I have a large family and the 6% cash back reward was ideal for me with what I spend yearly on just groceries alone. There are so many other rewards you get as well with stores you may use more often. I am a happy customer and I would recommend this card to anyone.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I hate this card I did look at the fees & limits before I put my tax return on the card I seen the daily withdrawal amount which is cool but I didn't see the monthly withdrawal amount until it was to late. That was my fault but why the hell would anyone want to put the tax return on a card that you only can pull 2000 off a month?? That's them thinking everyone swipe everywhere yes it's safer but I'm trying to buy a car from a private owner and can't because of course they want cash and I already took off 2000 for the month!!!! I thought it was better than green dot but apparently not I rather pay $5 load fee $5 monthly fee and do what the hell I want with MY $$ American express didn't think about that shit clearly. They won people over with that load for free and a $1 a month but it's the worst card ever and believe it or not but alot of places don't except it!!!!! I can't wait to cut this card up I'm soooooooooooooooo done and I will never ever get this card or even a credit card from them.

Extremely slow in calculating the rewards balance. The current statement will include the rewards balance for the previous cycle. The webpage does not show the same rewards balance as the statement. It takes 4-5 days to get updated. You have to wait until you reach $25 or more to be able to redeem while with Capital One you see the rewards balance in real time and you can redeem it any time with no minimum amount limit. Overall, the feeling is that they try to delay the redemption of the rewards as much as possible. Why does it take them months to calculate the rewards balance when all other credit cards do it in seconds? On top of it, you pay $75 yearly fee for this extremely slow service :-)
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: This seems like a pretty standard credit card to me. I do like the idea of how many points you can earn at a variety of locations, but without some indication as to what those points can be redeemed for or how many points it takes, it's meaningless. For all I know, it could take 1,000,000 points to get a reward. I also dislike the foreign transaction fee. This makes me less likely to use it when I'm abroad.

My husband just signed us up for Blue Sky from American express as we plan to travel quite a bit very soon. You earn points that can be redeemed towards statement credits for airline tickets, hotel stays, and other types of travel. This is perfect for a small family that likes to travel quite a bit. We used to use our Discover card, but it only offered perks that allowed to to buy from their store, which I didn't like.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content:
Great card for my needs though I have a bank account and do not have anything direct deposited to the card.


Registration on the BB website was a breeze as was setting up instant transfer of funds from my bank checking through either the desktop or Android app. It's also equally easy and very convenient to send $ to a friend's BB card, and all with no transaction fees. Take that, Green Dot and NetSpend!


My single complaint for my limited uses is that there don't appear to be many MoneyPass ATMs outside of Walmarts in the area, and they rarely seem to be in working order, and according to staff at one store "It's never working", but to give credit, that particular one WAS working for the first time in weeks or even months on my last visit. When withdrawing funds at Non-MoneyPass Atms, the fees are obnoxiously high, but that's no different than with other cards when going off-network. My limited dealings with heavily accented customer service have been adequate but I've only had questions and no complications to solve. People should take note that a prepaid card is essentially a debit card and as such does not offer the same protections as a credit card. Losing or having your card stolen is like dropping cash on the ground. As with someone using your debit card, your money is gone and the bank can investigate for an extended time before (or without) ever compensating you for your loss - and I'm not sure why they should except where either they've been notified that the card should be cancelled and their failure to promptly do so results in additional charges, or their systems get hacked,


For my purposes, it's a great card. Maybe not so much if it's your only banking option.

American Express Serve it's a convenient fair prepaid card, and the best part is you can conveniently load it for free at Walmart and CVS. You can use this card at the grocery store and any other retail store that accepts Debit or credit transactions, and you won't get charged a fee. Pay a dollar a month and you have a good little prepaid card

The Platinum Card from American Express may appeal to the high end business user but for most people it won't be worth the money. The annual fee is a whopping $450. If your credit is good enough to be approved for the card, you can really do better although the perks may make it worth it for you.


With the card you earn 1 point per dollar spent. You also earn 40,000 points if you spend $3,000 on purchases in your first 3 months. As it is an Amex the balance must be paid off each month. There are no foreign transaction fees and they offer a concierge service. This would be useful for an international business traveler.


For comparison sake, I also looked at the Blue Cash Preferred from American Express. The annual fee on that card is only $75. The Blue card does allow you to carry a balance and the APR is between 12.99%-21.99%. With that card you earn between 1 and 6% cashback. If you spend $1000 in the first three months you get a $150 statement credit.


I'd suggest this card for international business travelers with expense accounts. For users on more of a budget the Blue Cash Preferred or other rewards cards are a much better deal.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I like credit cards just not interested in one now I like prepaid cards

i love that the amex blue cash everyday has 0% for the first 15 months and is hassle free cash back. you get $100 after you spend $1000 in the first 3 months. that is such a great reward. you earn 3% back for groceries and 2% for gas and department stores. those are great numbers. the late fees are better than some other cards around and the intro rate for transfers is also 0%. i feel like you cant go wrong with this card.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I've had an American Express credit card for 15 years. American Express is my absolute favorite credit card company. Not only do they have lots of class, but their interest rates can't be beat. And whenever I've ever had a problem, their customer service has been friendly and helpful. I also love their reward program. I always manage to earn enough points through the year to buy gift cards to give as presents at Christmas. In all, I'm very happy with American Express and can't recommend this company enough.

I had this card for a coupe of months now and I must say it was a mistake to get it. Yes, reloading the card is somewhat easy - Seven Eleven etc... But if you try to do something advanced, like getting a money transfer from someone not in the Serve system, you'll be disappointed. No such option exists. The Direct Deposit option is no good for this (and frankly, it wasn't any good for my employer, who refused to do a Direct Deposit because "Serve" is not a "real bank" and their direct deposit info is not accepted by most corporations when it comes to payroll). So, if you are looking for a truly versatile prepaid card, keep looking!

Although you can use the American Express Target Prepaid Card anywhere they take American Express, it has a major drawback for me.

Sure you can reload the card like any other prepaid card.

And it has fraud protection, Direct Deposit, no monthly fees etc.

But seriously, $3.00 to reload a card?

We have the Bluebird card from American Express and Walmart, with no reload fees and the same perks that the American Express Target Prepaid Card has.

So when choosing between Target's version and Walmart's version, it was a no-brainer.

American express has always been one of my favorite companies to deal with but when i received the green card i knew that i would be a life long customer. although it requires a good credit score its worth the attempt to sign up. they update fast and the customer service is exceptional

After reviewing this card, it seems pretty good. The interest rates are pretty low and the rewards points are good for anyone who travels. However, unlike my Discover card, they do not offer 0% interest on balance transfers. Discover card offers a lower interest rate, and you can get cash back or a statement credit with the rewards you've earned. I also think the required credit score is too high for a card that does not offer enough benefits.

I really do not any the advantage to the American Express Green Card. Maybe I am missing something, but it seems there are are far better credit cards that do not require as high of a credit score. The card I currently have in my wallet gives me 1% rewards on all purchases and it only required an average credit score. Also, with my card I can opt to not pay the entire balance every month. This card even has a $95 annual fee!

AMEX Blue Cash Everyday is my all time best credit card right from the day I start using credit cards. Even though I had credit cards, I would always say Blue Cash Everyday work in a way towards cash back. Blue Cash Everyday has detailed split up with different type of merchants and each merchant category it has defined rewards percentage, unlike other credit cards broader classifications like Grocery, fuel, drugs. Blue Cash Everyday provides standard rewards points throughout the year irrespective of any seasonal offers, which might not help most of the customers. AMEX Blue Cash Everyday provides 0% intro APR on purchases and balance transfers for 15 months which helped me in financial critical situation. The most amazing feature which makes to love this card personally is their customer service, because one fine month, my auto payment stopped because of various issues with my back and accidentally called customer service to check the status and to check my late payment fee, I was really surprised the customer server person was very polite and said "we will wave the fee, since I had good history with them, this shows they know the value of their customer and more over they know how to respect their customer to grow their business. Keep up AMEX Blue Cash Everyday!!
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I love my American Express Card. I like that I earn points for my purchases. They have pretty good rewards for the points you earn. I used my points to get a fitbit in the past which was great! I'm not particularly fond of the annual fee however, that does not stop me from using the card. I have also heard that you need to use a lot of your points for airline tickets which is kind of disappointing but all and all I do enjoy this card and what it has to offer.

Ive had the SERVE card for well over a year now. As well as the original, i prefer SERVE as it is more convenient. I have never had an issue. Customer service always has an answer for me & resolves my issues. If i do not agree with something i was charged, i can call the immediately following & have the charge instantly removed if it is still pending. Ive had all or my students refunds as well as direct deposits sent to that account. No issues! As for ATM fees, nothing is free, they are a business. 1 dollar monthly fee is waived with direct deposit, what more can you ask for? Has a awsome app that lets you do everything righy from your phone, as well as create a savings account, that you can put on auto deduct. I love my serve card!

I just received the Blue Cash Preferred from American Express and i love it! It has the best security features for a credit card i have seen so far. Getting 6% back on groceries is great. The annual fee is recovered quick so it is no big deal. On top of it all, the free Amazon Prime for a year is the icing on the cake. You will not regret this card from American Express!
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: The very definition of bait and switch. They tried to get as many people to sign up for this by doing the double rewards dollars through Savings Catcher. Now? No more rewards dollars loaded to your Bluebird card PERIOD. No more double dollars. You get something that lets you get the money off of online orders ONLY. I just lost my only reason to shop at Wal Mart. I might still keep the card, but I doubt it.

As far as interest rates go, this card isn't terrible (in that we live in a world where credit cards of 17 to 30% are considered normal). However that is about the closest thing I can come to praise for this card. It is not chip enabled so using outside the US is going to be problematic and recently AMEX decided that their interest rates are going to rise. The displayed rates may not actually reflect what you're going to get if you apply. The points program is nothing to crow about either. You get 1 point per dollar spent and a $100 credit for every 7500 points. Honestly, go with capital one or another card, this just doesn't do you much good.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: Ok this is not a card that is connected to your bank account, it is a re-loadable card. Please be aware of the fees associated with this card. For example, you have a ATM Withdrawal fee. Customer service is terrible. If you have information in regards to a purchase, you might as well forget about it because they wont help you. Well that is if you can handle being put on hold for 30 minutes. I would not recommend this card to anyone.

For someone who doesn’t do a lot of grocery shopping, the Blue Cash Everyday makes the most sense. I did the math, and found that I’d have to spend a lot more on groceries to make the annual fee of the Blue Cash Preferred worth it. The interest rate is very high, yes – but you wouldn’t want to carry a balance on most cashback cards anyway. I tend to buy Amazon gift cards at supermarket checkouts anyway, so the 3% back definitely comes in handy.


Overall, I couldn’t be happier with my experiences so far.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I have never used a credit card that does the whole point system before, preferring instead to have lower interest rates. However, as someone that is able to keep their spending in check and likes to travel, it might be worth looking at the Hilton HHonors credit card in the future. I like that there are no blackout dates, and no annual fees. The late fee is a little steep, but that shouldn't be a problem if you use the card responsibly. That cash advance rate is also a bit ridiculous, but there's an easy solution to that: Don't use a credit card to pull cash out of an ATM.

Do not use this card, customer support is a joke. They want a bank statement or so on, plus a drivers license to activate them. Do you know what they can do with all that. pluss if you send in the less damaging ones they keep saying they can not see it clear enough. All they do is blow smoke up your tail pipe and do not care about what you want.

Looking at the benefits and the fees of the American Express Gold Card, I was happy to see the points and everything you can do with your points, but to me the annual fee is really high. I know you have to pay off your balance every month with American Express, so the people who can do this may not be bothered by the high annual fee. The points are nice, but I prefer cards that give me cash back. I think this card may be good for a certain demographic, but I'm not in that demographic. I prefer a low (or no) annual fee and cash back. I also like the option to not pay my whole balance every month in case I run into financial trouble.

The American Express Platinum Business card is known for being excellent and high end. American Express has built their business on superior customer service, and this card is no exception. I have the card and really enjoy how many points you can earn easily with the rate of $1 per 1 point. Additionally, I receive a $200 airline fee credit annually. The only drawback of this card is that the balance must be paid in full each month. However, the benefits of the card outweigh this.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express overall is a good deal. This APR is nothing for 15 months which the only other time I've seen that is a Chase card. The late fee isn't bad compared to some of the others out there. The $100 bonus for $1,000 is something that is great if you are using this card strictly for rewards and paying the credit card off in full. However with the 15 month no APR, it's not as big of an issue. It is important to be careful as these deals attract people who love to buy things now and suffer the consequences later. Another thing to note is any American Express is not taken everywhere like Mastercard or Visa is. Most small businesses do not take AE, so if you shop local, you may want to avoid this card or AE in general.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: BEWARE!! BAIT AND SWITCH! AMEX is a scam! They do NOT provide reward points breakdown in any manner to the customer. They only way for you to know what you get back for points is to call and inquire about each purchase, they do not provide this for the customer to review online or on print out or in the statement! There is no way to verify you are getting the points they advertise! For example: I purchased an ipad from Apple, this is one of the "additional reward points retailers" that you are supposed to get 6% back for. When I called and did an online chat with amex they stated that I only received 1% because it was Paid for online at apple.com instead of in the actual store, even though I picked the item up AT THE STORE! Such a scam!! I spend thousands of dollars with the card and most points back was 1% even though the terms state otherwise. The places you can earn 6% back on are so few I can count them on 1 hand. Check out their terms here, even though I provided them with their terms they still refused! Many places will not take amex anyway! Your better off getting 2% for every purchase from other cc companies!

They only way for you to know what you get back for points is to call and inquire about each purchase, they do not provide this for the customer to review online or on print out or in the statement! Your better off getting 2% for every purchase from other cc companies!
