department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: Great card if you spend $6000/year (or $500/month) on groceries at regular supermarkets (I.e., Albertsons, Vons, Trader Joes, Whole Foods). Do the math. $6000x.06=$360. Subtract the $75 annual fee and you are way ahead of the AMEX Blue Anyday card. The gas at 3% and select department stores is an added bonus. We limit our purchases for this card to the foregoing. Everything else (Dining out, ATT, Cable, Costco, Target, travel, etc) goes on our Fidelity AMEX which earns 2% on all purchase to be distributed to a fidelity stock account.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: The American Express Target Prepaid card for me would be a great service, as I do a lot of shopping at the store. Being able to use as a credit card adds to the convenience for those who do not have access to a credit card. The $3.00 ATM and refill fees seems unreasonable.

I wouldn't give it any stars. Ok I got the pack from Walmart a few weeks ago to use with savings catcher. Loaded the card with $1.00. i come home to activate the card and I am told "Sorry, we are unable to approve you for an Account at this time. Thank you for your interest in Bluebird."Hello AE it is a prepaid card why can't you approve it?! So I called customer service and she said you must use a computer browser like Firefox, IE or Chrome. Doesn't work with IOS browsers. Really!!!!! you have an app for it. But guess what it won't let me activate the card on any browser. Customer Service keeps saying try again tomorrow. 12 times and nothing and no one can tell me why at American Express. I advise you not to get this card not worth the hassle and I most certainly wouldn't recommend it to even my worse enemy .

While you do need an excellent credit score to get approved for this card, the rewards and terms of the Blue Card from American Express look very good. I like that there is no annual fee and that you can earn 10,000 points when you charge $1000 of eligible purchases in your first three months of having the card, which is not hard to do. Also, it seems like a good choice if you’re an avid traveler since you earn 2x the points when booking online travel through American Express, and you can use these points for travel expenses like hotels, flights, and car rentals.

The American Express Green Card overall is a good card. You can earn 1 point for every dollar spent and sometimes 2 points for a dollar. It’s great if you are someone who travels, stays in hotels or frequently vacations. Points are transferrable to 17 different frequent flyer programs. You can also redeem points for gift cards or merchandise. I like that there is no annual fee for the first year. I do not like that after the first year the annual fee is $95 and that late fees are $38 or 2.99% of the past due amount, this can get very pricey.
Nice card , its a good small business credit card from Amex OPEN, made for small business owners
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold Business American Express Card

content: Im Hearing all types of things about this card I can't judge it because I haven't had my refund deposited yet I should get it posted today or tomorrow for now I have nothing bad to say

DO NOT PUT YOUR MONEY ON THIS CARD. I called BEFORE I did my taxes and asked about taking out a large lump sum of money. The representative told me that I could call back and request the large lump sum to be sent in a western union money transfer free of charge to me!! I called back after my refund had been deposited and told the lady what I wanted to do and she said she would set it up and that I had to call back in 24 -48 hours to get the mtcn number I called back 3 days later to obtain the number and they told me they don't offer western union and there's no way to get money off besides ATM withdrawal which is only 750 a day no answer to why they lied in the first place TWICE I can not wait to withdraw all my funds and close the account down! You can't buy money orders or get cash back using your serve card I wouldn't suggest using this card for anyone unless u are using it to pay a small bill from a place you don't trust or something these people screw you and lie to you for there own benefit. I can't believe a company as big as American Express does this kind of bull to people! AND OF COURSE IT'S EASY AS 123 TO PUT MONEY ON THE CARD FOR THESE IDIOTS

I enjoy the Blue Cash Preferred from American Express. If you are a regular shopper with your credit card, earning the $75 annual fee back in terms of rewards can come quite quickly. The 6% back on groceries is an awesome perk for any family. However, you would have to make sure you are shopping at a traditional grocery store rather than a SuperCenter. I like earning 3% at gas stations. Anything that can lower the price at the pump is helpful. The APR between 12.99% and 21.99% is very fair and better than many other credit cards I have researched lately. The current credit card that I utilize does not have an annual fee and I earn 1% back on all my purchases. I do not think it would be a perfect fit for me to change to Amex simply because my spending would not counteract the $75 annual fee but for people that have large families or spend a great deal on groceries and gas, it could add up quickly!
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: The Blue Sky from American Express card is not my favorite card due to its bonus points program. It has becoming increasingly standard for credit cards to offer some sort of sign-up bonus. This card does not. Nor does it offer any incentive financing rates for the first 3-6 months. It's fee structure is in line with other credit cards I hold with typical foreign transaction fees of 2.7% and 3% on cash back. I do like that it doesn't have an annual fee. Basically this card serves the role of the credit card (for which I give it only 3 stars) but doesn't have any of the bonus offers that people now come to expect.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: The HiltonHHonors Credit Card actually has all of the standard features I've come to expect from credit cards that offer rewards programs. Credit qualification is not too hard. They have the sign-up bonus points, they have incentive bonus programs for select purchases like gas and supermarkets, and they have a base point program for all other purchases. This is the same sort of thing I see with the Amazon rewards card or the Barnes and Noble rewards card. Probably the thing that throws off some users is that 3 points equals $1. Why not just make it 1 for 1? Fees are pretty comparable across other credit cards I own. Really the rewards are what make this card a solid one to use!

I have some serious misgivings about this American Express Serve card. While the fee structure may not seem too bad with regards to cancellation or inactivity, the monthly fee and atm fees are certainly a turnoff. I don't like the idea of wondering if the atm I'm visiting will be an "approved" atm that will allow me to forgo fees or whether I'll be slapped with a $2.50 charge. The atm fee in terms of dollars is comparable to several credit cards I own. Seriously guys, no monthly fee and clearer terms and this could be a much better card.

This is a good card however read the fine print on groceries. Besides the $6000 annual limit, if you grocery shop at warehouses like Cosco you do not receive the 6% and the same applies if you do food shopping at places like Target stores and Walmart.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: This is my favorite card because you rack up rewards points quickly. Love it!

Although the rate they allow you to earn points is relatively high compared to some cards, I prefer earning cash rather than points. The travel benefits are a huge bonus, but the annual fee is a huge turnoff for me. I will stick to my cash rewards card. I don't see an APR anywhere, I am curious how they compare to other cards.

This card actually seems like it would very nice card. It offers 0% on purchases and balance transfers for fifteen months, which is a good perk. Once you spend one thousand dollars, you get one hundred cash back, that's American Express just giving you ten percent back on your first one thousand in purchases. The rewards system is very straight forward, and is actually a fairly nice reward system giving between one and three percent cash back on purchases. The annual percentage rate is actually nice because it is based upon your credit worthiness and the upper limit on the card is fairly high, but not outrageous for someone with a below six hundred credit score.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content:
This card is one of the best cash-back cards out there. 6% on groceries up to $6000/yr is a great deal, and the 3% on gas and department stores still outpaces most other cards. If you use this card smartly, the annual fee is basically a non-factor. With my spending, I figure I"ll be able to quadruple my cash back over the card I switched from in my first couple years. As with all credit cards, none of the perks matter if you carry a balance on it: you can't beat compound interest. But use it smart, and you can get a good deal here.

One star off for the annual fee and no chip, but the perks are solid.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: Wish I could rate this at 0. Worst customer service ever. They will do absolutely nothing to try and help you, just feed you lines about why they can't help you. They say there are no hidden fees but if you use your card to purchase food at a sit down restaurant they will hold $20 on top of your bill in case you decided to leave a tip. It will take them 3-5 days to release the money. If you need a prepaid card go get a Visa or Mastercard version and pay the monthly fee. You will save yourself headaches dealing with a terrible company and won't have to worry about your card being accepted when you go somewhere.
Worst card ever they steal you're money and never answer's your questions an customer service the horrible in the nation.

I used to have a city simplicity card and a visa card which gave me so much stress that I gave up credit cards all together until my friend recommended me this Blue cash everyday card from American Express. I thought of giving it a try and it was such a nice experience. The paper work was easy and I never had to give up any confidential information. The best thing is that there is 0% APR and I receive bonuses when I make purchases through it. I really like this card and my experience with it has been incredible. I would proudly recommend this card to my other friends too.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: The American Express Target Prepaid Card is a great option for someone who is looking for an easy to use, flexible card where you can control the spending limit. In my opinion, the $3.00 ATM fee is a little on the high side, so if you plan on using this card to get cash out of the ATM, keep that in mind. What I really like about this card is the ease of adding funds to your card, as well as the fact that there is no activation or monthly fee. If you have someone who is new to using cards (sibling, child, niece/nephew, etc.), this would be a great option to show them how to use cards wisely.
There are Gold Cards out there that have unlimited cash, but you would have to be incredible to ever get one or even lay your eyes on for that matter. I loved mine.

Blue bird sucks. You can't deposit personal checks. Not at Walmart and not through their mobile app, because they use Certegy who declines checks for some vague generic reason. Customer service sucks and doesn't speak english

I like to pay my bills and shop online. If I did not have a credit or debit card this would be a great back-up. There are many people who are unable to secure a checking account for various reasons and this would be a solution for them. I prefer to use a card rather than carry a lot of cash. The $3 ATM transaction fee is a lot, especially since there will be an additional fee added depending on the institution. That is the only drawback that I can see with this card. This card would make a great gift for my nieces who love to shop online. It would also be good for them when they are at the mall.
I have the card trying to put my walmart saving catchers on it

This is an excellent card. They waive the first years fee completely and then afterwards it stays at a reasonable 125 dollars. The rewards program is very good too and you receive one point for every dollar spent. You can also get hotel credits and two times Membership Rewards points at amextravel.com. Being a frequent flier, the card works well for me and has been very convenient when booking travel. Although it does carry an international use fee, it has a lot of perks and can save you some money if you know how to use it well. So for frequent fliers and travelers, this is a good card and the rewards program is also a good one for anyone.

The Platinum card looks like a very good card for those who are big spenders and big travelers. Although it has a big annual fee, it is designed in such a way that a savvy user can take advantage of the perks and successfully save money with this card. With the 200 dollar airline fee credit and the lack of international usage fees, this is an excellent card for anyone who travels frequently. The 40,000 bonus points is also an excellent perk for the bigger spenders among us. It is a significant amount and definitely worth considering. All in all, this is a great card as long as you use it frequently and responsibly.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I have this card and I've never had an issue with getting my direct deposit. It's always there on my payday no later than 7am, but most times by about 3 or 4am. Because I get more than $500 a month deposited, I don't even have to pay the one dollar fee. I can't use it to get cash back with my purchases which used to bug me, but that bothers me a lot less since there's a MoneyPass atm right in the Walmart where I always do my grocery shopping.

My parent's recently talked me into filling out an application for The Platinum Card from American Express so that i could establish some more credit. After I was approved, I was very disappointed in this card. The fees are outrageous! I don't know how they approve someone with my income and expect them to pay $450 a year! The $38 dollar late fees are quite ridiculous too. They add up quickly, trust me. All in all, I give this card a big thumbs down and would probably only recommend it to my worst enemy. If you are rich, I guess it could work for you?
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I got the card to have my Wal Mart savings catcher bucks deposited to it. I also set up a direct deposit of $100 from my paycheck to it and this is my "Wal Mart" money :) I can see where there would be issues using this as your primary account such as not all merchants accept Amex an the holds they place when pumping gas. You probably could go inside to pay for your gas and only get what you need, inconvenient I know but what can you do. You can use any Moneypass ATM which are widely available for no fee. I love this card as a secondary account.

'm a disable on Social Security had my SS deposited on American Express card every month for the past 2 years never had any problems NONE, I been reading about some bad reviews about this card and had to write a review to tell people hoe good the card was.


All this change when we went to Europe with my wife to visit our son, my wallet was stolen with my drivers licenses among several cards, one of them was the American Express Bluebird Card. When I realized that me wallet was gone, I went to the local police within 2 hours and reported it, I also call and cancel all my cards.


Someone use the bluebird card and withdraw 500 euro $592.65 dollars also try to use it in several other places but was unable to withdraw any more money. They also made some charges on my other cards and file a dispute with them got a provisional credit with in 2 days. American express ask me to sign a declaration agreement and upload that with 10 days in order to get a provision credit until the investigate my claim that take about 45 days.


Two days later I sign and uploaded the form, 4 hours later i got an email sating that my claim was denied here is the email “Recently you inquired about your charge(s) from your American Express Prepaid Card in the total amount of $592.65.  Based upon our investigation we have determined that no error occurred and that transaction in question was authorized. Therefore this transaction is not eligible for credit to your Account. 

 

You have the right to review any documents we may have relied upon in making our determination.  You may request this information by contacting us at 1-800-555-4318.  We are open 7 days a week, 24 hours per day to service you.”


Then 5 minutes later I got another email from them that my account is close. “During a recent review of your Account, we noticed activity that was in violation of the Bluebird Member Agreement, section:


Section 22D

Due to the violation, your Account has been closed.

If you have any questions, please call Account Protection Services at 1-800-660-2454.”


We had a balance on our account about 400+ dollars, I call them and told them we 5,500 miles away from home with NO MONEY and to allow me to get the 400 dollars out. The answer was we sending you a check at the address we have on file, that in Ohio in the meantime I’m in Europe. I request to speak with a supervisor WAST OF TIME he told me we are reviewing the account and we get back to you with 48 hours. I ask how can you investigate a dispute in 4 hours NO ANSWER.


I call again and again and they keep telling me they are looking into this, in the meantime they send me a replacement card via UPS next day AIR in Ohio with the account CLOSED and still waiting for the balance that was in my account.


I had no other choice but to contact the Social Security Administration my disability payments are protected by law. There are trying to get my money back including the unauthorized transection. THIS HAS BEEN A NIGHTMARE DO NOT USE THIS CARD, THE FEES ARE LOW BUT THIS COMPANY IS A SCAM. SHAME ON THEM. THANK GOT WE HAD OUR SON TO HELP US.

I've used several prepaid cards if the past few years and I have to say this one is the best, no fees with direct deposit, easy access to your money, bill pay options on the app, and the app itself is great and easy to use. Yes there are some small buisnesses that don't take American Express but it's easy to just get cash from an ATM. I've heard some people complain about using the mobile check deposit option because of how long it takes, but bluebird says right on it's website that it can take up to 10 days for funds to be avaliable so it gives you fair warning it's going to take that long, these people obviously haven't read the fine print, and all prepaid cards will put a $100 hold on your card if you preauthorize at the pump so that's something people just have to deal with. And this card actually has checks that you can get, which is amazing and unique. I definitely recommend this card!!

Serve closed my account and refused to tell me why. I called multiple times and spoke to multiple people. I was refused the right to talk to a supervisor because 'they have the same access to the system that [customer service does]'. They deemed the reason to close an account 'proprietary information'. Any business that withholds such information from customers does not deserve business.

I still have my savings account with my regular bank but I closed my checking account because of all the usual baloney.. overdraft fees, hidden fees, etc.. I been using Serve for about six months with zero complaints. I have yet to take the big leap by having my direct deposit set up because Im a little nervous. I heard a few people say that Serve can hold the deposit for several days before they make funds available, or, that they run a test first then a month later you would get your funds. That prospect sounds really scary to me. I can't find any specific information regarding this on their website. If anyone can tell me how their direct deposit experience worked out I would really appreciate it!!

This card is BS, and here's why . . .


Okay, you get a flimsy pretend-looking card in the box that you can load at a Walmart checkout. And, surprise surprise, it works like any other card for point of sale transactions. That's pretty much where the "goodness" ends.


After that, they send you a "real" card that you have to spend time setting up and confirming and all that goes with setting up an account. So, it begins to lose it's "minimal effort" selling point pretty fast to reap any of the other functions of the card (like adding funds while NOT at walmart).


Then, expect your account to be suddenly "flagged" without being told anything or with no one calling you. You then have to call in, provide copies of the front AND backs of cards that you use to fund the account, and go through other time consuming and painful measures, just to ADD money to the card.


Is it worth it? I didn't think so, and even though I have to pay a fee when withdrawing money at non-bank ATMs, I went back to a bank just because I'm not going to let a "free" card seize up my money. It's ridiculous . . . especially requiring me to PHOTOCOPY my funding sources to send in??? Sounds like an overseas internet scam more than a bank.


Oh, and there's no obvious way to reach these people in writing. It's always going to take time on the phone. Another ridiculous thing in 2015.

Horrible customer service. They will hold your money and allow fraud to happen on your account. The customer service agents are extremely rude and unprofessional. Agents will lie to you in order to get you off the phone. Do not buy this card or do business with them if you don't want to lose money.

I've been a Bluebird user for about 2 years, and I absolutely love it. No fee's no hassle, easy direct deposit, etc. We had an issue once where my card was charged at a Target in Texas(we live in Florida), and customer service was quick to fix the issue and send us a new card. So, I suppose customer service can be a toss-up just like anywhere else. The only drawbacks are, obviously, that many places do not carry AmEx, and the $2,000 monthly withdrawal limit only becomes an issue for me during tax time. There is a fee for withdrawal, however more and more gas stations such as Wawa, Thorntons and RaceTrac are offering surcharge-free ATMs. So its pretty easy to avoid any fees whatsoever. Furthermore, I absolutely love the BB app for my phone, it's absolutely painless to use.

Over-all, I highly recommend Bluebird to anyone who would prefer not to use a bank. :)

Overall this card greatly appeals to me. The monthly fee is extremely low and almost no other fees exist, the ATM transaction fee is a bit steep, but so many money pass ATMs exist in my location that it would not be an issue for me. The free cash reloads is nice as well as the other features including direct deposit, online bill pay, and a lack of monthly fees which is a huge plus. Overall the costs are using this card are almost nonexistent so I can see this being a phenomenal gift item for a friend or family member, perhaps for a birthday or Christmas. In short were I in the market for a prepaid card this would be a good a choice as any and I would likely recommend it to a friend or family member if the need arose.

The Blue Cash Preferred Credit Card has been saving me money. I'm an avid Amazon shopper and their $100 cash back program for purchases there has been fantastic. Plus it includes Amazon Prime which is saving me a ton in shipping. Their other rewards programs that give me cash back on my groceries and gas really add up as well. Their rates are on par with the card I was using from Capital One and the perks are fantastic.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: My mother bought me this card for my birthday a few days ago. I was pretty happy because it was 50 dollars. But there is nothing special about it. It is just like any other gift card. I wonder why mother even bought it for me. I have my own debit card so it is pretty much useful. I used to love getting gift cards as a teen because of the ease of swipe access. But now it’s no big deal. So I would say that this makes a pretty good gift for pre-teens and teenagers who do not have debit cards. I use Discover credit car. It is much better than this one. I have also used the Simons American express gift card. That one has great customer service and it can be used in a lot of places at the mall.

I am reviewing the American Express Target prepaid card. What I really like about this card is that you can direct deposit your payroll checks for free. Upon reading the charges and fees I was dissatisfied with the fact that it charges you $3.00 for every ATM transaction after only one free one a month, plus $3.00 for every reload. I think that is a bit too expensive.

The American Express Gold Card is good for people who spend a decent amount of money and pay it off monthly to avoid the large late fee. I prefer my Chase card because they're more lenient on late fees in my experience. However, I love the fact that you can use accumulated points in a large amount of places and transfer them to other point programs further adding to the amount of places you can spend your points.

This is a great card that does come at a high annual cost. However, this card is for big spenders that will gain points that make up that annual fee cost. Also, you get $200 airline credit per year which is excellent. Now let's talk about the service itself. I've had American Express for year, and their customer service is the best. They offer a lot of perks with this card - you can get into airport lounges at major airports for free just by flashing this card. And if you have any problem with the card, no worry - they'll send you for free another card by UPS next day shipping. Bonus is good - 40,000 points equals about $400. You'll get this if you spend $3000 in the first 3 months. All in all, a very good card, as long as you spend enough to makeup the high annual fee cost.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I don't think this is the best card out there. Through Discover, you earn money, not points, which I think is much easier than having to trade in points for items later on. You can use the money for gift cards, statement credit and many other things. Also, I would never use a credit card that charges a yearly fee...what a waste! You are basically earning what you already paid up front. Silly.

This Starwood Amex card now comes default with a CHIP+Signature technology. I got mine with the CHIP. Love the points and how you can redeem them for a lot of things. Can use it internationally and simply convenient-!!. Thank you AMEX.
department: Starwood Preferred Guest® Credit Card from American Express

content: The Hilton HHonors Credit Card offers some really great rewards! For people new to the card, you will get 40,000 points if you spend $750 within your first three months! But that's not all! You will get 7 points per dollar for every dollar you spend at Hilton properties! You will also get 5 points per dollar spent at all eligible restaurants, supermarkets and gas stations! Finally, you will also receive 3 points per dollar on all other eligible purchases! I have to say, this is by far one of the best rewards programs I have come across! If I could give it more than five stars I would!

I use my capital one card and my visa card and they have been such a hassle that I gave up credit cards all together for a while but then I heard about this Blue Cash Everyday Card from American Express and I applied for it and wow was it a difference. The 0% APR and first years balance transfer fee-less help is just the wonderful start. I also got amazing rewards with this card such as a free Amazon Prime Membership for a year, which if you shop from Amazon alot, between the savings on shipping fees and you get 3% back on grocery stores and 2% on gas stations with 1% on everything else. How can you go wrong?
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content:
I was a little apprehensive when signing up for this prepaid method due to the bad reviews.  I've read every single concern before diving in completely and because of that I was aware of the imperfections of the product. I signed up and received my Amex serve card in 7 days as promised. My funds were easily transferred and I called customer service several times for inquires about the product. They answered all my questions in a timely matter every single time I had called. I was very pleased that I could set up direct deposit through my job, which I received payment instantly. The serve card works almost as great as a bank, but you need to keep in mind that it is still a prepaid card. So, it is bound to have a few short comings.


In my opinion the serve card is a great alternative to banks! The card looks official, nothing like the other prepaid cards that are currently out. You can view/transfer funds through the app or website. Little to no fees. You can avoid fees all together as long as you are reading everything thoroughly. Look to see every option that provided to you! You can even set up a reserve account that works like a savings.Hint to the wise do not try to deposit a check if you need funds immediately. It will take at least 6 days to process, use your own bank or another source if you can not wait for that time period. Electronic deposits and cash is the best method because funds are received instantly! Thank you Amex serve!

I needed a last minute gift. Purchased early on Christmas Eve, was told that funds would be available within the hour. I bought it so a young family member could do some online Christmas shopping. You have to register to card to someone over 18. No big deal I put it in my name. Then try to register it after I gave it. THE SECURITY CODE DOESNT MATCH THE ACCOUNT! So the card is useless, until I receive a permanent card in the mail. And my niece has been left empty handed!!! What a joke, now three days later and I am trying to get my funds back and the initial 3 dollars I loaded. Be vary careful purchasing prepaid cards. I regret this impulsive move.

I am a current owner of the American Express Platinum card. This is a great card that comes with a price. Having this card will run you $450 a year. Getting approved for this card requires the best credit and history. That being said, let's discuss the card. This card is fully insured. You are not responsible for purchases that you did not make. Furthurmore, you are protected up to $2000 on purchases. Ordered something from Amazon and it came damaged in the mail? If Amazon can't fix the problem, call Amex, and they will take care of it. Need V.I.P access to lounges and certain venues? This card will vet you in fast. Point are pretty good for rewards, however, this card does not offer as much rewards as other cards. Customer service is great. 24/7 customer service. Lost a card? They will FedEx it overnight with no charge. If you can afford to pay $450 a year, and need perks, the American Express Platinum card is definitely for you.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: Terrible customer service. Terrible company. Was told I can buy a temporary card till the perminante one came in. Then when I went to link carded the manager said it wasn't possible.. Needless to say when I get my card I'm going to withdraw my funds and cut the card. worst company ever and Lexie he or she was terrible at customer service and getting me to a manager

This card offers pretty awesome perks like 40,000 points after you spend $3,000 on the card in the first three months. You also get a $200 Airline Fee Credit annually. However, interest rates are high on this card, and there's a high annual fee.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content:
The Amex EveryDay Credit Card from American Express is for cardholders with an Excellent credit score (FICO score above 720). With this card, there is a 0% interest rate on purchases during the first 15 months of usage, as well as a 0% interest rate on transfers during that same time period. The regular interest rate afterwards ranges from 12.99-21.99$ depending on your past credit history, and while this is slightly high, good credit can keep it closer to the minimum. There is no annual fee with this card, no annual fee for additional cards, and no maximum overlimit fee. However, the maximum late fee is a hefty $38, and the maximum penalty APR is 27.24%. The grace period is 25 days, which is more or less the median time frame for most cards. Additionally, there is Smart Chip technology in this card, which is a special kind of payment verification.


With regard to rewards, this card gives one year of Amazon Prime membership, as well as 10,000 Membership Rewards points after you have made $1,000 worth of purchases within the first three months. You do get automatically billed every year after that so if you do not want to continue the membership you have to remember to cancel. If you make 20 or more purchases during a given billing cycle, you can earn 20% more points on those purchases. US Supermarkets earn you double the points until you've reached $6000 in purchases there, and then reverts back to 1%. Other purchases earn you just 1%.


For those who travel, there is a Membership Rewards "Pay with Points" program that allows you to pay for part of or all of a flight and prepaid hotel stays; however, there is a foreign transaction fee is 2.7%. You can transfer points to over 20 frequent traveler programs. Second, there is car rental loss and damage insurance, and depending on specific details, you can be covered for a stolen or damaged vehicle. Third, there is a Roadside Assistance Hotline, though you have to pay for third-party service costs. Fourth, there is a "Global Assist" Hotline that helps with sudden changes in plans that you may need guidance with when you travel more than 100 miles from home. Last, there is travel accident insurance. This covers accidental death and dismemberment in specific circumstances. Overall, this is very good coverage for those who travel and want some kind of benefit that goes beyond simple monetary rewards.


When shopping, the card can add up to one year added to the manufacturer's original warranty, as long as it is a warranty of five years of less. If a store won't take an item back within the first 90 days of purchasing it, you may be refunded the full price if eligible. There is purchase protection, dispute resolution, and "ShopRunner," a 2-day shipping program with free returns. The Membership Rewards Program allows you to use points for rewards with over 500 brands, and there is no limit to the rewards you can earn. This is a great card if you travel and also make purchases regularly. If you have excellent credit, as this card requires, you shouldn't have a problem with any kind of late fees.
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content: I have had my card for several years now. Recently my card was comprimised, hacked I guess is the term, and used at a Targe sore in Brooklyn, NY. I contacted
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content:
My wife and I travel a lot so the Gold Delta Skymiles Credit Card has been very useful in reducing our travel costs overall.


It was easy to apply, we got our card in the mail within a week, and the terms have been pretty good. Interest varies but is still pretty mild overall, the reward points really add up over time and you can put them towards flights.


The rest of the terms are pretty standard fare, decent grace period, normal late fee but as long as you are judicial about that you shouldn't have issues.


By itself it's a pretty decent card but it really shines when you're a frequent flier.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: The Amex Green card has a good rewards program. I prefer not to have a card that needs to be paid in full each month. American Express Blue is a better option that will let you carry a balance if needed. Also, the annual fee is high on this card.

The Blue from American Express® Credit Card card is overall alright. I personally don’t use these things often but it seems to be about overage. The late fees can add up if you do not pay attention. I normally do not suggest getting a credit card but if you really need one, this one is alright. I have not had any problems with this one.

Gold Delta SkyMiles® Credit Card from American Express


For those who find themselves traveling a greater than average amount, the Gold Delta SkyMiles Credit Card is a fair option with great benefits in the beginning of membership. Unfortunately the early sign up bonuses you can earn in the first few months of membership are far better than what you can earn early on. Customer service at American Express seems to be hit or miss. Sometimes you will find someone who will pull out all the stops to help you, other times you might find yourself scrambling and frustrated to get the assistance you need.

Cost


Balance Transfer Fee: For all incoming credit card balance transfers into your Gold Delta SkyMiles Credit Card account you will be charged 3% the amount of the balance being transferred. Compared to other cards with a Balance Transfer Fee this fee is on the low end of the amount charged per Balance Transfer:


Annual Fee: The first year, users of the Gold Delta SkyMiles are exempt from the annual fee. Thereafter the Annual Fee is $95.00


Pros


Two Bonus Opportunities In The First Three Months: During the first three months of being a Gold Delta SkyMiles Credit Card, there are two bonuses that users can earn by using the card. First, if you make a purchase with Delta within the first three months you will receive a fifty dollar statement credit. The big reward is the ability to earn 30,000 bonus miles by spending $1,000 using your new card.


Earn Double the Miles When Making Delta Purchases: When making Delta purchases with your Gold Delta SkyMiles Credit Card, you earn two miles for every dollar spent.


Earn Miles Wherever You Spend: When using your card for non-Delta purchases you receive one mile for every dollar you spend.


Free Checked Luggage: For all Gold Delta SkyMiles cardholders, the first piece of checked luggage is complimentary on each flight.


Priority Boarding: All Gold Delta SkyMiles cardholders are entitled to priority boarding when flying on Delta.


Cons:


Higher Than Average APR: Like most rewards credit cards the Gold Delta SkyMiles credit card does have a higher APR that ranges from 15.24% - 19.24%. However, compared to the other rewards credit cards, the APR of the Gold Delta SkyMiles Credit Card is fairly standard. The penalty APR of 27.24%


Occasional Inability To Use Card: It's common knowledge that a select number of businesses do not accept American Express cards so users should make sure to have an alternative form of payment available.


Dropping Value of Rewards After Your First Few Months: While the card does offer some great rewards, unfortunately the time to get the best rewards is right after you become a cardholder. After that the amount of miles earned per dollar spent is pretty benign unless you are making a purchase specifically with Delta.


Other Numbers:

Max Late Fee: $38.00


Grace Period: 25 Days


Cash Advance Fee: 3% (Minimum $5.00)


Cash Advance Rate: 25.24%


In Conclusion:


The Gold Delta SkyMiles Credit Card from American Express overall falls into the middle of the middle of the pack compared to the other rewards credit cards. It's main issues is the fall in values of the rewards after your first few months as a cardholder. Also there are many other airlines rewards cards that have a better miles to dollar return than this card. To be fair however, many of those cards have much higher fees and APRs. Finally a common theme with the Gold Delta SkyMiles Credit Card seems to be problems with American Express' customer service. All things told I'd give the card a D in terms of letter grade and 2 stars.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I love the one free year of amazon prime - great marketing for amazon prime because I will probably purchase it for next year! The 6% at supermarkets is the best I have seen around. And on top of that, 3% at gas stations and department stores which pretty much sums up all of the purchases I would be making on a credit card. Not to mention, 0% for the first 15 months. I am extremely happy I found this card and will probably end up making it my main credit card from now on.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: This card is fantastic. Sure, you can't use it everywhere, but I've found that many places are accomodating. I used the 0% APR to purchase an engagement ring for my wife, and the additional cash back was a nice bonus. The only downside is that you need to wait until you rack up $25 in cash back before you can redeem.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content:
All around, this is a pretty solid card to use should you find yourself staying in Hilton Hotels more often than not. The fact that the Hilton HHonor Credit Card has no annual fee makes the card worth it alone. The real benefit of this card, though, is the HHonor points. After accumulating the points for some time on this card, I used the points to book a nice little room in the Hilton Grand Vacation Suites, just a block off the Strip in Las Vegas!


Now down to the brass tacks. The rate should you not pay off your balance is a bit high, but all credit cards will have a rate much higher than you’d like. The one part I will have to knock the card on is the 2.7% foreign transaction fee. This alone keeps me from making this my primary card as I travel often to Europe. Overall a pretty solid card if you pay your balance.

My Card Is great But however has many draw backs Like some stores not taking American express anymore and this is becoming a problem However No fees makes it a great choice for direct deposit and linking to working at home sites. I would suggest it to anyone with little to , none , or bad credit !

My sister lives in Maine I live in Florida and that is almost a 3 day road trip.I visit a few times each year.With the Blue Sky card from American Express, it seems every time I go I always save a little bit more each trip.Whether I take a road trip or fly, Blue Sky card really saves me a lot of money.I also Like that I have points that build up with certain purchases and they can be used just about anywhere like a hotel or a rental car.I like that there is no annual fee and I also like that you may pay all at once or over time.The APR is just a tad too high,but every dollar saved really adds up over time and the more I use this card from American Express,the more money I have saved, plus the points that build up is the perfect card for anyone that does a fair amount of travelling.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content:
What a card, the charge card is super for keeping up with monthly expense and it keeps you alert simply because it will not carry a balance over from month to month. This has made it a lot easier to budget, I've put myself in a better financial situation because you can see where you are wasting money over the long run.


I do always use this card and pay it off monthly. AMEX will send you a bill that contains the full amount due. There is a yearly fee, but it's not that bad because if you compare it to what the credit card companies will end up charging you even if you don't carry much of a balance.


I do earn points that I have used for tickets to Hawaii. I will use it for everything that I have to buy, but a credit card is easier and more convenient than cash.

American Express Serve Prepaid card is great because it only costs $1 per month and IS prepaid. I think prepaid is great because it can help people who do not have great credit. It also helps keep me 'accountable' because I am not going to go into further debt with this card. I can use direct deposit free of charge and I have the great AMEX 'power' that is widely regarded as a high status card. Most importantly this card is functional to be used at many retail shops and online as well. Ultimately I think the free ATM withdrawals at over twenty four thousand ATMs is outstanding and is a service to be applauded. I love the card for that reason alone as ATM fees are so annoying and so wasteful in my humble opinion. This card is an asset that can be highly functional and valuable in its usability and low cost to maintain attributes.

The Platinum Card from American Express is just alright. I am not too keen on the fee I have to pay of $450 each year to have the card. I have Discover Card as well and they are much better with not nickel and diming you for everything you do with the card. I guess that is the price you pay for getting amazing rewards back. I spend a lot so the points really add up fast. I really like the extra features the card provides like the ability to make a last second reservation at a nice restaurant around town. I do not get that perk with the Discover card and that is a really nice benefit to have since life can be hectic sometimes. Overall I like the card but make sure you read the fine print so you understand both the positives and negatives associated with becoming a Platinum Card Holder.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: The yearly fee after the first year is simply too high and even though this card is geared towards travelers, it still charges a foreign transaction fee. Also the balance has to be paid in full each month or you will be charged yet another fee. For a card that requires excellent credit, I see no advantages. I would be better served to stick with my Blue or just use my BOA card when I travel.

This credit card offers a few interesting points, the cash advance fee and the 1% cash-back/points are very nice features. The Chase Freedom card however has a lower max APR, and better introductory bonuses for cash-back. I have had a Chase Freedom credit card for some time now, and their customer service, and protection monitoring are excellent. Chase Freedom also offers a lower cash advance rate, as well as lower foreign transaction fees, which are great for military/sea-merchants.

CUSTOMER SERVICE NOT KNOWLEDGEABLE. I wanted to used the card for my daily spending ,so I could do a better job of budgeting. I am actually happy with my personal bank. First off it takes at least 5 days to transfer money on to card from a bank acct. (even though I saw it sent to SERVE card two days after requested I can't use it till after 5) Then, I made a mistake in entering my debit card # and it blocked my SERVE card. Even though they had my bank acct # and had gotten money successfully from there, they blocked all money coming from my bank. I had set up auto transfer and my bank sent them $200 ,but it was not on my card. I called and customer service said it was fine the money would clear. I got an email requesting all this information (my id,copy of the front and back of my card bank statements). I called customer service "oh your acct is fine" I had to tell them there was a problem. I was on hold 15 min before she confirmed I was right. I decided not to send the info because it is not that serious for me. But, called again to ask for an address so I could have my bank mail them a check (since it takes a week anyway) customer service didn't know A MAILING ADDRESS. I was done with the card ,but I needed my 200 back my bank sent. One call 2 min and my bank started the process and put it back. If you want to use this card to help with your problems spending or balancing out your money it will only make it worst.

The Blue Cash Preferred Card from American Express is an excellent card. The first strength in this card is that you get a $150 bonus for starting up the card, which is excellent. You will earn 150 in reward points in the first 3 months if you spend $1,000. The reward bonuses can be redeemed as a statement on the credit, which is also excellent. You get 6% back for supermarkets, 3% for gas stations and select department stores, and 1% for other purchases. All in all, this card is excellent if you like to get the best bang for your buck.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I applied for the Gold card on the Delta website while buying tickets. The application was approved and said it would be sent to me within 7-10 days. When the purchase screen came up the Gold card number did not populate so I had no way to use it. When I called American Express service I was told i had to wait until i received the card in the mail. They said they were unable to give me the number over the phone and could not cancel the card. I asked to speak to a manager in new accounts who said she cancelled the card and I could reapply and get the number online to use at time of purchase. When I did this I was, once again, not given the number online to use at the time of purchase. Grrrr. I was hoping I missed something the first time. So now I applied for the same card twice in a day (which will ding my credit score) and no American Express agent was able to solve my problem. I bought the tickets with a Visa and earned none of the promotional promises. As an American Express card holder for over 20 years I am very disappointed in their service and misleading online promotional promises.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: The Hilton HHonors card has many great benefits especially for those of us who are frequent travelers. If you plan to spend much in the first several months, there is a 40,000 bonus for spending $750 in the first three months. There is also a bonus where you an earn 7 points for purchases within the HHonors portfolio brands, 5 points for US Restaurants, Supermarkets, and Gas Stations, and 3 points for all other purchases. If you are a frequent traveler, you can book your stay with this card and earn 500 bonus points on any hilton honors room stay worldwide. Great card with great advantages.

I've had my AmEx Gold for 10 years and haven't had a single problem. There service is outstanding. From their phone reps, to managing your account online. They really do provide a better service than most other credit card companies. I have been really satisfied and thus why I've kept my Gold Card for this long. Sure they may not be accepted everywhere, but really most of the places are starting to accept them now and I always use my AmEx whenever I have a chance to. Their Customer Service is top-notch, I had actually bought an espresso machine online and it turned out the seller tried to scam me and didn't ship the item.

First I tried funding the card from my bank account, It took 5 business days for the money to make it to my Serve card. Then I did the direct deposit, and that worked wonderfully. Then I tried funding my Serve card from my debit card attached to my checking account. I noticed it funded the card almost immediately and took the money from my checking account immediately, then two days later I noticed a "debit hold" on my debit card for the same amount I had transferred. The debit hold was there for 3 days causing a check I had written to be returned for insufficient funds. I called my bank who told me I needed to call AMEX and get them to release the debit hold. I called AMEX Serve customer service and the person I spoke was all helpful telling me the funds had cleared and are on my Serve card. I explained to her it was not the funding on my serve card that I had an issue with, it was the debit hold they placed making the transfer I made double what I transferred. She promptly put me on hold for 10 mins came back and told me that they only pulled the original amount out of my account. I told her yes the money was physically taken from my account in the correct amount but AMEX had the same amount held via a debit hold. She put me on hold again this time for 20 plus mins, came back on and said there was nothing she could do about releasing the debit hold.

I have had 'points' cards in the past and I really enjoy them. You completely forget until you're minded on your statement and all of a sudden you can get a couple 'free' gift cards to spend on dinner or a favorite store. I wish they'd tell you what the points were actually worth though. 40,000 points seems like a lot, but if you need 50,000 points to redeem them then its just a whole lot of nothing.


There's a $200 annual airline credit, but the purchaser of the card needs to declare the one airline they can use it on? Why? Why is that even a thing? Why can't they use the credit wherever? That seems like one of those catches that keep you from ever ACTUALLY being able to use a benefit. That's just Murphy's Law. When you need a flight, that $200.00 credit will still not make the flight you CAN use it on cheaper than that flight over there. So, it becomes pointless and frustrating.


Ultimately, though, the $450 annual fee is STEEP. Right there, the platinum Card from American Express is a no-go. Why? You don't have a preset spending limit, but you can approve or deny purchases? So, there ARE limits on spending. If I don't have that one advantage, why would I ever pay an annual fee don't require them?
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I've had excellent experience with this card. The rate is okay. But the most important thing is having American Express behind you. They noticed some strange charges on my card and called me up. They took care of cancelling my card and issuing a new one. Saved me tons of grief.

I just started using the Blue Cash Preferred card and I love it. I just got my $100 bonus and 1 free year of Amazon Prime because I spent $1,000 in the first 3 months! The only thing I don't like is that there is a $75 annual fee.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: these people are a bunch of crooks. I went to withdraw $500 and ATM malfunctioned. bank where ATM is located confirmed that the withdrawal was never made. They debited my account on the 4th, They haver received all info requested. the bank sent them the fax they requested on the 4th. We spoke to them together. The next day the bank audited the ATM, They advised AMEX that in fact the transaction never happened. I was told they'd resolve it on the 8th, on the 8th they told me they'd resolve it on the 12th, today they told me they'd resolve it on the 17th but it could take 45 days, The supervisor I spoke with tonight said that he felt bad but he deals with these types of issues many times a day because their Dispute team never responds and even he is not allowed to contact them directly. DO NOT SUBSCRIBE TO THIS CARD!!

I recently applied for the Blue Cash Every day Card from American Express. I received approval in the mail a few days after application, with a generous credit limit. The introductory 0% APR for 15 months is a wonderful "plus." The cash-back bonuses combined with the extended grace period are a perfect combination for using this card for gas, grocery's or anything else. It also allows you to carry a balance, which is a great perk for those unexpected large expenses such as car repair bills, or a new furnace. I've been a member since July, and have been very happy so far.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

When call customer service they will answer in the philippines, some times you will get lucky and get some one that cares, most of them are women the ones they are respectful. I got a google wallet I am hope for good services.

I have had this credit card since 2008. In the years of using it, my credit line limit went from $200 up to $1100 limit. This has probably been one of the few credit cards I have ever owned with not an insanely high interest rate. This may or may not have to do with the current limit set by American Express. Other credit lenders have given me up to $10000 credit limits but the interest isn’t the best. I believe I will always continue to have this card in my possession. It’s nice for when I may have an emergency.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I would categorize this as a "mediocre" card. It does come with a decent balance transfer and a respectable 1% cash back on anything you buy. If you can spend 10K in the first 3 months the bonus is excellent. There isn't an annual fee unlike some American Express Cards which is a plus. I still would prefer either the Citi Double Cash Back Card or the Fidelity Rewards Card which earn 2% on everything you buy.

A really poor credit card. The balance needs to be paid in full each month and it carries a $95 annual fee after the first year. The 1% cash back is only so-so. Instead I would recommend the Fidelity Rewards American Express Card. It doesn't have the annual fee or pay in full balance each month and it earns 2% cash back on everything you buy.

I have had no issues with this card. I use it specifically to get the Sky Miles. I used to fly several times a year and now a little less than that. I have been able to get a number of my flights covered or nearly covered by using the Sky Miles program through American Express. I use the card to make the majority of my purchases so that I can rack up those mileage points. I have had no trouble using miles and have not had any issues with poor customer service. I would recommend American Express Delta Sky Miles credit card to friends and family, especially those who would like to travel.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: took 4 months to get my card... and 4 different departments to find out what was wrong! I definitely advise NOT getting an american express serve card!
I have the original amex prepaid card. Decided to get SERVE. Never arrived. Called and put on hold for 23 minutes. Sticking with old card!

Worse experience ever David answered the phone call I asked my question and he put me on hold for an hour and. 10 minutes; then he did a cold transfer to another dept who advd she couldn't assist me. She transferred me back to CSR who wanted me to reverify all the information again after a hour and forty minutes on the phone we finally got the issue resolved. I will never use this card again

The Hilton HHonors Credit Card comes with a nice sign-up bonus of 40,000 points and is easy to earn by spending $750 on the card within the first 3 months. The interest rate is a little high and you could get a better rate with a USAA card if thats important to you. There is no annual fee on this card. This card is especially useful if you frequently stay in Hilton hotels as you earn 7 points per dollar spent on their hotels.

I think The Platinum Card® from American Express is a really good card in terms of the rewards and the no foreign transactions fees. However, the only thing I didn't like is the annual fee of 450.00. I believe it is too much for a credit card but you pay for the credit card perks.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: This is decent compared to my MasterCard Gold. The American Express Platinum Card seems to have a high fee, but low late charge. I'd say give it some thought.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I do not like the Serve account. First they sent out a batch of cards that had errors on the card. I could not get access to my money for two days. Next, I wanted to pay two bills through my card automatically. I have plenty of money on the card and they rejected the payment and I almost lost my auto insurance. The third thing is that I took my son to Appleby's and in case no one else knows this but they expose how much you have on the card (your balance) on the receipt. I noticed AMEX for Serve will actually state on the receipt for Appleby's how much you have left in your account for the server and everyone to see that is putting money into the cash register. So, if someone hacks my card they will know how much to spend. What a terrible thing for a company to do. AMEX does not care what private information of yours they put out there.

I like the hassle free cash back, which contrasts the Capitol One card I formerly have used. Although I think the interest rate on the cash advance is a little high. I don't care for the cash back only being redeemed as reward dollars in the form of statement credit. I like the fact that there is no yearly fee. I think if used correctly and responsibly, the Blue Cash Everyday Card from American Express could be a very good card to use on a regular basis.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: Even though they advertise 0% on balance transfers, there's a (large) hidden fee in the fine print. Terrible customer service and really shady, false advertising. Not that I'm surprised...
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I currently have a Capitol One credit card and I must say that this Blue Cash Card from American express is great. It has a low APR and you get an awesome $100 bonus on top of that. And the best part is that there is no annual fee and all the benefits are still included. Would recommend to anyone.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: What I really like about the Blue American Express card is that it only charges a 3% balance transfer fee. That perk combined with no introductory interest and the point system makes it a no-brainer to switch from the Capital One Platinum Card. My Platinum card does not give me points, never offered 0% interest to me in all the 8 years I've been a customer... in fact, CO's only offer to me was a jacked up interest rate. Why not switch to Blue?

As someone who kind of lives paycheck to paycheck and someone who used to get hit by NSF fees I decided to end my bank accounts. Last year I got with more than $400 NSF and bank fee. This year I got hit with over $100 in NSF and late fees. That is more than $500 in NSF right there... Why was I hit with so many you maybe asking? Thinking that the charges to my card would "bounce" for the charges that occur monthly (phone bill, etc.) while I spent some in a fee places without recognizing that the "bounce" only occurs when you sign a 1 month contract each month at a physical bank location. For me $12 for a whole year sounds good to me. Though the problem with this card is that I just recently received this card and never used it. About a week latter I received a e-mail from AMEX saying that this card had some sort of error on it so they decided to send me a new one. The shipping is SLOW because it will take them something like a week to ship it to me. So officially 2 weeks of waiting for a card that works to come in.
I don't like to reload the card by direct deposit.

Cash Back on Groceries:

This card first caught my eye because of the benefits it offers. It offers 6% back on grocery purchases. This is attractive because it comes back to you in cash - not in points or air miles that limit how you use them. 6% back in cash is great, especially because of the wide variety of items you can get at most grocery stores now. Think about getting gift cards to starbucks, amazon, or some other place at a grocery store and getting the cash rewards on it. You can also get 3% cash back at gas stations and department stores. That is essentially 9 cents off per gallon if gas is priced at 3.00 per gallon. Another perk is the sign up bonus. You can get 100 reward dollars after you make $1,000 worth of purchases in 3 months. This might seem like a lot if you don’t plan on using the card much, but I’m sure you could think of a way to get up there. Between buying my books for school, paying off some utility bills, and buying monthly groceries, I was almost there.


Introductory APR:

The introductory APR of 0% was another big attraction for me. Usually, with a trait like that, you would expect the APR to be huge when it kicks in after 15 months. Depending on your credit, it might be. The APR can be between 12.99% and 21.99% based upon your creditworthiness. The low end of that range is very desirable, so if you have good credit, this is a very attractive feature. Even with mediocre credit, the middle range of this APR is not that bad, and is comparable to other cards you might find.


Other Perks:

The additional benefits are also nice perks that are valuable all by themselves. Roadside assistance, car rental insurance, fraud liability, travel insurance, purchase security, price protection, and emergency support are all things you get with this card. I thought there would be some kind of catch, but these are all standard features.


Drawbacks:

Of course, nothing can be perfect or too good to be true, so there are a few bad traits of this card. The annual fee of 75$ is a high one. This can be negated if your spending habits allow you to rack up that much in cash back. So this is one thing to consider before you apply, and one thing to keep in mind after you get the card. Consistent use is necessary in order to make the fee worth it. This trait makes the card one that you will want to use frequently, not one for emergencies or occasional expenses.

If you travel a lot, watch out for the foreign currency transaction fee of 2.7%. This may not seem like much, but it can add up quickly if you are not careful. You will also want to consider how much money you spend on groceries because there is a cap on the 6% back. The limit is $6,000 per year. After this, the reward drops down to 1%. This limit is irrelevant to me, as I usually only buy groceries for myself.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I hate this card and the customer service worse card ever!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! HATE THE CUSTOMER SERVICE THEY SENT ME A REPLACEMENT CARD AND IT TOOK 4 DAYS ONCE I RECIEVED IT THE CARD DID NOT WORK CALLED IN TO GET A REPLACEMENT THEY SENT ME THROUGH ALL THIS BS AND PUT ME ON HOLD ME A MANAGER 30 MIN THEN 45 MINS THEN 22 MINS. I HATE THIS CARD GREEN DOT IS MUCH WALGREENS AND ACE CARD ARE BETTTER THAN THIS FREE TRASH KEEP IT.

If you do not have a Blue from American Express credit card, it is time to get one. Who does not like receiving benefits for spending money? Not only does "Blue" provide an incentive point reward for every dollar you spend in the first three months, but it doubles points when booking with online through the American Express travel program. The American Express Green Card is a charge card that has to be paid in full each month so its somewhat different than a lot of cards. The 1% rewards is on the low side for rewards cards and the $95 annual fee is going to eat a lot of the rewards. Other cards, like the Quicksilver, offer higher rewards without the fee.
I love my card great costumer service, and I also get reward points on things.
With this Credit card from American Express has the best of the best. The best Security and the best rewards out of all the credit cards I have. I love this card.

content: I really like my Amex EveryDay card for the reason that it is a card that I can use everyday and then pay off. I also earn bonuses, like 10,000 points after making $1,000 in purchases for the first three months, which I did easily. I can also earn double points at supermarkets, where I’m frequently using my card. Also, unlike many American Express cards, there is no annual fee on this card, and the intro rate on purchases for 15 months is 0%. My only complaint is that not everywhere takes American Express so sometimes I am limited as to where I can use this card.
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content: I got this card because the benefits appealed to me. There are a lot of award options. If you use your credit card in order to get rewards then this is the card for you. Also, if you are having problems with your card, in my experience, they have had great customer service. They are really willing to help you. Lastly, in order to get this card you must have good credit so pay attention to that. Overall, a good card and would suggest it.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: Worst card and customer exprience. Suspended my account today and will put you through the ringer to validate ID and ownership of accounts. Documents requested included birth certificate/passport/DL/bank account statement/picture of front & back of credit card.....I am not confident that AMEX will keep my account safe or that agents will not share my CC# among "friends"

This Blue Sky card is one of the best I have ever had from American Express. I would say it is geared mainly toward retail use, and with no annual fee how, I am pretty impressed. The APR could be a little bit lower, and I am a little bit upset that they will allow a max late charge of up to 37 as I think that is a little bit on the steep side.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: First thing I notice about the Hilton HHonors Credit Card is that to get the 40,000 bonus points it is very easy. You only have to spend 750 dollars in three months, that is not bad at all. I really like that is does not have an annual fee, I am completely against all annual fees for credit cards. It seems very easy to earn points and there are ways to earn different amount of points. I think that the max late fee is a little high at 37 dollars but there is a grace period of 25 days so that somewhat makes up for it. This is similar to my Discover card but with my Discover card I get cash back instead of points but either way I think it is nice to know you are getting something, whether it be points or cash back when you make a purchase.

The American Express Serve card is one heck of a prepaid card! I had a Visa prepaid card before I signed up for this one and the fees were incredibly high, which is the main reason I wanted to switch. Now that I have the American Express Serve card, I am kicking myself for not having switched earlier. The fees are incredibly low, there is free unlimited customer support. I have never had a problem using the card with any merchant, including at hole in the wall establishments and mom and pop gas stations. I have always been able to get cash out using this card at ATMs. If you want a prepaid card, I challenge you to find one that can beat the awesome low rates of this card.
i love the fact that this card offers 0% for 15 months. I also love the fact that i get so many points with amex that I can use it for my travel and everyday purchase
department: The Amex EveryDay® Credit Card from American Express

content: This is the worst card/company I have ever worked with. To save the monthly fee I moved my direct deport to Serve and a week after my direct deposit posted they froze, then closed my account for a "card agreement violation" saying the account was funded from a card owner other than the card holder. In accurate, tried to get a supervisor, they won't get one on the phone, rather they say it will be 24-48 hours for one to call you. When I did finally get a supervisor, they could not explain how I violated the policy only that I did. They are still holding $1100 of my money with no status on when they will wither unlock the card account or return my money....avoid this card like the plague as their customer service is HORRIBLE.

The thing I dislike about this card and most American Express cards is the international transaction fees. I always though of AMEX as a travel card but very rarely is it beneficial to travel with. I lost my debit card in Spain and was left with only this AMEX that cost me big.

Not so good now due to the higher fee: used to be $120 and now $195 with less perks. they have removed the companion ticket which was the best thing about the card. I would recommend getting the gold delta card. not worse spending the extra $100 for no reason.

content: I totally love ths card.one click to reload from my phone, and if I loose my card I can recover my money with another click. Also like the reserve and sub accounts, perfect way to protect your money.
This card is great, the customer service is horrible.
this fucking card takes forever to cash a check!!!!! NO DO NOT SUBSRCRIBE. its the biggest scam in the market.

Blue from American Express has some nice features. The no interest for 15 months is a nice touch and if you are a traveler it looks like a card to have because one can earn x2 points when booking travel and those points can be used to book flights in the future. My Capital One card does not have any feature like this as far as doubling points if booking for travel.

I would give zero stars if I could. I had the worst experience with this card. They sent me an email saying if I applied and spent a certain amount of money within 3 months I would receive 50,000 bonus points along with some other perks. After I fulfilled the requirements within the 3 months, they only gave me 35,000 points. I literally clicked on the link from the email I received so I know I signed up for the offer. But when it came down to it, they only gave me 35,000 points. I would never have applied for this amount of points. After 3 disputes they refuse to give me the points I deserve. I have stopped using this card and want to let everyone know to BEWARE if you receive the 50,000 point email. It is a fraudulent way to entice you to apply. DO NOT get this card!
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I have used this card before and I loved it. I prefer not to use traditional banks, and this card has made that so much easier. I can easily reload money to the card, and at $3.00 per reload it is much cheaper than many of the other cards available. I can use the card to pay my bills online, reduce the amount of cash I have to carry, and use it for online shopping. For someone who doesn't want to store their money with a bank, this card is perfect. I even have my paycheck deposited directly on my card, and save myself a trip to the store to reload. The Target prepaid card is definitely one of the better prepaid cards on the market right now.

This is a terrible card. They can never find your direct deposit for 48-72 hours after it's been sent, if done on Friday you won't get it until tues or Wednesday. Customer service puts you on hold to tell you they have no idea what's wrong. Then you find out they have had it the entire time, but won't release your money for what ever crazy reason they feel like. Don't waste your time or money with them. Even if it's a free ATM they charge you $2 along with whatever that ATM charges. If you use the card as debit they charge you. Your better off with the rush card or just cashing pay checks at a check cashing spot then dealing with the mess that comes with these people.

I got the serve card & actually this have been the worst experience ever. You can get your money out half the time. Then I lost my card, called serve on Friday. The lady said I could get a money gram with in 3-4 hours. Then I called back the next rep said the code was still not available to wait a couple of more this was @ 10:00pm. Then I called Saturday @ 2:00 still no code. Finally I called @ 6:00pm on Saturday a guy finally stated that it takes 24-48 for them to get a code for money gram. Which I said the first lady could have told me that @ first and I wouldn't have keep calling. NOW, I called this morning come to find out the first lady never did the request for the money gram.


Diane which is the supervisor state that she will request the money gram & call me back with the code TODAY (yeah right I believe that when & if she calls).


This card is the worse prepaid card that I ever used. I get I will going back to netspend.com.

This sounds great! :


$200 Airline Fee Credit

Select a qualifying airline and then receive up to $200 a year in statement credits when incidental fees, such as baggage fees, flight-change fees, in-flight food and beverage purchases, and airport lounge day passes, are charged by the airline to your Business Platinum Card Account.*

"Our records indicate you have already selected an airline and are not eligible to change your selection at this time.

Read well....they only allow this benefit for ONE selected airline and cant not modify till january next year...that means if you have selected in your profile AA and your trip error was with DELTA ..you wont get any fee credit.

content: Best customer service ever !!
