The only thing that is inconvenient is the $1 monthly fee. It would be nice if that could be waived. Most other debit cards do not have that type of fee.

No annual fee AMEX card. YAY-!!!! Only downer, 2.7%foreign fee and no CHIP+Signature/PIN at this time.(quite disappointing being an Amex-WORLD CLASS)

So, traveling outside the USA with this card can be useless (unlike Bank of America Travel Rewards turns out better with chip+sign & no FTF) internationally. All else should be good to go for Blue Sky, no brainer-!!!1
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: I had some good experiences with this card and some bad. I loved the fact that I could just walk into cvs or 7-11 and put cash straight on the card. It enabled me to pay for a hotel room for my family online for a better price then I would have gotten just going to the front desk with cash. My issues with them were after the card was validated, it wouldn't let me add a bank account or transfer money from my bank to them. I had to call customer service to get it working. Then the card was charged for more than was on the card and it happened again! I went to pay the difference so that I could continue to use my card and it again wouldn't let me add a payment method. I had to call customer service and go back and forth for a few days. They couldn't figure out what was wrong. They ended up having someone reset my card from inside their system. So overall, I would suggest getting this card if all you want to be able to do is add physical cash to it, it's not the greatest card to utilize otherwise.

The Blue Cash Card from American Express is incredible. By far my favorite card, compared to my Capital One and Discover cards. The low APR and the longer-than-normal grace period are a huge help as I'm constantly on the road and sometimes (though I hate to admit it), am not always on top of things the way I should be. I use this car to cover car repairs which sadly, have been over the $1,000, but the Blue Cash Card's $100 bonus took some of the sting out!
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: Although the American Express Gold Card has a lower annual fee than the American Express Platinum Card, it still doesn't seem worth it or appealing to me. I dislike point based rewards, however, if it was a card that I used frequently, and the reward options (like merchandise and gift cards) were something that I was interested in, it might be a worthwhile card. The $75 credit on hotel expenses and using your points for airline travel would make this a great card for people that travel frequently. However, I am not one of those people, so this card doesn't seem that useful to me.

The Platinum Card from American Express doesn't appeal to me very much. It has an annual fee that seems rather high, and your rewards are point based, which, in my experience, doesn't translate very well. I have a Capital One card and the reward points I receive translate to about 1 cent for every $100 I spend. And on this card, you can only get the 40,000 points after spending $3000. However, if you travel out of the country a lot, the perks might be good for you, as there are no foreign transaction fees and you can get yearly airline credits.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I personally. Love this card. Free to load. Free to use.perrrrfect. i just wished their operators knew their english,and knew the english meanings.

Having this card was probably the worst experience i have ever had with costumer service. They would not send me my replacement my card while I confirmed everything they asked me: SS#,Date of Birth, Answer to the security question, Email address.every time I called them, they would confirm that is was on its way...lie.(I am still waiting for it) It took them 2 weeks to send me and to authorice a Western Union transfer when they told me it would be 24-48 hrs...lie(Had to get money out of the account since i didnt have my replacement card/Lost my wallet). They "lost" both of my request for money to be transfered to me so that I could go pick it up. Once I finally got them to transfer money through Western Union. My name on my ID did not match how it was typed into the Western Union Transfer System. So, I called them back to tell them how the name should be spelled out. I finally got a hold of the account supervisor and told her the whole story and she assured me that she would get to the bottom of this. She promised she wold call me back within an hour or so..I said "ok thank you"....Well, that ended being a lie. So, its save to say I will no longer have this card or be a customer of AMEX. I JUST WANTED MY MONEY FOR AN EMERGENCY! (No Stars if it was possible)

This card has been nothing but perfect for me. I was tired of being tied to a B of A or other banks so I decided to try this. I've gotten $75 dollars in free credit for various things since I've signed up! I love the convenience of being able to use my phone to utilize the tap to pay feature and get $1 for each time I use it. I've seen a lot of people on here talking about how bad the customer service is. I've had two minor problems since having this account. The first problem was I prepaid at the pump at a gas station once and for some reason they take out more than what you paid to make sure you have enough money in your account which is pretty dumb but I called them up and they put the money back in my account instantly and just let me know that they do that so now I just go inside to pre pay... Not a big deal. The second problem I had was I was charged the wrong price at a bar for some drinks so the bar had to void the charge and charge me the right amount and it was about a week later and the money hadn't gone back into my account yet. So I called customer service and they took the charge off on the spot and told me that next time that happens to just call them immediately and they would fix it right then and there. This is a great card that lets you have an account without being tied to a bank and you can also set up a reserve account which I just use for my savings. I highly recommend it for anyone.

I am not impressed. Three dollars each time I want to put money on the card, and three dollars each time I want to get money from the card (except for the generous one free atm withdrawal a month)? This would add up very quickly, and with all the better options out there on re-loadable cards, I can't imagine why I would accept these terms and pay all of that money. No thanks.

I just want to say the ONLY reason this is getting 1 star is because it makes me! We have been a card member since 2006 we ALWAYS make our payment before or on the due date and we always pay way more than the min balance Example: Our min payment is around 50 we always pay 200.. Well we were out shopping the other night and had to buy a few large items when we got home and I got online to see our available balance it was $0!!! It is supposed to be $3,000! So I thought it was just a glitch in the system so I called them and they said they took away our credit limit! I asked for reason's and they would not really give us a reason, Our credit is not Excellent but it is not poor! We have nothing in collections and we ALWAYS pay our bills! The manager told me in order to get our available balance back we had to pay the $1,200 off in 30 days or they would not due it... They also said there decision was based on the fact we had not used out card in a year! I about exploded we have been loyal customers from 2006 we have other credit cards and they have NEVER treated us like this! I told them to cancel the card we will not be coming back! Poor customer service is also a BIG thing, I was hung up on once because I was trying to get answers as to why they did this! I don't suggest ANYONE deal with this credit card!
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content:
Worst card ever!


-I cant pay bills via their bill pay because it tells me my account number and/or zip is wrong. No...I know that's not accurate.


-The card can only be used as a credit card at most locations so forget about getting cash back


-The ATM network is a joke. The locations are few and far between with low withdrawal amounts.if you want to get out $600 plan on making 3 transactions. Not convenient.


- They tie up your money! You're only allowed to take out $2000 cash each month. If I could pay my bills with this card that wouldn't be a problem but I need to withdraw cash to pay bills.


- Customer service is a complete joke. When I insisted they allow me access to the entire amount of funds in my account they said it couldnt be done. I reminded them that this is not a line of credit ,it's a pre-paid account FUNDED BY ME! They told me the only way they could allow me access was to wire the funds via western union to me. I said, "do it". They said it would take a little bit of time and I probably would not get the money until 24-48 hours later. Again. I said, "do it and close the account". They put me on hold and left me there for an hour and 16 minutes before I was disconnected.


WORST PRE-PAID CARD EVER! Pay the small fees with another card. Money well spent to avoid the inconvenience of a Serve card.

I really like this American Express prepaid card. I can load money on it for awhile, and then have a spending amount available for a specific purpose such as Christmas. There was no fee to activate it, and they only charge $1 a month to use it. I can even pull out money from some atm's for free with no fees. I don't think it would be good for international use. However, in the US it works well with no problems.

The Platinum Card® from American Express has many benefits that are not presented on here. You can visit www.americanexpress.com to view all the wonderful benefits. I have been with American Express since 2001 and never use any other card. The Platinum card has a hefty $450 annual fee, which is something that I don't see myself paying for. You can't really beat the 40,000 points offered for spending $3,000 in the first 3 months. I personally wouldn't recommend this card. I would recommend the Blue Cash card (I have been using this card since 2001). This card basically have all the benefits of the Platinum card minus the annual fee of $450. Some benefits are merchandise replacement within 30 days of purchase, returns of merchandise if the merchant doesn't take it back, one year extended warranty added to manufacture warranty, and great customer service.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: what's the beauty of a Card that has to be paid in full every month and cost you $450 a year, well NONE, you might as well use your Debit Card instead....
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: Pre-paid card that acts like a real credit card. They freeze your account for no reason and send you on wild goose chases when you call customer service in Pakistan. Typical BAD American Express service. Avoid like the plague.

They randomly flag accounts and freeze them without telling you. Then when you have a problem and want to find out why, it says to call customer service and gives you a phone number, however it isn't customer service, it is their fraud department. To which they want you to all of the sudden, for no reason, and of course they say they don't know why the computer is telling them this, they ask you to prove your identity with a government id, copies front and back of all your credit cards/debit cards you want to fund the account with, your social security card and a utility bill, no cell phone bill, must be power/water/garbage. Then when you download their app for your phone, you have to give it permission to have access to your entire address book, your camera, your microphone and your photos??? Why would anybody want one of these accounts other than to maintain a little privacy from big brother? This is the opposite and I think it is in poor taste to get you all sucked into their system, then once you have spent a bunch of time and energy, they freeze your account, won't let you get your money out until you email them all your personal information. You might as well just call the government and give them all your bank account numbers and everybody you have in your phone book just in case they can't find you, they can call and ask all your friends where you are hiding. I'd rather post all my information on Facebook, it will probably have less of a chance of it falling into the wrong hands.

This was the biggest financial mistake I have ever made. I place a large sum of money in this account monthly as a temporary alternative to my business checking account which was just recently established. If you need access to a large sum of YOUR money... good luck. You will have to wait days and jump through hoops after standing on one hear while singing the national anthem to get YOUR money. This has been by far the WORST experience all around I have ever had with a card company. Customer service with serve has told me on numerous occasions that there is simply no way that they can or will help me with my concerncs. Do yourself a favor and STAY AWAY FROM AMERICAN EXPRESS!

The Blue Cash from American Express is a good credit card, it has similar cash back rewards as the bank of america card although the bank of america card is more accepted because is Visa plus you also get an extra 10% cash bonus if you bank with them but let's get back to AMEX, the $100 cash bonus is good but you have to spend $1,000 in 3 months while other cards is just $500 in 3 months, also with AMEX you need a higher FICO than almost any other card out there, that's a downside too....
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: Great card with a great look! The Blue Sky from American Express card presents an easy way to have an Amex without paying the annual fee. In addition, the current bonus offer provides $75 of value for using the card the same way most people would anyway. A big downside is that this card provides only 1 point per dollar spent. Other cards, such as Chase Sapphire, Chase Sapphire Preferred, or Chase Freedom provide extra points for select categories (static or dynamic), which ultimately results in more cash-back rewards.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: Hilton is a well known hotel chain with an excellent reputation. The Hilton HHonors credit card offers many features that I find attractive. The bonus points program is outstanding. This is much better than the Marriott Rewards points. The complimentary "Silver" status and no blackout dates on hotel stays are a plus. Also the insurance offered through the added travel benefits could come in very handy. Although there is no intro rate, the 15.24% - 19.24% is pretty typical and really not a bad deal when you consider there is no annual fee.

I love the bonus points! One point for every dollar spent is appealing. I think the 0% APR for the first 15 months and no annual fee is a good deal. American Express has an excellent reputation and that makes the Blue Sky card attractive as well. To be fair, the 17.24%- 22.24% annual rate is a bit higher than my current Visa card. I would also like to know what is considered an eligible purchase and what the other terms and restrictions actually are.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content:
The Hilton HHonors Credit Card seems like a really good deal. The points reward system being the biggest inviting factor. The APR seems a little high and I wish they would lower it. Maybe offer a "0% interest rate for your first year" deal if you're not the person who travels often.

I like the fact that its not just hotel stays that earn your points. The ability to use this card when overseas is a plus, though the fee percentage is kind of high, however the grace period is phenomenal, never seen one so long. All in all, an A+ card.
worse experience I have ever had

The Blue Cash Everyday Card is a very good American Express to have. There is not an annually fee and you still get all the benefits that is offered by the American Express cards that have annual fees (like the Gold and Platinum card). I have held both the Gold and Platinum card and I honest prefer the Blue Cash Everyday Card. The rewards are not that lucrative, but I use it for the benefits as such, replacement benefit, returns benefit, and the extended warranty benefit. I bought a phone without a contract that costed over $500 and it stopped working after 1 year and 11 months. The manufacture warranty is only 1 year, but American Express adds 1 more year to it. I sent the phone into American Express and received the full credit to my credit card. Talking about great benefits! That was like getting a phone for free for almost two years. I highly recommend this card.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content:
Amex seriously falls down with communication on this card. Use caution when deciding to get this card. Three days ago my account was locked for an unknown reason and they never informed me, I had to initiate the call. Today I found out that the account was suddenly put into review for fraud and was never notified, I had to initiate the call.

The interesting part is I never use this card. We are using it to save for my step-daughters college fund and will be sending the card off with her when she goes to college next year. Amex's lack of communication for locked accounts and suspicion of fraud is giving me a very uneasy feeling about sending this child off into the world with their card. We will definitely be pulling back our funds and cancelling this card.

The Blue from American Express credit card seems like the ideal card for anyone. I have had American Express as my primary credit card before and was always very happy with it. The main advantage of Blue is that there is no annoying annual fee, and that there's no interest during the first 15 months. The rewards program is not out of this world, but hey, at least it has a rewards program. I've looked into a lot of credit cards that don't. Blue also seems like a great card for travelers, offering 2X the points when booking a flight through AMEX travel and providing the chip technology for easier spending when abroad.

This cards annual fee is rediculous I have never and will never pay that high of a fee for a credit card. The point system looks appealing for frequent travelers but for someone like me whos never even been on a plane it doesnt make sense. There are other great credit cards out there that offer much better perks like discover who offers 4% back on some of their deals. Also I find it kind of odd that theres no set limit. How do you ever know when or if you'll be declined? Could be embarrassing.
I luv my new card. Easy to use and its way cheaper than the netspend I have. Luv the app too.

Don't get this card, it's horrible. The user interface is good but OMG the customer service sucks!! I have had to re-link my visa debit funding source to this card 3x in the past two weeks. Each time it works for a while. Today I call Amex and the lady tells me that I have to send photo copies of my card and drivers license. I asked her why they are singling me out, she said they aren't. I am a "risk" according to their records but they wouldn't say why. Are you kidding??? I have been using Serve for 6 months! Now I am a risk and they want my first born practically. I asked her if everyone has to send a photo copy of these docs and she said yes. I doubt it. They are discriminating based upon something and I don't know what it is. Its not credit because they don't pull credit. What is it? Age? I am a professional, manager with good credit. Oh I forgot to say why I even got this card, so I can give my mom some money each month and she is in a nursing home.

I dont personally see the bennifit of having this card except for maybe a teenager. You can direct deposit funds onto the card and theres no fees associated with it accept atm fees after your 1st free one. This is similar to the Bank of America secured card accept it doesn't report to any credit bureaus so you dont really get any benefits. Again good for a teenager but not idea for an average person.

As a rewards card, this is by far the best of the best. Whatever I need, I can get, like gas, groceries, or even online shopping. Uniquely to this card though, I really like the rewards system and with all the online purchases I make, they add up!
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content:
I wanted to give half a star here but the system wouldn't allow me to do so.


The Amex Serve Card is the bane in my life. Customer Support is terrible, which is really surprising considering Amex is known for their customer service. Their internal system is flawed in so many ways that I am probably going to lose some money for their incompetencies. I am still waiting to hear back from them after an hour-long frustrating call I had with them earlier this week at the end of which no resolution or respite was provided.


So here's what happened:


I had scheduled a monthly withdrawal on my serve card to help keep my finances in check. I later realized that the withdrawal amount will offset my savings so I changed my mind and wanted to revert/cancel the scheduled withdrawal. So I log into my account about a week or two before the scheduled withdrawal and see no sign of the upcoming transaction. I figured I wasn't looking at

the right place and called customer support, who of course puts me on hold for a good 7 mins. Finally this lady comes online and does the general verification routine and goes through my account and confirms that there is no such upcoming withdrawal and that I would have to set one up if I needed to reload the card. I was a bit confused (because I was pretty certain that I had set this up) but happy that I wouldn't have to worry about money getting sucked out of my main account. I thanked the girl and asked her about how should I go about cancelling the card. To which she managed to convince me to stay and NOT cancel the card and gave me a thorough sales pitch on how beneficial and insignificant the monthly 1 dollar charge is. I decided to not cancel the card after the call.


The next day (or the same day... don't remember exactly when. But...) I transferred additional amount to my Serve card (now that I decided to stick with it). A couple days later I see that not only did my last scheduled transfer go through but the one before that (when customer support staff confirmed there was no transaction scheduled previously) as well, was processing. Bear in mind, it takes a good 5 days for the funds to come through into your card/account. Not having enough funds in my main account for this bulk remittance, I panicked (I did not want to pay any overdraft fees) and called Serve support.


By far one of the worst customer support I have experienced. And shocking, because it is an Amex product, known for their customer service. I can go on and on about how rude, clueless, uncooperative, and lackluster the service was. Their system is clearly flawed. They have no regard for their customers' time or business. And they probably believe that if you wait long enough eventually your customer will forget or not care for resolution. So why bother??


Now, I am just waiting to move/spend the balance amount on my serve card to cancel the service and get rid of this headache. Big mistake made when I signed up for this card. I seriously advise people reading this to go elsewhere where you'd be more valued as a customer.

The thing I like the most about the American Express Serve card is the free withdrawals at over 24,000 different ATMs. My current credit card charges a small fee at some ATMs and it starts to add up over a while. Having a card that has no fee would be a huge benefit for me or someone that withdrawals money on a daily basis. Another thing I like about this card is that it is reloadable via direct deposit, so you can control how much you keep on your card at a time.

This is a credit card that I can see myself using in the future. The point reward system is very good and it is easy for me to rack up points through things like travelling, which I do quite often. Also, I like the no blackout days. Overall, this is a very good credit card that I would highly recommend to anyone that likes point bonus reward systems.

I have used the Amazon Visa that seemed to allow for more rewards dollar for dollar. Also the APR is at a better rate but I suppose that is based on personal credit ratings more than what the actual credit card company offers. I would be concerned with "eligible purchases" with regard to how much points I can earn. I understand that other companies do have eligibility with their purchases but again, my Amazon Visa would seem to offer more.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: I have been using this card for a while, and I've been nothing but satisfied. Amex customer service is phenomenal. They really care about loyalty. Whether you've lost your card or a company you purchased from is overcharging you, they will support you and fight for you. Because one of my family members uses this for business, we have a lot of points. I actually have been able to get several flights and gadgets just from points. Also, it gets you free access to Delta lounges at airports. The only disadvantage is that it isn't accepted at as many places overseas as some other cards.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I signed up for the blue cash preferred card by American Express with the intent of only having it for emergencies, but after my car failed me, and I needed repairs, I easily spent 1,000 my second month of having the card....luckily I earned that $150 cash back. Once I realized how easy it was so spend and earn rewards, I began to use it more frequently. This card really is great, only default I dislike is the APR rate does increase further down the road.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: That's a pretty good reward card! I only get cards with 0% APR for a while and no annual fees. This one fits the bill pretty well (15 months 0% is quite good) and the 3% on groceries is a real plus, as this is where most people spend their money anyways. However, I regret the limit ($6000 in purchases for a year, that isn't much) that I find quite low. The initial cash bonus ($100) isn't that great either. Overall, a good addition in the no annual fee/ 0% APR category.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: Dishonest business practices led me to cancel this card. I was signed up to receive bonus points at $5000 spending. They did not honor this saying I opened it in December when it was actually first opened in March.
department: The Business Platinum Card® from American Express

content: This is a dishonest service. They will try and utilize any strategy possible for you NOT to hit your required spending limit in time. The sent me my card AFTER the limit was allowed, yes it took them 3 months to get the card to me, charged the fee and would not give the bonus points to me. Very dishonest practices.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I love that there is no annual fee for “Blue from American Express”. No annual fee is an absolute must before I will consider any other credit card benefit. The second best feature for me is no interest for 15 months! This card has a generous point system for travel and related travel charges, but I only fly two or three times a year. I do not like having to purchase $1,000 on the card in the first 3 months, even though I could definitely meet that requirement, a $1,000 seems high.

I really like this credit card. The perks are quite obviously the best part about it. I go traveling a lot so the points really pay off for me. The customer service is really great whenever I have a problem. They're always very nice and care about fixing whatever is going on. I rarely have any problems with them though. I dislike the fees, but I dislike any fees in relation to credit cards.

I have had zero problems with my card (I actually recommended it) until today. I can not believe the HORRIBLE customer service from THREE of your managers that I received today. A hotel I recently stayed at double charged me. I three way called WITH the hotel manager to you guys to get my money back on my card. No matter what the hotel manager offered to do your customer service refused to help me for 8 business days. I do not understand how you can treat your customer in such an unprofessional and demeaning way. How do you not have a way to put money back on a card in a reasonable time frame? Not only would I never recommend this card again (which I did frequently) I now will be looking for an alternative pre-paid bank card to use. I expected so much more from a company like yours. I picked your Blue Bird card because of the American Express name and so far your customer service is ruining that name. Even the hotel manager could not believe the level of poor customer service we just experienced. And based on other reviews it does not seem to be a one time occurrence. It would be very helpful to have a customer service staff that clearly speaks English and is willing to help their customers rather than insult them. I would like my several hundred dollars put back on my card in a time frame that is reasonable and done at other reputable banks. If you want this card/bank to be taken seriously it is time that you start implementing policies and customer service training that represents that.

I finally gave up on bluebird after being loyal for two years. There are definitely some advantages and disadvantages.


Pros: Great features, easy access online(and a well working app for Samsung galaxy s4). The sub-account feature is nice, as well as the bill pay option.


Cons: A lot of vendors no longer take American express, It was always embarrassing to get to a checkout lane and then realize they didn't accept american express. Always be conscious of what credit cards they accept. I would always forget to check and if I would have only remembered I would have saved myself a few embarrassing trips to checkout lanes. Fees at some ATMS(You have to scout out the ones that don't have fees), and if you lose your card, or forget your passcode online you're in trouble. The customer support is really quite a nuisance. If you get overcharged for something, it takes three days or more to go back on your card. You can also, only withdrawal a certain amount per 24 hours. So when it came time to pay our rent, we had to make multiple ATM withdrawals, which really would have cost the same as ordering checks(there is a fee for that too). If your atm machine that doesn't have a fee is down or broken, those multiple atm fees rack up a bit.


I was very happy with this card, and could work around other vendors not accepting American Express.(Just withdrawal some money to keep as cash on hand) We lost our card a few months ago and customer service was terrible. If we had gone with a local bank we could have just gone over there and had it replaced but with bluebird takes up to a week to get a replacement.


Just last night my husband forgot the passcode to access the account online.(I'm usually the one that accesses it), and he got locked out of the account. He never even made it to the secret question. They not only locked the whole account, but refused to accept his direct deposit. That left us in a world of trouble, because it takes bluebird 3 days to send money back. We were already down to change, you know how it is when you live paycheck to paycheck. Luckily, his company is awesome and drove 2 hours from headquarters to give us a check. We decided this was the last straw and made a real account with a local bank. Sure there are fees associated with most major bank checking accounts, but if it would save us the issue of having to deal with all these little flaws, then it's worth it.


The password problems, and the lost card issue were undoubtedly our fault, so I gave them a couple of stars and deducted two for their lack of care customer support. As far as quick prepaid cards go, this one is the best one we've ever had. So I'll give them credit for that. The VISA cards continued to deduct a monthly fee years after we had stopped using it. I found one in my wallet and checked it and it said -14 dollars. If you plan on using it for paying bills, and depositing large checks, it's not worth it, go with a real local bank, not a prepaid. Though, for the longest time, we had no issues with them, and could just work around the flaws. It would be a great card for kids or teenagers, you can view their purchases easily and add money to their sub accounts from your main account. The extra account does not cost anything extra.

I think the The Blue Sky card from American Express is made mainly for shopping. The Welcome Bonus is really good for people willing to do some good shopping within 3 months. By getting 7,500 points when you spend purchases worth of $1000 is really good, but not all people are willing to do this heavy amount of shopping. What I don't like is the high fees on this card, I guess my Citi card works better with that. So this card is limited to a certain category of people going shopping or in "spending" mood to get those 7,500 points.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: The American Express Serve card is really full of benefits! Starting from the free activation fee, free PIN and ATM transaction fees, and having no requirement for a minimum balance, amazing! One more great thing is it having a huge number of ATMs that you could withdraw money from. The $1 monthly fee is really minimal which I think is great. It could actually substitute having a full bank account!

I do like credit cards having the point system, but it's nothing special to this card. The annual fee is way to high! The first year being free will not let me oversee the high annual fee. My Citibank card has a much more reasonable annual fee. Also, I can see no travel benefits in this card as there is a foreign transaction fee, which bank of america's foreign card does not have.
Read the fine print. I signed up here and then was told I don't get the 15 month 0% APR or the $150 statement credit. American Express customer service is absolute garbage
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content:
$125 is a hefty fee for an annual card fee, even if you do receive the 1st year without the fee. I actually had this card but ended up canceling it. For someone who will use this for frequent flier miles and hotel visits then it is a great card and you can earn back your entire $125 with different deals and offers. One of the things I really did like about American Express was that you can't charge more than you can pay. The card has to be paid in full every month, so it you have your finances in order and don't have to worry about min payments it's good for you.


There are a lot of benefits for the card, but I like my Chase Freedom much more. I get cash back on all my purchases and that adds up to free money for me. I can redeem for gift cards, transfer to my bank account, or get a statement credit. Plus my card is a Visa so I never have problems with it being accepted where American Express isn't. Depending on the time of the year, I can get 5% cash back with my Chase Freedom card compared to 1% at other times. The categories always change, but they are usually ones that I use often; movies, gasoline, eating out, etc.

You get 1 star because I can't submit a review without it and because until you have to engage with customer service it gives you alternatives you might not otherwise get elsewhere.


My daughter signed up for this and had direct deposit set up. Limited options for ATMs is an issue for cash withdrawals. Customer service is a joke. Options to get replacement card after hers was lost were ridiculous. Tried to go that route 3 times. Were told it would take a week. Didn't receive first one until almost 3 weeks had passed. Oops. By then she'd already requested a new one. Oops again. The only replacement card to arrive in 3 separate attempts was deactivated and not possible to activate once received because another had been requested. Eventually she opted to pull money out via Western Union but wasn't informed there was a limit on the amount of each transaction - $450 - are you kidding me?? If you have direct deposit and your whole check goes in, you'll have to make a lot of trips back and forth to Western Union. Apparently they don't have this set up to automatically transfer once a request to withdraw all funds is initiated. American Express and Walmart need to get their act together - this is preying upon those least able to speak for themselves.
I think having the bonus points during the first couple of months of spending is a plus, but the annual fee of $450 is high!
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: The Blue Cash Preferred card deems to have a number of perks. The initial 0% interest rate is a great perk and it lasts for 15 months, unlike the 12 months that a Bank of America credit card lasts. The 25 day grace period is good, but like all credit cards, the interest rate is atrocious. If you want a credit card, the Blue Cash Preferred may be a good one. Just don’t plan to get rich from the $150 back after spending $1,000.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: This card would be good for a big purchase to be paid off slowly since it has the 15 month 0% interest. I don't understand points transfer to dollar amounts very well but this seems generous. Interest rates are nearly half lower than my Citi card which is fantastic. For someone who travels a lot this card would be ideal, i personally at this time in my life do not travel enough to take advantage of these opportunities though I would absolutely be interested in the future. I would recommend this card to frequent flyers and travelers.

The card has outstanding features, but the customer service is HORRIBLE. Outsourced to a call center in India, which would be fine, IF the agents spoke English proficiently and were knowledgeable about the card and its features, but neither is the case. What's worse, is there is no email address available for customers to do business or get help by email. Great card features, but I'm starting to wonder if it's worth all the frustration and aggravation of dealing with the ill-equipped phone reps...

I like the option of transferring points to frequent flier programs, but the American Express Green Card's annual fee is more than I would be willing to pay for a card like this. The other downside of the card is that, even though it is a card aimed at travelers, there is still a fee for foreign transactions. The Bank of America's credit card aimed at travelers does not have a foreign transaction fee. That just seems to make more sense to me.

The Platinum Card seems does not seem like a card that has many benefits the first problem is that the annual fee is four hundred fifty dollars which is a huge amount, although if you can get approved for a platinum card that might not be much money for you. The rewards program has much to be desired with no cash back rewards and a large spending amount before any type of bonus given to the spender.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: As the annual fee for the American Express card is fairly high -- $125 after the first year --getting the card is a commitment to their rewards programs. If you're consistent about using the card and getting the hotel credit ($75) as well as other rewards such as the complimentary room upgrades, you can easily make that $125 back and enjoy all the benefits of using American Express. My USAir mastercard has a significantly lower annual fee, however it does have blackout dates -- this card does not.
Since they have reduced all the benefits you are paying alot...for nothing!!!! Forget traveling over seas, AM EX declined the card every where I went. Thank goodness for Visa!
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: There are a lot of things to like about this card. It is easy to accrue points - both while traveling, and while at home. With no black-out dates for redeeming nights, it should be easy to spend those points, as well! Still, the interest rate is a bit high - and the penalty APR is very high... You need to manage this card carefully in order for it to be beneficial!

The Blue Sky card from American express has some perks. The first thing that caught my eye was the 7,500 in bonus points upon spending 1,000 in 3 months. That's $100 in statement credits! Nice! My main concern, however, is the high interest rates. I would suggest using this card on a vacation, especially during the 0% APR during the first 15 months. No earning or redeeming limits mean you keep earning and spending as long as you have the card! I also like that there is no annual fee!
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: The interest rate seems a little high on the Hilton Credit Card, but there are many perks to this card. It certainly is worthwhile if you're a traveler and like the Hilton brand hotels. 5 points per dollar at gas stations, grocery stores and gas stations is a bang for your buck! I also like that the card has a 25 day grace period for accruing interest. I am, however, concerned about the foreign transaction fee- seems like a catch 22 for a travel card.

I love the American Express Serve card. You can withdrawal money at a ton of ATMs for no fee, which can be really helpful. The monthly fee is only one dollar, which is really good. Also, unlike a lot of other cards like this, it doesn't have a minimum balance or anything. You can load it by direct deposit or by getting a card at a grocery or convenience store.
I like that it is online easy to work but i can't get the app on my blackberryq10

The Target prepaid card looks to be a good deal.

The no start-up or monthly fees in good in contrast to other offers (Cap 1, Orchard, etc).

The ability to reload at a Target store is nice as well; it's convenient to be able to add cash to your card.

Also, it's AMEX; I doubt you'd go wrong!
Worst card ever. Waste of time and money.
Horrible didn't receive card at all for 14 days striaght then I called and no one was there, on hold forever with and automated system.
Great card. Just wish we could change the picture or had card options :(

Forbes rates this card #1. They obviously never had to deal with customer service. I have spent hours and hours merely trying to get my daughter's sub-account card activated. After speaking with 4 different representatives over two days, I have concluded this is impossible. Since this is the sole purpose of setting up the account, my time has been completely wasted. Please do not even consider using this card. You will get only headaches.

This is my ultimate favorite credit card. I can use it on anything and everything anywhere and anytime, even out of the country. I get 1 point per dollar guaranteed and sometimes 2 points. I don't get penalized for not paying my bill right away, I can get cash advances and discounts on all travel expenses including flight, hotel and rental car. I love how flexible and versatile this card is and did I mention that I don't have interest for 15 months. Overall it is a great card to have and I prefer to use this one over most of my other ones.

The American Express Green card has a high yearly fee, and big late fee for not paying off the balance every month, which immediately puts me off. This card looks like it's been geared toward people who travel a lot, and if you do it might be a good value. For those of us who are staying in one place, there are a lot better deals out there. If you're interested in an American Express card, I'd recommend going with the Costco Trueearinings card, which doesn't have a fee (beyond Costco membership), and has cash back up to 4%.

I have had this card for a little over 8 months now, and I love it! There is a relatively high annual fee of $75, but with the $150 sign on bonus, that is basically covered for two years. Plus, you really can't beat the cash back bonus on groceries. Having three boys who can clean out a refrigerator in 2 days, this is definitely a huge plus! I also love the fact that there is no cap on how much cash back you can earn, like with a lot of other companies. The APR is a little high later on, but overall a great card to have!
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content:
This card is garbage, TRASH. I spent 5$ at Walmart to load the card, and I tried to make a purchase on website t hat doesn't accept blue bird so the card charged me 2$ for the card being declined. That's 7$ already, I made the purchase on another site and the card charged me 2$ that is 9$ already. I spent a total of 13.50$... so that leaves me with less than 3 DOLLARS and I can't make a purchase because the card charges 2$. DON"T USE THIS GARBAGE BUY A GREEN DOT CARD. I PAID AROUND $18 TO SPEND ONLY $13.50.


CANT EVEN USE MY REMAINING BALANCE BECAUASE IT COSTS 2$ TO USE AND THAT WOULD LEAVE ME IN NEGATIVE OR CHARGE 2$ TO TELL ME THE CARD IS DECLINED.

I loved this card from day one. I started off with a 25 dollar credit. Then after I linked another card I got another 25 dollar credit. I love how I have been gettinh 1 dollar off of all my purchases that I use my phone to pay for. I have recommended this card to mostly everyone that I actively socialize with

The Blue Cash Preferred from American Express is a good card if you use your card frequently due to the great rewards! I like that you can earn cash back on purchases, especially on groceries and gas! The introductory APR is also great! My concern is that the post-introductory APR is pretty high.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: The Hilton HHonors Credit Card is one of the best on the market. The rewards are great, as you get a lot of points cashed in for your first $750 spent. If you are someone who does a lot of traveling, this is card for you! Also as a bonus are the minimal fees. Overall, a very good card!

The American Express Serve card is great for those who basically want to go without a bank account and carry a simple card instead. There are very little rewards, but the fees are very minimal as well. This is a very basic, no fills card that can be good for some, and it is convenient, much like a regular bank account.

The Blue Sky card from American Express is a really good card for those interested in traveling, and for those who simply buy a lot of stuff! Virtually every dollar spent has some kind of point reward that can be exchanged for travel points. While the interests rates are quite high, when used properly this card has great rewards and great for using for family vacations!
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: This seems like a good card; but it is odd in the way that you have to spend so many dollars to get enough points for a free airline ticket that it defeats the purpose. The annual fee is enough itself for one free round-trip ticket per year! So unless you plan on making every purchase that you buy on this card alone it's not worth the benefit! If you only fly 1-2 times a year it's much more worth your while to get a card with better points and simply purchase the airline tickets yourself!
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: With the American Express Gold Card I like that you earn points ever time it is being used. The points do not expire and you have up to 500 different brands to use them for. You can also use them for frequent flyer miles. You can receive up to $75 in hotel credit, which can really help. What I do not like about this card is the $125 annual fee that has to be paid after the first year. That is not something I would want to pay.

I have been a satisfied AMEX Blue card holder for many years. Building rewards is simple, even easier to find, order, and use your rewards. Aside from ease of use with both rewards and the website, best part about the card is the look on people's faces when you hand it to them! Everyone rarely sees a clear credit card, makes me laugh every time!

This card has been a problem since I received it...customer service is the worst, no one knows what they are talking about and they give false information. And When your money miraculously disappears no one can get it resolved and they expect you to wait 10 days for them to refund your money, even though it was their mastake in the first place...Dont waste your time with this card its absolutely useless.
DO NOT USE. DO NOT USE. WILL PUT A HOLD ON YOUR MONEY AND TAKE OVER 8 DAYS TO RELEASE IT

The Target Prepaid Card from American Express has many great features. There are no activation fees, no transfer fees, and you can use the card either as credit or debit without fees. If you use an ATM more than once a month, there is a $3 fee, but that rate is average when you use any ATM that is specifically from your bank. Overall, this is a great Prepaid card.

This card is ONLY for people with excellent credit. If you're in the "Good" range, you won't qualify. You get $150 back if you spend $1000 in 3 months, which is easy if you use this card for groceries and gas. This card gives 6% cash back for supermaket purchases and 3% for gas purchases, so you would only want to use this card for those things. You can redeem cash back in the form of Reward Dollars and they credit your statement for that amount. There is a high annual fee of $75. Get 0% interest on purchases and transfers for the first 15 months. This isn't a credit card that the "average Joe" could apply for, but for those with excellent credit, the cash back rewards can't be beat.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: This card would be a good option for anyone who frequently makes high dollar purchases that they have the means to pay off right away. This is particularly beneficial for frequent travelers as this card has no foreign transaction fees and allows you to earn cash back on incidentals. The only thing that concerns me is it does not indicate how many points you need to earn rewards, such as how many you need to get an airline ticket. Therefore, it is hard to weigh the benefits over the $450 annual fee.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: The American Express Gold Card is decent, but does not really offer significant benefits that warrant spending the extra money as compared to the American Express Green Card. I prefer the American Express Gold Premium Rewards Card because it offers extra points on a wider range of purchases. Overall, the Gold Card does have good customer service features that make it a good card, but I believe that there are better cards out there.

American Express made an error but refused to accept responibility for it. Basically, I was double charged for an item - the second charge was 6 months after the first one - and the merchant had no record of the second charge and never received the money. AE's response was that once I use the card at a merchant, they are allowed to continue pulling out money for that merchant even without my authorization.


I'm out $60, which is more than the annual fee for a regular credit card. Since AE wants to treat me like a meal ticket rather than a customer, I'll never do business with them. Ever.

The American Express Serve card is an alternative to having a bank account. There is a minimal monthly fee, but if you are one to get lots of overdrafts with a regular checking account you will still come out way ahead with this card. The free ATM withdrawals and no canccellation fee are also very nice. This is one of the nicer cards to help substitute for a bank account. This is not a credit card.

The Blue Sky from American Express Card is a nice rewards card. There's no annual fee which is very important for this level of reward card and the zero percent intro rate for 15 months is a nice added bonus. The APR is typical to other reward cards I have had. This card is for those who have a good credit rate and pay off their balances every month to maximize their rewards.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: I think the Hilton Credit Card is great! Some of the great things about this card is that there is no annual fee, and there is a big bonus of points after you only make $750 of purchases with the card. This bonus is higher than other cards like Capital One cards. The regular rates are fairly low. However, the foreign transaction fee is not 0% like it should be. This is a hotel card, most likely for travelers. They should make this card more travel friendly. I wouldn't want to be stuck using this card when I'm abroad. This is a great card, but it is not for everyone.

This card has been a hassle since day one. It took two hours and many phone calls to get my subaccount activated. It randomly decides there is a "System Error" when putting money on the card. It takes a week for money to show up from a bank transfer. Now I am told there is some detail that needs to be cleared up before I can put money on the card via Debit now... Which I have been doing since I received the card... with the same debit card...

I have enough headaches in my life without adding another. Bye.

I love my Amex Serve card. I use it almost eveyday. It is true there are fewer moneypass atms available. But if your like me, and dont have to go to the atm everyday then your set.

I love it mostly because ive only had the card for about 3 months and i have already saved 400$ using my Reserve(i named it Happily Never After) (:

And i highly recommend this card to someone who has trouble saving like i did.

Up until now that is :) :) :) :)

For a rewards card, I think the Blue Cash Everyday Card is an excellent one. I would use this for everyday purchases of gas and groceries. If I was going to make a large purchase it would add up the rewards quickly.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: This card really doesn't have any downsides aside from the ATM charge, but I don't typically use cash, so it wouldn't be a big deal to me. Aside from that, there are few fees and no real issues (I like the lack of inactivity fee). I've used a prepaid Visa, which did have an inactivity fee, and that was fairly inconvenient, so it's nice to see that there are better options. Prepaid cards are great for students, because cash is inconvenient to use, but cards make it harder to keep track of money. Prepaid cards where you can add money in increments are great, and this one is no exception.

The Blue Cash Preferred credit card from American Express is a great credit card to have. I have always preferred to used an American Express credit card when I need to purchase items on credit due to the their rewards program and low interest rates. Over the years, American Express has become more popular, and more and more restaurants and stores are accepting them compared to years past. I advise individuals who want a second credit card, to get an American Express Blue Cash Preferred card.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I got this card when it originally came out, it was a great card that deposited some of your charges into a savings account. They cancelled the savings account a few years ago, and never replaced it with any other bonus. I would not suggest this card with no bonuses, there are many other cards that provide incentives while this card provides nothing other than the credit line.

I really like the Hilton Credit Card's Hilton HHonors Bonus Points system, offering tons of benefits and incentives. I do not like the lack of a Maximum Overlimit Fee, and the Max Late fee is higher than Credit One Bank®'s Credit Card.
The American Express Green Card has a high fee of $95, even if the first year is free. I have a Visa and it does not cost this much per year!
This card American Express Green Card has a high fee for a relatively simple card as far as rewards go. Other cards such as Capital One dont charge a annual fee.

The Blue credit card from American Express seems to have a good amount going for it! Definitely loving the fact that there is no annual fee. I have had issues with previous cards, more-so from Capital One, that have had annual fees and they add up over time. The 10,000 point bonus after charging $1000 in eligible purchases is a HUGE perk as it starts you off to great rewards right away. It does have a pretty standard 1 point per $1 spent reward, but you do get 2 points per $1 spent when booking online travel through the American Express website. 0% interest for the first 15 months is great, especially when it comes to meeting the requirements for that 10,000 point bonus for the first 3 months. The only complaint I have is that I personally don't like point systems. I would far rather have it be a cash rewards system, but hey that is just my opinion. Overall I would say it is a great card and give it 4 out of 5 stars.

My husband and I have used this card for almost two years. When we signed up, it was with the $150 cash back bonus, basically offsetting two years of the $75 annual fee. I'm not familiar with the Amazon Prime deal other reviewers are mentioning. We will continue to use this card going forward though; the cash back is wonderful! I put ALL of our groceries on this card, so we get tons back on the 6% grocery rebate. The 3% on gas/department stores is nice, too, along with the 1% on everything else. We actually recently started combining our use of this card with the Chase Freedom VISA card, using the Chase card for just the special 5% categories (it runs quarterly special cash back categories). For example, when the Chase card offers 5% back on gas, we'll shift to using that for the quarter instead of this AmEx card. The two cards combined would get 5 stars from me, but the AmEx just gets 4 because of the annual fee that cuts into some of the cash back (but doesn't cut in enough to offset the advantage of paying the fee, if that makes sense). AmEx also has a very sleek and useable website and a handy spending analysis tool, along with some special card offers for shopping (available through the website) we can take advantage of.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: The American Express Blue Cash credit card is awesome. It has great benefits and it's easy to earn cash back. You can easily earn cash back at places you generally spend the bulk of your money, like gas stations and groceries. American Express has fantastic customer service, and when I found fraud on my card, they investigated and returned the charges promptly.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: The 10000 bonus points looks inviting if you're into point-related offers, but the need to charge at least $1000 in the first three months of owning the card needs to be considered. The points offered are actually lower than many other cards, some of which give 3 points for grocery items where this card seems to max out at 2 for any type of purchase. The 0% interest rate for balance transfers for the first 15 months might look inviting as well. Just be sure to note that there is a 3% transfer fee added to a balance transfer; so you will be paying 3% interest on the balance transfer immediately. The regular rate of 15-20% is high, and once you add the current rates to that it will be a lot higher. If you're prone to making payments late, take note of the $37 late fee, which is also high compared to other card offers.

American Express has a great offer with this Blue Cash Preferred Card, but...you do have to have great credit to qualify for the card. Versus the Capital One Venture Rewards Credit Card, which I have had for several months now, this card is a step up in some ways, but does not offer any frequent flyer miles and the Capital One Card offers 20,000 bonus miles. So if you travel a lot, you might be better off with the Capital One Venture Rewards Card. The penalty on this card is better and that can be a big deal depending on your situation. The cash advance rate is poorer than the Capital One card but really it's better to never take a cash advance. If it's an every day card that you are looking for, this card is the clear winner with a full 1% less regular interest rate than the Capital One Venture Rewards Card.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: More help for me to carry money !

If you are a frequent flyer and/or a heavy traveler (for work or fun), the Platinum Card from American Express is the card for you. The benefits and credits you can receive for flying are tremendous. Use this card for airline incidental fees, i.e. check bags, snacks, flight changes, and you can receive a credit on your statement. There is no charging limit, although it is monitored by your spending habits, credit score, etc. This card must be paid in full every month and the late fees are pretty steep if you are late. The annual fee is high, but you do get great credits if you fly a lot.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: This card doesn't seem as if it would be the best fit for people like me. While the first year is free, every year after carries a $125 annual fee. I have a similar card from Amazon and Chase. It doesn't carry that fee, and it also allows more points per dollar spent. While this card gives a max of 2, the Chase Amazon card allows 3 points per purchase. While this may be a good card for some, in my opinion, it doesn't work well for me.

The Blue Cash Preferred from American Express is a pretty good card if you have the credit for it. 6% cash back is higher than many of the competitors, and they sweeten the deal even further with a $150 bonus after your first $1000 spent. When paying that back, it's no rush because the card comes with 15 months interest-free! After that, it's pretty good for this kind of card, with most people usually in the mid-teens. Check it out!
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I like the fact that this card has no annual fee, and a maximum late fee. For travelers, this is a very useful card, as the points for Hilton rooms are rather generous, and things like baggage insurance and rental car insurance are excellent benefits. No blackout dates are a real bonus, and the interest rates, while a bit high, are still reasonable.

I think the Blue Sky card from American Express would be a great card for someone who loves to travel. I feel that the 1 point earned per dollar is very generous and competitive with other card options out in the market, and I like that there is no limit on how many points you can earn and redeem. I think the best part about this card is the 7500 bonus points that you earn in the first 3 months if you spend $1000. I would definitely get this card if I was planning a vacation.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: This is a really good deal, especially considering the fees banks charge nowadays! There is no activation fee, no minimum balance and you only have to pay $1 a month to keep it active. If you use direct deposit to put $250 on it twice, they give you a $50 credit--basically free money! The only real downside I can see is that ATM fees could add up because there are only so many MoneyPass ATMs out there--I'm not sure if we even have them in our area. My other concern is safety--if you lose it, do you lose all of your money? I didn't see any answers about that.
Not a fan of prepaid anything. If I already had the money why bother going threw the hassle of getting the card. Plus never been an AMEX fan. Too much pressure to pay it all off at end of month.

Things that I liked about this card were that the interest rate was a lot lower than other cards, ranging from 12.99-21.99%, the 0% intro rate for purchases for 15 months, the 0% rate for balance transfers for 15 months, one year free of Amazon prime, the 6% cash back at US markets, and lastly the $100 statement credit you get after you make $1000 in purchases for the first 3 months. The Blue Cash Preferred from American Express has a lot of perks and is a great card to have!
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: The Blue Sky American Express Card is one of my favorite American Express cards. It definitely doesn't beat the Gold card but it comes a close second. I frequently use cards from American Express because I love building up the points to redeem for fun stuff. I have only been using this card for two weeks but so far I have not had any problems. I am planning a trip for the summer and I plan on building up points using this card.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: As a frequent flyer the American Express Gold Card seems like it could be very helpful, especially if used on a regular basis. The hotel credit could also be very useful. The only two problems I would see with card would be that it takes 5,000 points to start redeeming for travel. I could see it taking a while to earn that many points. The other problem is the 125$ fee after the first year. That is a fairly large fee. The citi credit card I have does not have an annual fee and there I get to redeem points much faster than 5000 points.

I am very impressed by American Express Serve. I was introduced to this card by my boyfriend, as a fairly new prepaid option with Amex. I signed up immediately for the card. I use it mainly for direct deposits. Im definitely impressed by the speed of deposit availability. Customer service has been very helpful, even though I only had to call once. I do believe this card has lived up to the American Express legacy.

Keep cash on you! I found out that pin only works to get cash from ATM. I was a bit embarrassed. Loads of money on there and i couldn't pay for $3 meal with my card. They didn't accept credit only debit or girl working there was to stupid to run credit. Either way pin didn't let me pay by debit

The Blue Cash Everyday Card from American Express looks like a really great card that offers unique benefits. I like that you get $50 back after making $1,000 in purchases as well as one year of Amazon Prime. This is very helpful to me and a great deal. I've never had a credit card that offered this. I currently use the Discover It card which I also really like. However I only get 1% back on all purchases and 5% on certain quarterly bonus categories. With this card you get 3% back on grocery stores and 2% on gas stations with 1% on everything else. The only negative I see is that there's a foreign transaction fee on this card. The Discover It card doesn't have any foreign transaction fee. Both cards have no annual fee and similar APRs.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I love my American Express Premium Rewards Gold card. The point earnings system is great and really adds up when you consistently use it for gas, groceries, etc. It's very simple to cash out your points through their travel website and it's very clear and easy to understand. The merchandise rewards are quite impressive as well. The products are high end and include apple products, high end audio, and quality home products. I received an excellent 50,000 point bonus after spending $1,500 over three months which wasn't very difficult. Those points cover a $500 airline ticket! The only downside is the $175 yearly fee which is a bit steep, however, the first year is free which makes it worthwhile.
department: Premier Rewards Gold Card from American Express

content: Blue from American Express Card is good for people who travel a lot and also for people who do a lot of shopping, and that's not to my advantage as i don't travel a lot neither do i do a lot of shopping at the moment, so i would rather stick with the walmart card which i am using at the moment.

In reviewing the American Express Green Card, I am not impressed with the $95 annual fee, this seems really high for a credit card! None of the other credit cards that I have (Visa, Mastercard) charge such a ridiculous fee. However, there are a couple things I like about this card. The Roadside Assistance program looks great, and this is not something that typically comes with a credit card. I also like that the card does not have a preset spending limit, which seems more flexible than many credit cards.

One of the best cash back rewards programs out there. Three percent on groceries can't be beat. As a single guy, this is the card for me, but families with kids should shoot for the preferred version. It carries an annual fee, but has a higher rewards rate.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: The Hilton Credit Card is great if you're a traveler! The APR and cash advance rates are great! Also, the initial bonus of 40,000 points is a great incentive.
I am won over with the 1 year of Amazon Prime free, as well as the 0% interest for 15 months and 0 annual fee. Compared with the Amazon Visa card, this is a better deal with all the extras included!
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I've been using this card for the last few months for online purchasing as well as a touch less payment option on my phone and it has performed outstandingly. The fees are more than reasonable. I have used both the web based interface as well as the android app for loading and transferring money to the card. Both interfaces are incredibly efficient. I could not more highly recommend this as an alternative to using your checking account or debit card for online transactions or touch less payments. It is a secure and easy way to accomplish both.

I am a frequent flyer and shopper so the American Express Gold Card looks to be very useful as I don't like to travel with a lot of currency. I wish there wasn't a foreign transaction fee, or an annual fee, but the annual fee is a lot lower than some of my other cards I use so that's a plus! This is the traveler's token of efficiency and excitement! Sign me up!

I am a frequent traveler to other countries and this card will be perfect for my travels! I like that there are no preset spending limits (perfect for those gifts I didn't know I needed) and no foreign transaction fees. There is even a fund for flight change fees and snacks! I'm packing my bags right now! Wait...annual fee $450.00? That's pretty high, though considering last year in Africa I paid $600 in misc. credit card fees that this card does not have, it all balances out. I love the 40,000 points after I spend $3000 (it won't be a problem). Except for some of the high fees, it looks like my kind of card!
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: The American Express Gold Card seems like a good card, has a good reward program for its loyal customers but I would warn new credit card holders that it has an annual fee after the first year.

Having used Amex long ago, this incarnation seems to be the best they have offered in a long time. The many rewards will offset the hefty annual membership fee, such as the airline statement credits, the introductory 40K points, and the zero foreign transaction fees, which my Citi card charges around 3%. If you spend a lot and have great credit, it's definitely worthwhile.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I find this card very simple and easy to use and as long as you transfer money to it the monthly fees are waived. Use it just like a credit card. It is a cheap alternative to using a bank and AMEX is a trusted institution. It truly is an amazing card for personal use and I can also see business uses for it. There are no activation fees so it truly is a simple card to use for college students, or as an extra way to carry money without actually having to carry cash. It is definitely a fantastic card to add to your wallet. I would definitely recommend this card and do tell my friends about it!

The American express blue cash card is a good card with only a 3% cash advance fee and 0% intro APR for the first 15 months. They also offer a 1 year membership for amazon prime no card I have had has offered these types of deals.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: The American Express Serve card is a really great deal for people who don't want to be tied down to a bank account! There's only a $1 monthly fee which is way less than most banks charge for their "service fees". No cancellation fee. Mobile App to transfer money to and from the card. There are free ATM withdrawals across the country too! I definitely recommend this card!

In reviewing the terms of the Blue Sky card, I like several features that they offer. The fact they have no annual fees and have an introductory 0% APR for 15 months is very attractive. Their transaction fees are reasonable. The bonus spending credits are also a nice incentive. I used to have a regular American express account and having to pay the full balance monthly was, at times, a challenge. This card gives you the option to make payments over time if needed.I would definitely consider this card option in the future.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: The card has very few fees and nothing that will come as a surprise to anybody familiar with prepaid cards. The ATM fee of $3 can easily be avoided by using cashback at a local store and there are no penalties for not using the card. The only additional thing that I wanted is the ability to reload the card at a Target location, like I was able to do with the Walmart prepaid card that I was using up until recently.

So far this card as been excellent when it comes to rewards and travel miles. I got this card through a promotion to get 30,000 travel points (equal to $400 of qualified travel expenses) after spending only $500 in the first 3 months of having the card. On top of that, I also received 0% interest for the first 18 months. There are also numerous coupons for many retailers available directly from american express for anywhere from 5% to 20% of a purchase. I would highly recommend this card to anyone.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: I am really in love with The Platinum Card from American Express. The fee is not really that high when you add in the low fees. Not every card can be used internationally, but this one can. When I travelled to Europe this was one of the only cards that I could use for spending. The low late fee ceiling is nice. Even if I do run a little late, the maximum fee is definitely nowhere near the competitors.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: Because we are a military family American Express blue cash helps us out in so many ways. I used it for grocery and got 6% cash back to 3% cash back getting some gasoline which is 3% cash back. Every where you go this is truly a big help for us. We drove back from Alaska to here in Alabama and used our bank of America for our gasoline and got cash back from it. I will recommend this card to any one of you this is a big saving reward card and as of now, I never had a problem with it even my husband. And our yearly membership is waived because we are military family.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I received this card for the added bonus with League of Legends, which made the card even more amazing. I received $140.00 in free riot points, and a valuable prepaid card. There is no monthly fee if you do a direct deposit for that month, which is awesome. Signing up for the card was simple, and with no credit involved it is safe and easy to use. Free ATM withdrawals are also a nice added bonus, and save me money compared to my debit cards. The online app is somewhat slow, but is still a nice feature also. Overall a fantastic card and I will continue using it for a long time.

I'm close to switching from my Wells Fargo Visa credit card over to the Blue Sky card from American Express. Both are similar in rates, but the rewards with the Blue Sky card slightly outweigh those currently offered from Wells Fargo. But I'm not just looking at it from a rewards standpoint; I plan on taking advantage of their 0% for 15 months on transfers. This right here pretty much seals the deal for me!
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: I switched from the Marriott Rewards card to this Hilton credit card for two reasons: the annual fee and I simply found myself staying in more Hilton affiliated hotels. Marriott Rewards gave me a little more initial sign-up points, but after that first year it felt like I was breaking even having to pay the annual fee. With the Hilton credit card, I'm guaranteed at least one free stay with my family a year, which helps a lot.

The American Express blue card is an excellent card, 3% max on your cash back is great. I would say it's a lot better than my 1.5% cash back on my capital one credit card. But with that being said, is it so much to ask for not having to spend so much money just to get to that 3% max but either way, thank you American Express for the great benefits.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: This Platinum Card by American Express is very intriguing. American Express is one of the best charge cards in the world. I have experience using the cards but never the Platinum Card. I currently have a Capital One credit card and I do not remember the initial bonuses being great like the bonus offered for this American Express card. Also, the “No foreign transaction fees” is definitely a benefit for the continual use of this card. The annual fee of $450 is definitely a downside over my Capital One card but the prestige of this exclusive American Express Platinum Card and the benefits may be worth every penny. Unfortunately, I do not think my wife will be persuaded to change because of this high annual fee.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I am not sure if this American Express Gold Card is the right choice for me because of the outline which states, “Balance Must Be Paid in Full Every Month.” This is a “Charge Card” that has to be paid off monthly which differs from a “Credit Card” that allows credit as a loan with annual percentage rates. The American Express Membership Rewards Program is a great feature but I enjoy a little more flexibility in the monthly balance like I do with my current Capital One “Credit” card. American Express is known for great frequent flyer programs and this card appears to have a great offer. Maybe when an actual “Charge Card” will be to my advantage over a “Credit Card”, I will review American Express Gold options again.

This card has been amazing, I have had it for about 3 years. It really depends on whether you use the services or not. I had a case where I accidentally damaged my laptop and it was within the accidental damage window. I called Amex and they subsequently refunded my money immediately! That in itself paid for about two years worth of card fees.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express
