It's also great for traveling, since you get rewards points twice as fast if you use the card and book through American Express's travel site. I like the year-long 0% interest rate on this card. It makes it easy to get the 10000 point bonus, then slowly pay the 1000 balance back without accruing interest. The only thing about this card is that the bonus initial offer is not as good as the Citi Dividend, BoA BankAmericard, or Chase Freedom which give 100 dollars back for only $500 spent. Besides that, this card looks pretty great!

The Blue Cash Everyday Card from American Express is an excellent credit card. It offers a great introductory rate of 0% for the first 15 months, which is much longer than some of the other credit cards I own. Even when the introductory rate is over, it still has a decent interest rate. Just be careful to pay on time every time, or the interest rate will skyrocket to more than double, which is really the only caveat of the card.


The best feature of the card is the initial bonus of $100 that is easy to obtain, and then the cash back. You earn at least 1% back on all of your purchases, without having to do anything extra! Other credit cards require you to select certain categories of purchases for cash back throughout the year, but you don't have to do that here. There is also no annual fee, which is fantastic!


The only bad part of the card is you must have an excellent credit rating to actually obtain the card, but otherwise, it is an exceptional card worth having!
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: The Blue Cash Preferred from American Express Card is probably the best rewards credit card on the market right now. It has great rewards with a $150 signing bonus and cash back on supermarkets, gas stations, and department stores. Since I'm a college student, getting cash back on everything I buy is a plus. The 0% APR is also great and the cash back deal starts right when you sign up for the card. This is something I definitely could not live without.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: Using the American Express Prepaid card is similar to using a debit card; there are minimal fees. This is sooo nice. Who wants to spend a higher amount of money in return for a card that is worth less than you paid for? Or pay more per transaction (ten dollars when your items total 7). It makes no sense. The only fee i really see with the American Express prepaid card is the transaction fee for ATM withdrawals and $2 per transaction is on the lower end and normal for cash withdrawals. They even give you one free w/d per month, which is nice if you're like me and don't take cash out very often!

Hilton Credit Card looks like a good choice for traveler, especially if you stay in Hilton often. From the other side, it would be nice to know explicitly how much 1 point worse. The introductory deal is good. It comes with rather big purchase of $750, but in Hilton you probably spend it in one trip. The fees and APR look rather standard (the same or almost the same as British Airways Visa Signature Card, or Amazon.com Visa, or TrueEarnings Card). You have extra bonus for restaurants, gas stations and supermarkets, which is nice. No bonus points for airline tickets, so if you travel a lot and stay short times, you might consider some card with bonus miles in addition to or instead of Hilton Credit Card.

The Blue Sky from American Express seems to have a pretty good point system compared to other cards. The initial 7,500 points after $1,000 in three months is nice if you plan to use your card for everyday purchases. $1,000 is a lot to spend in 3 months but you are planning on spending it anyways, the $100 towards travel is nice. The interest rate on this card is pretty high if you are able to get a lower interest card. My Quick Silver Cash Rewards credit card from Capital One offers competitive incentives with a lower starting interest rate of 12.9%. The Blue sky starts at 17.24% APR. Another positive of the Blue Sky card is that it has no annual fee and 0% balance transfers for 15 months.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: The Blue Cash Preferred Card from American Express has great bonus offers and the interest rates look good as well. I really love that it comes with a 15 month no interest rate introductory offer. That's definitely something that will be helpful. Other cards like the Wal-Mart Credit Card also offer deals like that with a 6 month no interest rate, but I've never seen one with one as long as 15 months that this Blue Cash card offers. The rewards for using the card at US supermarkets is great too because everyone has to shop at the supermarket. It's a card that can be helpful to everyone.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: My mom has this American express Blue cash everyday credit card and she told me to get this credit card as well. This credit card is similar to the Bank of America credit card, where you get cash back from grocery stores. The bank of America gives you 2% on grocery stores, whereas the Blue cash gives you 3%. I use this credit card for gas and grocery stores. The points accumulate fast when you use the blue cash everyday card for your day to day expenses. The reward of getting 100 reward dollars after spending $1,000 in the first three months is very doable too.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: The bonus points for the Hilton Credit Card are an awesome benefit to this card, especially if you are a traveler. It's also great that there is no annual fee. There are so many cards out there like the Southwest cards that have an annual fee and that kind of takes away from the great experience of having the card. There aren't any crazy fees that you have to watch out for and the APR rates are pretty close to the other credit cards you could get today. Even the late fee is about standard which is great. It's an American Express which is great because they are always so easy to work with. Their customer service is wonderful and you know that you are always going to be able to work things out if there is a problem.

I like the American Express Serve. There is no activation fee and no monthly fee. Never, ever use a prepaid card that requires a monthly fee when there are so many out there that are free of charge. A good example of an absolutely terrible prepaid debit is the Upside debit. You could be paying up to 4.95 a month on this card and you have to pay for customer service. Utterly ridiculous. The Serve debit is far better. You do have to pay ATM fees, but I don't think that can really be avoided. If someone knows of a prepaid card that gets around that, let me know. I think perhaps one drawback is not every where accepts American Express. That may require more ATM withdraws than you would otherwise have to make with another prepaid card. All and all, I still think this is a good option if you are interested in getting a prepaid, which is something I always recommend.

The Blue Cash Preferred from American Express looks like a card worth investigating. The introductory rate of no interest for 15 months really stands out. Another card I recently looked at, and actually liked, was the Discover More, but it offered "only" a 12 month intro rate of 0%. This one has it beat by 3 months. The cash rewards of 6% at US supermarkets is a really nice deal I think. I make most of my meals at home and spend most of my food money buying groceries. This would be a good card for a family who does a lot of grocery shopping. Here again is a variable rate that could potentially fluctuate nearly 10% though. Also, there is a max penalty of 27.24%. You have to be careful, but I suppose that should be said about any credit card. All in all, I think this is a not a bad card. I still recommend looking into your local Credit Union before you take the plunge on a major credit card company.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: Whoa, I want this credit card! The Blue Sky from American Express looks AMAZING. I love the initial bonus points (bummer that you have to spend 1,000 but doing that in three months should be all that difficult). It's like they just give you a 100 dollar statement credit on travel right away, which is nothing that any person would turn down. Again, they have the 1 to 1 ratio on points to the dollar, which is a little disappointing based on the rest of the card, but it is still good. The only other card that was/is like this is the Capital One credit card that offered a ton of miles (the double miles challenge) but it was just a temporary thing...the Blue Sky from American Express looks to be a bit more permanent. Loving the fact that there's no annual fee either. Great card and it'll probably end up being a staple in your wallet, too.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content:
The American Express Gold Card allows you to earn points that can be used to then buy gift cards. This is nice if you'd rather have gift cards to specific places than cash back. Also, while no interest may seem like a great benefit, it's because the card must be paid in full each month. You cannot carry a balance.

The benefits are pretty great, though. Their customer service is top-notch and they offer member perks like exclusive rates at different venues (hotels, concerts, etc.).

I'd recommend it if you're able to pay your balance every month and if the annual fee of $125 doesn't bother you.

Personally, I'd rather have a card where I have the option to carry a balance if I need to and NO annual fee. I've had the REI Visa for several years not and have always had great customer service and no annual fee.

The American Express Prepaid Card is leagues beyond most prepaid cards. I’ve tried other prepaid cards such as generic Visa prepaid cards and Walmart cards, but they’re often riddled with fees and are expensive to use. The American Express Prepaid card doesn’t have many fees and is much more fair than other prepaid cards. They even give 1 free ATM withdrawal each month which isn’t something that’s common among other prepaid cards. At just $2 per withdrawal after the first, it’s less than others like the moneycard that I’ve used in the past. Many cards charge up to 3-5 dollars to use the ATM.

Blue Cash Everyday Card from American Express is a very nice rewards card that should be in your wallet. The reason you should carry this card is simply because of the great cash back rewards it offers. You get 2% from purchasing gasoline or department stores, 3% at selected grocery stores and 1% on anything else. The rewards are given to you very quickly and easily without any issues or problems. This card also has no annual fee, a major thing I love about this card. When you first get the card, you get an offer to receive $100 cash back from a total of $1000 in the first 3 months, which is 10% back. Definitely take advantage of that and any other promotion they run every year, it really helps you save some cash. Blue Cash Everyday Card from American Express is a solid credit card to have and worth carrying in your wallet.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: The Blue Cash Everyday Card from American Express seems like a good choice for those who qualify (with a good credit score) for a couple of reasons. First, it has a good intro deal and a decent regular rate, depending on what you end up getting. Second, rewards. The cash back is great considering the other basic features, so you might want to use this regularly just for that purpose. I know that other cash back cards are comparable to this one in rewards. For example, my Amazon rewards gives me 2% at gas stations and grocery stores, while this one actually has 3% at grocery stores. Overall this card seems decent if you want basic rewards.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: i like everthing about this card

The one thing I like about the American Express Serve prepaid card is the great customer service. I had a problem with this card in the beginning, I couldn't figure out how to send money to someone using the online page that allows you to set that up. I called them and they walked me through the entire process, didn't even make me feel like an idiot for not getting it right either. This is a good prepaid card, it has almost no fees except for an ATM fee but you really can't avoid that. There's no monthly maintenance or fees to use the card. The card looks really cool as well! Highly recommended.

The Blue Sky from American Express is one of the best American Express cards I have. One thing everybody talks about is the incredible customer service American express offers. You won't be let down by them at all. Anytime you need some help they will help you and get it sorted out quickly. The intro APR is great too, it lasts for 15 months which I find to be very generous, especially when compared to some other rewards cards that don't even offer an intro APR. There is no annual fee either! If you can get approved for this card, then I would definitely jump on this. I use it whenever american express is accepted and I haven't been disappointed yet.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: The American Express Serve card offers a lot of the same services I would expect from a debit card, and the fees are surprisingly low. The only fee is for an out of network ATM withdrawal, which most banks are going to charge anyway. Other than that there are free email transfers and no transaction fees. I think that not requiring a minimum balance while still keeping fees down and offering credit card protections on purchases give this card the advantage over a debit card linked to a checking account. The one limitation I see is that American Express is still not accepted at a lot of places.

The Blue from American Express Credit Card is a great card to have for many reasons. The no annual fee and no other crazy fees attached makes this card great. Not only that but with this card you are going to get the absolutely fantastic American express customer service. No waiting on hold for hours and hours and then finally getting someone who does not even speak english. The rewards for this card are good as well, with decent APR rates and everything else. This card is a no brainer definitely. I also have to say that to me, it's one of the best looking cards on the market.

The American Express Green Card is a great card that offers a great reward program. This card lets you earn points on anything you purchase, which is really nice. One of my most favorite features of this card is that it lets you use the points you earned to purchase merchandise from websites such as Amazon.com. This is a major plus for the American Express Green Card if you do a lot of online shopping like I do. This card does have an annual fee after the first year, which is $95 and I do not like that at all. I do not believe any card should have an annual fee and is the biggest negative to the American Express Green Card. It comes with purchase protection so that you are not reliable for any fraud if your card is stolen, which is very nice as some cards make you pay for this. If you do a lot of online shopping to earn or use reward points and do not mind an annual fee, the American Express Green Card is a great choice for a charge card.

The Blue Cash Preferred from American Express is a great rewards card. When you are approved and spend a certain amount on the card within 3 months, you get $150 reward dollars which is a nice bonus. This card also has some of the highest cash back on purchases at supermarkets and gas stations I've seen. It's 6% at supermarkets, which is very nice and adds up quickly. There is a limit to how much you can earn yearly though. One downside to this card is the $75 annual fee, which isn't too outrageous, but it is a fee nonetheless. Overall this is a great card to have.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I've always liked American express cards, after having many nightmares with other credit card companies customer service and having to wait on hold for hours to get my issues settled, only to end up being very disappointed in the end, it's a breath of fresh air to deal with american express customer service. No problems ever with them. That said, the Blue Sky from American Express card is great in other ways too. The points are easy to earn and you get a great APR and usually no APR in the beginning. It is kind of hard to get approved for as you need pretty good credit, but if you can get it, definitely do so. The no annual fee makes this a no brainer in my book.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: I signed up for the American Express Serve card a year ago because they were running a special offer where you could receive the card, and also a free $50 just for signing up. I didn't think I would use this card much but I found it to be very useful. The site to manage the card online is very well designed, allowing you to add users to your account and manage their spending limits easily. It's a nice feature I haven't seen offered by other prepaid credit card companies. Of course, this is an american express card so customer service is going to be great. This is a good prepaid card if you're in the market for one.

The Hilton Credit Card is a great card to apply for, if you travel a bit or find yourself staying in hotels this is a great card to have. The card is an american express card, so as always you know the customer service is going to be absolutely top notch, no problems there whatsoever. The APR is comparable to other cards of this nature and there aren't any ridiculous fee's attached either. No annual fee makes this card a no brainer. This is a rewards card and you will earn points pretty quickly, you may even end up getting yourself a free stay in the hotel!

Although I have not had the card very long, I am already very impressed! I'm not well versed on the points but some of my friends have told me that AmX has the best bonus program of all the cards. I will start saving for a trip home using my points and then using the card for purchases once I get there! The annual fee seems a it steep and I don't really know why it exists in the first place but other than that, I really am looking forward to the rewards program and seeing what it can do for me!

The Platinum Card from American Express is one of those cards you apply for just to see if you have the credit rating necessary to get approved. I mean, overall, it's a great card but I'm not sure if it's worth it completely. The rewards are outstanding and it definitely has many advantages of using it. But it does have some pretty significant downsides, such as the ridiculously expensive annual fee. The concierge service is great but only useful to a certain type of person who travels quite a bit. Depending on your lifestyle this card may be worth it to you, but to most? Probably not.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: The Blue Cash Everyday Card from American Express is the perfect choice if you have excellent credit score because you'll enjoy a healthy initial bonus with your first purchases, but also because you get a long 15 month 0% APR introductory period for subsequent purchases. Besides getting the amazing, and effective American Express customer service, you get cash back, up to 3% of all your shopping at stores, or 2% on gas stations, all this with no annual fee to speak of. By contrast, the Chase Sapphire Preferred Card has a $95 annual fee after the first year, and less overall rewards. In other words, you can't go wrong with the blue cash everyday credit card.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: My nephew has the American Express Prepaid Card and loves it. His credit is kind of low at the moment, but he wanted a nice prepaid card that would allow him to make purchases and may also get him invited to some of the other American Express cards in the future, which can be difficult to get approved for, but offer amazing rewards. This card is decent if you are looking for a prepaid card. The best thing about it is there are no fees, where as some prepaid cards over load you with unnecessary fees and try to rip you off, this card isn't like that. The customer service is also top notch. Highly recommended for a prepaid card.

After reviewing the terms and offerings, I have to say that the Bluebird Prepaid Card by American Express is one of the best prepaid options in the market. For example, when you enroll in direct deposit through your work, you get access to thousand of ATM for free, which is a great feature. In addition, if you travel a lot like myself, the 'no foreign exchange fee' will be a godsend in many occasions. You also get a robust and professional customer service, and online banking tools (including a mobile app!). The feature that sold me was the purchase protection for up to 3 months after you buy a product and it gets damaged or stolen during that period, which is something that my U.S. Bank prepaid card did not offer!

I've had about 5 different credit cards, and this has to be either my favorite one or second favorite card that i have ever had. I originally got it to help me pay off a different credit card with the 0% interest offer. Everything went smooth and when i had it paid off i kept the card to use for other things since it has a reward program with it. Ive never had an issue when I've had to call in for anything. All of the reps are nice and easy to understand. The credit limit isn't huge, but that's OK because it will keep me out of trouble, spending too much. Would recommend this card.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: The Blue Cash Preferred credit card from American Express is a wonderful credit card for anyone who enjoys receiving rewards for their credit card use. Blue Cash Preferred offers a wide variety of perks such as a $150 sign on bonus, no limits on redeemable rewards, and earn at least 1% back on purchases. You can earn up to 6% with some purchases. The yearly annual fee is only $75. You can earn up to a 25% cash advance rate, which is a much better deal than you get with other leading credit card companies. Like always, the Blue Cash Preferred comes with a 0% intro APR for 15 months. The late fees are not that bad either, at only $35 per month. American Express has always been lenient on payments and the Blue Cash Preferred gives you a 25 day grace period. Overall, I would recommend this credit card to anyone.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: So yesterday actually I was looking around for a new credit card not only to consolidate some debt on but also just to help build my credit. After a few hours of reading what seemed like endless pages of fine print I came to the conclusion that the Blue Cash Preferred Card From American Express is my best bet to archive my goal. It offers a nice 15 months of no Interest then when the interest does go up its only to 12.99% that's not bad at all considering what I'm paying now. This is not a card I will hang onto for every but for me I think it suits me just fine.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: Out of all the different options out there for prepaid cards, Bluebird is arguably one of the best. With the very minimal fees and extreme ease of set-up, I'm really having a hard time seeing where you can go wrong with this card. I picked up my Bluebird setup kit in a Walmart for $5, loaded some money onto it right there at the cash register, and then went home and activated it online from my computer. The temporary card can be used as a debit card anywhere that American Express is accepted, until your permanent card arrives in the mail. All in all, Bluebird is a very cost efficient and easy option when it comes to prepaid cards.

There's really no other option for a prepaid card other than the Bluebird Prepaid Card. So many prepaid cards get you with their monthly maintenance fees, or their various transaction fees. For example, look at the AccountNow Prepaid MasterCard. A $4.95 activation fee, plus $1 every time you use your card basically. And if you wanna get some cash from an ATM, that'll be $2.50. How about the Bluebird Prepaid Card? No activation, free transactions, and even free ATM usage with a direct deposit. How is there any competition?! And this card even has purchase protection, something not commonly seen on Prepaid cards - 50,000 in a single calendar year! If you want a prepaid card, look no further, the Bluebird Prepaid is everything you wanted.

This Business Gold Rewards Card from American Express isn't a consumer card, that's for sure. The hefty $175 dollar fee makes it nearly unaffordable for most people, but this is definitely a business card. No preset spending limit makes it a great card for any size business though, except that payment must be paid every month with this card. So if your company can afford it, this card makes a great card to put your balance on. There's no fee the first year either, and the rewards program is pretty good. Compared to a Capital One Spark Business, that card allows you to rack up a balance, but this one has no preset spending limit. I think this card is quite good if your business can afford to use it.

A Bluebird Prepaid Card is a pretty handy card to have if you have an extended network of Bluebird users. The great thing about this card is how easily you can transfer money to others that also have a Bluebird card; if you have any family or friends it is great to do simple, quick transactions. Other than that, it’s a pretty standard prepaid card that can be used almost anywhere, although American Express isn’t as widely accepted as Visa or Mastercard. If you need a quick and easy way to use a debit card, this is a simple solution.

I should’ve known anything associated with Walmart was a bad idea! This card has been nothing but a Royal POA. they sell it to you as an alternative checking account, but it is nothing but a prepaid debit card. Unfortunately, it’s not even that! You cannot use it as a debit card. The only time the pin function works is to draw cash out of an ATM. Charges can only be run as a credit transaction, and unfortunately, there are many places that do not accept American Express. Further, there are several places that will only accept debit. One should be able to access their funds using a pin number with this card but we can’t! We have also had issues making deposits. We have gone to places, including Walmart, that according to the website had an ATM that accepted deposits and found that that ATM did not exist at that location. We have tried to use the smart phone and make deposits by uploading a picture, but the app has crashed three of our smart phones and does not work. Nor is there an option to scan the check and upload it with your computer. This card is completely lacking in options and service and unfortunately since it is an American Express card which is not accepted everywhere is no longer useful to us. We have changed our direct deposit and will no longer be using the bluebird card.

Bluebird Prepaid Card is not actually a credit or debit card but a prepaid card where you put money onto the card through an online service and then you can spend it anywhere credit or debit cards are accepted. There are no monthly fees or activity fees unless you're withdrawing cash from an ATM and thats $2. There's pretty much no fees at all and are great cards to give to like your kids or family members and don't want them to have a credit card. The only one downside to the card is that its an AMEX and AMEX is sometimes not accepted in places.

Bluebird is the feature packed prepaid card from Walmart that can be used as an alternative to a checking account in a lot of ways. The main benefit of Bluebird compared to other prepaid cards is that almost all of the features are free. This includes activation, cancellation, inactivity, support, store transactions and monthly fees. If you have direct deposit set up you’ll get free ATM withdraws at any MoneyPass ATM, otherwise there is a $2 fee for each withdraw. One of the coolest features of this card is that you can make sub accounts for your family, limiting their spending power while still giving them the benefits of a secured credit card. This is a card to consider if you need an alternative to banking or simply want an American Express card without signing up for the full blown credit card. The limitations of this card would be the lack of any rewards and purchase protection only good up to $1,000 per occurrence.

The Business Gold Rewards Card® from American Express is a great corporate card, or for the wealthy individual who makes travel a large part of their life. With the large point bonuses on gas and airfare rates and the need to spend 5k in the first 3 months to activate the full bonus points, it's obvious who this card is intended for. Also, it's definitely a business card and not suited to the individual as the balance must be paid off before at the beginning of every month. Unlike every other card I have had (including my Oklahoma State Alumni card) this has no pre-set spending limit. So you're free to "grow your business". Oh happy day.

I have a lot of family members who use this card in lieu of using an actual bank and they seem to be incredibly pleased with it. They just don't trust banks anymore and don't like the high interest rates on bank cards, so they choose the prepaid route and a lot of them have said that they've tried multiple cards but the Bluebird Prepaid Card is the one they like the most. I love the fact that activation, balance checking and everything else is free compared to cards like the Mango Prepaid Mastercard, which charges $4 simply for activation. I would recommend the Bluebird Prepaid Card to everyone just based off of the word-of-mouth that I've heard from my immediate family members and friends. It seems to be one of the best options out there for prepaid cards, period.

I haven't used American Express for very long- nor have I owned credit cards for a significant time. However, there are some positive things to owning a card from AmEx- I have personally found it the easiest card to manage, simply from not wanting to spend as much needless money on a "fancier" card, you could say. Might sound silly but human psychology is a wonderful thing. Merchants also look for American Express when you're buying things- you'll probably feel more valuble as a customer. The added addition of being able to use "points" for flights and such was wonderful. I was able to visit my family back west a little more!

I’ll tell you what, I would feel pretty silly carrying around a Farmville Prepaid Card in my wallet. I mean imagine whipping that out to pay for a meal at a nice restaurant. On the other hand, I always preach evaluating cards on their terms rather than their branding, so I have to practice that. The Farmville prepaid card has very few fees, which might make it immediately more appealing to you than many of the fee-laden cards out there like the Suze Orman Card. But you have to consider how expensive the card would be practically, and if you’re someone who makes a few ATM withdrawals per month, the fees could add up. You only get free ATM withdrawal per month, and after that you’ll likely have to shell out around $4 for each transaction (the Farmville Card’s $2.00 ATM fee, plus an owner surcharge).


So, if you are using a prepaid card as a replacement checking account, you can likely find a less expensive option. I like the GreenDot card since it does not charge a monthly fee when you deposit at least $1,000 per month (you could easily meet this requirement by directly depositing your paycheck) and offers free ATM withdrawals. If you’re using the card as a teaching tool for your child, well, the Farmville Card could be a decent choice since it has low fixed costs. I would probably just get them the standard American Express Prepaid Card though because it has the same fees and does not bring the Farmville aspect into things. I would be nervous that my kids would overspend just to earn some stupid in-game rewards. I suppose that could be a quality teaching opportunity though because I would just laugh if they tried to hit me up for more cash!


Ultimately, the Farmville Prepaid Debit Card is decent, but that’s not because it’s Farmville branded, it’s because its terms mirror the standard Amex Prepaid Card. The Farmville aspect doesn’t really bring much to the table, aside from the dubious lure of earning virtual rewards on your real money.

I've had my American Express Zync card for about 8 months now. I applied and was immediately approved with a NPSL (no preset spending limit). For only $25 per year, I've had my own American Express card, which comes with fantastic benefits and unparalleled customer service. I use my Zync everywhere I go and it has never let me down since. This card helps control spending because you cannot carry a balance over to the next month and need to pay in full, which I do like. The card also looks great and makes people look twice each time I use it. I like the fact I have so many benefits, such as rental insurance, extended warranty, and product protection. Product protection ensures that I'll be reimbursed if an item I purchase gets damaged, lost or stolen! No other card offers the benefits American Express does. I would highly recommend the Zync card to anyone looking to step foot in the door with AMEX!

Having an American Express Zync card has been super helpful. I applied and received it towards the end of my college freshmen year. Using this card I am able to pay for many of my monthly bills with it when I need to put them off.Since it is a Paid In Full card it keeps me from running up the charges and becoming more a responsible consumer. There have been a few times where I was late in paying in full, and Amex has reasonable late fee terms and prices. It is also nice that I can use my Reward Points with my Amazon.com account in order to purchase small items. I highly recommend this card to anyone looking for an alternative to a debit card, or just a way to build their credit.

My Zync card is great. Not only do you receive the benefits of having an American Express card (outstanding customer service!) the annual fee is low and you rack up membership rewards points very quickly! You don't have to worry about carrying a balance because it's PIF every month. My favorite part of the Zync card, is the customizable packs. You can tailor special "packs" to your card, some free, some with a monthly fee, that can double or even triple your reward points. Could be great, for example, to add the restaurant pack to double points at restaurants, if you eat out a lot. Highly recommend American Express and the Zync card!

I have had my Zinc card for a few years now, and like it a great deal. This was my second credit card and it has been very benificial to have. The pay in full requirement has been a bit tough, but worth it. I also recieved 10,000 bonus points in the first 3 months, which was really nice! They have a lot of things you can redeem your rewards points for, from cash to travel! The Zinc card also has a low annual payment, I think its only $25 or so, plus $10 for my husband to have a card, as well.

I currently have the American Express gold premier rewards card. I have had this card for about 6 years now and have been pleased with it. The rewards are okay, the offer bonus points on gas, airfare, and grocery stores, all other purchases are one membership reward point per dollar spent. The points can be redeemed for airline miles, hotel points, retail merchandise, as well as being able to pay for travel and part of your bill with the points. What I like most is the different money back policies they have. This card offers extended return times (90 days) versus typical stores which you only have 30 days and they also offer replacement items for anything you bought on your card within the past 180 days that has been broken or stolen. Overall I am pleased with the card and service.
department: Premier Rewards Gold Card from American Express

content: I have had this card for about five years and I can honestly say that it is one of the best deals going if you own a cellphone and/or need to also need to buy office supplies. The gas rebate associated with this card isn't one of the best deals but it is not too shabby at 3%. Another feature I love is the fact that American Express Simply Cash will fight for you if you have trouble with a merchant. Over the five years I have had it, they have won me two settlements with merchants over lost/defective items and overcharges to the card for services rendered. Keep in mind that one thing you should always do with any card is pay off the balance each cycle. The interest is a killer. But that is just common sense, right?
department: SimplyCash® Plus Business Credit Card from American Express

content: I very much enjoy American Express as a company very much. I have this card with them and also the American Express corporate card. Both cards have been very simple to use, pay off, and maintain with American Express. The only thing I dislike is that not everyone takes the American Express card and I have to use debit on occasion. I really prefer American Express credit cards because their website is very easy to use to navigate my bills, transaction history, communications, etc. I recommend any cards that they promote or offer because of their excellent customer service and ease of use as a consumer.
department: SimplyCash® Plus Business Credit Card from American Express

content:
The first thing you need to know when shopping for a business credit card is that your personal credit standing, not your business’, will be the most important factor in the application process. In other words you don’t need to start at the bottom of the totem pole if you are starting a new business. The reason for this is that credit card companies hold small business owners liable for business credit card use and report use to their personal credit reports. That means if you have excellent credit the American Express SimplyCash Business Credit Card will be an option. Whether it’s a good one is another story entirely. The Amex Simply Cash Business Credit Card offers 5% cash back on wireless services and office supplies, 3% cash back on gas, and 1% on everything else. Simply Cash Business cardholders also automatically get 3-10% savings on purchases business expenses from Fedex, Hertz, and OfficeMax. You also get 0% on purchases for 6-12 months. Sounds pretty good, huh?


Sure does, but you still need to ask yourself two important questions, is this the most rewarding card and can I use it for all company spending. Issuers can still change interest rates on business credit cards at will, which means if you need to use a credit card for funding purposes, you should get a personal credit card. You should still use a business credit card for everyday expenses though, which is where the American Express Simply Cash Business Card comes into play. Looking at other business rewards cards it does appear to be a competitive offer. It really depends on your company’s spending habits though. For example, the Ink Bold from Chase offers 5 points per dollar on your first $50,000 in business expenses each year and has an initial bonus, so if you spend less than $50k each year on office supplies, wireless services, etc., it might be a better option. Neither it nor the Amex Simple Cash has an annual fee in the first year, although the Bold has a $95 fee beginning in the second year. I’d recommend looking around a bit to make sure you’ve found the right card, but if you want simple, straightforward rewards, aren’t concerned with travel rewards, and office supplies, wireless services, and gas are three of your company’s biggest expenses, the Simple Cash Business Credit Card from American Express is likely the way to go.
department: SimplyCash® Plus Business Credit Card from American Express

content: After deciding on a large furniture purchase I knew I couldn't pay in full, the store offered me 90 days same as cash. I knew some credit cards offered 0 APR too as a new customer perk, so I looked around. This is where Blue Sky from American Express comes in. The deciding factor was a no brainer. AMEX is top notch anyway in my book, then the offer of 12 months 0% APR AND rewards points with no annual fee. It was an easy decision-- we got 12 months same as cash plus rewards points.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: This has to be the best card I have and I usually use it everywhere American Express is accepted. Claiming your point is easy and hassle free. The most bang for your buck comes when you use it towards travel related purchases but if you are not planning on traveling you could also use your points towards gift cards and cash if you prefer that. During the months of November and December they even had gift cards available at discounted point for many restaurants. I've had this card for about 5 years now and I have used points for over $400 in gift cards, Free airline ticket from Miami to Atlanta, and usually able to take $100 off most of my travel expenses using points. Like David Kauffman stated before me they have started to offer other deals. The last one I used was a $5 statement credit when you purchase $30 at olive garden. Over all this is one card worth having for the special deal. I would just recommend logging on to your account often to take advantage of everything.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: Everyone needs to have an American Express card, and this is one of the best ones you can get that has no annual fee and still gets some rewards, although you might not want to use this for your every day purchases due to it's standard base 1% you get back. I also found that I must use my rewards for travel, so I can't just easily redeem my miles for gift cards or cash back which is a disappointment. But if you follow Amex on social media, they often do deals where you get special promotions by using your card. For example, sync your AMEX account with your Twitter, and you can buy stuff through Twitter with your card! They had a deal where you could buy a $25 AMEX Sync card for $15, which is basically free money! They also have deals through their Facebook App where they do things such as "Buy $100 at Store X and get a $10 statement credit". I pretty much use my AMEX card exclusively to take advantage of these deals, and shop at CostCo and other places that only accept AMEX.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: I spend 2 weeks at my cousin’s in Ireland every year. I was looking for a card that offered some decent traveling perks. One of the things I loved about American Express was the rental car insurance they offered. I applied for the card and got it and went on my yearly trip to Ireland. I spent a little more than usual and generally had a decent experience. Since that initial trip the card has supplemented the costs of each successive trip. The customer service is superb, not just good, but superb. Every call has been dealt with professionally and courteously. Overall, it’s a great card, but for a specialty card it has the drawback of having a high rate, not the worst, but it’s up there. As long as you are financially secure and travel this card will benefit you.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: I love this card! Points add up so fast and I love to travel so it comes in really handy when it gets to be vacation time. I use it for all my expenses that have a credit card option then just pay it off in full each month if I can. I do not like carrying a credit card balance if I can help it. If you do then the interest cuts into the rewards you are earning. I have never had an issue with customer service either. I have always spoken to very friendly representatives and my issues have always been solved in a matter of minutes. I would recommend this card to anyone that likes to travel and with the high cost of airline tickets these days every bit helps!
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: So far this credit card has been great for me, the rewards incentives are equally matched by amazing customer service. For me Blue Sky from American Express is almost like another limb. I use it everyday and I don’t know what I would do without it. Every meal it eat, every trip I plan, and all the gas I buy is usually with this card. Likewise I also reap a lot of rewards benefits. Every couple thousand rewards points that I accrue the more options I am offered. Whether its a travel voucher or a gift card of some sort.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: I've had this card for a few years now and I love it. As others have mentioned, it's not accepted everywhere so it does have it's downside, but it's a minimal one. The customer service is top notch (the few times I have actually had to deal with them, it was certainly not an unpleasant experience), the rates are fantastic and the rewards are excellent as well. Having no blackout dates is also something I really like about this card. I hope to have this card for the foreseeable future and I would recommend it to any family or friends interested in getting a new credit card.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: American Express continues to be one of the leaders in credit card rewards and service. I do wish this card was acceptable in more places, but that would be the only complaint. The rewards add up very fast and American Express always treats you as a prized customer rather than someone they are trying to get money out of. When its time to redeem your rewards they walk you through the process and make sure you are getting the best available for your points. The no black outs is not a gimmick as I have never had a problem redeeming my points for travel.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: I have had this card for about 2 years now, and it's been a decent card. I do have good credit, and despite that, the rate is fairly high, but better than plenty others I've seen. You really need to pay it off monthly to get the good deals from the rewards. What really sold me on it was the fact that there are no fees and the rewards are pretty decent. So many other cards you are paying a yearly fee to get similar rewards, so you really win on that point with Blue Sky. Also, the rewards are extremely easy to redeem. When you hit 7,500 points and want to receive a $100 travel credit, you just make a selection online and click the travel/hotel/car you purchased that you want it applied to...and voila! The money is there. There are also several gift card/statement credit options. I recently ordered a gift card and it arrived two days later! If you are on top of paying off your credit card and using this frequently, the rewards definitely make it a good option for a card!
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: American Express is unsurpassed when it comes to customer service. I recently dined out and an untrustworthy member of the restaurant staff took my credit card information, went to a neighboring establishment, and made several purchases. These purchases didn't raise the red flag as illegitimate/fraudulent because they were small and local. They could easily have been mine. Nevertheless, when I reported it to American Express, they quickly deducted the charges and launched an investigation! They even demanded the merchant in question show proof of signature. I was amazed at their thoroughness, and how quickly they believed me and took action, rather than questioning the validity of my story.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: I have had this card for about a year now. It is very easy to use. Though I haven't used the rewards yet, I do feel that I am getting a pretty decent deal for earning a point for every dollar I spend. After you earn a certain amount of point you can trade it in for a $100 to go towards traveling. As I understand it, there are no blackout dates and my miles never expire. There is no annual fee and the interest rate is pretty decent compared to what is being offered nowadays. It offers online statements and payments. The website is incredibly easy to navigate and I also get monthly reminders when my bill is due. This is huge for me as I am definitely the type to let these details slip my mind from time to time.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: I have had this card for about a year.It is my favorite card. I like it because it has a lot perks.I also like it because there is no annual fee.I hate paying an annual fee it is such a waste of money. The card has a little chip in it so you do not have to swipe your card just wave it close to the card reader. American Express has great customer service representatives every time I call them they are polite and sincere.I had no problem when I called asking for them to raise my credit limit, it was done in less then five minutes.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: I've had this card for about a year and a half now. What I liked about it when I got it was that it had many of the perks of an American Express card, but without the yearly fee. I also was about to collect enough points in the first couple of months to be able to get a $300 credit on a flight I was taking, which was very helpful at the time. Paying the card online took a bit of setting up to do since there was an issue with the website not remembering my username and password combination, but once all that was straightened out, I've had no trouble with it. They give you plenty enough notice, via email, to get your bills paid on time as well. I've never had to use it to withdraw cash, so I can't comment on the ease or difficulty of that. The downsides to it are that due to the lack of a monthly fee, the 'perks' that come with an AmEx card are drastically cut down. And after the promotional period ends, points for travel or cash back are very slow to add up.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content:
While it has been a few years since I actually held a BlueSky card, it is still one of my favorite credit cards out there. One of the main reasons why I loved it so much was because it was just such a cool card, I loved the design and the fact that it had the swooping plane on the front and the little chip embedded in the card. I felt so modern and up with the times when I carried it around and used it.


Unfortunately the downside to American Express is that they don't tend to work with you if you are having difficulties. While I loved the card I had to pay off the balance and close it, and my other two Amex cards, when I went through a tight stretch because they were completely unsympathetic and offered me no way of help. Fortunately I was able to find a way out on my own and close the accounts, but strangely enough I still miss this card!
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: I have had this card as a permanent resident in my wallet for a while now, and I have to say, that I really do like this card quite a bit. It has not only simplified the travel arrangement making process, but there is also no annual fee, and no blackout dates. From the very moment I swipe the credit card, to the moment I make the payment, it's all been an enjoyable and genuinely positive experience. I am also very grateful for all the efforts that Amex has taken in ensuring that the card is not only dependable, but also protected from potential fraudulent charges. The customer service has been exceptional. I have been treated with both respect and courtesy in those rare occasions in which I’ve had to speak to a representative. The rewards are also another great perk; being able to redeem those points for Amex gift cards has been wonderful since we don't really get that many opportunities to travel often. All in all, having this card has been a very positive experience.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: One of my favorite features of the AMEX Blue Sky is the pay pass feature. Instead of taking the card out, waiting for it to authorize, signing a receipt, etc...all I need to do is scan the card at many kiosks and it recognizes me. My wife and I are planning our 10th anniversary, so beign able to use these points for airline tickets is an added bonus. I use this card for everything! The one negative that I have is that this card is not accepted everywhere (like my local coffee house). You can also use the points for other things besides airline miles, as some reviewers have mistakenly pointed out.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: I liked the American Express card when I first got it, but they dropped my limit down without warning me. I also feel that the rate is a bit expensive. I have called every three months to see if I can get a lower rate and once I was able to get it. The customer service people I spoke with were polite and helpful despite them being unable to lower the rate. I also have found the online transactions very easy and problem free. One slight issue is that some places will not take American Express, but it is fairly uncommon to run into these places.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: American Express is not accepted everywhere which makes them less convenient. They are the only card accepted at Costco, so if you can't pay debit, in that regard they are a convenient card to have. I, however, do not recommend American Express to anyone. After being a cardholder for over 10 years, never being late on a payment, American Express saw fit to randomly drop my available credit limit by over $15,000. This drop in the credit limit made it look as though I was nearly maxed out on this card which then hurt my credit score quite a bit. As I continued to pay down the balance, American Express kept lowering the limit by $1000. Over a 1 year period I went from a $25,000 limit to a $6000 limit with absolutely no warning or explanation from American Express. I have not closed the account but I do try my very best not to use the card. I'm sorry, I would not recommend American Express to anyone.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content:
I have had the Blue Sky card for about a year now. I mainly use it for shopping at CostCo, but also as a backup in case I can't use my primary Capital One Venture card. I feel like the rewards on this card aren't as great on other cards. The best deal is redeeming 7500 points for $100 in airfare credit, but that's it. Other cards let me do cash back, gift cards, things like that and redeem points at a much higher percentage back. American Express also would only give me a $2,000 limit, while other cards gave me as much as $15,000.


Overall it's a good card to have if you need to pay with AMEX like a place like CostCo, since there is no annual fee. But you are better off with other cards for every day purchases that offer you a higher cash back.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: I have had this card for many years now, and have to admit it's not my "go to" card any longer. I prefer to use Discover because it is accepted more places and seems to give more perks and rewards (cash back bonus is a biggie!). American Express doesn’t seem to be accepted as widely as Mastercard, Visa and Discover. But, that being said, I've always been happy with my experiences with American Express. Never have I had any customer service issues or errors on my statements or other problems. No annual fee is a bonus, and having the rewards add up (albeit slowly) is an incentive to use the card for larger purchases. I’d recommend having the American Express card among other credit cards in your wallet.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: I have been a loyal American Express card holder for more than ten years, and I honestly cannot say enough good things about the quality and convenience of service I have received. No annual fee is a HUGE selling point, but really more important are the bonus points and rewards related to how much I use the card. I travel extensively for both for work and pleasure, and being able to to smoothly redeem my points for travel rewards with few restrictions is just outstanding. This is the only credit card I have, and I really can't see any reason to get another. I highly recommend it to anyone who wants an easy to use, no hassle card that will end up paying dividends in the long run.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: This card is okay. I have noticed in my area that the amount of retailers participating in amex is dwindling. Thus making it harder to use my card. Whether this is american expresses fault or not I don't know. It could be the mom and pops stores have issues with it. I love the reward factors and the fact that there is no annual fee. Those 2 usually don't come hand in hand. I have scheduled my direct pays using this card and it helps maintain my bills and also gathering reward points in the process. For the most part I love my Blue Sky card.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: I absolutely love the Blue Sky card from American Express! I took advantage of the bonus points offer for 7,500 points when I spent $1,000 in the first three months (easy to do!) and have used the card for almost every purchase since. Those points add up fast! I love that there is no annual fee for the card. You don't see that often with rewards cards. The ability to redeem my points for travel, without a lot of restrictions and blackout dates to deal with, is also a huge plus! I would definitely recommend the Blue Sky card to anyone looking for a rewards card that really does pay you back.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content:
I’m not quite sure why people apply for the Blue Sky from American Express Credit Card. Maybe it’s due to American Express’ good reputation. Maybe it’s because it has a pretty name. Or maybe it’s actually because it offers 0% on purchases for 12 months and 1 rewards point for every dollar spent. If it’s the latter, you need to understand that neither of these perks is that noteworthy. Why? One percent across all purchases is pretty much the standard in the rewards credit card genre, and most of the upper echelon cards offer up even better rewards on certain popular spending categories in addition to that. Also, a 12 month 0% purchase APR is decent, but there are a lot of cards offering better deals. Take, for example, the Citi Simplicity Card. It offers 0% on purchases for 21 months AND 0% on transfers for the same length of time.


So, which cards in particular would be better choices than the American Express Blue Sky Credit Card? If you want rewards and don’t have any particular spending categories that dominate your monthly statements, I’d go with the Capital One Venture Card or the Capital One Cash Credit Card, as the former offers what amounts to 2% cash back as long as you redeem miles for travel-related purchases and the latter offers 1.5% cash back across all purchases. If you tend to spend a lot at gas stations, department stores, dining, etc., then you can find a card offering extra rewards on your biggest spending category and save more than you would with the Blue Sky American Express Credit Card. When it comes to interest rates, the aforementioned Citicard is obviously a much better deal than the Blue Sky. The bottom line is that excellent credit, which the Blue Sky Credit Card requires for approval, is like a golden ticket in today’s market, and getting a card like the Blue Sky from American Express would just be a waste of potential.
department: Blue Sky from American Express® Card

content: I've been using this card for almost a year now and I've been loving it so far. One of the great things about the card is the $0 introductory Fee and after saving up points you can use them for shopping at some of your favorite stores and restaurants. Also the customer service over at American Express has been fantastic, I think they are one of the best in that regard. One downside of that card is after the first year you have to pay, so keep that in mind. Despite that, this is still a card very much worth getting.

I've been an American Express cardholder for 8 years. The customer service is unmatched. I recently upgraded from the Blue Cash card (also wonderful) to the Gold card, mainly to take advantage of the points program that this card offers. We book all of our travel using American Express. It is accepted everywhere we have gone. I have also had to take advantage of their purchase protection, which is an amazing benefit. The customer service is easy to reach and very willing to help. When my card was used fraudulently, American Express worked very swiftly to resolve it as soon as they were notified. I am very impressed with this card and this company. I highly recommend American Express.

I have had American Express for about 2 years now I did not really like the idea of having a credit card but since I use the internet a lot and make hotel reservations. I applied for this credit card and got approved I do not use this card all the time. I do however like that the customer service is top rated very friendly and helpful. I also like the points program they offer with this card. They also offer me tickets to concerts and other opportunities before they even go on sale I would recommend this card to others.

I’ve had my American Express for over 4 months now and it has given me everything I could expect from this company. It’s accepted anywhere I go. The customer service is some of the best I’ve ever had to deal with. I am enrolled in their points program which really rack up if I exclusively use this card. So far, I’ve mainly used this as my business card which helps me track my expenses and manage my payments monthly. Another perk is that was unexpected is that I am offered opportunities to purchase tickets to events or concerts before they go on sale to the public. This summer is going to be very busy for me.

I chose the American Express Rewards card as my rewards card of choice. This card offers points for gifts instead of cash back or airline miles etc. like some others. The reason for this preference is simple-- of all the credit cards around American Express Gold fared better across the board. Firstly, they excel in customer service. Not only that, they are hassle free, accepted widely, and the rewards points accumulate very quickly. I admit I have a cash back rewards card but I don’t feel as if I'm earning very much. Pennies accumulate with every purchase, and I end up spending them on the next purchase. With cash back I am awarded a gift card for a dinner or other gifts that I can actually see feel or taste. This works better for my psyche and leaves me feeling even better about AMEX and the world around me.

I recently received an American Express Gold Card (over a month ago) and have thoroughly enjoyed it. There are a ton of perks with having this card, such as the points for spending system, and flyer miles (for those who travel a lot). While these perks are definitely a plus, I have to be honest in saying that the annual fee, although free the first year, is a little high for my tastes. If you are one to use your credit card anywhere and everywhere (especially to rack up those points to spend), then maybe the fee isn't too bad. Asides from that, I've dealt with American Express customer service a few times and have to say that they provide better service experience than most of my other cards I have. I do recommend getting this card, especially if you are one that loves using points to shop!

I love my American Express Gold Card. If you are lucky enough, they send you a mailer with a nice amount of bonus points to sign up. I received 75,000 bonus points for signing up for the account. This was enough to get two new laptops. One for myself and one for my best friend. Beyond the great sign up bonus, The American Express Gold Card is a nice card to have. They stand by their customers and help them out. Many times, they extend the warranty of products that you purchase using the card. They also have very helpful customer service. Get it, if you can!

I once had this card and loved it. That was during the time when I had a good-paying job and could afford many of the luxuries in life. I accumulated points which I used in time for free trips and holidays. It was a win-win situation. The more I spent, the more rewards I got. I would have loved to keep it if not for an unexpected reversal of fortune. One thing with American Express is that once you have fallen out of grace, there is no turning back. You are forever blacklisted. I found that out too late. I had a good run with it, though.

My father told me that first you get a Visa or a Mastercard, then you get a Discover, and eventually you get an American Express card. Visa and Mastercard will basically cover you everywhere. A Discover won't cover you everywhere, but it gives you better rewards and rates. An American Express gives you the best rewards in my experience of any of the credit cards that I have. I use it to pay for most things and I have used the points I've accrued to get the last couple vacations I took to be mostly free as transportation to and from the places I visited was the biggest expense.

I was always told by friends and family that an American Express card is the card to get. To have one is a sign of good credit and a good financial standing. Well I now have one. I don't know what it says about me, but I like this card. The ability to earn points is a good feature of this card. I like the fact that I have to pay the balance off each month. That actually helps with our bills and budget. Fortunately we have never had any issue with the card, but like others have said the stories I have heard about the customer service are amazing and praiseworthy. I recommend this card to any who are interested in it.

I originally started with the basic green American Express card, but last year upgraded to the Gold card. I am extremely pleased with this card and have stopped using all of my other cards because of this card's benefits. The customer service is exceptional and I am able to get a real person on the phone within minutes. You don't have to go through a million prompts and their customer service reps are helpful and honestly, just nice people. Amex provides travel insurance which covers you if your bags are lost and provides insurance for your rental car (saving you money!). My favorite benefit is the return protection that Amex offers. How many times have you purchased a piece of clothing just for it to fall apart after wearing it a few times? If this has ever happened to you (like it has to me), this is the card for you. The store won't take back your item? No problem! Just file a claim with American Express and they will refund you! The expensive shoes you bought kill your feet after wearing them? Again, not a problem! Amex has you covered. The annual fee I pay definitely is worth the benefits I receive from this card. Thanks Amex for the outstanding service!

I find the American Express card to be an excellent card. Unlike a credit card, it is required that you pay the full amount each month, but for people who do this anyways, this is a great card. The 15,000 bonus after spending $1500 in the first month is a great help, but the most amazing thing about this card is the benefits of being a Gold card member. To name some, they include roadside assistance, acceptance of returns that stores will no longer take, insurance when travelling using your American Express card and much more. Holding an American Express Gold Card in your wallet is much more than a credit card, it really does make you feel like you are a member or something.

One of the best cards around has to be the American Express Gold Card. It carries along with it prestige, glamor, benefits, and virtually no limit. It is wonderful for travel, car rentals, luxury purchases, etc. It also carries a built in insurance plan to insure most rental cars and probably other rentals as well. Mine comes with a rewards program where points accumulate very quickly. Some may wait to accumulate thousands of points for larger prizes but my method is to frequently redeem my points for restaurant gift cards. As opposed to cash back, rewards redemption gives me that feeling of truly being pampered by AMEX at a nice restaurant-- on them. The annual fee is $125 but the peace of mind I get in return with this card is worth every penny. You can't carry a monthly balance, but I like the traditional AMEX way of paying it off every month with no interest. My experience with customer service has been nothing short of professional. Overall, this is one of the top cards around.

I started doing business with American Express 7 months ago. I have found that there are many benefits to using the American Express Gold card, the greatest being that there is no spending limit on this card. However, there are a few things that I do not like about this card. I do not like that I have to pay my balance in full each month. On one hand, this keeps my spending in check, but on the other hand, if a big emergency were to occur where I would have an unexpected, large expense, I would not be able to use this card. I also am not thrilled with the yearly fee. The first year they waive the fee, but after that it is $125 annually. One great thing about this company is their excellent customer service. I have called a few times with questions and concerns and have always spoken with friendly and knowledgeable staff that were able to address all of my issues. Overall, this is a good card as long as you are able to make your payment in full each month.

I have been had every credit card brand there is an have come to the conclusion, American Express is definitely the best brand out there. First off, the customer service representatives are incomparable to other companies. Whenever I call for help, there is zero wait time on the phone and I am connected with someone who speaks perfect English. Secondly, American Express has an excellent policy regarding stolen or lost credit cards. A little over a year ago I lost my credit card and didn't realize it was gone. A month later I got my American Express bill and saw charges for 500 that I had no idea about. I called American Express and the charges were immediately reversed. This type of outstanding service is far from what I experienced from other card companies. All in all, compared to any other card I have used, American Express has proved to be the best card company out there.

I used this card (American Express Gold) for quite awhile but canceled my account with them earlier this year. My main gripe with the card was the fact that many vendors did not accept the card at all. This to me was a major annoyance as I used to use this card as my primary payment method. While the card gives rewards points I found that they didn't rack up fast enough for them to be of any real value to me. All that said, this isn't a terrible card. As long as you pay your bill in a timely fashion you should have no problems with it.

I had an American Express Gold card for three years. I don’t anymore. I think it’s better than most credit cards, but, let’s face it, these companies make money somehow, and that somehow means high late fees. But this is a charge card so at least there isn’t any interest accrued over time. You have to pay back the balance in full every month.


I think AMEX is a little out of date, from the era of traveler’s cheques. If you aren’t a business traveler, racking up tons of points and rewards, it’s easier to use your Visa or MasterCard debit card issued by your bank. Plus, they are accepted at more places than American Express.

Overall, the membership fee is too high if you’re not a business traveler, and you may actually pay more in membership fees than rewards you get back. I cancelled my card a year ago and don’t regret it.

I've been an American Express customer for years. If you don't carry a balance and are moderately organized this is definitely the card to have. The customer service reps are beyond parallel in the industry and they levels of fraud protection, responsiveness and rewards are much better than Visa's, for example.


The number of places you can use your card in are somewhat limited, but think about it as a loyalty club. This is not a card to buy your groceries (well, you can, but that's not its main use). This is the ideal travelers card. No lockups, fast service, robust online systems and low waiting times if you need to reach a customer service rep. I'm very happy with my American Express experience and would gladly recommend it to anyone else.

I've had my American Express Rewards card for a little over a year now and for the most part it has served me well. I always pay my bill on time and have had no problems with any errant charges. The best part about the card is that it gives reward points for most purchase and those points can be used for flights (and other things) which I find very useful. my only grip with the card is that many locations do not accept the card and many of those that do seem to frown upon it. that said that is their problem and not mine; I'm happy with the card.

I have been using this card for about six months now and haven't had any real problems with it. I use it quite often as a means to establish my credit. I am forced to pay the monthly payments each month, I can't just put it off for another time. For me this is a good thing since I can never get behind on my payments. The interest rate for this card is pretty decent, and hasn't really effected me so far. I have only gone over a limit once and the card froze up, I called customer service and the explained to me what happened. In return I learned what kind of limit I had as well as to never do that again. I have been told there is no annual fee for the first year, which I find to be really good. Overall so far I have had no real problems with this card, and would highly recommend it to anyone that can manage to get it.

I signed up for the american express card a while ago. It thus far has been the longest I have ever held a credit card in my life. What I love about the AMEX card is that you have the safety to purchase anything you want, the drawback being you have to pay the entire amount every month. I feel like this card keeps you more honest about your spending. Also the rewards are amazing, thus far I have booked two round trip vacations to the Caribbean with my reward points. Also I was able to set up my other family members on a shared plan which is amazing at monitoring our family expenditures.

American Express was the first credit card to ever give me a chance! I had somewhat poor credit due to identity theft, and it took forever to sort out! But, American Express gave me a chance anyway and I couldn't be happier with them! Their customer support is amazing! I can make automatic payments and when I make them on time (which is always) it helps dig me out and improve my credit score! So not only did they help me out with getting a credit card, they are also helping me rebuild my credit for the future! Although I do now have other types of cards, I rarely use them (only in cases of emergency) because this is the best one, by far!

I have used American Express for about 4 years. I wish more credit card companies would take the initiative in their customer service as American Express does. Anytime I have a question or need to get a hold of them, they are always very friendly and responsive. I don't have that feeling that they are rushing to get me off the phone, whereas other problems I've had with my other credit cards usually result in an unpleasant experience. Never once have I had that negative feeling with American Express. They tend to go the extra mile in security as well. If I spend a lot of money in a short amount of time, they call and verify that I made the purchases to confirm that my card has not been stolen. Over the last 4 years of owning this card, the only issue I ever have is coming across those few places that won't take them. Other than that, if and when I CAN use my American Express card, I do.

I have been using this particular American Express card for a few months now. However, I have used various cards from Amex over the years. Though there is an annual fee, the rewards program more than makes up for it. I have received numerous bonus items for using the card to purchase items as I normally would. It's a win-win really. They also have some of the best rewards items of any of the major credit cards. Don't let the annual fee scare you away from trying this card. If you pay for most of your household items with it and pay it off at the end of the month, the card will pay for itself within a couple of months.

I've been a member of American Express since 1997 and I am planning on continue for many more years to come. The card is great, you can earn points after purchasing with this card and the points can be used to pay part of the balance in the card, to get trips and flights and a long list of gifts in their own catalog. I got a great pan set thanks to American Express, a camera and a DVD recorder. The service is just amazing. In one trip to Brazil they copied the card number and immediately froze the account after suspecting that two purchases weren't ours, I share the same account with my husband. We were very please with the whole support team and how they handled a tricky situation despite the fact that the people who stole de number bought a 500 purchase in a department store and tones of gas.

I started with American Express through my company as that was one of the cards I had for all my business expenses. One of the biggest perks for me was the points program they offer. There is a wide variety of options in how to redeem your points and I have never had anything but excellent service and great experiences when I redeem mine. I have booked entire Hawaiian vacations, airfare included, using my points which to me is a huge perk! Another of the perks for me was I was able to get a personal card when I left the firm and have my rewards transferred to that account. I pay my balance off each and every single month as this card requires. I like that there is one flat fee for the year and no fee the first year. In order to get the most benefit from this card it is important to always make your payments on time, as they will get you with the late fees. However, as long as that isn't a problem for you I would highly recommend this card! It is important to remember there are still some retailers who don't accept Amex so I would also have a second card or make sure to have a debit card handy as well.

Having the American Express Gold Card is like carrying around gold. Just saying "I want to put this on my American Express Gold Card" could change the whole demeanor of even the most lax sales clerk.
