Everyone knows if you are carrying the AEGC you are in the upper most bracket of valuable customers and they best get on their game. I never had a problem in over 12 years of using American Express. We had a few issues with items that arrived broken in the post and American Express helped us get credit and resolve the issues with the shipper. That goes to my previous point. When I had similar issues using an HSBC card, the shipper wanted to haggle and hassle. When we used the American Express card we never got any grief. That is why I truly believe that the American Express Gold Card carries a hefty bit of clout for the consumer to throw around if need be.

This card is awesome, very secure and I am always able to check my account online! Every time I have an issue I call customer service and they are more than happy to help me resolve any problems I may have. The card balance must be paid in full each month so it's important to keep track of your expenses throughout the month.

The card has added security that others like VISA or Mastercard do not. At certain stores, I am asked for the 4 digit security code on the front of the card, or just ID but either way it gives that added security so that you know your information is secure. It is truly a great card, only con is that not everywhere accepts AMEX.

I have had this card for over two years and have been very satisfied with it. My family spends a lot of money on groceries and gas, and receiving double points for those purchases really adds up quickly.


I have also used the Membership Rewards section of the Amex website to receive extra points on certain retail purchases. I have typically received 2-3X points for purchases at both low end (Sears) and high end (Neiman Marcus) retailers. Another nice feature of the card is being able to use points directly on Amazon.com. While it's less than the typical 1% redemption rate, it is still a nice to have around the holidays.


The one thing I do not like about the card is the annual membership fee. It is very high, and they do not let you use points (at a 1% conversion rate) to cover it. If they let you do that, the card would be nearly perfect.


It's definitely a great card, and I would highly recommend it to people who tend to put a lot of spend on their credit cards.

I have been an American Express cardholder for almost 30 years. I use it primarily for travel, dining out and occasional big ticket item purchases to build up my rewards balance. The rewards points are easy to redeem. I have used their travel website to redeem reward points for air travel and I have not experienced any issues with restrictions. I just booked a free ticked for my daughter to travel to France this October. I like that American Express is accepted everywhere and that it is a recognizable brand credit card when traveling abroad. I also know that American Express has alerted me to unusual activity and fraud on my account and they removed those charges. It has also helped me with disputed payments on some items. The annual fee is a little high overall compared to other cards but I have learned to live with it.

As a business owner getting started, I needed to be able to easily segment off charges on one account so that reconciling receipts and expenses each month would be easy until my business was able to get credit. The American Express Gold Card is readily accepted by all of my vendors and even my utility companies. Unfortunately, I had a problem one month where I had been overcharged - two charges for the same shipment. Instead of waiting for a response from the vendor like I have experienced with other credit cards, American Express immediately credited my account. The company sets a high standard for qualifying, but this works in favor of a customer like me because the company can stand behind the customer's word. Very satisfied with AMEX and hope to open a business account with them in the near future.

I have had this card now for 6 months. I use this card for company expenses. My company reimburses me for my expenses and I keep the rewards for myself. It’s a great benefit. The card has worked well for me. My company pays for the annual fee. I’m allowed to use the card for my personal non-work related expenses. The website lets me track my expenses and send an expense report to my company for just work related expenses. It’s very fast and convenient. Their customer service is the best in the business. Their customer reps are incredible helpful and patient with any request I have. I highly recommend this card to any traveler or business professional.

There's two sides to getting this card. On the plus side, American Express is a great company, and having their army of customer support agents at your side is a pretty great feeling. The system is set up so ensure a great experience from the customer standpoint. However, the cons are more practical in nature. The annual fee is $125, which is a pretty high fee to deal with American Express. In addition, not all companies will take American Express, so having another card as a backup plan is a good idea. If you're in a financial position where this isn't as important to you, I would suggest applying for this card. Having it in your pocket when the need arises is certainly comforting.

I absolutely love my Gold Card. I think that the reward system is purely genius, and I have already redeemed most of my points towards Travel Rewards. The fact that I have to pay off my balance every month has kept me organized, and is a lot less stressful than paying a large bulk at a time. My budget since using this card has been clean and precise. AMEX is accepted most places around (California) here, so I've had no problems with being moved to another store just because of my card. Finally, being a huge music lover, I get to enjoy concerts with almost unheard of perks. This card was totally worth it, thanks AMEX!

I use this card for 3 reasons: gas, restaurants and travel. I use it to keep track of business travel expenses. I have often called the company to request information because I didn't want to wait for a full statement. They were very cool. I don't know if it is the status of the particular card or whether all AmEx cardholders get the same treatment - I'm hoping the latter - but they have EXCELLENT customer service. No lie, I get treated excellently. Even one time after I got laid off and was having trouble making payments, they were so kind and patient. They worked with me and when I got my new position, we resolved everything. I am 100% thrilled with this company and their service. The annual fee - I could do without, but I guess that's how the get the training they get.

I have had my Amex for a little over a year now, and I love it. When I first got the card I was worried about having to pay off the monthly balance every month because I didn't have to do this with my old credit card. After using it for so long though I can honestly say I LOVE that feature. It has helped keep myself on top of my finances even better than before. I also NEVER overspend now that I have this card because I KNOW I do have to pay it off. The only thing I don't like about this card would be that not all retailers do accept it like my old VISA. So, I try to remember those retailers when I'm out and about so that I can make sure to either brign cash or my debit! (:

I’ve always found that when I’m looking for a new card I go strait to Visa and I’ve been neglecting what American Express had to offer till now. I’m not sure why I always found myself stuck in that place but it was certainly worth broadening my horizons. My American Express Gold card gave me a sense of nobility, believe it or not. Merchants actually treat me different from when I use to pull out a standard Visa. Another nice perk is the special offers you get for being an American Express “Gold” card holder. I’ve gain some fairly lucrative access to concerts just by being a gold card holder. Like I said, “sense of nobility”.

I have been using my American Express Card since I was 19 years old to establish good credit. What I love about this card is the security, it was very easy to cut off my card when it was stolen a few months ago. The customer service is simple and great, and never takes too long- I also like the fact that I can constantly check my balance online and that I feel like I’m complete control of my finances. Since sometimes I feel like my bills can be rather ambiguous. However, I wish more retailers took American Express than they usually do, it can’t be my main credit card for that reason.

I have been a loyal American Express Cardholder for over 15 years. I have always paid my bill on time and have had no issues with chargebacks, etc. I have always been happy with their customer service as well. I can remember one time while traveling overseas that my card was stolen and I was overnighted a replacement card in Europe and all of the charges associated with the fraud were removed from my card with no difficulty. There is a fee associated with this card and any additional cards on the account but just for the ease of use of the website it makes it well worth it.

I have been with Amex since I was old enough to get credit. My favorite thing about a charge card is that I have to pay the monthly balance every month, meaning no racking up debt that I can't pay back. Only trouble I have with American Express is that the local businesses in my area don't like to take it, something to do with the fees, they wont offer any further information. I spoke to customer service on a few different occasions and seemed to be taken care of in a quick fashion. Maybe it's just me but I feel that the annual fee is a little steep. However I can't say that as a con because I don't have any other charge cards to compare it with.

I've had the American Express for 1 year now. I'm 22 years old and this is my second credit card I have owned. I have had zero problems with American Express and am very pleased with the card. The annual fee for the first year is waived and you get a lot of bonus rewards if you spend $2000 in the first three months. I only customer service contact I have had is after using the card for the first couple of times. They automatically locked my card, which was slightly annoying, and I had to call their customer service line. I spoke to someone from India, who spoke good English, who went over my credit transactions. After verifying it was me using the card, my card was unlocked and I was allowed to make further purchases. Besides that interaction, I have had no problem using my card anywhere.

I recently received an AmEx card through my job to pay for travel, food, and other expenses while at conferences or preparing for events. I have really enjoyed using the card and the online services that American Express provides are very well done. The only trouble I've had is that it is not accepted everywhere. I've had several situations where I had to use my other Visa card because certain places would not take my company AmEx. The protection plans seem to be great although I haven't ever had to deal with any fraud or miss charges. All transactions I've done have never had any problems and charges have showed up online almost instantly. Overall, I think its a great card but I wish that it was accepted in more places like my personal Visa card.

The American Express Gold Card is one of the best credit cards that I ever used. There is an annual fee, but it is well worth the price.


American Express provides a lot of protection for its customers. If there is a dispute over a payment, it is very easy to cancel the charge. For example, one time I ordered something online but never received it. I was able to call up American Express and get a refund without any hassles. Dealing with customer service is really a breeze.


Besides excellent security and protection, American Express also provides a lot of other rewards for using the credit card. When making purchases, you accumulate points which can then be redeemed for things such as travel, shopping, dining, or entertainment rewards. As an added bonus, Gold card members get certain perks. They can buy tickets to concerts, shows or sporting events before they officially go on sale.


I am very happy with this credit card and I would definitely recommend it to others.

I’ve had this card for about a year now and in that time I’ve had it I’ve been able to completely pay off any future annual fees that I’ll incur with the rewards they offer. After traveling internationally multiple times I can safely say that AmEx’s customer support is flawless; I’ve never had a charge be rejected and it’s rare that I call ahead when traveling.


Unfortunately it can be hard at times to use my gold card as some retailers do not support it. Luckily these dealers are few and far between, however it has been frustrating from time to time. While Visa and Mastercard have universal acceptance, the rewards AmEx offers seems to overshadow this.

I've had my AmEx Gold for 10 years and haven't had a single problem. There service is outstanding. From their phone reps, to managing your account online. They really do provide a better service than most other credit card companies. I have been really satisfied and thus why I've kept my Gold Card for this long. Sure they may not be accepted everywhere, but really most of the places are starting to accept them now and I always use my AmEx whenever I have a chance to. Their Customer Service is top-notch, I had actually bought an espresso machine online and it turned out the seller tried to scam me and didn't ship the item. I quickly called AmEx and their Reps handled it quickly and got the charge-back back on my account. I actually feel more protected with AmEx where-as other credit card companies just have me thinking about interest rates. If I ever go down AmEx would be the last credit card I'll cancel. American Express gets a 10/10 from me.

Overall, I can say that I'd be hard pressed to find a better card provider. I've been an American Express customer for almost two years and I haven't had a single problem with the company yet. Every time I contact them with an inquiry, the waiting times have been short and the customer service representatives have always been professional and helpful. When I was still in college, I lost my card at a football game and American Express immediately closed the previous card and sent me a new one, which arrived within a week. They don't seem to be interested in setting gouging interest rates either; they seem to be interested in having good long standing relationships with their customers.

One of the best parts about having an American Express card is the automatic insurance applied to purchases. This insurance covers purchases for a period of up to 45 days. I was extremely grateful to have this insurance when my brand new iphone was stolen while I was on a trip in San Francisco. I was excited to learn of this policy and especially excited to learn that it did not involve any extra effort on my part-the insurance was included with the card. The process for receiving reimbursement for my stolen iphone was easy and painless, and I will probably continue to buy large purchases with an American Express card.


The downside to American Express, however, is that not many business accept the card. I have had to keep another credit card with me for dining out and retailers that do not accept American Express. However my card works with almost all online purchases so it has not been too much of a burden.


Overall I am very happy with my American Express card and will continue to use it.

Just from the name of the American Express Gold Card, you know it’s centered on travel rewards. It is a credit card for consumers with excellent credit; it has a very nominal annual fee and offers 25,000 bonus miles, which you get in 1,000 increments each month you make a purchase with the card for the first 25 months. Credit card companies often offer rewards in this manner because it ensures that their customers will make purchases and they will get interchange revenue. This Card also gives you 2 miles for each $1 you charge across all purchases, making it similar to the popular Capital One Venture Card, particularly since you can redeem for travel on any airline. I would recommend it for all my friends.

I have been a Gold Card member for five years and have been amazed by the level of service I have received. As a college student, I lose things like it's my job, and this card is no different. They have been extremely helpful in cancelling and sending out a new card upon request. When there were fraudulent charges on my father's card, they were taken care of by American Express before he even knew they had been made, now that's service. The annual fee is well worth is for a family, I have paid for all of my cross country flights to and from school using rewards points. Overall, the best card out there.

My employer has give me an Amex card. Initially I was a bit hesitant and afraid of accepting it but I had to take it as my job involves lot of traveling.


I still remember that it was the first time that I had used the card. I was traveling and I forgot my debit cards in the car. So I was in a fix and didn't knew what to do. So then I remembered that I had my card with me in my Laptop Bag. So it was a life saver.


From that day I have been using my card and I am so happy that I don't have to worry about carrying multiple cards with me always.


There are no hidden charges and the annual fees is also reasonable. However still don't have any much idea about the rewards plan. The best part is its acceptable almost every place that I visit.


Overall I would say that this a wonderful card. So Go and get your card.

I have been with American Express for over 25 years now, and they are by far the easiest credit card company to work with. One time my wallet was stolen and I called them about it, they even offered to call my other cards and get them cancelled for me. Their service is what really beats out the competitors. If I ever have a problem with a payment, they easily cancel it and are not hard to talk to about problems. I had a few fraudulent charges on my card and they fixed the problem within 5 minutes, I was amazed that I actually spoke to a real person and they handled and fixed the problem so quickly. I have no reason to switch to a different credit card, and don't believe that there is another card out there that cares so much about its customers.

I've been using AmEx for the last five years (employer-issued card) and this card for the last two years. There are some places near me I like to go to that won't accept the card, but it's easy enough to use another card or cash on those rare occasions.


I'm quite satisfied with the charge card idea as opposed to a credit card since I feel it discourages excess spending. The annual fee is reasonable given the amount I use the card, and though the 2.99% late fee seems reasonable, it calculates out to more than a 40% APR, which is outrageous compared to regular credit cards. But of course this is NOT a credit card. I don't know why I'm still amazed at the power of compound interest, but I am.


I don't know much about the rewards plans since I don't really use them and so don't pay attention to them.


I've yet to deal with their fraud protection department, but customer service has always been polite and knowledgeable when I've called with questions about policy and whatnot. Wait times are a bit long, though, but when are they not?


Overall it's my preferred card and I'm quite happy with it. 4 stars.

The company I work for uses the American Express Gold Card. Dealing with the American Express customer Service is probably the easiest and most pleasant part of my job. My company earns a high amount of rewards because all of the transactions that are made with the American Express Gold Card. We enjoy to have an endless spending limit because there are times our company needs to make extremely large purchases. The American Express Gold Card allows us to do that.

bought this card two months back only because there was no limit set on this card.

The first month bill I got was for 550. I wanted to pay the amount using two checking accounts. I paid 250 by one account and when I tried to pay the remaining, got a message that it needs a minimum of 48 hours to process another transaction. I made another purchase of 800$ and with a day the card was locked and I got call from Customer care asking me to pay the entire amount immediately.

I got so frustrated with the behavior of the customer care executive. I have never had such a ugly situation in my life.

I also had an incident a few years ago that made me question whether to keep Amex. I had a restaurant double charge me and disputed the charge with Amex. But they said only if the owner agrees the charge is a mistake will I keep the credit. This despite I had never disputed a charge before and I spend thousands a month on American Express without incident.

Amex's investigating time period takes so long I worried the restaurant owner would no longer have the nights register receipts by that time. So bottom line is I went to the restaurant myself and talked to the owner as soon as possible while the receipts were still available. He issued me a credit, no thanks to American Express.

I've had this card for about 2 years now. You need good credit to obtain it as I previously had the American express blue card and decided to upgrade. The card has no preset spending limit. However, if you decide to make large purchases with the card within the first few months of owning it, Amex may decide to suspend your card. I had an issue with them when I used the card to upgrade the laptops for my office. It was a 10k purchase and Amex decided to suspend the card. I had to supply the correct information including taxes and my employment history to continue to keep the card. In addition, they also did not want to waive the first years fee even though it is what they agreed to. However, they complied and waived the first year and decided to grant me back the card.


After all of that, the card is great to have. It is excellent for rewards and it gives you an incentive not to over spend since you have to pay the bill in full each month. So far the card has been good to me and I get great perks and gift cards from them for spending all the time. If you need a flexible charge card, this isn't the card for you. If you pay on time and want rewards, this is perfect.

Issue with charge card for beginner is exactly what you stated. No preset spending limit. This has more issue than "let's see how much amex is going to give me if I keep spending". It also means the % of credit usage isn't reported properly to credit bureaus. Say a normal cc like amex spg. I have preset limit of $20k. If I spend 1k, BOTH max limit 20k and 1k spending is reported to credit bureau. So they will be able to see that I am not maxing out my limit and using the card properly.


For charge card, however, the max is unknown, and isn't reported. So credit bureau won't be able to see my credit utilization. In fact, the highest monthly spending becomes the so called "max" for that card. (which is the reason why they suggest you take one month to put all your spending on a single charge card to artificially set high credit limit for that card).


now getting back to THIS specific card. One word. DON'T. amex has premier gold that is UBER better than this card (50 bux more per yr, but totally worth it, if you are someone who are consider getting this card anyway). only reason I can ever see getting this card is if I am not going to fly a lot next year, and my first free year for amex premier gold is nearing end, just to keep my amex reward points alive.

I’m not really quite sure why more people don’t use charge cards. I mean, I get that you need excellent credit to get them most of the time, and you have to pay your bill in full every month, but isn’t that a good thing? If you’re going to get a rewards card, you should be paying its bill in full anyway, so why not at least include charge cards in your search to see if any offer the best rewards available on your biggest expenses? American Express controls a large portion of the charge card market, which means that the American Express Gold Card is an option you really should keep open.


Pros


- The Amex Gold Card doesn’t have an annual fee in the first year (most charge cards charge relatively high annual fees to compensate for the added rewards they provide – come to think of it, this might be a con).


- Exclusive access to sporting events, concerts and shows (charge cards are sort of known for offering “access” and “unique experiences” in addition to the normal points, miles or cash back common with rewards credit cards, but aside from maybe getting the chance to buy tickets before the general public, what does “exclusive access” really mean? )


Cons


- The American Express Gold Charge Card has No Preset Spending Limit. While I used to think that this meant you could spend as much as you wanted each month, it actually just means that Amex basically makes your limit up as it goes along, you never know what it is, and you can hurt your credit score because of high credit line utilization or something along those lines.


- $125 second year annual fee; If you’re going to charge a high annual fee, there had better be some pretty darn good rewards to justify it. That means the Amex Gold Card’s exclusive access better be top notch.


When you get down to it, you might find cheaper credit and charge card options that give you more than the American Express Gold does. But if you are a big fan of sporting events, concerts or shows, you might not. I’d therefore carefully consider your priorities and maybe give Amex a call to hear more about the Gold Card’s rewards before making a decision.

Our Lowe’s credit card is excellent. They do not play games with the interest rate, due date, or penalties. They are very straight forward, with easy to understand guidelines. Periodically, the card will have special, a certain percent off on purchases, or free interest for a given period. The card can be used in other locations besides Lowe’s, and seems to be widely accepted. We have access to our account online, and have been able to shut off paper statements reducing the risk of information being stolen from our mailbox. I would recommend this card to anyone wanting a credit card which is fair.

The American Express business has helped to build my business, allowing me to make purchases and decisions I otherwise would not have been able to make. It has also helped me to have credibility within the community and with my vendors. When a vendor or other client sees the American Express symbol, the trust factor automatically goes up and there is a much better business scenario. It is almost as if I am a part of a group of trusted business people that have a reputation without having to get to know them. The only disadvantage is having to pay the card off each month, however this save my business untold amounts of interest.
department: The Blue Business® Plus Credit Card from American Express

content: I like this card, I have had it for a few months and have not had any problems so far. I use this in place of a bank account. I applied for the card online and the online application process was fast and easy. It took about 4 days for me to receive my card after I applied. I like that it doesn't have any fees and that it provides the same features as the other cards they have. The only thing that I don't like is that American Express cards are not accepted everywhere. Other than that I do not have any complaints about this card.

I really enjoy having the American Express Prepaid Card. I've had mine for a almost a year now. I use mine instead of a bank account. I received my card very quickly, within a week of applying. I get my money direct deposited. It is very convenient because I do a lot of independent contracting and the money is deposited typically with in two days of the time I request a deposit. I have never had good luck with bank accounts or regular credit cards. This one allows me to only spend what I have, and I can check my statements directly on the website. I also opted for e-mail notifications so I know exactly where my money has gone. My card is accepted just about everywhere. I like that the card has no fees as some other pre-paid options do. There is no monthly fee. I use my card for everything. I feel more secure carrying it around than a giant wad of cash.

I applied for the American Express Prepaid care about 6 months ago. They had a great promotion where I got a $25 bonus on my first deposit. I received the card about 2 weeks later and it was simple to set up. I can access my account online and also by phone. I get access to 24 hour customer service. The card has no minimum and there are no usage fees when making purchases. I can load my card with a GreenDot MoneyPak or with direct deposit. It was so east to setup the direct deposit with my online account. I use this card for mostly online purchases and feel safer with the prepaid card online.

I use the American Express prepaid credit card. I found out about it from an online promotion that was paying $3 to apply. It has a lot of good features including no activation fee and no monthly fee. I use it as a backup credit card for times when I'm travelling or shopping, and something goes wrong with my primary credit card. Although it's a prepaid card, If you use it regularly and keep your account in good standing, you might get an invitation to apply for an unsecured American Express card. You get one free cash withdrawl per month from an ATM machine, which most prepaid cards don't offer. Reloading is free if you do it from your bank account or through direct deposit.

This card isn't worth it. You have to wait even longer to get paid (if you have direct deposit) because it takes them an additional 2 to 5 business days to process, etc. NetSpend gets expensive, but it's a heck of a lot better than this thing!

This card is wonderful! I use it all the time and it is so easy. I have had absolutely no problems using this card. It is easy to sign up for and use. When I want to make a deposit or transfer money, it arrives without any problems within around two days at most for me. It was also easy to sign in and out as long as I remember the password but for some reason, the password will not save to my computer so its difficult but that is the only problem I have had. It is also extremely easy to see all of my account information and all of my transactions in and out of the account so I know what is going on and where my money has went.
great card, but the bad is that AmEx cards are not accepted everywhere.
THIS CARD IS A FUCKERY!

As advertised, I have yet to incur any additional fees, I have owned this card for over a month now and haven't yet had a problem. As Connie suggested I feared being in a small town that AMEX would be a harder card to use in the area but it's not as bad as I had originally though.


The only problem that we currently have it the load times. I'm new to prepaid cards so I'm not sure if it's normal for it to take more then 2 days to reload but it has for us. We have had our bank account linked to this card and verified, yet still takes 2 or more business days for the funds to be available.


ATM fees are a bit steep, however you do get one "Free" withdraw per month. Free as in AMEX will not charge you however ATM fees may still apply based on whatever bank owns the ATM. Also, worth noting are said ATM fees, AMEX charges their own fee, and it is stacked on top of whatever ATM fee there is, so keep that in mind if you ever need to use the ATM.


Overall, great card if ATM use isn't on top of your list.

I've had this card since November of last year, and my only real complaint is trying to find a restaurant in my area that will take American Express. Some smaller, privately owned stores won't take AmEx either. But overlooking that one flaw, I really like this card. I love that they give you one 'courtesy' a month and allow a free ATM withdrawal. That's just awesome. Then, after that just two dollars which is much less then any of of the other Prepaids I've dealt with in the past. AmEx really has that going for them, the truly minimal fee thing. Honestly, this is my fave of my Prepaids and I'd recommend it to those who don't plan to use when dining out. Oh, and their customer service is great. I've only had to call twice, but both times got through to a live Rep straight away and had my issues resolved instantly; just small issues too with updating my email and mailing address.

I have had this prepaid card for almost a year now. It is a great way to carry a debit-type card without having it linked to your bank account and obviously makes your wallet lighter because you don't have to carry cash either. I have yet to find a store that does not accept this card for whatever reason. If they take plastic, they take this! Adding money to the card is a simple process that I do quickly and efficiently online. I am very happy that there are no fees attached to this card beside the ATM fee, although I do not need to use this card for the ATM so that works out well, also. Overall, I would say this is a great card for yourself or a child if you want them to have access to money without putting it on a credit card.

I got the American Express Prepaid Card about six months ago and have yet to incur any fees. I usually upload a few hundred dollars at a time to the account and replenish those funds once I am close to exhausting the balance. To add money I have strictly used their online banking, but it appears as though you can also do it by phone or by using direct deposit from a bank account.


The one thing that Amex will charge you for is for withdrawing funds from this account from the ATM. It is because of this that I recommend you get this card if you are looking to benefit from their great customer service or if you are looking to build your financial track record in the hopes that you will be invited to apply for an American Express Charge Card.

I use two of these to give my kids their allowance. The kids thought it was cool until they figured out that it wasn't a charge card like the one I use and they couldn't just buy whatever and pay it back later. It worked out okay, though, and I can schedule automatic payments to this card with my bank. The $2500 monthly limit for this method of adding money to the card works out nicely since there's no way they're getting anywhere near that much money per month.


I like that there are very few fees, though the $2 per ATM transaction is a bit steep considering the ATM frequently also charges a similar fee for use. It works out to about a 20% charge on a $20 bill. The kids have pretty much stopped using cash except for emergencies.


The replacement policy is probably the best part since the kids have lost or destroyed the cards several times already. I'm not sure how they manage to do that but the lack of access to their money for a few days because of not having a card doesn't seem to affect their ability to take the cards out of circulation. I still haven't gotten a straight answer about how the one card got torn in half the long way.


In any case, these cards are almost perfect for what I use them for.

I am a frequent flyer and I have to say that I LOVE my Gold Delta SkyMiles Credit Card, by AMEX. I applied to it online and get approved right away, and after spending $500 in less then 3 months, I got a 30,000 miles bonus, meaning $300 towards a plane ticket. With this I could get a round trip to Florida for some vacation without spending anything. Every time I spend a dollar, I get a mile, and 2 miles for every dollar spent with Delta, oh and by the way, these miles never expire! You check your first baggage for free, saving you $25 each way, and you can share this offer with up to 9 other people traveling with you, useful when you have a big family or a lot of friends, isn’t it? Also you can enjoy priority boarding. I really recommend the card and even if you are not a frequent flyer, it is always nice to save on plane tickets or hotel rooms and use the savings towards some more fun during vacation time.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: The Gold Delta Sky Miles credit card was a godsend when I first came across it. My wife and I love to travel and we’ve seen and uses plenty of other mileage rewards cards but so far Gold Delta is our favorite. Our family loves to do two things: spend money and travel around the states. The Gold Delta card is pretty much a perfect answer to that. One of the biggest perks, other than the 30 thousand mile bonus is the fifty dollar baggage discount per passenger. 50 dollars may not seem like a lot but with a family of six 3 hundred dollars a month adds up pretty quickly. I love my Gold Delta Skymiles card and I don’t plan on giving it up anytime soon.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I use my Gold Delta SkyMiles Credit Card from American Express for just about any purchase I can. I got this card many years ago and have honestly been very pleased with little to no issues at all. The apr really isn’t too bad for a credit card and on top of that I get a ton of bonus miles that can be used for flights to just about anywhere. Since I have had this card I was able to go on several trips without paying a dime on airfare. If you like to travel or fly then you should totally get this card.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I have had my Gold Delta SkyMiles card for four years now, and have had great experiences with American Express during this time. The Delta benefits are great, and I have definitely enjoyed being able to fly without paying for additional baggage. They honored this even while I was flying with my cello! My most recent American Express customer service interaction was when I had missed a payment due to the flu—I both forgot to make the payment, and was unable to meet the minimum payment after all my missed days at work. The customer service representative canceled the late fee and allowed me to make the payment in two installations, all while being very polite and noting my typically excellent and on-time payment record. I’d definitely recommend this card to anyone looking for flight mileage benefits.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content:
I have had my Gold Delta SkyMiles card for 5 years. During this time I was very pleased with the card until recently. I relocated across the country for a job, and due to this relocation was forced to try and do a short sale on my house. Other than this, my credit has always been exemplary; my payments were always made on time. I used my SkyMiles card to cover my moving expenses and promptly paid down the bill. However, because of the pending short sale on my home, my credit limit was cut by approximately 75%, I contacted customer service and they told me that they were unable to provide me with any further information. Since this time, every time that I pay down the balance on the card, my credit limit is cut to approximately $100 over my current balance. I have continued to contact customer service to try and get my limit raised, as I was using this card primarily for business travel, but they are unable to connect me with anyone that can assist me. I am continually told that I will receive as email or a letter with instructions on how to dispute the credit limit reduction, but it has been 3 months, and no email or letter has arrived.


Up until this point, it was worth it to me to have this card, and have available credit in case of emergencies. I was able to justify the high annual fee because of this. At this point, I am considering cancelling the card and paying off the remaining balance. The interest rate is high and the annual fee is high, but because I can no longer use the card to make the purchases I require for business travel, I frequently need to use my other airline rewards card that continues to provide me with the credit limit that I require.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I have been very pleased with the Gold Delta SkyMiles card. I am a frequent flyer and the upgrade in service one gets as a result of simply being a skymiles member has be my favorite thing about the card. As for working directly with American Express, customer service has always been extremely willing to help with any questions I might have. As a college student, this is my first credit card. The staff has been very helpful and patient in teaching me how to read statements, understand billing periods, and payment deadlines. I never have to wait on the phone on hold for extended periods of time. The staff is very timely and considerate of the customers. The iPhone app for AmEx and the online services have proved extremely useful as well. I have been thoroughly please with my service. While I do feel that the skymiles program caters more to businesses than everyday citizens, simply because of how hard it is to increase skymiles, it has no doubt come in handy when I have taken numerous continental trips. I would recommend to anyone planning on getting this credit card to apply shortly after taking a Delta flight. The benefit of this is that one can put the miles earned on this flight toward the skymiles account on the credit card. I would recommend (and have recommended!) this card to numerous people, especially if you are a frequent flyer.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I've had the Gold Delta SkyMiles card from American Express for over three years now. I initially got it so that I could earn SkyMiles on my airline and daily purchases. The card has actually turned out to be SO much more! If you travel even a little bit, this card is for you! I earn double SkyMiles on all Delta purchases, get 20% off in-flight food and beverages, get a $99 companion flight each year (which offsets the annual fee), and I get priority boarding on all Delta flights. When a flight is full and overhead space is bound to fill up, this is an amazing benefit! I was even upgraded to first class on a recent flight from Paris to JFK. Can't say for sure that it was due to having this card, but I assume that it was. I have only had to contact customer service a few times, but each time I had a good and helpful experience. I definitely recommend this card to anyone looking for a great airline miles reward card.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content:
I have had this credit card for the past 10 years or so. It is my primary credit card. I have had quite a good experience with it to date. As with all American Express cards, there are some places that won't take it, but I'd say that 90-95% of the places that I've tried to use it have accepted it.


I have never carried a balance on it, so I can't comment on fees or interest rates. However, the customer service is excellent. On two occasions, the American Express fraud prevention team has called me with questions about a recent purchase on the card, and in both cases, it was found that my card had somehow been compromised. In both cases, American Express overnighted me a new card, including once when I was out of town. Of course, they also removed the spurious charges. In another case, I accidentally missed paying my bill by one day. I called American Express, and they removed the late fee and interest charges without any issue.


Finally, I like using this particular card because of the airline miles I accrue. My wife and I recently flew first class to France on KLM and Air France through miles we earned on this card. It was a dream. I'm definitely sticking with American Express, and at least for the time being, I'm also sticking with this card.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content:
This is one of the good ideas I had that turned bad over the two years I had the card. I traveled within the United States a couple times a month on business, and flew Delta when I could. This card initially gave me some benefits as they advertise, and I was satisfied with it. The interest rate is very high in this time of 1% bank interest, but I didn't carry a balance and that was not a concern at the time. The waived fee for the first year and actual accumulation of miles from ordinary purchases would have had me rate the card 4.5 STARS at that time, with the only issue being some merchants not accepting American Express cards.


The second year was a different experience. Paying the annual fee was justified by the mileage benefits and some customer service aspects having the card gave me when flying Delta. I had 2 cancellations in Atlanta due to weather, requiring overnight stay, and this card did make the experience less stressful each time. But in part due to those charges and delay in getting reimbursed by my company, I started having a balance on the card.


The interest rate had never affected me, but now I realized how high it really was. I started running a balance due to some cutbacks at work, but always paid at least three times the minimum due. One morning on a business trip I tried to used the card to pay for gasoline and it was declined. Calling the company, they said the card had been suspended due to my credit rating, completely unrelated to my payment experience with American Express. I had no warning of this at all.


So while the card did have the advertised benefits, I would not recommend this, or any card from American Express. 0 STARS based on the issuing company.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: My brother is the one that turned us on to this credit card, mostly because we travel frequently and fly Delta about 80% of the time. The mileage earned for flights - plus the free baggage - is great. I think we've saved HUNDREDS, literally, in baggage fees just this year alone. Even just this Thanksgiving weekend we were thankful for the Priority boarding. It is those little "perks" that make this card truly worthwhile. We started using this card as our "everyday" credit card, just so we could build up our miles, but have also found that like other American Express cards, the customer service is great, too. Getting the card took a bit longer than we anticipated, but once approved, we had it very quickly, and have been satisfied for the 2 years or so we have had it. We have never had any issues and our miles add up very quickly. The annual fee we thought may be a bit high, but realized it really is not, given what we earn and get back in miles and perks. We do find ourselves even flying Delta more for our business, and when we book the flights using the card, we earn double the points we normally do. This card is definitely worth the annual fee.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: This card has really come in handy for myself and my family. I signed up for this card just to see if I would even be approved and was shocked to see that they approved me. I wasn't too happy about the annual fee. but I have grown to accept it because of the miles that I have gotten out of the card. The only downside is that AMEX is not always accepted everywhere. What I have learned to do is if I want to purchase an item using the card, I call or go on the website before I count on using the card. I also find that AMEX has fantastic customer service and they are really nice to you when you call them and ask for something. I had a problem a few months back that other credit card companies didn't really help me with, but AMEX did. I really like this card and the perks associated with it.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: When Northwest Airlines folded and Delta (who absorbed Northwest) was courteous enough to roll my miles and rewards into their SkyMiles program (for a small fee), I went ahead and applied for this card. I never had a credit card linked with my WorldPerks Northwest miles, and I knew this was arguably the best way to rack up points, so I took this as an opportunity to start over and start to accumulate points and miles with this card. The initial mileage bonus is generous and what immediately attracted me to this card. I admittedly do not use it enough nor do I fly enough to have any free trips, but I was able to rent a car totally free of charge due mostly to charges I've placed on this card. It's a good card for someone who travels a lot, but I don't know if I would recommend it for someone past the first year. There is no annual fee for this period, and if you cancel within the first year, you can still keep your mileage bonus. Just my two cents.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: This credit card has been wonderful for me and my family. We spend money on the items we need in our daily lives, and get SkyMiles as an added bonus. Just recently, I was able to go on a trip to Orlando, Florida with my family because we had saved enough SkyMiles to book four tickets. Flying for free really helps save money on our travels, and being able to earn those miles just from trips to the grocery store is just an added bonus. Overall I am very pleased with the benefits of this credit card, and the representatives at American Express have always treated me very well.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I got this card a while ago pretty much on impulse, as I was going to have to be traveling frequently due to a parent's health problems, and figured the points would be worth the $95 fee. My other card offers cash rewards, but no miles. Plus, there's a tiny part of me that likes having an Amex card, just for the sake of having one. Anyway, because I have a main credit card that I love, I didn't use this card as much and didn't gain a huge amount of miles beyond the initial bonus over the time I've had it, but it still managed to make one trip this year basically free. Because of the fee and because I get generally more useful rewards from my other card, I wouldn't recommend it unless you plan on using it fairly frequently and like flying Delta. Fortunately for me, Delta is the only airline I've ever used to travel back and forth to my parents' house, so it's been helpful in that regard, but I can't escape the feeling that I don't use it often enough to justify the annual fee. This isn't necessarily a reflection on the card, more on my card-usage habits, but maybe you're in a similar boat as me. I fly frequently, but not frequently enough to make this my main card, which in turn makes it less rewarding to own. Vicious cycle, anyone?
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: If you travel a lot and pay for the travel with your credit card this is a great card to use. You earn double points on travel purchases and with the price of travel being so high the points tend to add up very fast. On top of that you are also earning points for every day purchases. American Express has always treated me as a human rather than a customer, or potential money. They are always on top of what's going on and there to help. For travel purposes and great travel rewards redemption this card is hard to beat.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I wasn't looking for a new credit card, but about a year ago I was traveling on Delta to visit my son and when I got to Atlanta to go to my connecting flight I was pulled aside by a couple representatives making me an offer I couldn't refuse. Sign up and get 30,000 Skymiles after my first $500 in purchases and also get priority boarding on Delta flights along with a free checked bag. I wasn't entirely impressed with the interest rate, but the annual fee was waived for the first year, so I decided I didn't have anything to lose, but a lot to gain. Now I have received a lower interest rate and the customer service is great. I love their website as it is well designed and easy to use. I have pretty much decided this card is worth keeping, though when the time comes for a renewal I will definitely look for something without that annual fee.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I have had this card for a few years and it is decent for a travel rewards card. I frequently fly with Delta for business and pleasure, so it was a no-brainer for me to pick a Delta rewards card instead of the many other options out there. The $95 annual fee stinks, but I accrue enough Skymiles each year that it is worth it for me. If you don't often fly with Delta or you will be using the card minimally, then this is probably not a good card for you. The AMEX customer service has been awesome! They are really good about flagging potential fraudulent transactions and notifying you about them. I have also had to dispute a couple of charges and they have been so easy to work with! All in all, this card is great for me because I earn so many Skymiles (and regularly use them), but I would recommend doing an analysis to see if it is worth it for you with the $95 annual fee.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I love my Gold Delta SkyMiles Credit Card from American Express. It is definately one of the better cards. The rewards are my favorite part about the card. Having the miles works great to visit my son who is going to school across the country. We use this card fro everyday purchases so we can accumulate more miles. More miles means more times to see my boy. The annual fee is a bit steep if you are not going to take advantage of the rewards. There customer service department is good. They are helpful and very knowledgeable. The hold time is not that bad when you call with a problem and most things can be answered in the frequently asked questions section of the website.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: My husband and I love to travel a lot, and this card has been perfect for us. The perks that come with it are great - we use the buy one, get one pass every year, especially because our family is from out of town. The skymiles shopping is also great; we have earned well over 1,000 miles on small purchases, such as flowers, by going through the skymiles shop. Their customer service is also excellent. We ran into an incident when we upgraded this card, and the customer service people were extremely flexible and helpful in resolving the issue. If you are going to travel a lot, this is an excellent card. If you aren’t a big traveler, the annual fee might not be worth it.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I just recently got this card and so far it is great! The sky miles bonus is a huge plus for me as I am a student that travels home and back frequently. Also the fact that your first bag is checked for free is huge for me moving my possesions home and back. So far no problems charging it anywhere as I would expect from this company and I must say that I like the look of it. If you are in need of a great card with amazing starting benefits, this is definitely the card for you. I highly recomend it.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I only had this card for a little under 1 year, as I didn't want to bite the bullet for the $95 annual fee. The main reason I signed up for it was for the 30,000 mile bonus, which is great because it's essentially a free flight just for using this card for an easy amount of purchases to accumulate ($500 in 3 months). Before canceling my account, I called and asked if they would waive the fee, but they wouldn't, so I canceled it. If you're looking for a credit card that you can easily take advantage of for the introductory rewards and then get out of before any fees kick in, this is the perfect one. As others mentioned, if you fly a lot the fee could be worth it, but for me it wasn't.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I have the card. I received a flyer in the mail to refer a friend and get 10,000 Delta Skymiles.. My friend completed the application on line , was approved but indicated that there was no where on the application that it asked who referred him. Therefore, Delta would not give my my 10,000 miles when I called and requested them.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I have been using this card as often as possible for a few years now and have been able to rack up quite a bit of miles. Converting the miles to actual flights has been relatively easy to do. AMEX’s online service is top rate as well and it is very easy to pay off the card when I want to. I prefer to use this card wherever AMEX is taken. I have tried other cards in the past but the rewards don’t seem to be as easy to use and the online service isn’t as good. AMEX customer service is always top rate as well so I don’t have to worry if the card gets lost or stolen either.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I got this card because my girlfriends father works for Delta Airlines. It isn't a bad card but it doesn't really stick out from the bunch of airlines miles cards. It does get you a free bag (amazing what used to be free is now a privilege) for you and up to 9 of your guests on the reservation list. You are able to board early with some of the priority people so that is a plus as well. The APR isn't outrageous for a rewards card, something like 14-15%, but I pay off my balances every month as it is. The 30,000 miles is cool when you sign up but you're still short 5,0000 miles if you live in Hawaii to get a free round trip. Oh well.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I've been traveling for awhile, and it never really occurred to me to get a credit card with frequent flyer miles. I always assumed they were scams. Recently though, a friend received one of these cards and told me about the huge bonus miles you get early on. I could not resist the temptation, so I applied immediately. I received the card last month, and I've already been able to get two free trips across the country with it. I can not tell you how much stress this card has taken away from me. I can now use all of the money I saved up for tickets on fancier hotels and attractions. I highly recommend this card to anyone who loves to see the world.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: Traveling as much as I do, I really wanted a credit card that would benefit my lifestyle. I got the delta skymiles card because of how frequently I do fly, and how nice it is to get paid back to fly on my usual trips. A lot of people use this card to sign up for the perk of airline miles but I really like to use it to UPGRADE to first class. It's cheaper that way, then buying a full ticket with my miles. I really enjoy the bag check too because baggage rates are ridiculous now a days. Also the best thing about the Skymiles is that they don't expire, so I can use them without worry.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: My husband and I thought we should get an airline miles card after our recent vacation to the Virgin Islands. After some research, we decided on the Delta Skymiles card and we're quite happy with it! It's exciting to see the miles building based on spending we do anyway. We got 30000 miles for signing up, and if you spend $500 in 3 months with them, you get another 30000. They offer free bag checks which is great, and the miles don't expire or have blackout dates they can't be used on. We're excited about taking our next trip with an airline ticket we didn't have to buy, and enjoying the perks on top of that!
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: It is so nice to be able to earn miles while making normal purchases. While cash back and other similar offers are great too, miles offer me the freedom of experiencing new things and visiting loved ones. My favorite part of being a user of this card however is free bags on delta airlines! This may seem like nothing to many folks, but for me personally it saves a lot of cash since baggage rates are ridiculous nowadays. The free flight bonus on signing up is nice too, but I would look at other reasons to get this card instead. This is a good card, but in my opinion for most people who aren't as big in to travel is probably a waste of time and effort.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: As a fairly casual credit card user, many of the big-time benefits of the Gold Delta American Express card are lost on me, as I don’t charge nearly enough to accrue enough miles to be worth anything significant. However, the benefit of getting a free checked bag on every flight I take when I use the card for booking saves me several hundred dollars a year, which is a huge benefit. Every experience I’ve had with customer service has been pleasant and helpful; my only other complaint is that it still seems as though many smaller merchants are hesitant to accept American Express. At any rate, as long as I continue to fly with Delta, I will continue to carry and use this card.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content:
I feel like a lot of people see a credit card offering a free flight and jump at it bc it seems really great. And while it is great, you’re looking for the most value, so it’s important to see what else is out there before applying. I’m not trying to discount the Gold Delta SkyMiles Credit Card from American Express but am just saying that it might not be as simple of a decision as you might think. To help you make this decision, here’s what in my opinion are the Delta SkyMiles Credit Card’s strengths and weaknesses.


Pros


- Free Flight - You get a free Delta flight from spending $500 in the first three months, which is pretty good. If you’re looking to benefit on summer travel though, I’d probably go with a rewards card that offers an initial bonus after your first purchase.

- Free Checked Baggage - This isn’t a draw if youre not a loyal Delta passenger because other airlines like Southwest offer free bags standard, but if you fly a lot with a large family, having 9 free checked bags could save you a lot of money.


Cons


- Ongoing rewards: When you consider the fact that a card like the Capital One Venture gives you basically 2% cash back on all purchases, getting 2 miles per dollar on Delta purchases and 1 mile on everything else doesn’t seem all that attractive.

- Priority boarding and in flight savings: Who cares that much about getting on an airplane first, and even with 20% savings, the stuff your going to buy in SkyMall is still going to be expensive.


When you get down to it, I’d say that the Gold Delta American Express Credit Card is a pretty good option for loyal Delta customers who fly at least a few times a year with big groups. If you’re just looking for a free flight and you don’t care who its with though, I might go with the Chase Sapphire Preferred or the British Airways Card instead of the Gold Delta SkyMiles Amex. The Sapphire gives you $500 to spend on travel or $400 cash and the British Airways Card gives you a free roundtrip transatlantic flight.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content:
Credit card companies really like branding their products with metallic colors that signify achievement and wealth, huh? It makes sense, but just like Will Ferrell in Elf, you could learn a hard lesson if you believe everyone who says they make the “world’s best cup of coffee” or offer “gold” rewards. Sure, it’s Christmas time (explains why Elf is on the brain), but you should be a bit cynical when evaluating the Gold Delta SkyMiles Credit Card from American Express. American express deals mostly with the excellent credit crowd, and the Delta SkyMiles Credit Card is no different. For your excellent credit, this card provides 30,000 bonus miles when you charge $500 in the first three months, which are good for a free Delta flight. Up to 9 people on each of your Delta reservations can also check their bags for free and you receive 2 miles for every dollar spent on Delta purchases and one mile for everything else. You also get 20% off in-flight purchases, which could be a perk if there is a good duty-free deal, but not if you just buy something from SkyMall. The priority boarding isn’t really a benefit because what does sitting on a plane for longer really get you?


When you get down to it, youre probably only going to get the Gold Delta SkyMiles Credit Card from American Express if you are a frequent Delta flyer. Other airline affiliated cards offer at least one free flight, so that’s not unique. A card like the Chase Sapphire Preferred offers a points bonus worth up to $625 in airfare, which you can use on any Star Alliance airline. The 2 points per dollar spent on travel and dining and one point on everything else also beat the Gold Delta SkyMiles Credit Card. All in all, I’d only recommend getting the American Express Gold Delta SkyMiles Credit Card if you fly a lot and mostly (if not all the time) with delta. Now aren’t ya glad you were cautious?
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content:
Most of American Express’ business cards are charge cards which means you need to pay your balance in full every month, but the Jet Blue Card from American Express Open is one of the few business credit cards Amex offers. If you are a Jet Blue customer/small business owner, you may be highly inclined to get the Jet Blue American Express Credit Card and if you aren’t you may be scared off by the branding, but either way it really comes down to what the Jet Blue Credit Card offers. When it comes to rewards, the Jet Blue Amex Card offers 10,000 TrueBlue points with your purchases (weird that they’re points not miles, but who really cares since you get a free flight out of this initial bonus) and 1 point per dollar spent on everything else. While a free flight is nice, the ongoing rewards offered by the American Express Jet Blue Credit Card doesn’t quite measure up. This is especially true when you consider that the card doesn’t offer a 0% rate on purchases, doesn’t allow balance transfers and has a $40 annual fee.


If you want an Amex card there are plenty of alternatives to the JetBlue Card. For example, the American Express Simply Cash Credit Card is a good offer, as is the gold charge card. Another good business credit card to consider is the Capital One Spark Cash for Buiz since it offers 2% cash back across all purchases. Finally, remember that whether you get the Jet Blue Amex Credit Card or another business rewards card, you shouldn’t carry a balance on a business credit card. You should instead use a personal credit card with a long 0% intro rate like the Citi Diamond Preferred Card.
department: JetBlue Business Card from American Express OPEN

content: I have had this card for several years and have no complaints. It is a great card with a good interest rate that also looks cool! I would definitely recommend this card to my friends. American Express has always been very helpful if I needed anything, and their online module is very useful. The rewards program is not the best, but I have received several gift cards from them over the years. $25 is not a lot, but it is certainly a good surprise to find in the mailbox. This card has been very useful to me, I am glad that I got it.
department: Clear from American Express Credit Card

content: I applied for the American Express Clear card back in 2004. I was immediately approved and had a super low interest rate. My initial credit limit was $12,000. It was raised to $16,000. I have always paid my bill on time, and I have always paid more than the minimum amount due. When the economy started to go down the drain in the latter half of 2008, I got a letter stating that they had cut my credit limit to $7000. Every single time I made a payment, they cut my limit again. For example, if I paid $500, they sent another letter stating my limit had been cut by $500. It was unbelievable since I had NEVER been late on a payment. My credit score at the time of all the credit limit cuts was 762. On top of that, their rewards program isn't anything to get excited about. I don't use the card, although I still have it. I never got rid of it simply because I have a very low interest rate on it and can use it in case of emergency. That said, I don't use it, and won't use it unless absolutely necessary. My husband and I paid off all our credit cards last year and I don't want to get in debt again.
department: Clear from American Express Credit Card

content: We are long-time card holders of the American Express Clear card. We started at a very high credit limit and used the card to do some re-modeling on our new home. Frm the time we recieved the card our credit did nothing but improve but each time we made a large payment on our American Express Clear card, they lowered our credit limit quite a bit, usually by the amount that we paid. Upon calling to inquire as to why this had happened, we were told that if we made a second $5000 payment, they would raise our limit by $300. This card is a joke. A complete joke. I have never been so unhappy or unsatisfied with a credit card company before. We also have cards with several other large companies and have chosen to only use their cards and to stay away from American Express at all costs. We have never missed a payment or been late on anything including American Express and we now make a lot more money than we did at the time we received the card. It amkes absolutly no sense but once that card is paid off, it's being cut up. American Express is done collecting money form us. We will stick with Capitol One who has a better customer service and much better incentives.
department: Clear from American Express Credit Card

content:
Sometimes it’s abundantly clear that a rewards credit card is a good deal, other times its far less so. In the case of the Clear Credit Card from American Express it’s easy, and that’s not a good thing for Amex. Though the Clear from American Express Credit Card requires excellent credit for approval, it only offers 1% cash back, allowing you to redeem every 2,500 points you accrue for a $25 American Express shopping card. One percent cash back is not competitive in todays excellent credit credit card market (1% is the industry standard base rewards earning rate, but the best cards supplement it with even more lucrative rewards on certain types of expenses. General-purpose shopping cards/gift cards also tend to have fees and service charges not found on store issued gift cards as well, meaning the rewards you earn with the Clear from American Express Card might not even be as lucrative as you might think. Sure it also offers 0% on new purchases for 12 months, but that’s not so special when you consider that a few other cards offer 0% for as long as 21 months.


For those of you looking for a good, simple cash back card, the Capital One Cash Credit Card is a good choice because it offers 1.5% across all purchases. The Cap One Venture Card is also a good option if you like to travel because miles can be redeemed for any travel related purchase at a rate that makes this card basically a 2% cash back card. The Chase Sapphire Preferred is the other recommendation I’d make for the rewards crowd since it offers $500-625 as an initial bonus and has an attractive base rewards structure. For those looking for 0% on either purchases or transfers, check out the 0% Citicards, as there are three that offer 0% for 21 months on both types of transactions. Whichever of these cards you choose, youre bound to be better off than if you got the American Express Clear Credit Card,
department: Clear from American Express Credit Card

content: There is nothing like an American Express card. It is a necessity for the image of your business. This is especially true if you are traveling. I have this card through my brothers business. The customer service is top notch. However, be prepared for a high yearly fee and paying in full each month. We had fraudulent activity on my card a few years ago. Removing it was as easy as calling in to customer service. It was removed and we never had to do anything else. I was with Discover and after having $5,000 in fraudulent gasoline charges and months of dealing with having it removed. This issue was not a problem. Amex is always recommended by me.
department: Business Green Rewards Card from American Express

content: I've used American Express for almost a decade now and I can honestly say that when you're traveling a lot it's a necessity. It has helped me so many times while I was on the go, or in another city that I can hardly keep track. I also love to use it for shopping online. Overall, it's a luxury and a convenience that I've grown to love over the years. They have great customer support and always make me feel safe using their card. I love it, and I have never had a problem even when I lost my card once. A++!
department: Business Green Rewards Card from American Express

content: I've had my American Express Business Credit Card for nearly a year now and I enjoy having it. Whether using it for rental cars, gas, or other business related purchases, it's sort of reassuring to have the green card in my wallet when I need it. I can walk into most businesses with my card and know it'll be accepted, while also building reward points. Another factor I enjoy about this card and AmEx in general is being able to pay the balance online or check my usage via the American Express app. It has truly made my experience enjoyable and easily accessible.
department: Business Green Rewards Card from American Express

content: American Express of course is the de facto standard in business credit cards, and you aren’t a real business traveler unless you have one. From its acceptance around the world, to the additional protections and services that American Express offers, this card is the only way to go. No matter where I’ve gone, this little green card in my wallet has given me confidence that I could do whatever I needed to, whether it was rent a car, buy a plane ticket, or take a client out to dinner. Now that American Express has added rewards points, this card is only better, and I will continue to use this card and be happy to have it in my pocket.
department: Business Green Rewards Card from American Express

content:
Going green is en vogue in the business community these days. Green is the color of money. Getting an idea of what American Express was going for in naming a card the Business Green Rewards Card from American Express OPEN. But does the Green Rewards Card live up to its connotations, that is the question. Well, first of all its important to point out that it is a charge card, which really isn’t a big deal for a reason I’ll touch on in a bit. When it comes to rewards, the American Express Business Green Rewards Card offers 5,000 bonus points after your first purchase, which is nice but not great, as well as 1 point for every dollar you spent, 2 pts for dollars spent through Amex Travel, and up to 10 pts at retailers through Amex’s online mall. As you may know the extra points via Amex’s mall or travel booked through Amex aren’t really a big deal because prices for whatever you buy will likely be much higher than you can find elsewhere. It’s therefore clear that the Business Green Rewards Card from American Express OPEN doesn’t give you enough green to be worth it.


An alternative for ya: The American Express Simply Cash is a good option because it gives you 5% cash back on office supplies and wireless services, 3% cash back on, and 1% cash back on everything else. Your cash back is also automatically added to your statement each month. This card paired with the Citi Simplicity Card (or one of the other personal Citicards offering 0% on purchases and transfers for 21 months) makes for an excellent business credit card strategy. As alluded to earlier, you only need a business card for purchases that you will pay for in full on a monthly basis. Business cards do not have protection under the credit card law that prevents issuers from increasing rates on existing balances without cause. Personal credit cards do not increase your personal liability, so there’s no reason not to adopt this approach. Besides, if you pick the cards I just laid out, things will be exceedingly “simpler” than if you were using the Business Green Rewards Card.
department: Business Green Rewards Card from American Express

content: I first got my American Express card when I moved into my own place. There were a lot of things that I needed for my house and it was nice to have the opportunity to purchase what I needed without having to spend the money up front. I quickly learned that American Express is a charge card, not a credit card. I know I probably sound like an idiot for not knowing that but someone I managed to rack up close to $2000 after buying all that I needed for the house plus furniture. But it actually worked out okay. I could not pay it all up front, but I got on a payment plan. American Express withdrew $200 from my bank account on the last day of each month, and after 10 months - I had the card paid off and still got to keep all of the things that I had purchased from my new place. I did cancel the card but I would definitely open one again in the future when I am more prepared and have more money to pay it off every month.....

My American Express credit card has worked out very well for me. There have been instances where I have needed to contact American Express about issues with a bill and also for charges that I did not incur. There customer service was excellent and professional, totally hassle free.


I try not use credit cards very much, but I must say when a sudden expense appears it is very comforting to know I have credit to cover. The extra time to think and rearrange the budget is invaluable.


I had gotten into substantial debt with credit cards in the past, but I learned my lesson. The American Express is world wide and well established so, I also have been able to use it trouble free in foreign countries. I would recommend this card for peoples who are in control of their finances.

I have been an American Express member for 7 years, and I use my American Express Green Card all the time. I have found that most merchants accept it, and it is very convenient not to have a pre-set spending limit to worry about. I like earning points, and especially appreciate that I can link them to my Amazon account and pay for items using my American Express points. American Express’ website is very easy to use, and I have never had a problem processing payments or finding information online. In the few rare occasions that I’ve had to call their customer support it has always been a pleasant, fast, and polite experience. I’m very pleased with this card.

They sent me an invite through the mail a few years back, I did not expect to get approved with a credit score of about 680 but to my surprise I was (unfortunately I had an item on my credit record at that time that I couldn't get rid of.
