Thankfully, it's since been successfully disputed.). So far I have been really satisfied with this card. No limit and no late fees. Excellent customer service. They are the true definition of "active monitoring". Last year they caught the theft of my card number really fast, before I had even saw my statement. Apparently, it was being used to make a bunch of internet purchases and the card company was able to quickly determine they were suspicious (compared to the quantity and nature of my usual spending activity). I had no clue what was going on, so what a relief to be contacted about the situation and discover my credit card number had been stolen, but then be immediately told that it's already been taken care of. I was so grateful. I love this card.

We initially signed up for an American Express to help lay a good foundation for our Credit usage. We already had good credit scores, but we wanted to have a more history for when we got older. The only thing we used it for was once a month we bought a week’s worth of groceries with it, so we could easily pay it off each month. Once our first year was up, we decided to pay the fee to keep it only to continue to build credit. We had no problems with the card, but after that second year, we decided against keeping it. They offer good programs, but unless you travel most of them aren’t that great. We couldn’t justify the cost each year to keep the card, when it’s only purpose was to build credit. However, if we decide later to travel, we will likely pick it back up.

I first got my American Express card when I moved into my own place. There were a lot of things that I needed for my house and it was nice to have the opportunity to purchase what I needed without having to spend the money up front. I quickly learned that American Express is a charge card, not a credit card. I know I probably sound like an idiot for not knowing that but someone I managed to rack up close to $2000 after buying all that I needed for the house plus furniture. But it actually worked out okay. I could not pay it all up front, but I got on a payment plan. American Express withdrew $200 from my bank account on the last day of each month, and after 10 months - I had the card paid off and still got to keep all of the things that I had purchased from my new place. I did cancel the card but I would definitely open one again in the future when I am more prepared and have more money to pay it off every month.

A lot of people don’t include charge cards in their rewards credit card search, which is odd because charge cards are technically credit cards. Obviously, charge cards are generally for people with excellent credit and they require that you pay your balance in full every month, so they aren’t right for everybody, but they often have better rewards than traditional credit cards. From name alone, you’d therefore have to be encouraged by the American Express Green Card. I mean, it could be good for the environment or give you citizenship or something, but that’s doubtful since a card offering those things would definitely have a higher annual fee than $0 in the first year and $95 thereafter. Unfortunately, you’re bound to be disappointed by the Amex Green Card. It only gives you one point per dollar spent, 2 points for every dollar in travel purchases via American Express travel, and 10 points when you shop at www.membershiprewards.com/earn. The latter two things don’t really count either because credit card company run online shopping malls typically charge higher prices than you can find elsewhere, so these rewards offered by the American Express Green Charge Card aren’t really rewards at all.


So what cards will give you more green than the Amex Green Card? When it comes to charge cards, the Amex Gold and Platinum Cards offer much better rewards, but also come with steeper annual fees, so you would have to determine how much practical benefit you’d get from these rewards and how much it’d be worth to you. When it comes to credit cards, it really depends on your biggest expenses, but cards like the Capital One Cash Credit Card, which offers 1.5% cash back across all purchases, and the Chase Sapphire Preferred Card, which offers a $500 initial rewards bonus, 2 points per dollar on travel and dining, and 1 point on everything else, would both be better options than the American Express Green Card.

The Platinum Delta SkyMiles Credit Card from American Express is a great credit card if you are a frequent flyer or if you just enjoy flying frequently for personal pleasure.


I applied for this credit card because I fly here and there for work and it has phenomenal benefits. Just for starters, I received a free checked bag when I travel ($25 each way) and I think it is up to 8 people who travel with me can also check a bag free. I also enjoy the benefit of boarding early in Zone 1 which is very nice since overhead room can be hard to come by. Finally, the best benefit of the card is the fact that I get a free domestic voucher for someone to fly with me each year!
department: Delta SkyMiles® Platinum American Express Card

content: I have had this card for several years and have liked it. Since I do a fair amount of flying, the frequent flyer miles are a huge bonus for me. I use this card for every purchase I make. At the end of the month I pay it off in full and reap the miles! For the downsides, I don't like the high annual fee. Some places still don't accept American Express so that can make certain purchases difficult. This might not be the best card for young people but if you can swing the annual fee and would use it enough to make the miles worthwhile, I highly recommend getting this card.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Platinum American Express Card

content: If you're a frequent traveler, this is a great card. This card comes with a $450 annual fee but you can earn more in benefits than the fee. It comes airport lounge access for Delta, American, and US Air. They also have a $200 airline credit which you can pick a different airline each year and it's very easy to max that out and basically get $200 back. It also comes with SPG gold status, National Emerald, and Hertz Gold as well as many other perks. Even if you aren't planning on spending a lot of money, the traveling perks alone are well worth getting the card.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Platinum American Express Card

content: I have only had this card for about six months, but so far I like it. One of the main reasons why I got the card is because I travel often. I was attracted to this card because I was able to get 40,000 SkyMiles just for signing up and spending a certain amount of money on the card within a certain amount of time. That is almost a free ticket within the United States and I am very happy about that. I think that is going to save me a lot of money on my travels. I have also had good experiences talking to their customer service staff. They have always been very friendly any time I have had a question or a concern about something.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Platinum American Express Card

content:
The Platinum Delta SkyMiles Credit Card from American Express is yet another credit card offering a free flight just for signing up. Well, at least that’s what you might think at first, but apparently you only get the 25,000 bonus miles necessary if you add 2 authorized users to your account, which most people won’t do. It’s not all bad though because you can start redeeming at 10,000 miles, which would get you $100 off a Delta Airlines ticket. That means the annual fee you have to pay with the Platinum Delta SkyMiles Credit Card from American Express ($150) would be offset during the first year by the 20,000 bonus miles you get after your first purchase. Aside from its initial bonus, the American Express Platinum Delta SkyMiles Credit Card gets you a free companion ticket each year, a free checked bag each time you fly Delta, and at least 1 mile for each dollar you spend.


The question of the hour remains though: Should you get the Platinum Delta SkyMiles Credit Card from American Express? That depends on two things: whether you have excellent credit and whether you fly often and exclusively with Delta. American Express has basically targeted its entire credit card business to people with excellent credit, so applying for this card without a long, basically impeccable credit record would be a mistake. Also, since you want rewards you can redeem often, only Delta Frequent Flyers should even consider getting the Platinum SkyMiles Credit Card.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Platinum American Express Card

content: I got this card at my job for company expenses. I felt in love with how easy it was to use this card. They give you points you can use to book flights etc. I had enough points to book a flight within 6 months and it was a tremendous help. I personally thought that it's an amazing card for corporations and if I ever have my own company this is the card I will use for my expenses. I don't think it's a good card for an individual just because when I applied for it they gave me very limited credit limit and their late fees was too much.

Small business owners have a lot of important decisions to make and which credit card(s) to use for company spending is merely one of them, so I’ll try to make this little review of The “New” Business Gold Rewards Card from American Express Open a short one. First of all, it’s important to point our that the Amex Gold Business Card is a charge card, not a traditional credit card, which means you need to pay your balance in full every month. That’s actually a good thing though, for two reasons: 1) The CARD Act does not apply to small business credit cards so you shouldn’t use one to revolve a balance anyway 2) charge cards often have better rewards. Speaking of rewards, the American Express Gold Business Card offers 3 points for every dollar you spend on airfare, 2 points on advertising, gas and shipping, and 1 point on everything else. You also automatically save 3-10% on every purchase you make through FedEx, OfficeMax, Hertz, etc. Therefore, it offers you good rewards on some of your most important expenses. In this regard, it passes the test, so to speak. Obviously, interest rates don’t apply to charge cards, so let’s move to the American Express Open Gold Card’s fees. It doesn’t have a membership fee during the first year and while it charges $175 beginning in the second year, the rewards and membership benefits are likely worth it (enhanced spending tracking and management features, purchase and travel insurance, roadside assistance, etc.).


Nevertheless, you may want some alternatives. The Capital One Spark Cash for Business and the Citi Platinum Select Credit Card are good options for everyday purchases and revolving debt, respectively. Whether you choose one of these cards or American Express’ Gold Business Charge Card, you really can’t go wrong (as long as you use them for the right kinds of transactions).

I applied for this card about a year ago after realizing that I was paying the same APR for my American Express card without receiving much in the way of "points." As with other American Express cards, the customer service is exemplary, both online and over the phone. With the initial bonus points offer, points add up pretty quickly and I already have enough for a free one-night hotel stay (and I don´t spend that much on my credit card). I pay 15.24% interest, which is not necessarily low, but if you pay off your balance every month, this would be an excellent card.

My wife and I have had this card for a while now, and we have been nothing but happy with the decision to apply for it. The bonus points you earn build up rather quickly, you can get a few forever dollar spent, and they can then be used towards the Hilton rewards system. We have even been able to convert our points into frequent flyer miles, which helps us considerably when traveling. It was easy for us to track the amount of points we had through the Hilton website. Customer service has been relatively good as well, though we only had to call a couple of times, the representatives were friendly just the same. It's a great card, and highly recommended.

I have had The Platinum Card from American Express card for a while now and I love it. The annual fee pricy but it is well worth it for the benefits you get in return. There are too many benefits to list but some of my favorites is the 24/7-premium global assist hotline. If you run into a problem and need assistance with anything the hotline is most likely able to point you in the right direction and help you out. Another highlight is the Airport Club access you gain with the card, it is really nice to pop into these lounges and relax for a bit while traveling.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: This is my go-to card in my wallet. I travel full-time for work, and I use this card for the majority of my airfare, hotel, rental car, and miscellaneous travel expenses. Although the annual fee is high, the perks are fantastic and well worth it. I use the access to airline clubs (American, Delta, and US) every week. I've also taken advantage of their reimbursement for the fees associated with the Global Entry program. Plus the card comes with access to cruise benefits, access to the American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts program, benefits with Hertz rental cars, and gold status with the Starwood Preferred Guest Program. The card earns American Express Membership Rewards which can be transferred to many frequent traveler program or used to purchase gift cards, travel, or other perks.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I wasn't impressed with this card, to be perfectly honest. I applied for it almost to prove to myself that I could get a good credit card which requires excellent credit, as a reward for painstakingly building it back up. What I got was a card with so many heavy fees and payment requirements that it felt like I had gotten one of those cards for people with poor or no credit. On top of that, there's the expected hassle of finding yourself someplace that just does not take American Express. It was a poor decision on my part and one I would not make again.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content:
While some may shy from a credit card with fees there are so many benefits from American Express that make it more than worth it! Apps like Foursquare allow you to receive discounts, through American Express that you would not otherwise receive. This would be a perfect card for business or personal spending! Lots off opportunity for rewards and benefits!


Also the customer assistance alone is worth that yearly fee, after a bad experience through my Visa card, I really don't use any other card. They ar every helpful, the wait time is short if at all, and the employees are very helpful.


If you are looking for a good card I'd recommend giving this one a try.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content:
This is my second year on platinum after having the gold card. I travel fairly regularly, and to be honest, I cannot think of a card I'd rather have in my wallet. The Centurion (black) might have a few more perks, but the $2500 annual fee really takes the fun out of it. The benefits are excellent and I've used most of them.


Some balk at the $450 annual fee. To be honest, if you travel at all, the annual fee can pay for itself in a single trip. Getting a free room upgrade at a hotel, and a free night covered 3/4 of the annual fee right there. Saving the cost of a $50/day pass to the lounge on the outbound and inbound flight made up the rest of the annual fee. Not to mention the breakfast credit, $100 hotel credit, free car upgrade rental, etc.


If you don't travel, but want the service of AmEx, stay on green or gold. If you travel, this is where you want to be. If you have a 7 or 8 figure income, go ahead and move to Centurion. You're more likely to use that private jet service than us lowly platinum folks. :)
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: My family has been using this card for as long as I can remember. It is rather expensive to obtain year to year, but the benefits are worth the cost. It is very good for anyone who travels because the card gets really great hotel discounts and travel benefits. It also makes your travels more relaxing because you can take advantage of airport lounges around big cities in the world. My father travels extensively and he has been happy with what the card has offered him to make his travels more relaxing. This is a wonderful credit card to have if you travel often.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I have had this card for over 10 years. What I like about it, is I can get into the Delta crown room for free. I can also book my travel with a platinum travel concierge. The membership miles program is an added plus, I have flown around the world using points transferred to Delta Airlines. I also transfer the miles into my Starwood Hotel account for discounts on hotel stays. The only real thing I do not like about it, is the large yearly fee (for two cards it runs me around $600). I do wish they had a cheaper fee so I wouldn't get slapped with such a hefty payment every September.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I have had this card for a while now and it has generally served its purpose. The yearly fee is a bit much but it is worth it to not worry about expenses for a bit. I also enjoy the customer service from American Express. Everytime I have called them they have been helpful and I get an answer to any question I might have very quickly. This is the only card that I have right now and it has been worthwhile to have it. I also have found that it is great for your credit score if you keep up with payments. I just purchased a new car and got a very good rate. Also the entertainment options are great, such as restaurants and also airline benefits. I have only flown once since having the card but I got some very good rewards.Overall I am impressed with this card and am pleased that I got one.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: This card is not cheap for me to maintain, with annual fees of $450 a year, but it is well worth it. American Express is the king of business credit cards, and the Platinum American Express is the best of their card family that you can apply for (The American Express Black is something else entirely). American Express gives exemplary benefits and protection for business travelers around the world. This card also gives you access to 600 airport priority lounges around the world, saving money on memberships with the various airlines. The entertainment options this card offers are exemplary too. Having this card gives access to the American Express Concierge service, with access to all of the best shows, restaurants, etc. This is the best card to pull out when you want to make a serious impression.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I have 4 cards - all have rewards benefits. The 3 non-Amex cards have no yearly fee but it is much harder to accrue points on them.I use my Amex most because of the extended warranty protection (they replaced a phone and a printer in the years I've been with them), ease of disputing charges, 1 bag free, companion ticket, pay with miles program and ease of accruing miles. I'm okay with the fee because I get much more value than I pay for the card. One thing I have never understood over these many years is what benefit MQM's are? What do I get if I accrue these? I've never seen a feature/benefit statement on any literature or offers. Overall, this is a great card for me.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I Love using the American Express Platinum.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I've had the American Express Platinum card for a few years now and have been quite pleased with it. The points add up very quickly. While it is true that I use the card for my larger out-of-the-ordinary purchases, I also find months where I use it only for run of the mill every day needs and still find that my points rise pretty fast. There is a requirement that the balance is due every month, which I have never had a problem with meeting. Redeeming the points is also very easy, doable online. When I did need to have some customer service help I found them to be attentive and reasonable. I'm happy to write a positive recommendation for the American Express Platinum Card.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: The Platinum American Express card has some strict requirements, needing a superb credit rating, as well as paying the balance in full each month, but offers many nice bonuses if you can qualify for the card. The card offers many helpful benefits for travelers, such as extra discounted tickets, hotel and resort bonus programs (offering exclusive upgrades and other features worldwide). On the negative side, the card has a $450 annual fee (at the basic level), and a $35 late fee (or 2.99%). The points system the card uses basically gives 2 points per booked travel trip, as well a 1 point for every other dollar spent, which is quite nice.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I have had the Platinum Card from American Express for a few years now and I love it! The benefits are great! It seems like the Membership Rewards points add up quickly and they give you a ton of things to choose from when redeeming them. I love getting something back for making purchases I have to make anyhow! I use my Platinum Card for just about everything these days. The travel benefits are really helpful too! Not to mention the “exclusive” upgrades that I get to a lot of different places. I also want to say that the customer service for the Platinum Card over at American Express is wonderful! Any problem or issue I have and they help me fix it right away! I have never had any problems whatsoever. I highly recommend getting a Platinum Card from American Express to everyone!
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I recently upgraded to American Express Platinum Card from their Gold card a month ago. My company offered me the card so the annual fee was waived which is pretty high at $450 a year. The new benefits are excellent. I received 25000 reward points for spending $2000 in the first few months of owning card which is huge benefit. I travel heavy sometimes and the card offers annually up to a $200 refund on any airline fees such as baggage fees. The Platinum Concierge is a great luxury. On my last trip, the hotel lost my reservation. I call concierge and within in 10 minutes they book me a room a mile down the road at a much better hotel with a nicer room at no extra charge. I highly recommend this card even if you personally have to pay the annually fee out of pocket. The card easily pays for itself.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I must say that at first I was pleased with American Express, but over time became more and more disappointed with them, and specifically their customer service. They seem to be too by the book and are often not willing to be flexible. They are very by the book and all business. Something is missing in this approach to customer service. I will likely cancel my account and seek out a bette company to do business with. There are so many good credit card companies out there, that you should expect only the best customer service and benefits. I will be doing a little shopping around in search of a better deal. I like WalletHub as it offers a wide range of opinions on a variety of credit card products. This has been a big help.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I've been an American Express Card member since 2007. I started with the Gold card and was offered an upgrade to Platinum about a year after that and have loved it ever since. The annual fee is definitely a little steep but it comes along with great benefits and rewards and I've never had a problem disputing charges. Actually, in most cases American Express has gone and fixed the problem themselves before I've even called. I've also done some of the members only events and they were amazing. I took a one night cruise just for cardholders for the christening of the Norwegian Gem cruise ship where John Mayer performed in a very intimate setting, and Bobby Flay designed the menu and on board for a book signing. I especially love that you can now use your points for almost any rewards you can think of, and if its not specifically on their list they will figure out the point amount for you so you can get whatever you want. You can now also pay your bill using points as well. This is a great card that I use almost everywhere I go. Highly recommended.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I have been using my American Express card for over 5 years now and I have never had any complications/problems with it. My sister signed me up for the card because I informed her that I needed one to build up credit for the future. She was already an Amex member so she decided to sign me up and I am very thankful. I've never had any issues with the card while making purchases. Therefore, I have never had the opportunity to call customer service but I'm sure it's excellent. The benefits are very good and the website is easily accessible. The benefits from the airline miles are worth signing up for if you are an avid traveler. I would highly recommend getting an Amex card for first time users.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I am quite pleased with my American Express card. I am a relatively new cardholder and this card is a pretty good initiation. My dad also has the same card and he got some kind of deal for both my brother and me! The annual fee is about half because my dad actually pays the full amount. I feel a little above my means using the card, because at the full $450 price, I really doubt that I would have been able to afford it at all since I am still in school. I do travel home to and fro from home to college quite a bit so the access to private lounges is really nice. Despite the perks of the card, it does have a real downside that I just cannot overlook. Often times, I will go to pay at a small businesses establishment, and it turns out that they just do not accept American Express at all! This is kind of annoying to say the least, because I really like little out of the way restaurants and botiques. I think this card is really for the more well off person who visits mostly areas where businesses all accept American Express. This is also the reason, that I may just have to get another card, because I can only carry so much cash on me... Another great thing about the card that I adore is the points! Personally, I don't have enough to get anything fabulous, but my dad amounts enough to get something cool every now and then.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I've had this card for a while now and it has proven to be a quality choice many times over. The strengths of this card alone far outweigh any negatives like the $450 annual fee. For example, there is a terrific concierge service, an airport lounge program, and several promotional opportunities. Then there is also protection features like the 3 month coverage from theft, and protection on many items you purchase. You can also send an item to Amex for a complete refund minus shipping if the initial retailer refuses to take an item back, and at up to several hundred dollars per item, which is great for items with no return policy. Customer service has also been absolutely brilliant, and at least as far as I'm concerned, these experiences alone have validated the high value of the credit card.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content:
I have been using the American Express Platinum Card for almost 3 years now and I must say that gives me a lot of benefits. The 25,000 membership rewards points when you spend 2,000 during your first three months of card membership is a great deal. They gave you 1 point for almost every dollar you spend. Well, and you can get access to a lot of good lounges. I travel a lot so these are greats pros. I think their service is what really beats out the competitors.


But I have to say that this credit card has an annual basic fee of 450, and you have to pay your full balance credit card every month. If you spend 5,000, you must pay the whole 5,000. Overall, I'm thinking in dropping the card. 450 annual fee is just getting to expensive for me. But I have to say, you get a lot of prestige just by owning the card.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: This card is a good platinum card for what it is worth. First off the reward you get for spending only 2000 dollars is quite substantial you get 25,000 points for their membership plan which I feel if you use your card for normal purchases and bill payments you will easily make it to the 2000 dollar mark and earn your reward points.with this card you also get 200 dollar airline fee credits which can be very great for extra bags and other uses.To me the best part is you get an exclusive upgrades at quite a bit of hotels and resorts you may visit when you travel. I give this 5 out of 5 and one of the best platinum cards I have had.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: This card has treated me very well. The airline miles are great! I have been able to do much more traveling than I expected this year because of this. I traveled abroad to Costa Rica and used this card all of the time. I felt very safe and secure using it, and did not have any problems. I have always paid my balance every month so I have not had any experience with how it works if you don't. But if you can pay your balance off each month, the fees are very reasonable. I had a question about my bill and customer service was able to explain it to me in a way that I understood (after explaining my situation to several different people). I would recommend this card to someone, especially if they travel a lot.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I have always been a huge fan of AMEX, there cards have always been a blessing to me. I didn't care for the annual fee but sometimes we have to accept things we don't want to. The rewards membership is pretty cool to me. Customer service is decent, a little slow, but all in all satisfactory. I have never actually used the airline credit but am planning a trip in the near future and am looking forward to taking advantage of this.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I absolutely love my American Express card! I love the customer service that the company provides whenever you call, and I love that when I upgraded from my Gold to Platinum card, they prorated the annual fee (and even gave me back a little bit as a "thank you.") One of my favorite things about the card is the sense of security I have whenever I travel with it, as I know that American Express will take care of me if something bad happens with my card. I love that I can get access to the Admirals Club with American Airlines as a perk for this card. When I travel, I like to be in a quiet, relaxing place before I get on my plane. Also, I love the "Destinations" magazine you get with your Platinum card, as I love to read about traveling and culture in general. If I had to get rid of all of my cards except for one, I would keep my American Express card hands down!
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I've had only good experiences with this card. Last year I went abroad, with help from the airline travel I received from the card, and American Express made it easy for me to get in contact with them and even easier for me to keep track of my funds. I would say the best thing about the card is the company that it is based through, I really feel like the people who I contact are there to help me. Recently, I had some trouble with a certain seller charging my account for items I did not purchase. I called American Express and less than a week later I got a email telling me that the charges were taken care of. All in all I love this card but I mostly love the company and what they are willing to do for their clients.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I personally love this credit card! As other reviewers have mentioned, the airline credit is great. This is especially valuable to me as someone who travels a lot. The rewards are also great. Twenty-five thousand bonus points just for spending 2 grand! That's awesome! I always feel like I'm getting something special when I earn points, and there are always extra ways to earn them. I also love that they don't expire which was a major problem I had with lesser cards. Overall, I think the annual fee is very reasonable considering all the perks you get. Overall, it's my favorite card.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I forgot about global entry rebate, so if you include $200 airline credit, global entry rebate ($100) + 25k points(valued at about $350), you get more than what you pay for first year, but I still standby what I said: unless you are a high roller, don't get this card.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content:
Dear Margie and Joe. I have one question. I notice u guys commenting a lot on these cards, an I wonder whether you have used them yourself?


I have previously owned this card, when I was doing hardcore travelling. As Margie spelled out nicely, this is a wonderful card to have, if you travel often. Lounge certainly is great, but to be honest, if you are someone who can afford $450 annual fee without flinching, that means you either fly higher class cabin (thus you get lounge anyway), or you are probably high tier member for many airlines, and u get lounges anyway.


so why is this card good?


BESIDES the pros and cons Margie already listed except:


1) 200 airline credit is flat out awesome. You somehow packed too much, and airline charges you money? No problem. Put it on amex plat, and they give you back. had to make changes due to unforseen circumstances? no problem. amex plat got your back.


2) while Margie put this as cons, their "glorified" customer service - aka concierge service is great. You need anything ANYWHERE around the world? just call the number on the back, (they give you number to call for each country, so you don't have to make international calls for 1800 number), and they can direct you to anywhere, and assist as best as they can. I used its service and found them to be so valuable, and each story will be too long to list.


3) Margie is wrong, in that amex DOES have shopping mall, and having amex plat gives you opportunities to earn 4x, 6x, and sometimes 10x points.


4) if you are a fan of exclusive privledge, and high-end resort and hotels, this card can help you tremendously.


So what's the final verdict here? Let's be honest WalletHub. This card is geared toward high spenders. The prestige that comes with owning amex plat is significant. Its like people asking why do you drive Benz when your good ol' Scion can get you there just fine? Same thing. This card has that special feeling. You have to ask yourself if you are worth it to get this card at $450 per yr. (no first yr free too! sheesh).


why do I say let's be honest WalletHub? It's because WalletHub gets referral fee for people signing up for credit cards. But there are already other websites that cater toward high spenders/prestige group that either have/or be exposed to this card already.


i think the major target group for WalletHub is either newcomers or those who need 2nd or 3rd card, and not a charge card that on average annual spending is close to $180,000. Yes , that's the average spending each person makes on their amex plat, who owns this card.


So unless you aim to put about 80-100k on this card per yr, its not worth it.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content:
What kind of credit card is worth a $450 annual fee? In my opinion, probably none, but I guess we will see because that’s what the Platinum Card from American Express charges. Anyway, I don’t believe the Amex Platinum Card is actually made of platinum so that theory is out. That seems like two negatives compared to zero positives, but let’s give the American Express Platinum Charge Card a fair shake.


Pros


- 25,000 bonus points when you spend $2,000 in the first three months. Since you can get a $250 statement credit with 36,000 points, that sure is a pro.

- Airport lounge access is certainly a nice amenity for frequent travelers.

- A free companion ticket will also bring a decent amount of value.

- $200 in airline credits for incidental charges will also come in handy for frequent travelers.

- Getting a points discount when you redeem for travel is pretty good too because you’re going to do so as much as possible.


Cons


- The ongoing rewards aren’t special. If I'm going to pay $450, I want more than 1-2 miles per $1 spent.

- The whole concierge service offered by credit cards is just a glorified customer service and I wouldn’t give it much weight.


Overall the Platinum Amex Card gives you a lot but it takes a lot too. You really need to sit down and monetize how much each of the cards “perks” would actually amount to and compare this amount to the annual fee. If they’re worth less or the card doesn’t provide as much value as say the Chase Sapphire Preferred Card ($500-625), then I wouldn’t get it. And I'm guessing that the Amex Platinum Card does not.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content:
You know, people don’t really talk about charge cards that often, but they are actually pretty popular among those with excellent credit scores. The reason for this is that charge cards often have some of the most lucrative, interesting rewards attainable with plastic, and that includes rewards credit cards (the only difference between a charge card and a credit card is that you have to pay your bill in full every month w/ a charge card). American Express is one of the most active major credit card companies on the charge card market, and The Platinum Card is one of the companies premiere charge cards. The first thing that you probably notice about The Platinum Card from American Express is that it has a $450 annual fee. That doesn’t necessarily mean it’s a bad card though because banks sometimes charge high annual fees in return for extra rewards, meaning whether or not you get this card depends on if the rewards it offers are worth at least $450 a year to you.


In terms of rewards, American Express’s Platinum Charge Card offers enough bonus points after you spend 1k during the first 3 mo. to get a roundtrip domestic flight. It also gives you $200 in Airline Fee credits each year, a free companion ticket with a first class or business class ticket purchased through Amex’s travel services, airport club access, and deals on upgrades at hotels. Then there’s the typical 1 point for every $1 you spend with the Platinum Card from American Express and double points for trips booked online. I’d have to say that this stuff does seem pretty valuable IF you travel very frequently and you like to do so in style. Still, if free flights, airport lounge access and hotel upgrades are what you’re after, there are likely cheaper options out there. The Southwest Airlines Credit Card is currently offering 2 free flights, so that’s at least one offer worth checking out.
department: The Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I have had this card for several years now (not sure exactly when I got it, but has been at least 7 years) and I use it for a wide variety of purchases. They've raised my limit a few times without me even asking, which has been great for larger purchases (which yield lots of points). No annual fee is great and I've been able to pick up some great items with my reward points. The biggest reward I was able to get was a Kitchen Aid Mixer for my wife. I've also just recently been able to get a toddler bed for my daughter using only points. The points certainly are what drive my use of the card the most. The interest rate is not great so I try not to keep a balance on it for very long. I haven't run into too many places that didn't accept American Express, but there have been a few (always for small purchases, though, the larger purchases have always been on my American Express). I also love the year end reporting that I get from American Express. My purchases are broken down by category and I can really get a good picture of my spending habits. The only thing that would make the report better is if I could use my American Express everywhere and actually track all my purchases, rather than having some be on a different brand of card. Overall, though, I am very satisfied with this card and plan to keep using it for a long time, especially as long as the points keep coming.

I've had this card for about seven years now and it has been great for the most part. Of course the first year was amazing with 0% interest on purchases, plus the no annual fee and the reward points. I have used American Express' mobile apps to track my spending, which is amazing. I've had to contact them about fraudulent charges a few times and the customer service was amazing at resolving my issues and getting a new card out to me. One thing that has started to wain on my use of the card is that American Express just isn't accepted as much as Visa. I lived abroad for two years and had a very hard time using my American Express Blue Card and had to opt for a new card that didn't charge foreign transactions fees and was more widely accepted. Besides that, a great card for those who know how to properly manage their money.

I have been using American Express blue card for about a year now and I have never had a problem with it. I love how there are no annual fees for the card or the reward program which is great. There are some negatives though. The reward program is decent but there are not too many good rewards without breaking the bank. The APR, which was at 0% for the fifteen months, went up to a number which is slightly higher than my other credit card. Their accepted me very quickly when I applied for the card and have never had a problem with them. The expresspay is great when a store has it and the card is one of the most beautiful card I have ever seen. Overall I think it is a pretty good card.

I have had my Blue card for a few years now. I also have the Credit Secure program which is offered in combination and a monthly charge on my card. I really enjoy and use that option however with the APR and that charge my minimum monthly payments would never pay off the card. Apart from that I really like the card although since I paid it off my usage has decreased dramatically. I also like the points options but have yet to accumulate enough to use them for anything. This card is seldom used but well protected.

I have been a steady user of this Blue card for years now. To date, there has not been any issues with my Account in terms of fraudulent charges, timely statements, and timely payment postings. I keep track of all of my purchases through Quicken, and this card is fully compatible with that software. I also have this card linked to my Amazon Account so that I can earn points through my purchases. The interest rate is nice, even though I pay off my Bill every month. Also, I like the options that you have as to how to redeem the points that you generously accrue. I once also asked for a credit limit rate increase because I was renovating my house, and was accepted instantly. This was something that was very kind of the customer service department on their end. Overall I would say that I am a very satisfied customer.

I've had a Blue card since release. I like the points I accrue from my purchases and the offers that I receive in my email. The American Express website is easy to navigate and support, when needed, has been great. While it's not accepted everywhere more and more businesses appear to take it.


Once I used my Blue to purchase a few items from a online store. Several months after my purchase I received a call from Amex - my card number had been stolen from the vendor's database. Amex had cancelled the card and was offered to overnight me a new card. I told them that I was traveling and could use my Visa, so just send it normal mail. The rep I talked to said that they'd overnight it to me where ever I was. The next morning my card was in my hands. Amex removed the charges from my card and dealt with the vendor; with my Visa I had to prove to them that I didn't make the charges. This impressed me greatly and is one reason (of many) why I continue to due business with them.

I have been using Blue by American Express for several years now. I like having the card; I have it linked to my Amazon account so that the points I earn go towards my Amazon purchases, which is very handy. This card is different than other types of American Express cards because the entire balance does not have to be paid off by the end of the month like other cards from this company. The interest rate is also very reasonable. The only thing that I really do not like about the card is that I do not receive very many, if any, balance transfer offers. I know they are offered from time to time but I must not be eligible. This is not a deal breaker but the option would be appreciated.

American Express is blue. No, it doesn’t need cheering up or anything like that; rather, it offers a number of rewards credit cards with “Blue” branding: the Blue Cash Everyday, Blue Cash Preferred, Blue for Business, Blue Sky, Blue Sky Preferred, and this the no-frills (at least when it comes to the name) Blue from American Express Credit Card. Let’s move past the fact that this card sounds like a “fragrance for men,” to what it offers. Blue for American Express gives you 10 points per $1 spent on purchases made through Amex’s online shopping mall, 2 points per $1 when booking travel through Amex and 1 point per $1 on everything else. The 1 point per $1 is all you should really count on though because online shopping malls and credit card run travel programs don’t usually have the most competitive prices so rewards on those types of purchases aren’t worth too much in a practical sense. When it comes to rates, the Blue Credit Card from American Express gives you 0% on purchases for 12 months, which is fine, but certainly not on the high end of the spectrum with other cards considered. Therefore, though the Blue American Express Credit Card does not have an annual fee, it’s still not competitive with the best offers on the market.


If a no annual fee credit card is what youre after, there are myriad good options. A card like the Chase Sapphire Preferred doesn’t have a fee in the first year and gives you a $500 – 625 initial bonus for spending $3k in the first three months. The Capital One Cash credit card gives you 1.5% cash back across all purchases and a $100 initial bonus. The Citi Simplicity Card offers 0% on purchases and transfers for 18 months. Keep in mind though that paying an annual fee is often the price of getting the best rewards.

Ever since I got this card about 10 years ago I have used it for nearly all my purchases. It has been a fantastic card with the rewards being very nice. You can use the rewards for airline tickets (transfer to airline account) or for free nights at one of the Starwood Hotels, including Westin, St. Regis and Le Meridien (there are more by I have not stayed at those hotels yet).


The card and Starwood have both been easy to use and customer service has been top notch at both. I cannot begin to tell you how fast and efficient American Express was when I lost my card! I called customer service to let them know I lost my card and all they need to know was what was my last purchase and when, next thing I know, a day later I have my new card.
department: Starwood Preferred Guest® Credit Card from American Express

content: I got this credit card a few years ago when I was working very hard to get to the 2 million mile club with American Airlines to become a lifetime Platinum member. I found this card on a blog (can't remember which one) and found out that 20,000 dollars spent would be worth 25,000 miles on American Airlines. This was the highest conversion rate I could find so I went for this card. American Express is a top-notch company and I have been very pleased with their professionalism and have felt I've been treated by them very well. I have since purchased a business and routinely charge about 8 to 10 thousand a month which makes earning miles very easy. I can also use those points to stay at Sheraton hotels. I would definitely recommend this card for anyone wanting miles or hotel points.
department: Starwood Preferred Guest® Credit Card from American Express

content: I recently received a Starwood Preferred Guest® Credit Card from American Express. I used it to replace a credit card that I already had. I am able to earn hotel stays and flight miles in a very quick and easy manner with this card. Customer service was very friendly and professional when I contacted them about an issue with my card. The application was quick and easy. It gave me an instant approval, so I did not have to wait for something to come in the mail. My interest rate is very competitive for being a rewards credit card. They gave me a large credit limit without hesitation.
department: Starwood Preferred Guest® Credit Card from American Express

content: I am currently a member of the Starwood Preferred Guest "club" and I wanted my dollar to stretch a little further when I travel to my vacation destinations so I decided to get a Starwood Preferred Guest Card by American Express. So far so good with the card, I earn 1 point for every dollar I spend with the card, sometimes up to 2 points per dollar if I shop at one of their partner retail locations. It may not be my favorite card (that goes to the Costco True Earnings Card by American Express) but I still pull it out from time to time to earn some points. My fiancee and I are planning a pretty big vacation after we get married so these points will come in handy. I definitely enjoy the luxury that Starwood Hotels is known for so that is a plus in my book.
department: Starwood Preferred Guest® Credit Card from American Express

content: This credit card has been great for us when traveling. I became a member in 2008 and have used the points on this card for two Disney World vacations. There are two Starwood hotels onsite at Disney, if you stay there you get most of the Disney hotel benefits (transportation to and from parks, etc.) but you can use your Starwood American Express card points to stay. Additionally, I recently lost the card and when I called to report it, the customer service representative was wonderfully helpful and knowledgeable. I received my replacement card quickly. I also like that there are so many hotel choices and few blackout dates. I also utilize their online payment and the Amex app on my phone. Using the app, you can get great deals on shows and restaurants as well as check and pay your bill.
department: Starwood Preferred Guest® Credit Card from American Express

content: I love this card! I have been a member for just under a year time, and this fits my family's situation perfectly. We travel quite often as a part of work (we are coworkers too!), so while traveling to hospitals, we usually stay at Starwood hotels. We also book conferences through them and, you guessed it, we use this card to make it all happen. We have accumulated so many points combined, that whenever we go away at our own leisure, the room is totally covered. We also use this card for our regular purchases (gas, utilities, etc), so we get even more points that way. If you don't stay at least a couple of weeks at Starwood Hotels (W, St Regis, Aloft, Element), then this might not be the best card for you. The customer service is top notch as well, and we have never had any issues to report thus far.
department: Starwood Preferred Guest® Credit Card from American Express

content:
This is a great credit card. I first heard about it when a family member recommended it to me. I originally signed up as a favor to him (he got 5,000 Starwood Preferred Guest points to his account), but I didn’t have a strong opinion about the card at that point. To my surprise, I got 25,000 points myself for signing up! So yes, they have a GREAT referral program.


I was able to use the points in many different ways. The most common use of the points is for hotels. I have gotten hotels in Kauai, Hawaii; Malibu, California; and Brooklyn, NY. They have so many different places where they have hotels. There are different tiers of hotels ranging from good to great. You usually need anywhere from 2,000-12,000 points to get a night’s stay at a hotel. There’s also the option of using points to lower the price of a hotel; this is a mixed option, where you pay some cash and use some points. In addition, I have also used my points to book airline tickets. American Express allows you to transfer points to almost any major airline. Because I am a Delta frequent flier, I transferred 40,000 miles over to my account. The great plus to this option is that American Express will give you a bonus 5,000 miles for every 20,000 miles you transfer. Essentially, I got 50,000 miles when I only transferred 40,000 miles.


The only con to this card is the $65 annual fee, which is automatically charged to my card.
department: Starwood Preferred Guest® Credit Card from American Express

content:
Joe, I can't shake a feeling (especially I see that you are a loan officer at Bank, but doesn't specify which one) that you work for capital one. otherwise, I don't see how u can push for those cards, and downplay amex spg.


one note of correction. you earn 2 points per dollar spent on starwood hotel stay FROM the card. u get 2 points per dollar spent on starwood hotel for staying there, (3 if you are elite), but the card only gives you 2. but you have to understand that 2 point is worth more than say, 10 points in hilton or marriott, so do take that into consideration.


If you talk to anyone who have actually USED the card (or using like me), this is my primary card to use in the States for non-dining/gas/flight/hotel (sans spg) purchases.


If I am going to earn 1 point per dollar spent, then this is the card I put it on. why? because its simply one of most flexible card out there. Yes, if you don't fly a lot, this might not be for you, but even if you take a cross continental domestic flight, this is golden.


spg has so many transfer partners, its not even funny. american? check. United? check. Non-US carriers? check check check.


if you transfer in bulk, say 20,000 spg points, then u get 25,000 miles, which is great!


you don't have to stay at sheraton 6-8 times a year to make this card awesome. even once is great. Since, starwood has awesome hotels in wonderful and exotic locations like Bali, Koa Samoi, or even one of my favorite Mystique, Santorini-Greece, using these points for that purposes is going to make your dream come true.


this card ALWAYS stays in my pocket, if I am in the states. Sadly, this card does have forex charge, so when I travel, it stays at home, sadly waiting for my return.
department: Starwood Preferred Guest® Credit Card from American Express

content:
If you’ve ever stayed at a Sheraton, a Westin, or higher-end hotels like The W or the St, Regis, you’ve stayed at a Starwood hotel. If you stay at any of the hotels under the Starwood umbrella (also includes Le Meridien, The Luxury Collection, Aloft, Four Points, or Element) exclusively when you travel, it might make sense to get a Starwood Preferred Guest Credit Card from American Express. First of all, the American Express Starwood Credit Card offers 15,000 bonus points (10K after first purchase and 5k after spending $5,000 in first 6 months), which is redeemable for 6 free nights at the company’s Category 1 and 2 hotels (list available online). That’s a pretty darn attractive initial bonus for someone who knows their going to be staying in such hotels in the near future. You also get at least 4 points per dollar spent on Starwood Hotel stays with the Starwood Credit Card from American Express, 2 points per dollar spent at Starwood retail partners, and 1 point on everything else.


Earlier I said that the Starwood Credit Card “might make sense” because the fact that you are a loyal Starwood customer doesn’t necessarily mean the Starwood credit card will be your most rewarding choice. There are a lot of really good rewards cards out there, particularly for people with excellent credit, which is what it takes to open the Starwood Preferred Guest Amex Card, since Amex’s entire credit card business is targeted to the upper crust of consumers. So, if you don’t spend at least 20 nights in a Starwood Hotel each year, you shouldn’t consider opening this card for anything else other than its initial bonus. And if you aren’t going to need 6 free hotel nights in the next year, I’d go with a card like the Chase Sapphire Preferred that offers an initial bonus of either $625 in travel accommodations or $500 cash over the Starwood Preferred Card. If you do stay in Starwood Establishments for 20+ nights, by all means go ahead and get the Starwood Credit Card, as it will help you save on one of your biggest expenses. I’d probably also get a good everyday cash back card like the Capital One Cash card to use for all of your other purchases.
department: Starwood Preferred Guest® Credit Card from American Express

content: I have had my Blue Cash American Express card for about 5 years. It has been a great card. I have never had any problems with it whatsoever. I was able to get them to lower the interest rate to 9.9%. You can only ask for a decrease in interest rate once per year. Alternatively, you can either as for that or ask for a credit increase, but I don't think that they will do both at the same time. Each year we build up enough points to pay for birthday presents or something special for the kids such as Disney on Ice tickets.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I have had the Blue Cash Preferred credit card from American Express for three years, and it is my favorite credit card. This card offers $150 back after you spend $1,000 in the first three months. If you purchase gas & groceries, the reward program cannot be beat. The card gives 6% rewards on grocery store purchases and 3% on gas. You also get 1% back on all other purchases. I usually take this as cash back on my statement (available in $25 increments) which essentially means I get free gas & groceries every month. The customer service is top-notch, and they are always quick to respond. My card was used fraudulently one time and American Express took care of it right away, including sending a new card to me via next day air. I highly recommend this card to anybody!
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: The Blue Cash Preferred credit card from American Express is by far the best credit card I have ever had. They offer the best rewards I have ever seen. The annual fee is pretty low compared to other cards. They also give you $150 after you make your first purchase which is fantastic. The reward rates at which you earn rewards is also amazing. The interest rates are very low compared to most other credit cards as well. Since I have had this credit card, my credit score has improved substantially. When I have questions, the staff from American Express has always been there for me. They have answered all my questions and have always fixed all my problems quick and easily. They always sound like they want to help with makes me feel respected as a client. I would recommend this credit card to anyone!
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I love the Blue Cash Preferred Card from American Express. I’ve had it for about a year now and have no complaints. Customer service has always been pleasant and all the extras you get with the card are great. Right away you can earn $150 reward dollars after spending 1,000 in the first 3 months. You get 1% cash back on most purchases but 3% cash back when you put gas in your car and 6% cash back the grocery store. There are also ways to earn rewards faster by doing things like adding additional cards for your friends or family or enroll in automatic bill pay etc.. The interest rate is standard or high depending on your credit, and the annual fee of $75 is a bit high, but if you take advantage of all the extras the card offers with discounts and services it will even out in the end and you will actually be gaining more even though you are paying a high yearly fee.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content:
I've been a customer of American Express for a few years. I have a few cards from them, and the blue cash preferred card is my latest one from American Express. I was invited to apply for this card about half a year ago. I have been using this card a few times a month for groceries since then, and have had a really good experience for this card so far.

I love that I can get 6% cash back on my groceries. The savings more than makes up for the annual fee. I have only called customer service once to replace my card and they were very friendly. Overall, I am very satisfied with this card.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: This card has been ok. Honestly, at one point for no reason they decided to cap my account and it was really tough for me financially. I waited a few weeks and requested them to check my credit again, they did and removed the cap. It was frustrating and I was not happy with their customer service department. I had never had a set limit previously with this card. Other than this incident it has been ok. I accumulate points and am able to redeem them
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I got the American Express Blue Cash card about a year ago. Let's be honest. It's okay. It's not amazing that the company hasn't stolen all your money from hidden fees. That should be expected. I don't like that they don't offer 0% on transfers. Otherwise, it's a decent alternative to the standard bearers Visa and Mastercard. If you're able to use an American Express, in particular an American Express Blue Cash Preferred, then you'll probably get better deals than with a Visa or a Mastercard. At times it's only competitive with Discover. I just wanted to let people know what's up because other people are practically saying it's the best thing since sliced bread and I like a little bit of honesty served up with my reviews.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I have used American Express for probably 2 years now. I have been pleased with this credit card. I love the low rates that are offered and I also love the rewards. American Express is a very trust worthy company in my eyes. I do travel quite a bit and this card is perfect for travelers. I will probably continue using this credit card, or the credit card company for a while. They have been good so far and seem like they will be good for a long time. The only down side is that sometimes the credit card is not accepted. Some stores don't take this credit card but for the most part, most stores do!
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: We have had our American Express for several years now. We have never had any problems with the company, and we appreciate the lower rates that they offer. In checking the statements, I have found no indiscretion that I have felt the need to call up the company to have them fix the problem. This is an indication to me that they must be a trust worthy company. The only drawback to using this card is the amount of vendors that don’t take American Express. I am a Costco girl myself, and as long as Costco accepts my card, I will continue to be happy with this card and plan to keep it for years to come.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I've been an Amex Blue Cash Preferred holder for over 3 years now and so far have been quite pleased with the benefits they have offered me over the years. After spending $1,000 on my card within the first 3 months, I received $150 as bonus reward. Their cash back rewards program is simply awesome and it helps you earn unlimited 1% cash back on virtually everything you buy. Moreover, there is no annual limit to your cash rewards. You earn 6% cash back for your purchases at U.S. stand-alone supermarkets; 3% cash back for gasoline at U.S. stand-alone gas stations and select major department store purchases. I use it primarily for groceries and gas and trust me I do save a great deal. The only negative thing is their annual fee of $75 which is not waived for the first year. However, by using your card very often you can easily get far more cash back than the annual fee. I highly recommend it to those who want to earn the highest cash back rate possible as this card is the best in the market.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: When I got my American Express Blue Cash card a few years ago, it was an excellent card for me to have. I travel a lot, and the card is very easy to travel with. Although not everyone accepts American Express, many, if not most places that I go do accept it. I think I only experienced one place that refused it, which was good anyway because I really didn't need the splurge, anyway. It was a great card to use as a student. I was in grad school when I first got the card and making very little as a grad assistant while living on campus. This card was great for emergencies. It was nice to know that I had a reliable source of funds if the need presented itself. The cash back feature is also nice, but I really never used it enough to benefit too much from that feature. I also think American Express has great customer service. I'm extremely satisfied with Blue from American Express.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I have been using this American Express card for a little over two years. Generally it has been a very good card and I have been satisfied with it. The interest rate has been pretty reasonable and the other fees aren’t too bad. The rewards program definitely can make up for those if you use the card a lot. This is really helpful, especially if you pay off the card within a reasonable amount of time. The only complaint I have is that sometimes the card is not accepted when I am making purchases in stores. Some online shops don’t take it either. Aside from that this card has been really good and I have been extremely satisfied with it.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I had this card a while ago (about a year ago) and it was a decent card to use. American Express isn't always the greatest when it comes to being accepted everywhere but when they are accepted I used to usually bust out this one. The rewards were pretty good, especially at supermarkets where you would get 6% cash back. I also would use the card on gas because of the 3% cash back rewards on those purchases. The only thing I really didn't like about the Blue Cash Preferred Card was the annual fee of $75! You would need to spend $1250 in groceries at supermarkets just to break even with this card and I really didn't like that. I had a Costco membership so I switched over to The True Earnings card because of the no annual fee.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: Overall, I love having this card. Not only do you get great cash back at grocery stores, but also at gas stations and other places as well. In fact I get 6% cash back at grocery stores. When you are making purchases for a family of 5, that really pays off quickly. At, first, I wasn't too keen on the 75 dollar annual fee; but, after doing the math I'll easily be making more than that back, just in cash back from grocery purchases. On top of all of that, I like the fact that it's an American Express. There is still a small amount of prestige in having this card.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I just recently opened an account with this card. I've never had an American Express card, mostly because U order online from a lot of overseas companies and they won't accept anything that isn't Visa or, very rarely, Mastercard. However, I am more than pleased with this card. The rates are great, much better than my Visa or Mastercard rates. I also really love the cash back rewards for grocery and gas purchases; I use this card most of the time when I go grocery shopping just to rack up awards. I've never had any problems with their customer service, and they've always been great with answering any of my billing or general questions. Highly recommended.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I opened up an account with American Express Blue Cash about two years ago and it has been a pleasure having this card in my wallet. The interest rate is low compared to my Mastercard and Visa cards. If American Express is accepted where I am shopping I always choose this as the card I use. Another thing about this card is the purchase protection American Express offers. I was on vacation in Miami, Florida and the first night I was there my rental car a Cadillac Escalade was stolen from the hotel parking lot. I needed to rent another truck right away but my credit limit was at its maximum. I called American Express and explained my situation and they temporarily extended my credit limit so I could rent another vehicle. I was very impressed. They even sent me flowers when I got home from my vacation saying how sorry they felt about my situation. Love this card.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I have used this card in so much over the years. I use it to track my spending through the month and pay it off each month. On the months I run short...I pay what I can & catch up on the next due date! Works great!!!
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I opened up an account with American Express Blue Cash about a year ago and I have been very impressed. They were offering up to $150 if you charged $1,000 in your first 3 months. I charged this and more and was amazed at how easy it was to receive the $150. I also love the cash back on groceries and gas since this is what I use my card for most. All in all the features offset any of the fee's etc that are associated with this card. It's true that there are cards out there that have lower fee's but with all that you get back from this card, and their amazing customer service, I would say it is well worth the little extra out of pocket cost.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: This is hands down the BEST credit card I own. American Express is the most prestigious credit card company in the industry. American Express is also very safe, they always have your back. I am confident that protect their customers against credit card fraud. I signed up for this card after graduating college and began using it at the peak of my professional career. My job requires me to travel quite often, so I have been able to rack up A LOT of reward points thanks to the 3% cash back on gasoline. I was also able to rack up the 150 dollar after my 1k purchase. The reward dollars came in handy because I was able to use them towards my dream purchase. The annual fee is also extremely low considering you are having the privledge of using the BEST credit card company on the market.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I had this card throughout my first few years of attending my undergraduate school. For the most part, it's features outweigh any fees, etc. The main reason I got it was the rewards/cash back, but also because the interest was lower than any other card I've had in the past. For every thousand dollars spent, you get a pretty decent amount of reward dollars, and while that was a plus, it's somewhat outweighed by the fact that you have to pay an annual fee to use the card. The fee isn't exorbitant but when you're a student, pretty much any annual fee on the card hurts your wallet. Still, the rewards were pretty handy, especially the 2% back at gas stations, which was far better for me than the 'standalone supermarket' cash back.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I love my Blue Cash Preferred card from American Express! I love it because of the low annual fee, the quality that I know I always get from American Express, and espeically because of the cash back rewards! Who doesn't love making some money buying the things they already need to buy? I sure do. I only have to spend $25 a week at the supermarket to earn 6% cash back. I love that! I don't know any one that doesn't spend at least that much per week at a grocery store. With grocery prices going sky high, getting a little bit back is a huge relief!
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: American Express has been the standard for business credit cards for years, and with their new Blue card, they just continue to raise the bar. Blue not only gives you the standard quality and backing of American Express, but adds a great cash rewards program. The standard 1% on purchases can be found anywhere, but Blue also offers 3% on gas and 6% on groceries. Looking at that 3% sure makes me a lot happier every time I’m filling up my gas tank. Unlike some rewards cards, Blue also offers the rewards as a straight payment back on the account, rather than having to use the points to buy things I don’t really want. They also offer an additional $150 if you spend $1000 in the first three months, so where can you go wrong?
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I've had the Blue Cash Preferred American Express card for over five years and have been very happy with it. I was in another country when I was having breakfast with my friend at a out-of-the-way "quant" breakfast restaurant. However, I paid the bill and then my friend looked at the receipt and realized that I had been charged nearly 10 times the actual value of the meal. On the final receipt, the decimal point had been moved over several times. This sounds crazy, but it actually happened. We were almost 30 minutes away when my friend realized this, so we had to drive back. I talked with the manager and they said they had it resolved, but come a month later I still have that charge. I had told Amex I was going to be traveling in this country, so I realize why I wasn't alerted to this purchase. However, Amex was able to get my money back from the restaurant, which was a huge relief. It was a bizarre situation and I was glad to have the customer service from this card in my corner making sure that I wasn't charged the outrageous amount for this meal. So, overall amazing customer service.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I love this credit card. A few years ago, I was in a search for a new card after finally paying down several thousand dollars of credit card debt. I was coming from a bare-bones Visa that I was given right after turning 18, which had no reward structure of any kind and which I had been maxed out on for years. It was an awful experience. I finally paid it all off, and I wanted something with good rewards that I could pay off every month and still make a little return on. I've found that the 6% back at grocery stores adds up very quickly, and their customer service has been fantastic. I've never used the reward structure for anything except the cash back, but that's exactly what I was looking for anyway. There are still some places out there that don't take AMEX, so you may not be able to have this as your only card, but when you use it where you can (especially grocery stores and gas stations), it's great. Highly recommended.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I have had the Blue Cash Preferred for a year now and I am nothing but thrilled with both the cash back and the service American Express provides. If you spend a decent amount on groceries, the 6% back on groceries alone makes it worth the $75 annual fee (this is in comparison to the no annual fee Blue Cash Everyday that gives 3% back on groceries). The 3% back on gas and department store purchases is just icing on the cake for me (I don't spend much on gas). As for the customer service, American Express is extremely helpful on both the phone and by email. Email usually receives a response within a few hours. This card has become my everyday card.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I have the American Express Blue Cash Preferred card and I prefer it to other cards I've had. I have a nice low APR. Yes there's an annual fee, but that is more than made up for by the generous rewards program. I use this card for all of my everyday needs such as gas and groceries and my rewards add up very quickly! I love the wide variety of rewards that are available - there is a large selection of gift cards, quite a few electronics and other actual items that you can purchase with your points, or you can choose cash back and get a credit on your account. I let my rewards add up and then buy gift cards for Christmas shopping, but that's just me. I like that I can choose how and when to use my rewards. Another thing I like about this card is the website. It is so easy to view and manage my account and they have a very easy to use program for categorizing and tracking your spending. I have had a couple other cards in the past that had similar programs, but they were not as user friendly as this American Express one. Overall I have had a great experience with this card and plan to keep it for many years to come.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: This is a great credit card. I use it primarily at the grocery store because it pays a rate of 5% on all groceries. Once I surpass the $6500 threshold of spending in a calendar year, my rewards rate also increases (from 1% to between 2 and 6%, depending on the type of purchase). Anyone who is forced to make everyday purchases such as gas and groceries would benefit financially from this card, as you are receiving money back for things that you would be forced to buy anyways. Everyone should be careful to pay the balance promptly, because the variable rates after the introductory period can be substantially high, as is the case with most credit cards.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: This is my third credit card, and so far it is not exactly my favorite.
