I usually draw the line when it comes to applying for anything that has yearly fees, but I was tempted by the $150 free for making $1,000 in qualifying purchases in the first three months. I achieved that easily, and did get my bonus, but it felt like two steps forward and one step backward, because the $75 came out of this reward. I also was able to get no interest for a year after signing up, so it quickly became my “safe” card to put larger purchases on while I saved up to pay the sum off in one go. I felt that even after the first year was up, I would be coming out ahead by earing 6% cash back on my grocery purchases. But I often shop at stores that are not recognized solely as supermarkets, so my purchases never get classified under the 6% returns, but instead under the 1%. This has really slowed down my accrual of cash back, and after the “honeymoon” year is up, I don’t think I will be continuing with this card. I don’t really use the perks that come with an American Express card, as I am not interested in luxury items, but rather how to stretch my dollar a bit further.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I've found the Blue Cash Preferred card to be a great all-around credit card. I applied, and received zero percent interest for twelve months, along with a $150 bonus for spending $1,000 in the first three months I had the card (easy to do, just pay your everyday bills with the card!). So far, I'm very pleased with the ease-of-access and manageability of my account online, as well as with American Express' customer service. It's a very straightforward and simple-to-understand rewards system, and I love that the higher-earning cash back categories are for purchases I make regularly such as at grocery stores and gas stations! Those categories really add up! Of course, the interest rate is on the higher side, but that is to be expected with a rewards card of any type. You just have to be careful not to carry a balance! All in all, this is a great card to use!
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I occasionally use my American Express card when I am at the grocery store because it gives me the best cash back of all my cards. When I have made a transaction with my card, everything has gone smoothly. One thing that I do enjoy is their website. The website is very clutter-free and easy to navigate. I have never had a store decline my American Express card and it seems this card is universally accepted. While this card is not necessarily the card I use most often, I do have good faith in this card and still keep it in my wallet. I would definitely advise my friends to use an American Express card, especially for grocery shopping.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I have an American Express card and was traveling abroad. I contacted my bank ahead of time so there would be no problems when I was there and to alert them to expect foreign charges on my credit card. When I arrived in Nairobi, Kenya at my hotel, I gave the front desk my credit card but it was rejected. I was sure it was a mistake so they were kind enough to call AmEx for me. AmEx had canceled my card because of my attempt to use it in a foreign country, despite my previous call. Apparently, there was no communication with their website and the Visa website, which had input my information. I was extremely disappointed in the bank's actions and argued. Eventually, they were able to re-activate my card. However, this experience seems to be common with AmEx and if you are traveling abroad, I would highly recommend using another credit card. Aside from this experience, my use of it in the US has been satisfying and the rewards are good.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: After college I needed to start building my credit, so I decided to get a credit card. After looking around and reading reviews I applied for the American Express Blue card. I buy groceries, drinks, food with it when I go out and gas when my car needs it. I love it because its there when I need it and I just pay it off when I get a bill. There website is great its easy to navigate and adding bank accounts is very easy. The website is how I check and pay my monthly bill. Overall its a great card for building my credit, and getting points I want to save my points for something nice or worthwhile, great card overall.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: My first credit card was an american express, I mostly try to use it just for gas and food but every now and then I use it to get something extra. Its a great card to earn rewards on, I like to save my rewards for christmas. At first I didn't like the idea of having to pay an annual fee but it seems to balance out in the end. So I don't mind it so much now that I did the math. Its accepted most every where I go with no problems. I highly recommend this card to anyone who actually uses their card, that way they earn the rewards and its worth it.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I have really loved having this card. My husband got it for us to use for only gas and groceries in order to get the cash back rewards. We have been able to save a sizeable amount of money over the past 8 months that we have had the card, which we are hoping to use on a family vacation in the next few years. I would highly recommend this card because it is such an easy way to save up some extra money. We have to buy gas and groceries anyway, so we may as well be working on earning a reward!
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: This was the first (and only) American Express card I've had. I was initially hesitant when I saw the application, as unlike most of the other cards I have this one charges an annual fee. However, I did the math and realized that with the high rewards earning potential the card would essentially pay for itself and then some, and that's just in terms of rewards earned on groceries and gas, not counting the bonus you get initially for spending 1000 on it within the first three months. It's also more widely accepted than my Discover card. My only complaint would be that it can sometimes be difficult to redeem your points, but it's not too terrible a hassle. Overall I'm quite pleased with this card.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: Amex Schmamex. I guess we don't use this card enough to get the RIGHT kind of "cash rewards" because every time we've tried to USE the so-called "cash rewards" we've been met with truculent obstructiveness by their so-called "Customer Service" people. We tried to use our "cash rewards" to buy theatre tickets and, even though that kind of use was approved IN WRITING by American Express, when it came time to actually buy the tickets, we had to go through this ABSURD rigamarole nonsense that ultimately ended with us NOT being able to use them. It was a real disappointment because we couldn't afford the theatre tickets otherwise. American Express is a greedy corporation interested only in lining their CEO's pockets with their customers' money. Their rates are WAY too high and choosing this card for so-called "rewards" we can NEVER use was a MAJOR mistake. We paid it off, cut up our card, sent it to them, and told American Express what they could do with the resulting detritus. So, whatever you do, do NOT buy into their ridiculous, nonsensical corporate line shown on this website! "Integrity?" Nope. "Respect for people?" Nope again. "Customer Commitment?" You gotta be kidding me.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content:
Out of all of the credit cards I have ever had, this is by far my favorite one! The ability to get cash back rewards is always nice and this card really helps you get the most out of your credit card. Why wouldn’t you want cash back! It makes me use my card more and really appreciate a great card like this one. When you can get rewards like this, it makes the annual fee seem like not a big deal.


Like others have stated, you need a great credit rating to be eligible for this card but if you have this, its well worth it. American Express Blue Cash Preferred is the right card for anyone who is eligible. The card itself looks good, the rewards are like no other, and the customer service is top notch!
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: My parents first got me this card when I first started college because of the benefits it had and I love it and still use it ever since. It has such amazing rewards like 6% cash back at the grocery stores, which is pretty convenient since there are a lot of grocery places near me. I also like the Shell station deal which is the $5 back on a purchase of $25 of gas, which is really helpful since I always spent over $25 on gas anyway so it is always nice to get some cash back. I also like how it is partnered with ticketmaster so that you have pre-sale access. That is an extremely convenient feature especially since my boyfriend and I love to go to games often. This way we can get really good seats at an earlier time!
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content:
American Express has been a privilege to me, I have had great experiences with this company and continue to do so. I also get money back on purchases I make and also get points which makes it very fun shopping with American Express Card. My son is also asking for a card since he is a junior, I will also make him a junior Debit card on a Joint bank account with American Express.


It is a pleasure to have American Express on your side and their customer service support is great as well and they help you with any issues regarding your Card.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I just recently got this card even though it comes with a 75 dollar annual fee it can be subsidized by the 150 bonus that you can get when spend 150 after you spend a thousand dollars in three months. The card is perfect as an everyday reward bonus card I especially use it for going to the grocery store because it comes with a 6% cash back. They also offer many special offers though their website you can get money off like Ticketmaster and shell gas stations, they also have discount on hotels and rental cars. Its a fanatic card as long as you use it as your everyday credit card.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content:
This is my husband and I's favorite card! We love the American Express Blue Cash Preferred! The first thing we noticed when we were looking for a credit card as we wanted to make a smart choice was the rewards! You get 6% cash back at supermarkets, 2% at gas stations - who doesn't want money back at a gas station with gas prices nowadays? Plus, you get 1% cash back on purchases every where! It was those rewards that pulled us in. We liked that there was no Earn/Redeem limit, too. The only downfall was the annual fee, but I have no problem paying the annual fee if I am getting those kind of rewards in return. Another thing we liked is that when we mentioned the card to our friend who was looking, they signed up too and got approved and we received a referral bonus.


I should mention you need to have excellent credit to get approved for this card. We also have contacted customer service at American Express with questions and they were very helpful, knowledgeable, and friendly. I usually give my business to a company that can answer my questions and don't give me the runaround and I'm happy to say American Express did none of that! They made sure we got our answers and we didn't have to go from person to person. So, if you are looking for a card that has awesome rewards, friendly customer service, I would definitely recommend this American Express card!
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content:
My girlfriend and I wanted to get a joint card after moving in together, and chose this one. We have been very happy with it so far - the 3% back on supermarket purchases was our primary motivation, and the 2% back on gas is great for when we take trips. American Express also has the best user account page that I've ever used - it quickly and beautifully breaks down all your purchases, and makes it very easy to see both how we are spending our money, and also what rewards we are accruing in a given month. And it's very easy to simply apply the reward back to our account bill automatically, which is also nice.


The only thing I fear with this card is late payment fee - it's huge. We are vigilant in paying off our card each month, but that looming 20% fee is cause for concern. Also, Amex customer service is kind of strange - they're almost too friendly. They profusely thank you for giving them your year of birth, which just weirds me out. Granted, that's a pretty minor complaint.


In summary: a great card for household purchases and everyday reward credits. I spent hours researching options, and have no regrets with this choice.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: This was the first credit card I ever got while I was in college. I started off at a low credit limit but as I made payments on time and gained credit the limit increased. I really like this card because it has many perks that come along with it. For example, this month they are offering $5 back on a purchase of $25 of gas at Shell stations. Since gas is something that you need to buy anyways, it’s just an added perk to get $5 back. They also have a great cash back program that you can redeem after you’ve reached a certain mark (I think it’s $50, but I can’t remember). I think that the best thing about this card is the pre-sale access to ticketmaster.com. Many shows open the AMEX presale days before tickets go on sale, which gives me the opportunity to get great seats before anyone else. This month they are also offering $25 back when you spend $75 at ticketmaster. The only draw back to the AMEX is that is isn’t offered everywhere like Visa and Mastercard. All in all I think that this is a great card and don’t know what I would do without it!
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content:
I've had this card for about two years now. My experience with AMEX using this card has been pretty good with minor complaints. Any time I've asked for a credit limit increase, they've granted it without hassle.


The best part of my experience regarding this card has not been the cash back, it's been AMEX's customer service in the identity fraud department. I use this card very frequently (often multiple times daily) to purchase online, buy groceries, eat out, and a variety of other uses. You name it. Imagine my horror when I had my identity stole not once, not twice, but THREE times in a six month period. AMEX called me and caught the fraudulent charges, before I was even aware of them, all three times. I didn't even have to dispute the charges. They knew it wasn't me due to location and the type of stuff being bought, and cancelled them as soon as I called in to confirm that I was not the one making the purchases.


AMEX gets an A+ from me. Oh, and the large amounts of cash back are nice too.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content:
I initially applied for this American Express card because I was purchasing a new laptop and knew that they would double the warranty on it. Unfortunately I had to exchange my laptop in the store, and due to a difficulty with the exchange they retailer was not able to do the transaction on the same receipt. Because I had a new receipt with a new computer, Amex would no longer honor the warranty policy on it. I was hoping I could work with Amex customer service and provide documents showing that I had simply exchanged the computer and hopefully still get covered, but because of the problem with the receipts they could not help me. This was disappointing since the nitial charge on my Amex was not reversed and I was still paying them off for this purchase (the problem was that the computer listed on this charge no longer matched the computer I wound up with due to the exchange).


I still plan to use this card for purchases on things that I would benefit from an extended warranty on, but because of my past experience, I have concerns about what technicalities might come up that would void this program.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I have had the preferred for almost a year, and have had great customer service and cash back opportunities, especially with the 3% for gas to and from work. The AMEX website has been very helpful with keeping track of my daily expenses, the various levels of cash back bonuses and links to discounts on a variety of services. On top of that, I really like the design of the card, and have actually received quite a few compliments. I just wish that American Express could be accepted in more places to take further advantage of the 1% on everything else! The next re-enrollment period I am definitely sticking with American Express, I'm just caught in a tough decision between the Everyday and Preferred cards.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I have had my American Express Blue for a few years now, and I love the fact that this card supports me through everything. It allows me to have the cash back incentive program, the rewards are great. The one thing I like the most about American Express is the fact that their customer service is great, I recently had trouble with fraudulent activity on my card and one call to American Express made everything alright. They made sure my charges were reversed temporarily and I was sent a new card almost immediately. As for Credit Line increases, they have increased my credit card limit almost every year along with my rewards going up for each travel purchase I've made.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I have had this card for a while now. It gives me a cash back incentive, lets me link to my bank account, and is very convienient for day to day purchases. My personal favorite about this card is the cash back incentive program though. Who doesn't love to spend money and get money back? Go Amex or go home.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I've had this card for quite some time. Its been very convenient and I like the ability to link the card to my bank accounts so if I end up misplacing my debit card I can still access my cash in my bank through my American Express. I'm also very satisfied with the customer service experience I've had with American Express. Its always been very courteous and understanding. This card has an excellent financial asset to building credit and boosting my buying power. I would recommend this card to anyone who wants the benefits American Express and its products offers to consumers.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I would have to agree with Jameson's post below. This card has been great on my day to day purchases, with the cash back incentive making it that much better. I have not had the opportunity to refer any friends as of yet, but with 75 dollar incentive, it's worth a little effort. Some may complain about the annual fee, but with great money management, the fee breaks down to a little over seven dollars a month yearly. With the rates of bank fees for checking accounts these days, I would say that seven bucks is better than 12 bucks a month. And most banks don’t offer a cash back option. All in all, I love this card.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: I've had this card around 2 years and I cant say enough great things about. First when you sign up they basically give you 150.00 just for using it with 1k worth of purchases, which for me I earned very quickly. I've also referred this card to my friends and each time they've successfully applied and received their card Blue gives me 75 bucks each time. I would highly recommend their customer service as well, any time I've ever had a problem they have handled it with superior customer service and in a very timely manner. I'm surprised their rating isn't higher and a perfect 5 out 5 because that's what my service has been with them. Thanks American Express!
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content:
People often make a big deal out of the Blue Cash Everyday Card from American Express and for good reason; it offers 3% cash back at supermarkets, 2% at gas stations and department stores, and 1% on everything else. Great card, no doubt about it. I just like the Blue Cash Preferred Card from Amex better, and it’s not because the word “Preferred” is thrown into its name. It’s because I am content paying a $75 annual fee in return for getting 6% cash back at supermarkets, 3% at gas stations and department stores, and 1% on everything else. I mean, I’m going to use my credit card regardless and I’m confident that the more lucrative rewards structure offered by the Blue Cash Preferred Card will give me enough free money in the long term to more than make back my $75. This is especially true since the Amex Blue Cash Preferred also gives you a $150 initial bonus. The Blue Cash Preferred even gives you 0% on purchases for a year!


Don’t get me wrong, from where I’m sitting this card has its weaknesses. I mean, not everyone can get it since you must have excellent credit for approval. There’s also no low balance transfer rate, and as quickly as the annual fee will pay for itself, we’d all obviously prefer that the Blue Cash Preferred Amex Card not have one. With no annual fee, you’d feel no obligation to use the Blue Cash Preferred regularly and could instead save whenever you wanted to make purchases with plastic. But if you have the proper credit standing and could use a good rewards card for your everyday expenses, you can’t go wrong with the benefits provided by Amex’s Blue Cash Preferred Credit Card.
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content:
Warning about the Plum card for your Readers:


I just got the Plum Card and was made aware of something that the Customer Service Rep wasn't aware of until I pressed the issue and he had to find out the answer from a supervisor:


The 1.5% is strictly applied to payments within the first 10 ten days after the monthly cycle closes. The caveat there is that payments made during the monthly cycle do not get the discount reward. That's an important distinction that will not necessarily be clear to anyone reading about the card and I think you should know that. I now realize that if I pay "too early", the discount doesn't apply. I was very disappointed. AMEX charge cards may not have a preset limit but they do have limits based on spending patterns. If I have $5000 available and use that in the first week of the monthly cycle on unforeseen expenses with several auto-debits still to come, I need to pay down the balance quickly within a few days and thus NOT get the discount on that payment. The discount only applies to the ENDING BALANCE. Now, if you have a stratospheric limit on the card, it won't matter. But for many small business owners juggling expenses and spending limits while trying to get maximum rewards, this can and will be a nuisance. Applicant beware.
department: The Plum Card® from American Express

content: I have had this card for over two years now, and it was the first credit card I ever received. I don't personally own a business, but am signed up under my parents' business so I am able to enjoy the benefits of a business member as a general consumer. However, I am still unsure of all the benefits that this card provides. I have never used the card to enter a business lounge or an airport club because I have not had time or needed to. The one benefit that I do enjoy is the points system where I can get cash back on every purchase. Although many cards offer this benefit now, it is still worth mentioning.
department: The Business Platinum Card® from American Express

content: I love having an American Express card in my wallet for the times that I need one. The Blue Cash Everyday Card is definitely one of the better options for those that don't use their American Express card a ton. The main reason being that this AMEX card does not have an annual fee, which is very common for AMEX. It also does included rewards too. I would recommend trying to reach the $1,000 threshold in the first three months for your $100 reward, essentially making all your initial purchases at 10% cash back. Then just using it as you need it. Me and the wife pretty much just use our card for when we go to CostCo, as they only accept American Express and we were tired of stopping at the bank every time we wanted to go shopping there.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I really enjoy the AMEX Blue card. They pay their rewards promptly and easily. The rewards system is very easy to understand. You may be concerned that a lot of places don't accept American Express, but you'll find that most places definitely do, as long as they aren't a "mom and pop" type place. You will pile up rewards quickly if you do a lot of grocery shopping for your family. Also, they have excellent first year deals and NO annual fee, which is amazing. If you only have one credit card, you can always add a second by getting the AMEX Blue card. There's no risk and it only rewards you for getting it. I would highly recommend this card to my friends and family.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: This is definitely one of the best credit cards I have had. When I first signed up, I earned $150 for spending $500 in the first three months, which was the promotion at the time. You also earn 3% cash back on groceries, 2% on gas and 1% on everything else all year around. They also have great offers available such as spend $75 dollars at Whole Foods, earn a $10 statement credit. Towards the end of the year, AMEX has a promotion where if you spend $25 dollars at an eligible small business you earn $25. Also, one of the best features is in the case you buy items such as a laptop or a TV on this card, AMEX will offer a one year warranty on top of the warranty you receive from the manufacturer.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I like having an AMEX card because I occasionally run into stores that only accept AMEX as their payment method, and I don't always carry cash on me. The nice thing about the Blue Cash card is that it has no annual fee, yet also has some rewards! The bill payment system online is excellent, and I love how I can get a year end report of all my expenses. AMEX also has special promotions during the year, such as Small Business Saturday which this card qualifies for. If you are looking for an AMEX card, definitely consider this one before any others with annual fees.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I think one of the best features of the card is that you can get cash back starting at $25 and then you can use more than one on the same bill. I make sure to get a $25 cash back credit as soon as I hit $25 so it will be waiting for me by the time I make my next payment. I also think the website is pretty easy to use. I've never had problems submitting a payment or looking at my bill. The only downside is the really high APR once the 0% intro rate expires. I'm going to try to pay most of my balance before my 0% rate expires because 20% interest is just too much.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: The American Express Blue Cash Everyday is the best credit card available for consumers and its my favorite credit card to use. This card gives me great cash backs and their always a promotion going on that would allow you to earn rewards from using this card. The American Express Blue Cash Everyday allows you to earn rewards on everyday purchases. If you drive your car everyday you may put gas in it everyday as well, this card gives you 2% back on gas purchases. When you purchase groceries you receive 3% back, you earn 2% back for department stores purchases, and 1% back on other miscellaneous uses. I work part-time an go to school full time and the rewards this card offers helps me tremendously. Also this card does not have an annual fee and you have the flexibility to pay it over time. There is no spending minimum, no enrollment, and no rotating categories for you to earn cash back. Also, if a merchant does not accept a return of one of your eligible purchases, American Express will refund the purchase price. You can manage your account online and a number of tools is available for consumers who use American Express online. Also, you won't be held accountable for any fraudulent charges. This is the best credit card I have and I highly recommend it due to its amazing cash back rewards program.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I've been actively using this card since 2009 and I couldn't be happier. I love the fact that I get more of a cash-back return when I use it to buy groceries and gas since those two categories are high dollar categories for me. I also recently discovered that they offer complimentary 'extended warranty' service on certain purchases and even complimentary roadside assistance! I rarely run into situations where a vendor doesn't accept American Express so we try to use it as much as possible. One thing that I like that changed over the past year or so is that now you don't have to wait until the end of the year to receive your cash-back rewards. You can apply your rewards to your balance at any time throughout the year which is really nice. For the amount of reward dollars that we've been able to accumulate throughout the course of using this card, I can't believe that everyone doesn't take advantage of this. It's like getting free money for buying stuff that you'd normally buy anyway!
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I love this card. I love that it gives 3% cash back on gas, especially with how high gas prices are. My husband and I are med school students so we don't make any money and therefore, money is super tight. This card surprisingly adds up alot in cash rewards and has helped us significantly. I would recommend it to anyone. It is also nice when making purchases at Cost-Co because they only accept Debit or American Express cards and we try to always use out credit cards so we can get rewards!
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: The American Express Blue Card is hands-down the best credit card I've had and used. The sign up bonus is incredibly generous, but where this card really shines is the rewards. A credit card isn't worth it unless you get something back, and this AMEX gives it back in spades. A lot of the other credit cards I was looking at had reward categories that encouraged more spending than I should be doing (movie theaters, department stores, travel, etc), and I'm trying to stick to a budget. Other cards had rotating categories for rewards so I never knew what I should be spending. The Blue Card is straightforward - 3% on groceries, 2% on gas (and department stores) and 1% on everything else. How great is that? Groceries and gas, the two things every person spends money on anyway, and they are giving you cash back for it permanently, all year around. And 1% on everything else means that I've moved all my expenses to this card, and I'm getting amazing rewards each month. I can't recommend this card enough to other people.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I've had this card for several years now. I originally signed up for it because I wanted the cash back since I never seem to use any rewards other than cash. Getting the cash rewards couldn't be easier. I can do it directly through their website and the rewards post directly against my outstanding balance. I really love the website interface that comes with the card too. It makes it very easy to track expenses and to print backup for my expense reports at work. I've found the interest rate to be a bit on the high side compared to some other cards I have, but I find that is typically the case of cards with good rewards...I suppose that extra interest helps pay for the rewards.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I've had this American Express card for about two years now. I am a college student so I am very picky to what little credit I have. I decided to open a card with American Express due to a low APR rate and no annual rate. This card also has the perks of receiving quite a deal of cash back. I believe that you get $100 for the first $1,000 you spend in the first three months. Also, you receive a specific cash back percentage for purchases spent on food, gas and clothing! That is basically all I purchase anyway so this is a perfect fit for my lifestyle. American Express is excepted at most retailers including Costco, which is a plus since they do not except any other form of credit.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content:
Everybody needs an American Express card these days, and the Blue Card is one of the best you can get that doesn't have an annual fee, but still has rewards that will eventually add up to something. I don't use my AMEX Blue card much, as I mainly use it at places that only accept AMEX as payment (a place like CostCo for example). Because of that the rewards of an annual fee card would outweigh the benefits of having a free version with minimal rewards.


I also have used my AMEX cards to get many of the benefits that are offered to actual AMEX members, such as Small Business Saturday, and the occasional store specific rewards (Spend $200, get at $20 statement credit).


On top of that, Amex is just a pretty great company to deal with. The website interface is nice, bill payment interface is great. Customer service has always been good to me.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I have had the American Express Blue Card for several years now. It is the best card I have ever had. The APR is low and other fees are low. They have great customer service. I get a very fast response when contacting them by email. Over the phone they are polite, courteous and very helpful. Their website is very user friendly and very well designed. It is very easy to manage your account online. I do like their rewards program. I have redeemed several rewards with them and was very happy with it. I have never had a problem using the card unlike other card companies. I use this card primarily for big expenses but I have been using it monthly to buy gas to earn more points and pay it off monthly. If you are going to get a credit card than American Express Blue is the one for you.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: Blue has been one of my “go to” cards for years. I travel some and Blue is always welcome where ever I end up at. The signup bouns is sweet, but the best features for me are the grocery store rebates and the fact that it is all in cash as a credit on the bill. That is outstanding compared to many other “rebate” cards who only pay out in points which you later need to redeem before they expire. Or you can only redeem for lame items like some half-useless thing from China that obviously might have cost the company $1 to aquire in the first place. I say that you should go get Blue and simply enjoy the cash it pays you for using it on everyday purchases.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I have had my American Express Card for about 5 years. It has been great. I like to use it on my everyday expenses such as groceries, gas, and clothing. I also like to use it for online shopping. I have never had any type of identity theft problems when using the card. I pay it off at the end of each month by logging into the amex web site and transferring money from my bank account. This is very easy to do. The more you use it, the more points you get. I have used my points for hotel rooms and for Disney tickets. Now, I am saving up my points for a new Apple iPad.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I have really enjoyed using my American Express Blue Cash Everyday card so far. I have had it for about a year and the first year has been interest free on all purchases. This has been a great benefit because I don't have to worry about paying the card balance off in full every month. I also received a big cash bonus when I signed up for the card which was a nice benefit. I use this card all the time especially for the bonus categories. I earn 2% back on gas and 3% back at the grocery store. I truly believe this is one of the best credit cards out there on the market right now. I had trouble finding a credit card at first because I am right out of college but I was approved for this one with minimal credit. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a credit card that has no annual fee and pays great rewards.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I used my American Express Blue Card for all purchases with the 1% cash back program. What I did was set all my bills, such as utilities like gas, electric, cable, cell, HOA fees, gas for my car and groceries. It was great; I had all the bills set to auto-pay and also used it for purchases on other items as well. I loved the fact that there was no annual fee – that was an absolute must for me! I’m saving my points to either pay for an entire trip or to use towards an incredible trip, such as Bali! I can’t say I’ve ever had a problem with unexplained charges. One time I did have to reverse a charge, and their customer service is the absolute best! I didn’t have to feel I needed to be defensive, they resolved the situation and kept me informed every step of the way. They are the number 1 credit card company as far as I’m concerned.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I have had the American Blue Cash card for about 5 years now. I love this card, and usually use it for my larger purchases since I get cash back. This card has no annual fee which I love. I am against paying to use a credit card. I don't put a lot of charges on it, as I mostly save it for emergencies. I have never had a problem with the customer service for this card as well. Most recently I used it to make some Christmas purchases after not having used it for a while. I found out the next day that the charges did not go through, because American Express needed to verify that I was authorizing them. I simply logged into my account on the webpage, clicked on pending charges, and verified them. They went through instantly, and I didn't have to sit on hold with some customer service representative in another country! It was quick, painless, and most of all easy. I love my blue cash American Express card.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I have had this card since 2006 when my husband joined the military. They have always been so helpful to us. We used this card for a move from Georgia to Washington and since my husband was in the military they gave us a lower interest rate while we were paying off our balance. He was being deployed after we moved and because of his service they were super helpful when I accidentally missed a payment. We LOVE the rewards program. We bought our airline tickets for a visit home through the rewards program, and it didn't cost us a penny. I have not had a single problem with my card, and the customer service is great. My husband lost his wallet at one point and they diligently cut the card off and were able to issue us a new card over the weekend! By far the best credit card, and I would recommend it to any of my friends.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I use this card all the time, especially for gas. 2% rewards on gas is an a life saver for me. I mainly use the card for gas and groceries for the rewards program. I have had zero problems with the card, as I consistently make sure to pay it off monthly, and I do not use it for any extraneous purchases (as stated before, groceries and gas), and as such the interest rate is irrelevant to me. I got it as soon as I turned 18, and I'm going on 20 now, and will likely continue to use this card into the foreseeable future. With the great rewards, I can highly recommend it to others as their first card.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I opened the original Blue Cash card back when the cash back program was "tiered" and you earned 5% on certain purchases (like gasoline and grocery stores) but only after the cardholder reached an annual spending threshold of over $6,500. Thankfully, they changed that not too long after I opened the account (I think Amex realized that their customers weren't too happy with having to reach an annual spending threshold just to earn the 5% max). Instead, they came up with the idea of splitting it into 2 new cards, a Blue Cash "Everyday" and a Blue Cash "Preferred" (both with a simple non-tiered formula). I believe they still offer the old Blue Cash card but I switched my account over to the "Everyday" as soon as it was available (mainly because this one has no annual fee). Now I don't have to worry about cash back restrictions every time I go to use my card, or about having to make sure I'm signed up for those revolving cash back categories every month. This is also the only card I've ever had that gave me 3% on all supermarket purchases and that really comes in handy. I use this card every time I go grocery shopping and it pays off big time (I save the money I earn in cash back bonuses for Christmas every year). They pay existing customers $25 for every friend that is referred and I've earned $75 so far! I highly recommend checking out their "Blue Deal" page online too because customers can save alot of money on their partner deals. All in all, this is a really great card and with one of the best cash back programs around.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I use this card mainly for the rewards. I’ve compared to some others, but most cards seem to be either a flat 1% on everything or 1% on all purchases with a rotating category that is worth 5% for about a month at a time. I feel that the rewards on this particular card are much better than that. 3% on groceries, 2% on gas, 1% on everything else is a much better deal, especially since the vast majority of my purchases are either groceries or gas. Not having an annual fee is basically a must for me to even consider a particular credit card. As for the interest rate, I pay my balance off monthly, so I don’t even notice. Honestly I couldn’t even tell you what my current rate is.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I have American express Blue and I am very happy with it.The base one percent is four times larger than Discover Card and has a bonus up to five percent when you reach a certain level of spending.On my purchases that do not fall under the normal categories- Grocery, gas, etc.- I only get 1/2 percent cash back.That is still better than many other credit cards out there.My apr is around 18 percent but I always pay my balance off before that kicks in. The reward redemption is good, the minimum cash out as a credit to your account is $25, but they process it very quickly.You can also use the credit for merchandise through their website.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: The Blue Cash Everyday Card is one of the best credit cards I have ever had. Their customer service is impeccable. I use my card for everything, so when it goes missing it kind of feels like the world is falling around me. Luckily customer service always have my back. A new card is always mailed to me within a few days of my request for a replacement. There have even been several fradulent charges made to my account. Thankfully customer service was available to correct the situation and reverse the charge. I haven’t even mentioned the best part, you actually get a percentage of the money back that you spend. You really can’t go wrong with card.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I read about this card about 6 months ago when looking for a rewards card. We originally had an Amazon Chase card, which gave us decent rewards in Amazon.com credit, but we wanted to see if we could get something better. Once we got the Amex card, I was intrigued at how amazingly high percentage this card gives back, especially when going grocery shopping. We use this card religiously for everything now and pay the balance off every couple weeks. It took about 2 months for rewards to start showing up (had to call Amex for them for it to show up), but once they did, we are completely satisfied by getting about 50-80$ a month in rewards.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: This was one of my first cards. I find that a lot of places don't take American express and ended up letting it go to clear out the clutter. It was easy to get which was nice when I was younger and trying to build my credit up. The cash back that they offer is nice but I found that I earned rewards that added up a little faster with other cards. The rates aren't bad and the customer service is helpful. Overall, this is a nice card to have, and you can often get one with a low credit line to help you get your credit established.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I have the blue cash everyday card from American Express. Though it is not a fancy card it is great for everyday life. There is no annual fee and I earn a ton of cash back since I use it for everyday things like groceries and gas. It has easy to use rewards and I didn't have to enroll in anything it was automatic every time I used my card. The fees are reasonable and competitive. Customer service is always helpful, which is a plus. I have been using this card for almost 5 years now and though I have a few other ones this is the only one that I not only feel comfortable using everyday but make it a point to use everyday!
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: My husband and I originally got this card for Costco only purchases since they only allow American Express. We got this one and were so attracted to its ease of use, no annual fee, low APR, and the best part cash back for every dollar you spend. It's a great card and American Express has out of this world great customer service. We had a small issue with an autopay going through twice and they fixed it and put my mind at ease in the process. I recommend this card to anyone who is looking for a great card where you earn a little back as you spend. It's especially great if you pay your balance off in full each month. Highly recommended!
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I am a college student with good credit and this card has been great for me. I got offered 18 months with no interest and 0% APR. They also have 1% cash back, which is a pretty standard feature. I have been very pleased with American express and I also like their rewards program. I feel that when it come to credit cards, American Express is definately above the rest. Their customer service is also great, and they have handled any problem I've had with great ease and have been extremely nice and professional when handling problems. I would definately reccomend this card and more importantly I would definately reccomend American Express as they are a great credit card company with excellent customer service.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I got this American Express card mostly to use at Costco since they don't take any sort of other credit card, but find myself using it for purchases wherever it's accepted now. The base cash back of 1% is nothing outstanding, but there's no minimum you have to spend before you get the 1%, and no annual fee. The purchase protection and extended warranty and all those extras that come with an AmEx card are what pushed me to use this card whenever possible instead of my bank's 1% cash back credit card. Also nice are the higher cash back percentages (2% for department stores and gas, 3% for groceries).
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I have always been weary of credit cards. However, as I was looking through all of my options I came across the Blue Cash Everyday Card from American Express. I must say that this is a wonderful card. Since I have had it I have absolutely zero problems with it. Even if I need to call the customer service with a question they are always prompt and courteous in answering my questions. They are very friendly and are always helpful. The discounts are amazing and I can use this card on everything. I strongly recommend this card to anyone, especially those who are looking for their first card, this will be a great and wonderful experience for you.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I have had my AmEx Blue Cash card for about a year now. I appreciate not only this card’s ease of use but also this card's look. I especially love to use it for gas because of the cash back attached to it since the rewards focus on everyday buying such is the card’s name. I enjoy that there is cash back instead of points. Who doesn’t want to see the amount they made by spending? I also use it for shopping and on occasion school expenses. I like that this card offers no annual fee and I would gladly recommended to anyone who is interested in a nice, no hassle card.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: Outstanding is all I can say. I have Excellent credit and was offered 18month no interest, 0% APR. I really feel that American Express is not really a credit card, but more so like a "loan" debit card. I'm expecting the reward program to be good and not unreasonable with the points I earn. I use this car primarily for business and it has made me be able to open up new accounts and not having a reoccurring bill until the merchandise sells. Only down side is some merchant do not take American Express as a payment so you just have to be careful when you plan out things.

content:
More than this card itself, I have to write about my experiences with American Express. I have had other CCs in the past, but AmEx does a wonderful job of providing customer service. With any dispute, they are happy to use simple common sense and go out of their way to ensure the right thing is done. Their coverage on return policies is outstanding.


Like others have said, I am aware of the merchant fees that are charged to the store, so I rarely use this card in mom/pop stores or for small purchases. But with any large, big-ticket item, I will always whip this card out- both for the ease of mind on the purchase and for the generous reward structure they have in place.


I'll use it occasionally for grocery shopping, if I made a significant purchase, but am hesitant to swipe when it's
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I recently got a new card and it was my first American Express. It does feel kind of nice to pull out the AmEx when paying for something. Either way, this particular card is great. I love that there are no annual fees, as can often be the case on American Express cards. The rewards, though not amazing, really pushed this card into great territory. The 1% cash back is pretty standard but the little extras you get on top of that make this card a joy to use. I love seeing my statements at the end of each month and seeing how much I've earned.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: Using an American Express takes quite a bit of risk out of making purchases. Notwithstanding the warranties from the particular retailers I frequent, I find that Amex typically provides superior coverage. Moreover, the built-in insurance for rental cars and travel is piece of mind I quite enjoy. Apart from the base benefits that all American Express cards have, the cash back option is stellar. I’ll say that again, receiving cash is far superior to any point system other cards offer. Typically, I’m able to redeem a $25 credit per billing cycle. My only caution would be that this card is best for those that tend to spend a couple thousand dollars a month on the credit card to maximize the rewards.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: After opening my first credit card to pay off a large purchase when I first got married and being dissatisfied with the entire experience I vowed to never own another. An unexpected bill a few years later created the necessity of another line of credit since I refused to use the card I had paid off I was so displeased with. I researched my options more thoroughly this time and found American Express. There are no processing delays when paying online – with my other card planning ahead was a necessity if your payment due date was on the weekend or your payment was made after 3pm. I’ve never been hit with late fees because the payment was not processed until days after I submitted it. Customer service is always friendly and quick to provide answers to any concerns I’ve had over the five plus years I’ve had this card. I would recommend this card to anyone who needed a card for the basics or to make a large purchase.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content:
Just two words for this card.

Big supermarkets.

Any large grocer I will gladly use this card wherever it's accepted in order to get the cash back.

The only place I won't use this card, or any card really for that matter, is any place that I either.

A. care about their financial status AKA not corporate-owned.

B. too small to negotiate good transaction costs with AMEX/other card companies, usually the same type of business as listed in example A.


I'm hesitant to use my card even at some gas stations, I know this sounds weird, because they get nickel and dimed by the card companies every time you swipe for something as little as, say, 10 dollars worth of gas, their take is pretty much obliterated. It depends on which place it is, if it's owned or franchised, etc., but I still try to use discretion.


In short, don't worry about the above, the bottom line is that this is a cool card for everyday shopping at places that take AMEX! :)
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I started using this card only last month and it is my first credit card. I like that it has 0% APR for the first 12 months which gives me a great flexibility to pay over time. In fact I just bought a new desktop computer and laptop with it. And if you spend $1000 in the first month then you get $100 bonus. The cash back percentages on gas and groceries is also a huge plus since I love to cook and spend alot of money at the grocery store each week. My work is also far away and I have to spend alot of money on gas so the cash back it gives on gas is great too. So far the blue cash everyday card has proven to be an excellent card and I would recommend it to anybody that wants to get a new card with great cash back program.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: This is the third credit card that I have had since turning 18, and is probably my favorite of all three that I have had. Mostly, I love the rewards that I am eligible with this card. I get 3 percent cash back on grocery store purchases as well as 2 percent cash back on gas stations. Considering that I hardly go out to eat at restaurants and that I have a considerable commute to and from work everyday, I fell like this is a great card for me. Also, I have found that American Express customer service is the best that I have had to deal with out of all my cards. They are always helpful and courteous, especially considering that I only contact them whenever I have a problem.

content: American Express is the first credit card that I have gotten and have not looked back. This is a very good card with very good customer service. content: American Express is the first credit card that I have gotten and have not looked back. This is a very good card with very good customer service.
