content: American Express was one of the first cards I opened when I began to work on building my credit. I've had an account with them for about 8 years now and recently upgraded my card to the Blue Cash Everyday card. The customer service rep was very helpful in letting me make the switch. I like that this card has no annual fee, but still has decent cash back rewards. I'm going to need to buy gas and food anyways, so I might as well get a few bucks back by using the Blue Cash Everyday card. Overall, I've been very happy with American Express and would recommend this card to anyone looking to get some decent cash back rewards without an annual fee.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I've had this little card here since the first day I turned 18. I am 25 now and I'm still using it almost every day. Through the years, customer service has always been pleasant, making sure all my issues are resolved and have given me an increase in credit limit every time I request one. Throughout college, this was my go to card to every place that accepted American Express. Sadly however, there are still many places that don't accept American Express. The Cash back system is always a bonus despite not being as high as other cards but back then, especially being a broke college student, every penny counted. Overall, I would definitively recommend this card to anyone who wants a card to start building credit and has a pretty good cash back system.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: This American Express card is one of the best out there especially for someone who is just starting out and needs to build credit. You don't hear of many cards that offer you a rewards system that is easy to apply for. I was able to apply for this card when I entered college with little credit history. In terms of the rewards, it's always a bonus that all my spending will result in a few extra bucks a month that I can use on food, movies, or gas. Best of all, it's cash back and not some lame points system. The card also looks pretty neat. The only con about this card is that not every place I go to takes American Express which is quite difficult at times especially for people who only carry this card. Besides that little issue this card would be perfect for beginners.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I have had an American Express card for close to twenty years. The card has evolved through the years and when they offered the Blue Cash version, I went ahead with that. I have never had a problem with American Express and their customer service is the best of any credit card company I've ever used. The cash back isn't a lot of money but I figure it's a bonus for using a card that I was using anyway. With no annual fee and a decent rate, I highly recommend this credit card offering to anyone. It can be hard for someone with little credit history to qualify for an American Express card, though. They seem to be a little harder to convince to give you an account but once you have some credit established, definitely add this one to your financial arsenal.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: The Blue Cash is an interesting card. For me, the cash back on it never really gets as high as the other cards I have, so I don't use it as my main card. Also, for whatever reason Amex decided to give me a fairly low credit limit compared to my other cards. Still, the real reason you get this card is because of the benefits of working with Amex. Their customer service is excellent. The card will extend warranties longer than most others. I find that most places accept Amex these days too, but there is the concern that Amex charges the highest credit card processing fees to merchants. For that reason, I tend to avoid using it at small businesses.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I wanted to get a card with decent rewards. We pay off our card every month so I honestly don’t even know what my interest rate is or how it compares to all the other cards out there. The rewards are great for a no annual fee card. I especially like the cash back on gas! I haven’t had any problems with their customer service before. I had a couple charges where I had problems communicating with the company and didn’t get what I ordered, and American Express took care of it very quickly without a hassle. Their website is great. Even when they were making major changes to the interface, the change went smoothly and without a hitch.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content:
This was one of the credit cards I got after my divorce. Almost all of "our" credit had been in my ex-husband's name, so establishing credit on my own was something both my parents and my lawyer suggested I do right away. In the industry I work in, I knew a lot of people used American Express, so I looked them up online and decided to apply. I knew what credit I had was already very good, so the application process was very easy. I don't like filling out forms online, so I called and spoke to a Customer Service Rep, who was very helpful. I did have to wait on hold for a while, but once on the line, he (I don't recall his name) was helpful and listened to what I needed. I received the application and packet in the mail later that week, and after returning everything, was approved almost immediately. I was very pleased with the introductory rate of 0%, and decided to make some needed purchases for my new home, which would not only help me establish this credit on my own, but give me a chance to pay everything off while still using the 0% interest rate.


I now use this as my "everyday" credit card, and all of my gas purchases. I try to pay it off in full every month, but when I do carry a balance, my interest rate is much better than the other card I have.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: This was the first credit card I ever got while I was in college. I started off at a low credit limit but as I made payments on time and gained credit the limit increased. I really like this card because it has many perks that come along with it. For example, this month they are offering $5 back on a purchase of $25 of gas at Shell stations. Since gas is something that you need to buy anyways, it’s just an added perk to get $5 back. They also have a great cash back program that you can redeem after you’ve reached a certain mark (I think it’s $50, but I can’t remember). I think that the best thing about this card is the pre-sale access to ticketmaster.com. Many shows open the AMEX presale days before tickets go on sale, which gives me the opportunity to get great seats before anyone else. This month they are also offering $25 back when you spend $75 at ticketmaster. The only draw back to the AMEX is that is isn’t offered everywhere like Visa and Mastercard. All in all I think that this is a great card and don’t know what I would do without it!
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I had this AMEX for quite a while before switching to the Costco AMEX. It is a pretty good little card considering there are no annual fees. The trade ins for point are kinda random sometimes and don't necessarily give you the best bang for your buck. You can also redeem your points earned (1 point per $1) for travel rewards and in that regard they are very similar to all the airlines rewards cards. I thought it was a fine card because of the rewards but some of the categories weren't as highly rewarded as the Costco AMEX on the things I buy more frequently, so that's why I switched (3% at supermarkets instead of gas, 2% for gas and dept stores versus travel and restaurants, and 1 % for everything else). The APR on these types of cards are relatively high so make sure to pay off your balance each month or there's really no sense in earning rewards.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: My husband and I have had the AmEx card for quite a while. It was his idea; frankly, I try to avoid getting credit cards because they always seem to be burning a hole in our pockets, if you know what I mean. It's SO easy to "forget" you eventually have to pay for what you've charged...and then some! We got the card for our online business' exclusive use: buying postage, office supplies, and...most importantly...more books to sell in our bookstore. So that means we're almost constantly spending money. After several months of using this AmEx card I realized it was sort of paying for itself IF looked at from ONLY that perspective. Yes, the no annual fee is what made it most attractive but getting the cash back is pretty darn cool, especially for a small business like ours! The drawbacks are, unfortunately, there as well. First of all, there's the interest rate. We're paying their maximum of 22.24% and that sucks BIG time. AmEx apparently was wary that our bookstore didn't have a credit history all its own so, even though it's a sole proprietorship, insisted that if we wanted their card we'd have to pay the maximum fee. This really ticked me off because OUR individual credit histories and scores are really good and the bookstore is, after all, a SOLE proprietorship, NOT a corporation. The other thing that bugs me about AmEx is that if you don't pay 100% of the principle by the due date...which they prefer way more than other credit card companies...you get penalized. So what we've wound up doing is having to scrupulously pay 100% of the principle by each month's due date, then putting aside the cash back "rewards" to help pay for the following month's billing. It doesn't puzzle me what AmEx is trying to achieve by this business strategy...most consumers, they've obviously found...are too stupid to realize there really isn't a reward in the "cash back" concept when you have to pay 100% of the principle each month. Most people will rack up a big bill expecting big cash rewards every month when, in fact, the money you get "back" only goes to pay AmEx eventually. I've decided that we're getting rid of this card by the end of the year and finding something better with a lower interest rate...at least a credit card company that will regard our bookstore as part of US and not as a separate entity.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I had a hard time receiving this credit card due to the minimum credit requirement. I am glad that I barely qualified because I immediately spent $1000 and received the $100 cash back. The rewards are decent for having no annual fee. Now that I think about it, having an annual fee would definitely pay for itself if you used it daily. I myself am self-employed and I only use this card for gas and groceries. One purchase a week is about all I do and the rewards are not much. In my opinion this is a great card if you want something to rely on for the time being.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: The blue cash card is pretty good overall. I really like that there is no annual fee like many other American Express Cards. I don’t make a lot of money in cash back. I do wish the card had a higher cash back percentage. I would definitely use the card more if it did, but it is better than nothing. I also feel very secure using my Blue Cash card, because AMEX takes care of you very well if your card is lost or stolen. They are also very easy to work with if you have any fraudulent charges and can resolve problems very quickly.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: This is the second credit card I got after graduating from college. I started out with a not so great Capital One card since I had no credit and it didn't have the best rewards program. So, as soon as I built up enough credit, I got the blue cash everyday card from American Express and I use it exclusively for groceries so I can take advantage of the 3% returns. I also like that the reward comes in cash rather than points or miles, and it has a high limit and no annual fee. The only thing I don't like is that the reward is low for most purchases. I spent over $1000 on groceries at supermarkets and earned the 3% as well as a hundred dollar bonus. If you travel a lot, you should consider getting another credit card that offers better rewards for travel. For example, with the delta skymiles card from American Express, you can earn 2 points for every dollar spent on travel. Overall, I think it's a great card if you use it only for purchases at supermarkets and gas stations, but if you're looking for one credit card to use all the time, you can do better.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: My American Express card has served me well for over 6 years now. I initially signed up for it because of the great rates and the points incentives. I have stayed with them because of their customer service and their willingness to help out when I am in a jam. Their points system is pretty straightforward and has many versatile uses. You can use it on their site for travel, shopping, gift cards, or merchandise. If you don't like anything they have to offer, you can jump over to Amazon and use your points there with amazing ease. I also like that American Express is accepted almost anywhere. It is a good card to have in your wallet.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content:
Joe Weider down there joked that you wouldn’t want blue money cause itd be worthless but as far as I’m concerned as long as that blue cash equates to a lot of green, I’m cool with it. And you know what, it does, the American Express Blue Cash Everyday Card is a great offer that does give you great rewards on the purchases you make the most, grocery stores, gas stations, and of course shopping at department stores. And we can all see that it gives you $100 bucks essentially for singing up. But I’ll give it the ol’ pro con list treatment anyway.


Pros

- Good rewards for recurring purchases.

- The fact that the rewards are cash rewards (more straightforward than points or miles).

- No annual fee to offset the value of the rewards.


Cons

- The only bad thing about this card is that it isn’t the best at what it does. The Amex Blue Cash Preferred is just a better Amex Blue Cash Everyday Card than the Amex Blue Cash Everyday Card is. Yes, that card has a $75 annual fee, but it also gives you double the rewards as the Blue Card Everyday.


So, overall, I gotta say that the American Express Blue Cash Everyday is a great card, but its cousin is just a bit better.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content:
Who wants to get blue money everyday? It’d be worthless! Of course I am joking, and the “blue” part of the Blue Cash Everyday Card from American Express is just the brand name Amex attached to its premier credit card line. Obviously humor isn’t my thing, so I’m going to get back to something I know rather well, evaluating credit cards. It pays to know what a card has to offer and how it stacks up against the competition before applying for it, so I’ve taken it upon myself to use my knowledge as a bank officer to help out all you nice credit card shoppers out there. The Blue Cash Everyday Card from American Express is obviously the product Amex has positioned as its everyday rewards card, and it does give you 3% cash back on supermarket purchases, 2% on gas and purchases made at department stores and 1% cash back across all other purchases. Keeping with the recent tradition of rewards cards offering initial bonuses, the Amex Blue Cash Everyday also offers a $100 rebate when you spend $1,000 during the first three months. To finish with the basics, the Blue Cash Everyday Card is for people with excellent credit (Amex’s primary customer base), does not have an annual fee, and has a 0% introductory period for purchases lasting 12 months.


It’s fair to say that the Blue Cash Everyday Card is one of the best rewards cards on the market. I mean, there’s a reason that this website has it on their Editor’s Best Page. This card would make a great card to use for everyday purchases (surprise, surprise) IF you have excellent credit and actually shop at supermarkets and department stores a lot. If you don’t, there’s no point in applying because you should get a card that meets your credit standing and spending habits.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: I had a merchant refund almost $300 to my bluebird card and they hold it as long as they possibly can. They will not let me open a dispute to get my money back and tried telling me the merchant didn't issue the refund yet. I have the receipt where it was issued and was pretty much told that the receipt doesn't show anything although they were not interested in looking at it. Sorry very sorry company. They never did let me show the receipt showing the money was refunded. They didn't have any problem taking money out of my bank account to fund my card with but when it came to issuing the refund...BIG PROBLEM.

I could tell the customer service agent had been sleeping and just woke up when I first called to open this account. They didn't know the difference between a hard and soft inquiry. I called back the next day and was told that a hard inquiry would not be made to open the account. (still unconfirmed) I put $250k in my account and let it sit for a month, but they never updated my balance to reflect any interest earned. I tried to withdraw the money to my wife's bank account, which is allowed per their Deposit Account Agreement, but they refused. Even though I offered to provide proof that I have the authority to deposit, withdraw and exercise control over the funds in the account, American Express violated their own terms and conditions and insisted it must be my own personal account in my name that funds were being transferred to. They had absolutely no legal or ethical ground to stand on. I cannot stress enough that nobody should do business with any bank, such as American Express, that doesn't adhere to their own terms of service.

The initial bonus and Amazon Prime membership (worth another $79) is an okay benefit to this Blue Cash Preferred card from American Express. However, this American Express suffers from having a $75 annual fee. There are way too many credit cards, including Blue Sky cards from American Express (if you catch them at the right time), out there that do not have an annual fee to ever get one with a $75 annual fee. You would be better off to get one without the annual fee and use the money saved towards an Amazon prime subscription (if that is something you want).
department: Blue Cash Preferred® Card from American Express

content: Great card unless someone steals your info fraud dept is a joke they stole 400 from me and closed my acct and mailed me my left over balance. Left me and my kids with no money for over a week!!

I've had my card for years. Then, I received an email to provide personal information. No. Then, I got a letter with a check saying my account was closed. They close your account if you haven't "purchased" anything for 6 months. They suck, and this is a scam to get you to buy another card. Don't!
They are a joke. If you get a refund from a merchant even tho it is an instant refund, bluebird will have you wait 8 days before you see it in your account.

I really dont think anyone should have a bluebird card there coustomer service is really bad we had a double charge on our card well the merchant has taken there money and bluebird will not put the funds back on my card emidietly like a real american express card would they dont help you on the phone they just say well sorry for the inconvince but there is nothing they can do but there is stuff they can do its just a button and i recomend no one going thru this company again you are also only allowed 2000 a month to take off your card really bad people at this company
Would give a higher rating , however deposits extremely long! 10 days on some deposits is too long! With the tech we have today, no excuse.
Love this card! Customer service is great, no monthly fees and they appreciate their clients!

I just opened an american express gold delta credit card to be able to plan a trip on Delta and when I tried to book my trip, the AE card was not accepted. I am still waiting approval to book my flight. Be aware that instant use is not instant!!!!!!!!
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content:
Signed up for Bluebird on-line. Changed mind about using this type of account as it is kind of a hassle and I've had a traditional checking account for 30+ years. Received card. Never activated the card. Called Bluebird to close account and requested confirmation of closure. Was told it would be emailed immediately. Email was never received. Called a couple days letter and requested confirmation letter again. A week passed and still no email (yes, I checked spam folder). Called Bluebird again. Finally get tech support who sends me a closure letter. Letter states "has been closed because you repeatedly tried to add funds from your linked bank account that was not able to be processed." "•You canceled the transaction through your bank

•There wasn’t enough money in your bank account" "This activity violates the terms of the Bluebird Member Agreement". THIS IS NOT CORRECT. Call tech service back and was informed that they only have boilerplate notices that they can generate. He reads me the list of options he can select. All options contain verbiage that either reflects poorly on the consumer or implies the consumer did something wrong. I ask if they have anything that simply states "This account has been closed at the consumers request." Tech service advised that they do not and since they do not work for American Express and they cannot create a letter. REALLY? I've opened and closed at least 30+ accounts in my lifetime and have never had this problem. SO HAPPY THAT I NEVER USED THIS ACCOUNT! If the American Express Bluebird banking structure is so inept that it cannot produce a simple closure letter (that any other banking card company is capable of producing) then I shudder to think of the problems others are facing with Bluebird. I will not be recommending this card to anyone.

Sent my student refund check drawn on BoA in by mail TWELVE days ago and it still is not showing up. Then apparently i have too wait several more days for it to clear. The post office stated it should have been there in 5 days at most. In the meantime I have no idea when I can access my funds. Customer service is clearly outsourced an AWFUL. Both online and phone reps have very little product knowledge nor do they even know what is on their own website! Stay FAR FAR AWAY for this card. I will be cancelling ASAP.

Best for groceries at 3%.


Fixed categories make it easy to know when it's best to swipe this one.


Amex is not accepted everywhere so a second card should be carried.


The card offers other deals that can be added and used at certain retailers to increase savings.


The card usually comes with intro cash bonus and 0% APR


No annual fee makes it a great candidate to have in your portfolio of cards


Amex customer service will usually fight vendors on your behalf if you happen to have a complaint on a charge you feel is unfair.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: i do not like the fact that my ssi benefit was sent direct deposit too my account december 1st and bluebird said they never recieved it. i got so much proof that it was sent too my account but these peoplo continue too say they got nothing, fraud complaint is in process and filed charges as well.

Love my american express prepaid (bluebird) account! it makes life simpler, by having to not worry about overdrafts, and lots of "free" atms to use. i don't know of any fees i haven't ever seen any on my account balance, also like that direct deposit is available. i would recommend this card to anyone looking for a prepaid. the only thing i don't like is i live in a smaller town and not alot of places accept american express.

Apparently many online merchants will not accept the Bluebird card as valid. Thus far I have attempted to pay two bills online with my new Bluebird card without success and only one successfully. That would be a good batting average, but not when you're talking about a debit card. And the bad thing is, they know it. When I called them, the representative said, "Yes, we are aware that some merchants will not accept the Bluebird card despite the fact that they accept the American Express card." I will be discontinuing the use of the Bluebird card.

I use the Bluebird card from American Express, I've had nothing but amazing customer service from them. I signed up under my former married name, then changed my name back to my maiden, then was remarried, changing the name on my account was so very easy to do. They were prompt, polite and made the process of changing my name the easiest of any of them that I had to do.

I've had this account for about 3 years and I love the fact that it's very easy for me to transfer money in and out of it by linking my checking account to it that I have with a different bank. I also love that there are no fees for this account and that the interest is pretty high compared to regular savings accounts. I’ve seen other high yield savings accounts at other banks that have a slightly higher interest rate but I prefer to stick with this one due to a sense of security of American Express as well as ease of use.

Great card for someone interested in 'getting an AmEx' for the first time. Rewards are not amazing, but there is no annual fee and you still get the AmEx experience. The customer service is great, rewards redemption is very easy, and credit limits are on the upper end of the industry range.
department: Blue Cash Everyday® Card from American Express

content: This is a great deal for a high return savings account. I switched to this account after the 2009 bank bailout crisis as my local bank was merged into a mega chain that I did not like. The main thing that was difficult in transitioning to amex was getting used to _NOT_ having _ANY_ brick and mortar branch to walk into. Making deposits was initially cumbersome, but their new mobile app makes it much easier (ability to photograph checks) and faster than when I first started with them. The _NO MINIMUM BALANCE_ was the major selling factor for me, rarely will you find this in a high yield savings account anywhere else. Love it for non brick and mortar savings.

So far I very pleased with my account through Centurion Bank. I've had this account for over 7 months now, and so far customer service seems great, I didn't have to wait too long to reach an operator and she answered my questions thoroughly. I have a checking account through them, but use it as my travel savings account. They have a reserve account feature that I like and it is easy to set up bank transfers.

As an Amex cardmember to begin with (I carry an Everyday Blue), they were my first choice when I was looking at high-yield online savings to supplement my 529 account for college savings. Actually, even in these times when savings accounts are paying pittances for interest, their rate isn’t that much less than my guaranteed 529 return! Add to that the protection and customer service you get from Amex, and it’s really a no-brainer. I haven’t had to have any problems resolved or dispute anything (for either the savings account or the cashback card, for that matter); been a perfect CS experience to date.

I love my Bluebird American express card! I've never been a huge fan of banking, but American Express has mad it so easy! I love that there are NO fees or required min. balance. The app makes everything available at your fingertips and is always current and up to date. Not everyone accepts American Express anymore, so my only wish is that I could transfer funds between my Bluebird and my Visa

I opened my American Express Savings account about one year ago. I have had an American Express Credit Card for several years but always kept my savings at a commercial bank where I earned virtually nothing in interest. The American Express savings account pays approximately 0.80% interest; that is roughly 8 times what I earned at my previous bank! I have never had any issues with making withdrawals or deposits online, and I can easily view my account activity from their user-friendly website. I would highly recommend American Express savings as a strong alternative to a normal commercial savings account.

I absolutely love my Amex card. Their customer service is incredible and the perks with this card are unbeatable. I fly a lot so it is definitely worth it to me. I have had this card for only a few months and already have enough points for a free flight. You also get your first checked bag free which is another great perk. The Amex website is really user friendly and I am never confused about when my bill is due. I would definitely recommend this card to anyone who travels a lot, and likes Delta.
department: Delta SkyMiles® Gold American Express Card

content: I have had this account for years now, and it has helped me save a bunch! Along with the interest rate & APY that it has, plus never incurring any fees, I love it! I can add direct deposit to the account, and link it to other accounts if I want to transfer money in or out of the account. It's definitely assisted me in saving for the rainy days. I picked American Express as well since I have also used Serve in the past for other services, so that was a plus as well. I am definitely satisfied with this account and hope to continue saving with it in the years to come!

I recently started with American Express to start a separate savings account or backup money. They have simply been amazing, the customer service has been great and they have kept me up to date with any changes and or updates. It’s great to have a Bank with no hidden fees or surprise charges. I would recommend them to anyone. Any one of their services will work great for you, whether its saving money, or credit.

After landing a new job in my career last year, I decided to seek out a savings account that would provide me with good returns in order to help myself down the road. I decided to sign up for American Express' High-Yield Savings Account because of the interest rates and high yield. I also chose American Express because I have used multiple services that they provide over the years (including Bluebird and Serve), so I have invested trust in the company. As a fan of online banking and American Express, it is very easy to manage my finances between my accounts. I want to also note that customer service is easy to work with. I accidentally opened the wrong account, and I was very surprised that customer service was able to immediately cancel the erroneous account within minutes instead of days.

I have been using American Express as a bank now for almost a year. The bluebird service is quite excellent, a great way to supplement or replace other online banking or payment services, such as PayPal or Visa prepaid cards. My deposits always post to the account I use within two days, and there are never any banking fees like for transfers or overdrafts. There are ATM fees, like most banks have, but they use a larger third party network, so there are enough locations by far. I would definitely recommend this service!

My husband and I have been with American Express for three years, and for the most part we haven't had many problems! The most complicated issue we've had was a year ago when there was an interest mix up with Cost Co, and we tried to talk to the bank about it. There was an unwarranted interest charge that had added up to over $100, but the representative we talked to said that we could not talk with the manager until we paid off the interest charge on our account.... it made no sense. Other than that they've been great!

I'm satisfied with the utility of my AMEX Serve card. It serves (no pun intended) its purpose as an alternative to Paypal, allowing quick transfers between customers with no delay whatsoever. The only concern for those looking into their service is it does have a newly implemented monthly fee of $1. It's not the end of the world, of course, and it's waived if you direct deposit once per month, but it's something you ought to be aware of. There are other prepaid cards with no monthly fee.

I have been with American Express since 2013 and my experience with this banking institution has completely changed my opinion about Banks. I immediatly enjoyed their Bluebird card offer! no fees and great features that make it worth for any traveler around the country or the globe. I use the direct deposit, bill pay, and the instant money transfer features with absolutely no problems. The value is in the serenity the card brings whenever you travel abroad or in a different state. For example I love the fact that I can go to many ATM locations and pay no fee to withdraw cash. Their is no hidden fee but also ne fee at all, combined with a great a friendly customer service. I definitly recommend American Express Bluebird. A lifechanger !!!

Everyone should have a Bluebird card! There are no fees and great features that make it worth getting. I use the direct deposit, bill pay, and the instant money transfer features with absolutely no problems. I also love the fact that I can go to many ATM locations and pay no fee to withdraw cash. Also, as an added bonus, their customer support is friendly and very helpful. I recommend Bluebird to anyone who is sick of paying fees.

I love my Bluebird card! I keep it as my regular account and it works fantastic! No overdraft fees, no hidden fees, I can have my checks direct deposited to my account, so easy! I encouraged my daughter to get an account as well and I can send her money instantly.

I had no idea that banking could be this hassle free!

If I transfer from another bank account the transfer is fast and easy. I can also connect it to my PayPal account and move funds between those accounts as well.

As a freelance photographer/writer, I have a variety of ways that payment is coming in so having the ease and convenience of being able to link my accounts and manage them easily is a wonderful thing for me.

The only drawback is that American Express is not accepted by all merchants. That's OK, though, I can either go to the ATM or use my PayPal debit card.

What is really cool about this card is that I can use the Walmart ATM and it does not charge me any fees. If I want to add cash to my card I can just do it at Walmart - no fees, no hassle.

I prefer Bluebird over a regular bank any day!

After building our savings back up to a solid level following the purchase of our home in 2011, my husband and I were getting tired of the tiny interest deposits on our Bank of America basic savings account. We opted for the American Express High-Yield Savings Account because it offered a 0.85% interest rate, which was phenomenal compared to what we had before! The rate is currently at 0.80%, but we're still very happy with that number. I was hesitant to use an online bank, but the electronic transfers between our Bank of America checking and this AmEx account are so easy. I had a brief misunderstanding at the opening of the account and accidentally generated a duplicate transfer from our checking. I called customer service and was put through right away to a real person who was quickly able to help me navigate the online interface (which is very simple and user-friendly). So, even though AmEx doesn't have physical banks, I know that I can get good service from a real person if I need it, that the transfers always process correctly, and that I'm earning a respectable amount of interest on a savings account.

I was a card holder for over 30 years until the crash of 2009. Amex cancelled my business card and two personal cards without notice. They revoked over 300,000 mileage plus points and wrote a negative comment on my credit with all three agencies. All this despite being current and having a sterling record of payment. The only reason I was given was that I owned a remodeling business.


What is ironic is that my wife and I now get regular solicitations for business charge cards!


AMEX is not the friend of small business and I will never carry one of their cards again.

Now Once I got to the point that I had some time to build up a decent financial nest egg, I wanted to spread some of it around, investing and saving. I chose the American Express High-Yield Savings Account because I was already an American Express credit cardholder and because the account is what it says it is: high-yield. Few options offered a better return on interest (and I have enough money now to where that actually matters), and most of those which did wanted monthly fees which would end up eating a large portion of what I was making from interest. The Amex High-yield account was the best option I could find and I've been totally satisfied.

I got the AMEX card to use for my business just over a year ago. Having the first year free was great and even though I had initially planned on canceling after the first year, my experience was such that I have kept the account and gladly paid the yearly fee. The points earned through the Reward program have been very useful in making purchases at a good discount for my business. Paying the entire balance off every month saves me any interest I would have to pay with another card and I still have the flexibility to make a purchase and pay for it a month later instead of immediately. The card is excepted just about everywhere and the level of customer service is excellent. Their on-line center is easy to use and provides all the information needed to track purchases, schedule payments and stay updated on Reward points. The fact that AMEX supports Small Business Saturday is also a major plus in my book. Great card, great service. I highly recommend applying.

I do a lot of online banking and after recently setting up and using an AEB account, I have found the bank to be one of the better options. Processes are carried out efficiently, website is easy to use, limits are high on external account use, and customer service, if needed, also is efficient and friendly. The only significant negatives to me so far are that the bank imposes a six business day waiting period on external transfers, which is longer than at least some other banks, and they don't offer online (through email or chat) customer service. Overall, I would place the bank as one of the best handful of online alternatives!

Positives: Fast and fair application process. Variety of medias. Good banking and rates.


Negatives: Iffy customer service and problem resolution. Once I dealt with a shady website and some of my information was stolen. Getting in contact with customer service at American Express was a hassle. At the time, I had no online banking. Therefore, I needed to call and get information on my account and get it locked down. However, it took over 2 hours to get the situation handled. In this time, 500$ was stolen from my account. I also had a few minor customer service problems. I cannot say for sure that American Express in general has horrible customer service, but my experiences were poor.

I have never had a better prepaid card! This card has a direct deposit option that I use for online work. When I transfer funds, they are there within 1-2 business days. It is very fast, and there are no fees for direct deposit that I've seen. No fees for using the card either! The only fee I've ever seen is for ATM withdrawals and almost all cards have that. It took me a while to get the card linked for direct deposit, but after I did, it was great! This is by far the best prepaid card out there in my honest opinion. Their customer service is really outstanding as well. Hold times on the call were very low, maybe 3 minutes. All in all, awesome!

American Express has been great and extremely helpful in a few pinches. Their application process is quick, simple, and painless, and offered over a variety of medias. I just wanted a card I could depend on if I couldn't quite keep up with bills or rent for a month, and American Express has really delivered for me! It's been so great to have a reliable card, and I couldn't make any really negative comments, other than the usability in different locations may be spotty at some points. Be sure to have a back up plan! All in all though, great, friendly service, and a great card to have!

I recently got a promotion that would provide me with some extra money every month. I wanted to be a responsible adult and save the money but I wasn't comfortable storing the money with my regular bank because I was afraid I would spend it. I also wasn't comfortable with putting my money in a CD or any other type of hard to access investment. When it came down to it, I picked American Express, I have an AmEx card and I liked that they offered quality customer service as well as one of the highest interest rates available on their High-Yield Savings accounts. Sure, .85% isn't as great a rate as what we used to have in the USA but it's the best today so it did have some sort of influence on my decision. The thing I love about the account is that my money is earning interest, and is still easily accessible in case of an emergency (although there is a 3-4 day wait for withdrawals). The only downside to the account would be the website. It's a bit drab, and honestly doesn't have the easy to use bells and whistles functionality of some sites that offer similar products like Ally or ING. While this isn't a deal breaker by any means, it would be nice if the site was more user friendly and modern but as long as my money is safe, I'm okay with it's basic appearance.

I signed up for the American Express personal savings account about a year ago. I have been pleasantly surprised by the experience thus far. When I signed up for it originally they were offering 1.15% APY, which was about as good as I could find for a savings account. Now it is down to 0.85% APY, but still pretty good compared to what is out there. The nice thing is it is FDIC insured, there are no minimums and no fees associated with the account. Additionally I was surprised how quickly the transfers take place in and out of the account. They literally are next day transfers with no fees. All in all, I am very happy.

American Express prepaid cards have been a a great thing to take advantage of during special ocassions. I know I can give someone an American Express prepaid card and they will be happy. Even though they charge a fee to purchase one, they make the perfect gift and I do not have to stress over someone not enjoying it. Whenever I have received one myself, I am very happy knowing I can use it almost anywhere.
